11511311331.content:
“Ugh… Audrey, I’m a little –UUURRP- full,” Banagher moaned, rubbing his now-swollen middle. “Do you think I did a good enough job showing you how good normal food –URP- is?”

“NO!” Audrey cried out, a bit more forcefully than she intended. Clearing her throat, she added, “I don’t think it’s quite good enough yet, Banagher. Surely you can fit a bit more in that big belly of yours, right?”

Banagher looked down at this stuffed, midsection, giving it a poke. It gurgled in response, reminding the brunette of just how much food he packed it with. He ate enough food to feed a couple families of five already; he had no idea if he could fit anymore in there.

However, when he looked back up at Audrey, he saw that she truly had an eagerness to see him eat more. It made him actually think: did she have an active desire to see him stuff himself? Granted, he already knew that she found his belly nice to play with on occasion, but would she also enjoy something like that? Of course, there was only one way to find out.

“Oof… sure, Audrey. I think I can fit a bit more in. But are you really sure you don’t want any?”

Audrey nodded firmly, eyes still eager to see Banagher stuff even more food into his greedy mouth. Banagher, for his part, inwardly apologized to his stomach before getting to work.

And what work it was. Even though his stomach was protesting him to stop by this point, Banagher still pressed on. Slices of cheesecake, fistfuls of chips, and sticks of corndogs all went into his mouth one by one, all joining together in the sloshing pit that was the brunette’s stomach. It was getting less and less spacious by the minute, though, signaling that Banagher was reaching his limits.

Finally, after eating through eight more dishes worth of food, Banagher decided to call it quits. His stomach, once soft and jiggly, was now completely spherical and hard. Poking it, Banagher gave out a moan of both pain… and yet also, a slight bit of pleasure. Despite how physically draining stuffing himself to such an extent could be, it surprisingly felt a little rewarding. Granted, it was quite the feat to be able to fit enough food in your stomach to be able to feed a family of ten twice-over, but now it was time to end things.

“UUURRRP! Audrey, do you think it’d be –URP- okay if I stop eating now? I think I’m done for the rest of the day… and probably the next…” Banagher said, resting a hand on his bloated middle. “You understand, right?”

Audrey snapped out of her bliss upon hearing these words, realizing Banagher was indeed uncomfortable. Shaking her head, she immediately began apologizing.

“Oh, sorry, Banagher! I-I didn’t mean to push you too hard!” she said, bowing her head in shame.

Banagher gave a little laugh in response.

“Ah, don’t worry, you didn’t do anything wrong. Blame my gluttonous appetite instead, heh heh!”

Audrey looked up, sighed, and gave a bit of a laugh of her own. Banagher was always cute when trying to cheer people up.

+++

An hour later saw the two of them arrive back at the living room where they began, except this time with Banagher obviously being several sizes bigger. It was quite a sight, seeing the relatively petite Audrey helping to support the incredibly obese Banagher on her shoulder. It was a little comical, actually: Banagher lumbering and swaying about due to being stuffed silly, while Audrey attempted to keep a more dignified air as she helped to support her friend as if he were drunk.

Of course, neither of the two realized how funny the situation was, for different reasons: Banagher, because he was way too bloated to care, and Audrey, because she was nearly suffering sensory overload with Banagher’s giant mass pressing up against her.

Banagher’s engorged stomach was so spherical it was pressing right into the blonde’s side, and even with its firmness from the meal previously, there was still a layer of soft fat that was incredibly evident. Combined with seeing Banagher’s legs and stomach jiggle and jostle with every footfall made, how labored his breathing was, his round face betraying how out of shape he had gotten, it nearly made Audrey’s knees buckle.

(Un)fortunately, however, they were able to make it to the couch, where Audrey gently laid Banagher down, allowing his bloated stomach to stick up into the air like a mighty mountain. Pausing a moment to look at it, Audrey was nearly lost in the tantalizing way it moved up and down with every one of Banagher’s labored breaths, before snapping her attention back to normal when a giant belch filled the air.

Of course, it came from Banagher, and was accompanied with a cute moan. Audrey, being the considerate girl she was, immediately started questioning him.

“Banagher, are you okay? You’re not sick, are you?” Audrey said, placing a hand on Banagher’s taut tummy and beginning to rub the sphere of adipose with great care.

After a few seconds, Banagher began with, “Oh no, I’m really not that-UUUUUURRRRRP-“

But then he was cut off by one of the biggest belches he’d ever belted out in his entire life. For a moment, there was complete silence following it, with Banagher’s face going beet red. Then, however, he and Audrey looked at each other, and they burst out laughing,

“Banagher, what do we say?” Audrey asked in a playful tone of voice, somewhat recovering from the laughter.

“E-excuse –UUURRRP-“

“You got the first part down, but what about the second part of that statement?” Audrey said, a bemused expression on her face.

“UUURRRP! Excuse –URP- me…”

“That’s nice. One should always remember to have proper manners, Banagher,” Audrey said, giving a light pat to Banagher’s stomach before continuing with her rubbing activity.

This continued for a while, before Audrey decided to bring up some small-talk.

“So, how’ve you been doing with getting that high score in Ghoul Guns? I hear it’s a pretty tough game.”

This perked Banagher up enough to allow him to lift his head and smile. If there was one thing he was surprised by when it came to Audrey, it was her interest in his video games. Considering her upbringing, it was a rather surprising revelation. He could still remember the time when he first showed her his collection; the look of sheer wonder on her face made his heart warm.

“Yeah, it is, but guess what? I actually beat it! Beat it fair and square, no cheat codes used at all!” he said triumphantly. “That old score of 100,000? It’s just been boosted up to 200,000!”

Audrey nearly squealed in admiration before quickly composing herself. “Why, that’s amazing, Banagher! I knew you were good, but not that good!”

Banagher scratched the back of his head, sporting a big grin on his face. “Ah, what can I say? Enough practice will boost your skill level at anything, really. Thanks for the compliment, though. Do you wanna play a bit?”

“Maybe later. Right now, though, I think we should help to soothe your stomach. Sorry if it felt like I was pressuring you earlier. I really don’t know what came over me.”

“No, no, that’s fine,” Banagher assured her. “I really don’t mind. It was really good food, though; do you think you’d be willing to try more the next time we go?”

Audrey shook her head affirmatively, giving a bit of a chuckle. Satisfied, Banagher laid his head back down.

The brunette let out several more belches, with Audrey occasionally adding in a, “Well, excuse you!” every time, in increasingly playful ways. After a while, Banagher drifted off to sleep, leaving Audrey still contentedly rubbing his stomach even as his breathing got softer and no more burps escaped his lips. Audrey sighed in contentment, looking down at her friend’s round face in happiness. But then she flashed back to the restaurant, and contemplated what happened.

“Really, though, what came over me? I have no idea…”
11511311331.title: Stuffed to the Brim.

choices: Micott and Takuya get a bit hungry
115113113311.content:
As Banagher slept off his big meal, he dreamed that he and Audrey were sitting on their couch, happily watching TV. Just like in the real world, Audrey was her regular skinny self while Banagher was fat. Suddenly, Banagher's stomach let out a loud rumble in hunger, catching both teens' attention. The brunette self-consciously placed a hand on his dome of a middle, a slight blush tinting his cheeks.

"I'm going to get a snack." He said as he heaved himself up. The obese brunette walked over to the fridge and opened it, he licked his lips as he looked at all the delicious food inside.

A few seconds later, Audrey gained a shocked expression on her face as she saw Banagher carrying a truly absurd amount of food as he walked back to the couch. It was like something out of one of those cartoons Banagher introduced her to.

"That's uh, quite a large snack." The blonde stated as her overweight friend sat back down in his spot on the couch and placed his meal next to his side.

"Yeah, I might've overdone it a bit." Banagher chuckled. He quite the assortment of food with him. Pretzels, potato chips, cereal, and ice cream just to name a few. "You can have it too."

"Thanks, Banagher." Audrey said as she grabbed a bag of potato chips.

Unsurprisingly, Banagher ended up eating far more then Audrey. Whilst the blonde merely ate one bag of potato chips, Banagher devoured everything else he brought and his gut was as bloated as one would expect. His belly was normally big and round, even when it wasn't filled with food, but now it was even bigger. Banagher's dome of a middle even snapped his belt in half, popped off his pants' button, and even forced his zipper down before he was even finished eating.

"Whew, boy am I –UUURRRRP- stuffed!" The bloated Gundam pilot said, giving his big belly a few pats.

"I've noticed." Audrey said, chuckling a bit. She reached a hand out to Banagher's gut and began rubbing the large orb, eliciting a moan of pleasure from her bloated friend's lips. "How's your stomach feeling?"

"Ahhh, it feels great –UUUURRRAP- now that you're rubbing it!" Banagher said with joy. It always felt amazing when his blonde friend rubbed his tummy whenever he was bloated from a big meal.

"Good to see." Audrey said with a warm smile, giving her friend's belly a few pats, accidentally forcing a huge burp out of him.

"UUURRRAAAP!"

"S-Sorry about that!" Audrey stuttered out, her cheeks blushing red.

"Don't worry about it, that felt great!" Banagher happily said, smiling in a reassuring manner, though he was still blushing a bit. After all, belting out a huge burp in front of your friend was far from polite.

"It-It did?"

"Yeah, burping actually helps me feel better." Banagher clarified. "Speaking of, do you think you could press down on the top of my belly?"

Audrey took a few seconds to process what Banagher just said, and when she did she placed her hand on the top of Banagher's big gut and pressed down slightly. And just as expected, a "URRRAAAP!" came flying out of his mouth. Banagher and Audrey immediately started laughing.

After a while of Audrey rubbing Banagher's belly, coaxing out quite a lot of loud burps from him, the overfed Gundam pilot was just about to fall into a food coma like he did in the real world, ironically. Suddenly, Banagher's phone started ringing. Surprised, Banagher pulled it out of his pocket and read who it was coming from.

"Who is it?" Audrey asked, still massaging Banagher's belly of course.

"UUUURRRP! It's Riddhe." Banagher began answering. "He-" Was all Banagher could say before he was cut off by Riddhe.

"Banagher! Neo-Zeon is on it's way to Industrial 7! The Nahel Argama is at the docks, get here ASAP!"

"I'm on my way!" The call ended.

"I'm coming with you." Audrey stated, the blonde had a dead-serous look on her face yet she was still giving Banagher a loving belly rub.

"Please stay here, it's much safer." Banagher pleaded before he attempted to stand up, only for his overstuffed stomach to prevent him from doing so.

"It's my responsibility as the princess of Zeon to aid you however I can in ending this threat." Audrey said. She stood up and extended her hand to her friend. "And I'm safest with you."

'Thanks, I really appreciate it." Banagher grabbed his friend's hand and after a bit of huffing and puffing from both of them, he was lifted up. "Let's go."

Audrey nodded.

Of course, their determination didn't mean that it was going to be easy for Banagher to walk there while he's got a belly this bloated. Much like how the real version of her did earlier, Audrey supported Banagher as he waddled over to the docks, his huge abdomen pressing against the blonde's flat stomach. Upon actually getting there, Banagher was faced with another challenge: getting into his pilot suit.

Banagher grunted as he tried with all his might to force his suit to zip over his belly but it simply refused to do so.

"Come on! Come on!" He grunted in frustration.

He sucked in his stomach and actually started to make some progress but he ran out of breath and had to let his gut come flopping back out. The brunette was panting and red in the face from exhaustion.

"Do you want some help?" Audrey said in a concerned tone. The blonde was already in her normal suit.

"Yeah *huff* thanks."

Banagher needed one hand on the zipper and another on the suit itself. And he couldn't suck his tummy in long enough to zip up his suit. This made pulling the zipper up all the way impossible for Banagher to do on his own (until he digested his snack) but Audrey had a solution. She gently pushed in Banagher's gut for him, eliciting another belch from him as she expected, which gave Banagher just enough room to move the zipper above his belly, with Audrey perfectly timing when she removed her hands from her friend's round stomach.

"Man, you're smart. Thanks!" Banagher complimented with a goofy smile after he zipped his suit up all the way.

"Oh, it was nothing." Audrey smiled as she blushed at Banagher's complement.

Audrey then saw Banagher off as they stood in front of the Unicorn Gundam's open cockpit.

"I know you'll succeed." The princess said.

"It's because I've got you supporting me." Banagher then pressed a button on his helmet that made it's visor come down. He then turned and attempted to enter the cockpit when he faced his next challenge: actually getting his fat butt in the cockpit.

Yes, Banagher was so fat that he actually got stuck in between the hole to the cockpit. Of course, the hole to the real life Unicorn Gundam's cockpit was much larger. Since this was Banagher's dream and dreams are made of one's subconscious, it wasn't too surprising.

Banagher grunted as he tried to squezze through to no avail. "Hey, Audrey, can you give me a hand?" The Gundam pilot said, blushing up a storm.

"Of course!" Audrey said in a concerned voice.

Audrey pushed her close friend's bloated frame as hard as she could and after a seconds of doing so, Banagher finally squeezed through. However, this sent both of them tumbling through and falling over. Audrey placed a hand on the cockpit's chair for support, however, she unknowingly pressed the button that closed the cockpit's hatch.

"There's no time for me to get out, just launch with me."Audrey sated, fearless as always.

Banagher nodded and then got up. He didn't want Audrey to be so close to the fighting but he had already taken too long to launch so there really wasn't any time to let out his skinny friend out. Either way, Banagher knew no harm would come to her, he would make sure of that.

But just as he was about to plant his fatass in the cockpit's chair Banagher woke up and his dream ended.

Banagher opened his eyes to see that he was till laying down on the couch in his school dorm's living room, with Audrey still sitting next to him. The only differences were that Audrey had placed a blanket on him and that Takuya and Micott were siting on one of the other couches. He let out a small grunt as he shifted lightly, alerting to Audrey that he was awake.

"Oh! You're awake." The blonde said.

"Finally." Takuya added, placing his mobile suit magazine aside. "Man, you sure know how to sleep, Banagher."

"You're not any better yourself, Takuya." Micott teased.

Banagher let out a loud yawn, still a bit sleepy as one typically was when they woke up. "How long was I asleep?"

"About an hour. You slept like a log." Micott informed, a bemused expression on her face.

"By the way, Banagher, isn't there a video game you want to show me?" Audrey said.

And just like that, Banagher's drowsiness was instantly gone. He always had energy for video games.
115113113311.title: Let's delve into Banagher's dreams, shall we?

1151131133111.content:
Shortly after having breakfast the next day, Banagher got a phone call from Marida asking if today was a good time to start exercising together. Keeping mind how he had definitely gained a few pounds from his binge yesterday (even if he didn't looks visibly fatter), Banagher told her that today was the perfect time to start.

Banagher walked down to the nearby park, his tummy bouncing with every step as a reminder of how badly he needed to do this, where Marida said they would be doing their exercise. Seeing the nice clear sky, beautiful scenery made of grass and trees, the brunette could easily see why Marida wanted to work out here, even though he was never really an outdoors kind of guy.

Not far from the park entrance, he saw his red-haired friend waiting for him on a park bench, she had two bottles of water by her side. "Hey, Marida." Banagher said as he walked over.

Marida looked at how much her friend's belly was jiggling with every step. She thought on how Banagher was right, this really was the perfect time to start exercising together. "How's your diet going?" She said as Banagher sat down next to her.

As soon as those words left Marida's lips, memories of how much eating he had been doing lately, especially yesterday, flashed through his mind like a montage. "It's been going fine, I only had breakfast so far. Cereal and orange juice, just like you said. No snacks at all." The brunette avoided eye contact with the redhead as he nervously scratched the back of his head.

Now, Banagher wasn't surprised that his lying failed to trick Marida, but he was surprised by how she verified that he was lying. She lifted his hoodie and shirt up above his belly and started feeling up the ball of fat with her hands.

"W-What are you doing?" Banagher's full cheeks were a shade of red.

Marida ran her a hand over his stomach, with her other hand she poked it, jiggled it, pat it, and grabbed a handful of his belly flab, while Banagher just watched in confusion and embarrassment. It took less then ten seconds but it sure as hell felt like more. "You've had four hot dogs, a hamburger, and a large soda." The redhead calmly said as she removed her hands from her friend's tummy.

Banagher could only give her a sheepish grin.

"We'll start with stuff like jumping jacks and sit ups, then we'll do some jogging around the park."

"That sounds good." Banagher pulled his hoodie and shirt back down over his stomach.

"But before we do that, have some water." Marida handed Banagher a bottle of water. "The first rule of exercise is to always stay hydrated."

"Kinda reminds of me of when I was in the desert with the captain." The two then drank some of their water.

"It's the same basic principle, drink at regular intervals even if you're not feeling thirsty. Now then," Marida stood up. "Are you ready to exercise?"

Banagher stood up as well. "Yeah, I'm ready to lose this gut." He lifted up the mass of flab and then let it drop, sending it jiggling and bouncing.

"That's what I like to hear." Banagher felt the jiggling made that less cool then he thought it would be, but he was glad it impressed Marida. "First, we'll do some warm ups. Just stretch however you want."

Marida did professional warm up techniques with perfect form, Banagher's form was rather awkward, something he knew very well. All his stretching was done clumsily, and when he leaned over to the side to stretch, his love handles and side rolls got deeper. After half a minute of this, the warm up was done.

"Now that our bodies are ready, we'll start with a simple exercise, touching our toes." Marida said before she did so effortlessly.

Banagher looked down, his stomach blocked the sight of his feet but that didn't deter him. "I've got this." He thought. He leaned over and reached down, meeting much greater difficulty then he expected. He felt his belly press his crotch and legs as he kept reaching down, giving him some discomfort that made this even harder. Grunting, he was visibly annoyed and uncomfortable. He couldn't tell as he was only looking down, but Marida watching him the whole time with patience, still touching her feet. She realized this might prove harder then she thought but she knew Banagher would reach soon, he wasn't THAT fat. And indeed he did. "Got it!" He said when he finally reached his feet.

Originally, Marida was going to have him hold that position for a few seconds but she decided to give the poor guy a break. "Good work. Let's drink some water before we try something else." She got back into a normal standing position and walked back to the bench where they placed their bottles of water.

Banagher stood back up, panting a little. "*Pant* *Pant* Sounds good."

Next up was push ups, which was in some ways even harder. Once again, Marida did the exercise perfectly, but the poor young man to her side was struggling. Not only was his form awkward and clumsy like usual, his tummy made touching the ground difficult. His middle pressing and squishing against the ground threw off his balance when he tried to make his flabby chest hit the ground, and he had to actively press his stomach into ground to complete a push up. By the end of this, Marida had done 34 push ups. Banagher had only done 13.

Then there was the sit ups, easily the hardest for Banagher yet. Banagher held Marida's feet in place, anchoring being the official term, as she did twenty sit ups. Banagher knew his friend was fit, even without the aid of her Cyber-Newtype enhancements, but he was still amazed by how good she was at this. And then it was Banagher's turn.

"You've got this, Banagher!" Marida cheered on as her fat friend struggled to do one single pull up.

The pilot of the Unicorn Gundam was grunting and huffing, fighting his belly to pull one pull up off as it squished against his legs. His exercise partner could see some sweat and redness on his round face.

"Keep it up, you can do this!" Marida kept cheering.

"O-O-One!" He shouted as he finally did it after fifteen seconds of effort. He immediately flopped right back down, panting and sweating. His stomach rose up and down with every pant.

"Good job. That's the key to exercise, you just have to keep at it and believe in yourself." Marida said. "Ready for the next one?"

"Y-Yeah."

Marida mercifully ended the sit ups at five. Their last exercise before jogging was jumping jacks. They weren't hard for Banagher to do, but they were still exhausting. His belly, moobs, and butt jiggled and bounced with every single jumping jack, and his tummy slapped against his legs. His jumping jacks got more and more sluggish as he got more and more exhausted. By the time they were done with jumping jacks, Marida had finished 50 while Banagher had only finished 22.

Before they started jogging, the exercising pilots took a quick break to sit down and drink some water.

"So how I am doing so far?" Banagher felt he already knew the answer.

"For someone of your weight and lack of physical activity, pretty good." Marida answered.

"R-Really?"

"Even though your form is clumsy, you're getting exhausted far too quickly, and having trouble with even the most basic exercise, you're still keeping at it and that's what's important. Most people like you would've given up after the first sit up, but you did four more."

"Thanks, Marida. I was sure I was doing terrible."

"As long as you keep at it, you're doing great."

After having some more water, they started jogging, the obese brunette's legs, ass, and belly jiggling and jostling the whole time. Banagher's chubby legs gave him a bit of a wobble but he could still keep up with the speed Marida was going at. After thirty seconds of jogging, Banagher started panting. Ten seconds later, he was sweating. Five seconds after that, some redness was appearing on his chubby cheeks and he started moving slower, something Marida noticed, so slowed down to match speed with her obese friend. Eight seconds later, he was panting heavily and face was completely red with painful exhaustion and drenched in sweat. He soon had to ask Marida if they could take a break, which she immediately granted. The poor young man collapsed onto the sidewalk right outside the park, huffing and puffing.
1151131133111.title: Working Out

choices: Banagher and Marida go home for lunch
11511311331111.content:
"How *huff* *huff* did I do?" Banagher asked. Once again, he felt he knew the answer.

"Like I said, for someone as fat and out of shape as you, pretty good." Marida answered, surprising Banagher that she still felt he was doing good. "Though I think we should try something other then jogging for now." The redhead pondered on what they should do next. It had to be something that would keep them both moving a lot but not non-stop. Being able to sit down and take a break whenever they wanted would be ideal. But what matched that description?

Casually looking at the scenery around her, Marida noticed a basketball court on the other side of the street, no one was currently using it. "Perfect."

+++

"Have you ever played basketball?" Banagher asked as he watched Marida dribble the ball in place. They were both standing in the middle of the court, Banagher was on his side while Marida was on hers.

"No, but I understand the basic rules. Have you played it?"

"Just a few times during gym class. Ready?"

"Ready."

Marida tossed the basketball into the air, she got it before Banagher was able to. She quickly ran over to Banagher's side of the court, Banagher chased after her as fast as his bloated form would allow but the redhead quickly dunked the ball, leaving Banagher shocked at how good Marida was.

"I thought you said you never played this before." The brunette said.

"I haven't. My physical fitness just gives me an advantage."

Banagher look at his stomach, frustration evident on his face. "And my body gives me a disadvantage." He emphasized the "dis" in disadvantage.

"Don't worry about the score. The goal is just burning calories."

"I know. It's just not fair."

"Take that frustration and use it as fuel to keep trying."

Marida threw the ball again, the result being the same as last time. Banagher got a little closer to Marida then last time before she threw the ball, which fell in the hoop. The next time Banagher actually manged to get the ball dribbled towards Marida's side, jiggling like he did during his jogging, but Marida stole the ball as soon as he was about to shoot. She quickly dribbled back to Banagher's side of the court, the side's owner chasing her and panting,and preformed another successful throw.

When Marida threw the ball at the start of the next round, Marida threw it again, she caught it and started running towards her chubby friend's hoop, only for him to steal the ball from her. Jiggling like mad and panting, Banagher quickly wobbled to Marida's side and made the shot, which fell through the hoop.

"Good shot." The redhead said.

"Thanks. I'm actually *pant* a little surprised I did it."

"I'm not."

Marida once again caught the ball for the next round. Banagher decided to try something different this time. Rather then try to steal the ball there, he ran with all the speed he could possibly summon and blocked Marida in front of his hoop. However, Marida did a poor dribble that made the ball bounce out of her reach and then right into the middle of Banagher's gut, making it jiggle violently. It kept jiggling and jostling for four seconds.

Marida was hit with a wave of worry and guilt the second Banagher was hit by the ball. "I'm so sorry! Are you okay, Banagher? Is there a bruise?" She ran to Banagher, knelled down so her eye level was at her friend's orb of a middle, and lifted his shirt and jacket up to inspect the damage.

"I'm fine. That actually didn't hurt. I think all this fat actually protected me." Banagher poked his big tummy a few times, finding that his finger actually sank into the fat before it met resistance.

Feeling and inspecting the mass of flab, Marida found that Banagher was correct, there was not a single mark. "Hmm." She gave it a poke, finding the fat immediately went back into place as when she removed her finger. "It seems your big belly has some uses."

"So, uh, now that we know I'm okay, can you stop now?" Banagher's beet red face wasn't looking at Marida. "There's some girls looking at us."

The duo played for a few more rounds before they decided they had enough exercise for today. Marida's score was 17 to Banagher's 4. Banagher was left a mess by the end, he laying down on the bench, panting heavily, his chubby face once again red and covered in sweat, his stomach jutting straight up into the air and moving up and down with every pant. Marida was sitting at the other end of the bench.

"You did good today. I'm proud of you." Marida said after drinking some water.

"*Huff *huff* Thanks." Banagher then took a big sip from his bottled water, getting as much water as he possibly could. It was so refreshing to feel the water fill his thirsty, thirsty mouth. Like drinking water from an oasis after traversing a desert for hours without water. "That was really fun."

"I haven't had that much fun in a long time. Let's make this a regular thing."

"Good idea."

A loud growl of hunger then sounded from Banagher's middle. He looked at it, looked back at Marida, and gave a blush and goofy grin. "Guess I'm hungry, heh heh!"

Showing a small grin, Marida gave Banagher's tummy a friendly pat. "Let's get lunch. I'm feeling hungry myself." Marida's own stomach growled in hunger. She gave it a few pats, blushing a little.

1151212.content:
Mineva Lao Zabi had discovered that the Vist Foundation intends to handover a powerful relic called Laplace's Box to Neo-Zeon. Despite her heritage she believes that Laplace's Box would be misused for the sake of the Zeonic movement if Neo-zeon were to obtain it. To prevent this, she travels to the space colony Industrial 7 as a stowaway aboard the Neo-Zeon freighter, The Garencieres. Unfortunately while entering the colony she accidentally ran into a construction area and fell out of the center of the colony. However she was rescued by a young boy named Banagher Links. Despite this, she was still far away from where the deal would deal would be held and she needed to get there fast.

"Why aren’t you eating? You gotta be starving."

Banagher's words quickly snapped Mineva out of her thoughts. The two had just made a quick stop for some hotdogs.

"You mean we’re going to eat and walk…?"

Truth be told she was feeling rather hungry but the princess within her felt uncomfortable eating while walking. Still she quickly took a bite out of her hotdog and was surprised by how good it tasted. She couldn't help but blush. She had never eaten a hotdog before but now she wanted to eat as many as she could. She quickly ate the whole thing.

"Delicious." Mineva thought as wiped her mouth with a napkin.

But much to her surprise she quickly heard her stomach growl for more. Mineva put a hand on her stomach and blushed. She had never felt hungry after a meal. Despite her embarrassment and concern for her weight, she decided that she should eat a little more to keep her stomach from growling before Banagher noticed. After all just one more couldn't hurt and she would get to eat another hotdog.

"Um, Banagher. Do you mind if I get another?"
1151212.title: Temptation

choices: Banagher convinces Mineva to take a break
Mineva convinces Banagher they need to keep moving
11512121.content:
"So full..."

Mineva moaned, hands on her engorged belly as she continued walking with Banagher to their destination. Mineva had eaten far more then she meant to, she was only going to have one more hotdog to quell her growling stomach but it seemed like no matter how many she ate it wasn't enough to satisfy her hunger. At least until she had eaten a dozen or so. Now she felt like she would explode if she ate any more.

"I can’t believe I ate so much."

Mineva looked down at her bloated gut. Her large orb-shaped belly strained the buttons on her coat, almost to the point of popping. She moaned as she rubbed it before accidentally unleashing a loud unladylike belch. Mineva immediately slapped her hands over mouth, blushing. She really hoped Banagher hadn’t heard that.

"E-Excuse me." Mineva uttered after a few seconds of silence. The two continued walking, Mineva still groaning all the while.

"Do you want to take a break?" Banagher asked, "You look a little tired."

"There’s no time, we need to keep moving."

However due to the extra weight her bloated tummy had added she soon lost her balance and fell. Banagher quickly grabbed hold of her, preventing her from hitting the floor. Though he had not intended to do so by grabbing her belly. After helping Mineva regain her balance Banagher awkwardly removed his hand from her belly, both of them blushing heavily.
11512121.title: The Stuffed Lady

choices: They sit down at a bench near a fountain
They rent a room at a hotel
They find Mineva some better fitting clothes
115121211.content:
"Let's rest for a minute."

Mineva and her stomach really wanted to take Banagher's suggestion but despite how much her belly hurt, she knew that to much was at stake. She couldn't risk lives over a tummyache. Even if it was a rather painful one.

"I told you what could happen if we don't make it in time." Mineva said, gaining a serious look on her face. "I won't risk another war breaking out just because I have a stomachache."

"I know that." Banagher started. "But I'm not-"

Both Banagher and Mineva's thoughts were interrupted by a loud -ping!- sound. They then heard the sound of something light hitting the ground and saw that it was the button on Mineva's pants. Mineva's bloated belly had finally managed to pop off the button on her pants, causing her tummy to pour further outwards, undoing her pant's zipper as well as straining her coat's buttons even more. It also would've given Banagher a small look at her underwear had her coat not covered it. A blush quickly appeared on Mineva's face.

"I, I think you should lay down. Just for a little while." Banagher said. "I don't want you to be in pain."

"Th-Thank you, Banagher." Mineva said. This was the first time someone her age had ever expressed concern for her as a person, rather then as a symbol of Zeon.

The buttons on Mineva's coat soon popped off, exposing her stuffed belly and revealing that her blouse had ridden up to the point that her belly button was clearly visible. While this made her tummy feel much more comfortable it also caused Mineva to feel embarrassed.

Mineva moaned as rubbed her newly-freed stuffed belly before accidentally unleashed a loud unladylike belch. She immediately slapped both her hands over her mouth, blushing.

"E-Excuse me." Mineva uttered after a few seconds of silence.

Banagher gave a small friendly chuckle at this. This helped relax Mineva, as well as cause her to give a small smile. She was still embarrassed of course.

"Banagher," Mineva said, sounding a little more happy, both due to Banagher and their being less pressure on her tummy. "Could you pick up those buttons? These clothes are expensive."
115121211.title: Stuffed Girl

choices: Banagher gets some food for himself
1151212111.content:
Mineva let out a sigh of relief as she and Banagher sat down on a bench next to a nearby fountain. She had to admit that it felt nice to sit down and relax after walking for so long. It also gave her a chance to give her stomach a soothing rub, something it really needed.

"So how do you know my name?" Banagher asked.

"Banagher, wait!" Audrey said as they stopped walking. "How do I look?"

"Huh?" Banagher said.

"Is my belly any smaller? Do you think I can cover it now? Maybe I could-"

"You're being kinda weird, Audrey." Banagher was caught off-guard by Audrey.

Audrey let out a loud sigh.

"I know." Audrey admitted. "I just want to look presentable."

"Just be yourself." Banagher said. "That's how we became friends."

Audrey accepted Banagher's advice. She nodded before they continued walking to the front door. "Be yourself". Audrey felt like she was in a whole different world. One where she had a friend. One where she was herself.

The two reached the front door. Audrey realized that when they went through it, they would be at her world and she would be Mineva Lao Zabi again. Her heart began pounding, she felt like she was about to lose everything. She felt like she was about to lose Banagher. When this day began, she would've abandoned Banagher when she didn't need him anymore. Now she couldn't imagine doing such a thing. She needed him and she wanted him to need her.

Banagher knocked. There was no response.

Audrey let out a sigh of relief.

"Maybe no one's home." Audrey said. The deal wasn't going to be held for a few more hours so it's possible that the man she was looking for wasn't here. At least that meant she would be with Banagher longer.

"Do you hear a piano?" Banagher asked.

"Huh?" Audrey said. All she could hear was a few birds chirping. "I don't hear anything."

Banagher ignored her and entered the mansion.

"Banagher!?'

"Excuse us! Is anyone here?" Audrey said as she followed him into the mansion.

The two walked up the stairs. Audrey blushed as her belly jiggled with every step she took.

Banagher entered the room the stairs led too. He couldn't explain it but he felt drawn to it.

"Banagher, you can’t just…" Audrey stopped as saw the beautiful sight that stood before them. The room had six tapestries in it. They should be related works as the base colors and structures of all these works were the same. They had a woman standing at the middle of a garden with flowers and animals woven in them. The imaginary world the woman was in would remind one of a small outer space. There were two beasts on both sides, and the completely different parties created 6 scenes. Amongst the two beasts, one of them was a lion, and the other one was one with the body of a horse and a long thin horn on its head—

"A unicorn…" Audrey muttered to herself.

The woman who was taking fruits from the tray the maidservant was holding; the woman playing the harp at the table; the woman making a crown of flowers. The woman who let the unicorn rest on her knees and looked at the mirror; the woman holding a flag with a moon on it; and last of all, a woman standing in front of a small tent, putting her jewellery into a box a maidservant's holding. The unicorn and the lion were on both sides of the tent, and the woman who looked like she was putting her jewellery away was entering a tent. The tent had the words 'A Mon de Désir' written on it.

"To my only desire…"

"You can read all of that?" Audrey asked.

"I remember this." Banagher said. "I’ve seen this before."

"I think I've seen it too." Audrey said. "What's it's name?"

"The Lady and the Unicorn."

11512121112332112113.content:
The two continued to enjoy the painting, it was beautiful. Audrey gently grabbed Banagher's hand. She couldn't put it into words but it just felt right. She felt Banagher hold her hand, she could tell that he was feeling tense. He needed someone to talk to.

"So, uh, do you like The Lady and the Unicorn? I do!" Audrey said.

"Y-Yeah." Banagher said. "'To my only desire.' The beast of possibility... The symbol of hope."

"That's a nice quote. Did you come up with it?"

"Yeah, it just sorta came to me."

"I'll remember it."

Banagher gave a little smile. It was weird, how Audrey made Banagher feel, a warmness permeating his heart that he didn’t get from most other people. The closest was Micott, but even that was different than what Audrey made him feel. It was almost as if she was helping to fuel his happiness and confidence, which he was tremendously grateful for.

For some reason, he couldn’t shake off the feeling that that’d be very important later on.

The two close friends continued to enjoy the painting. Eventually, a loud yawn filled the air.

"Sorry." Audrey said, blushing. "I'm feeling kinda sleepy."

"I guess you've eaten yourself into a food coma." Banagher said, a friendly smirk on his face.

"W-What's that?"

"It's when you eat so much you fall asleep."

"Oh. Well, I did eat a lot." Audrey said as looked down at her filled up tummy, blushing.

"I'm feeling pretty sleepy myself." Banagher said before yawning. "Do you want to lay down for a bit?"

"No. Well, yes. But I don't know where we could sleep. This isn't our house after all." Audrey said, concerned with being polite, as always.

"I don't think anyone will mind if we sleep in the guest room." Banagher replied.

"But still..."

"Besides, we'll pass out on the floor if we don't get some sleep."

"That's true." Audrey replied, taking Banagher's joke completely seriously. "Alright, you've convinced me."

Audrey and Banagher soon found themselves a room. Much like the rest of the mansion, it was filled with incredibly expensive furniture. Despite this, everything looked like it hadn't been used in a long time, yet the room was still clean.

"This is a pretty nice room." Banagher said as he looked around.

"Yeah. My room is kinda like it." Audrey instantly realized she said too much.

"Really? Is your family rich or something?" Banagher asked.

"Uh..."

Audrey was having difficulty coming up with what to say. She had to tell Banagher something but she didn't know what. She couldn't tell him that her family wasn't rich, she just admitted to have a fancy and expensive bedroom. And she obviously couldn't tell him that she was the princess of Zeon. Audrey really wished she could just tell Banagher the truth.

"Um... Well, I'm rich. I mean! My family is rich. But you know, it's not a whole lot of money. I mean, it is but that's not my opinion." Audrey twiddled her fingers and tried to avoid looking at Banagher.

"Don't worry, Audrey. You don't need to tell me anything." Banagher said, a little smile on his face.

Audrey looked at Banagher and breathed a sigh of relief.

"Thank you, Banagher."

Banagher laid down on the bed, letting out a sigh in pleasure.

"It feels so nice to relax after everything." Banagher said. He noticed that Audrey was staring at him and seemed nervous. "Is something wrong, Audrey?"

"I, uh..." Audrey was blushing. "I-I've never shared a bed with someone before."

Banagher immediately started blushing. He hadn't realized just how intimate he was getting with Audrey.

"Oh. Well, I-I haven't either."

They were both silent for a few seconds.

"So, w-what should I take off?" Audrey asked.

"J-Just your shoes." Banagher said. "A-And your coat."

Audrey blushed as she took off her coat and shoes. While she wasn't revealing anything other then her bloated gut to Banagher, she still felt nervous. Banagher blushed just as much as Audrey as he removed his jacket and shoes. He was just as nervous.

Audrey and Banagher then laid down in bed together, blushing heavily.

"So, uh. Do we talk and stuff?" Audrey asked.

"If you-If you want." Banagher said.

Audrey came up with a conversation starter.

"What's your favorite video game?"

"I think it's Dangan Ronpa. Have you heard of it?" Banagher asked, excited to geek out with Audrey.

"I don't think I have. Tell me about it." Audrey replied.

"It's about a group of special high school students that are trapped in a school called Hope's Peak Academy by a teddy bear called Monokuma. And the only way anyone can get out is if they kill someone and don't get caught." Banagher said as if it was the most normal thing ever. "After every murder, a class trial is held between the survivors who investigate the case then vote on who they think the murderer is. If they get it right, then the murderer is executed. But if they get it wrong, then the murderer "graduates" and is allowed to leave the school, while everyone else is executed."

"That sounds pretty interesting, Banagher." Audrey said. It sounded complicated to her but it still sounded like a good story.

"Sorry if I told you a little too much at once. Heh heh." Banagher said with a goofy smile on his face.

"Don't worry, I'd actually like to know more about Dangan Ronpa. Can you tell me about the characters?" Audrey said.

"Yeah! Their all really great. My favorite is"

The two close friends continued to geek out together. After a while, Audrey started giggling profusely, truly enjoying the time she was spending with Banagher. However, she felt a bit of a disturbance within her gut, a gurgling that forced her to put a hand on her stomach in shame. This attracted the attention of Banagher, much to the young woman's' embarrassment.

"Huh? What's wrong, Audrey?" he asked, concerned.

"N-nothing, I just -UUURRRP!" she belched out, growing red in the face. "Excuse m-me..."

"Um, Do you want a belly rub?" Banagher asked, a nervous smile on his face.

"Y-Yes please!" Audrey said, smiling sheepishly.

Audrey moaned in satisfaction as Banagher began rubbing her belly.

"Ahhh. UUURRRP! Excuse me!" Audrey said as she and Banagher chuckled.

"Don't worry, you're excused." Banagher said as he continued to rub her belly.

Audrey and Banagher continued to geek out for several hours. It was actually starting to get quite tiring, forcing the two teens to start drifting off to sleep.

Audrey woke up a few hours later, stretching and yawning. She wasn't sure how long she'd been conked out, but looking out the window, she could see the Sun was setting She looked over at Banagher, who hadn't yet woken up. He looked so cute sleeping.

Looking down at herself, Audrey realized that her meal had an effect on her, and not in a good way. Her stomach, which used to be completely flat, now had a fair amount of pudge to it, filling a little bit of her lap. There weren't any rolls or anything to speak of, but it was certainly straining the hem of her pants quite a bit.

Her breasts were a tad fuller as well, feeling somewhat snug against her bra, and they rested on the creamy flesh that made up her stomach. Audrey always had a respectable chest, but it had just gotten a little bigger with all the calories she digested.

Her legs were thicker, not enough to touch yet, but getting there, and they were connected to meaty thighs. They seemed to jiggle quite a bit more when she moved them, to which she was quite embarrassed about.

Her ass was fuller too, no doubt due to influence from her legs, and it was filling up her mattress more than the young princess would care to admit.

Her face hadn’t actually seen much change (granted, she couldn’t tell anyways), although her cheeks were just a little bit fuller than before.

Audrey's face was beet red as she looked over how much weight she had gained. She had no idea how she was going to lose this fat. A loud yawn interrupted her thoughts. Banagher was awake.

"Good morning, Audrey." Banagher said as he stretched.

115121211123321121131.content:
"Good morning, Banagher." Audrey said. "Uh, well it's actually the evening."

"Oh, right." Stretching and giving a big yawn, Banagher sat up. "Man, that was a good nap. How are you feeling?"

"Oh, I'm feeling fine. It's quite a beautiful day, isn't it?" Audrey asked, staring out at the scenery outside. "Like something out of a painting."

"Yeah, I guess it is." Banagher said.

Despite Audrey's attempt at distracting Banagher, she knew that he noticed her weight gain. While Banagher could tell that Audrey was embarrassed about her weight, he still found her to be incredibly attractive. He wanted to say something to help her feel better but he knew it was better to not say anything for now.

"So, uh." Banagher sheepishly scratched the back of his head. "That guy you're looking for should be here now, right?"

"I think so." Audrey replied. "His name is Cardeas Vist. He's in charge of the Vist Foundation. Do you want to meet him?"

"Yeah, sure." Banagher said, a sweet smile on his face. "I'm probably out of my league. But I want to be there for you."

"Thanks, Banagher." Audrey was smiling herself.

Audrey felt her belly jiggle as she and Banagher walked back to the room with the painting, catching both of their attention. Audrey's face was beet red. Banagher decided to start some small talk to help Audrey get her mind off of her weight.

"So uh. Did you sleep well?"

"Y-Yes I did. I even had a dream about us." Audrey's eyes instantly widened when she realized what she just said.

"I-I-I-I actually dreamed about us too." Banagher was blushing.

"Oh, is t-t-that so? Well, umm, what was it about?"

"It was us y-you know, going to school together and hanging out after."

"Oh, is that so?" Audrey asked, caught off-guard. "Because, honestly, that was the same type of dream I had. But that seems incredibly coincidental..."

"Well we are having a good time together." Banagher said.

"That's true." Audrey said. "It was a nice dream."

"Yeah, it was." Banagher said. They were both smiling.

The two of them entered the room with the painting. It appeared that no one had entered the room since they left it. Banagher and Audrey looked at The Lady and the Unicorn. It felt so familiar to Banagher.

"I've seen this before." He muttered.

"Interested in that?"

A voice interrupted their thoughts, startling them. The two teens turned around and saw a man standing at the door. He looked at Audrey, who was frozen, and again looked back at Banagher. The man slowly entered the room. Banagher felt the pressure in the room get even more intense. He subconsciously took two steps back, when Audrey grabbed his hand. They both looked at each other, ready to talk with the man.

"The Lady and the Unicorn". It’s a tapestry believed to have been created in France before the middle era. And it’s no replica. My predecessors went through a great deal of trouble to acquire it prior to the One Year War. I’m head of the family, Cardeas Vist. This is my home."

"I must apologize for coming into your home without permission." Audrey said. " My name is… Audrey Burne."

"I’m aware of who you are." Cardeas stated.

"Then we’ll skip the formality." Audrey said. "As long as you understand my position, that’s all that really matters. I’ve come here to ask you to rethink this course of action. I’m referring to Laplace's Box and your plan to hand it over to us."

Cardeas turned his attention to Banagher. "I think you had better leave." Banagher felt nervous but he would never abandon Audrey. Cardeas immediately returned speaking to Audrey. "It’s too dangerous. We shouldn’t be talking under these circumstances."

"Zinnerman is a rational man. He wouldn’t cause trouble unnecessarily." Audrey replied. She noticed that Cardeas seem annoyed at her attempt to get him to reconsider.

"Do you consider your protection unnecessary?"

Audrey was beginning to get annoyed at Cardeas' attempt at dodging her questions. She hadn't gained weight just to be dismissed. Banagher noticed that her hands were trembling slightly. Unable to understand what they were saying, all Banagher could do was stare at them as they talked. Just as he thought, he was out of his league. But he was determined to stay with Audrey until this was over. And after.

"Tell me." She began. "Why are you doing this? I've heard that Laplace's Box has guaranteed the prosperity of the Vist Foundation for decades. Why give it to us now?"

Once again, Cardeas avoided her questions. He faced Banagher. "Excuse me. You’ve been asked to leave."

"There are people after her." Banagher wasn't going to leave Audrey, no matter who asked him to. "I won’t leave her alone!"

"Do you even have the slightest idea who they are or what they want with her for that matter?"

"I don't." Banagher immediately answered. "I don't, but I know that I should to be with her."

"Do you feel that he should still be here, 'Audrey'?"

Even though Audrey was furious at Cardeas for dismissing her after coming all this way, her anger was immediately replaced by fear and anxiety. She had no idea what to say. Audrey didn't want to put Banagher at risk but she also needed to be with him.

"Uh, I-I-I, he doesn't have to be h-here if h-he doesn't want to. Y-You can go home if you want, B-B-Banagher. I'll c-catch up with you." Audrey stammered. "T-Thanks for everything B-Banagher. It-It was really c-cool. And I'm going to s-shut up right now."

Normally Banagher would've given a friendly laugh and Audrey would've too, but the brunette knew that Audrey needed to hear what he thought.

"Audrey, I can still help. You came here to prevent a war, didn’t you? And doesn’t he have the power to do something about that? Hearing you talk about the war is so different from hearing my professors talk about it. More grave. You've made me see how bad it would be. So please, let me…"

"Banagher..."

"I just... My heart was pounding when I saw you fall from the sky this morning. Everything that felt off in my life just slid into place. For the first time in my life I knew what I was suppose to do. I don’t care who you are! Just say that you need me and I'll... Just tell me…"

"Banagher."

Audrey took a deep breath. She had her answer. Banagher's words made her realize that no matter where they are going, they were going together.

"W-What?"

"I said let's leave." Audrey stated. "It's clear that Cardeas isn't willing to reconsider his decision."

"Are you sure?'" Banagher asked. He knew that Audrey understood the situation and he trusted her to make the right choice but he still wanted to sate his thoughts. "We went through a lot to get here."

Audrey turned her gaze to Cardeas, her face looking very serious. "I urge you to rethink the consequences of what you're about to do."

"I understand your concern about this" Cardeas responded. "You’re not wrong. I’m aware that Full Frontal is being called the second coming of Char and not to be taken lightly."

"Then why are you--?!" Audrey was then cut off by Cardeas.

"Because it’s not that simple." Cardeas stated. "Even if given the key, it will still take someone qualified to open Laplace's Box."

"Laplace's Box?" Banagher thought. It felt familiar to him but he didn't know anything about it. In fact, he didn't know anything about what Audrey said could cause a war. While he knew that she was correct, he still would like to know what is going on. Banagher decided to ask Audrey exactly what the situation is after she was done talking with Cardeas.

"The key to the Box?" Audrey asked, almost as confused as Banagher.

"We have taken steps to create something that will ensure that this is no easy horse to break."

"While I doubt things will go as you say, it seems our business here is done for now." Audrey faced Banagher again. "Banagher, let's leave."

"Uh, sure." Banagher said as they began walking out of the room. Neither of them had any idea where they were even going.

"I can arrange transport for you both to Banagher's class." Cardeas said.

"We would appreciate that. Thank you." Audrey said as she and Banagher continued to walk.

Banagher and Audrey were both silent as they walked out of the mansion. Banagher had trouble deciding to what to say. He had never seen Audrey this mad before. Even during their confrontation with Marida, the blonde wasn't like this.

Audrey sat down on a bench near the mansion's gates. She gave a sigh before looking at Banagher.

"Sorry to you had to see me like that, Banagher." The blonde apologized. "I didn't mean to get so upset."

"You don't need to apologize." Banagher said as he sat next to her. "I'm a little angry myself."

"Still, I'm not sure if I made the right choice." Audrey said. "Do you think I did?" This was the first time Audrey had ever asked someone if she did the right thing.

"You did." Banagher assured. "There wasn't anything we could do there."

"You're right." Audrey said. "Thanks, Banagher. I needed to hear that."

"I knew this whole time that you would make the right choices" Banagher said.

Audrey couldn't help by smile at this. A blush quickly appeared on her face.

"So..." Banagher nervously scratched the back of his head, trying to word his question in a way that wouldn't seem awkward. "What's Laplace's Box?"

"It's a powerful relic." Audrey answered. "I don't know what exactly it is. Only that it has the power to destroy the Earth Federation."

There was a a small pause as Banagher contemplated what Audrey told him.

"Does-Does anyone know what it is?" Banagher knew he was getting involved in something dangerous but having it confirmed made his heart beat faster.

"Only a select few in the Vist Foundation and the Earth Federation." Audrey said.

"And what's that key that guy mentioned?" Banagher had a feeling that it was more then just some simple key.

"I don't know." Audrey said. "This is the first time I've ever heard of it."

Before Banagher and Audrey could continue their conversation, they heard a car pull up to the mansion's gates.

"Looks like it's time to leave." Banagher remarked.

The two teens got up and walked towards the limo parked near the gates. Banagher stopped and looked back the Vist foundation mansion. Audrey noticed this and walked back to him.

"Is something wrong?" She asked. Banagher had been acting a little odd since they arrived.

"N-No. I'm fine. Let's go." The brunette stated as he walked towards the limo with Audrey.

By the time they reached their destination nighttime had arrived. Banagher's class was currently staying at a hotel. The limo left almost as soon as the brunette and blonde stepped out.

"He could've at least waited until we checked in with your class." Audrey thought out loud. "Yes I'm aware of the irony of asking for politeness after belching so much."

"It's kinda charming." Banagher said. "Uh, that could've been worded better. Heh heh!"

"Perhaps I should burp a little more then!" Audrey joked. They both burst out into laughter.

"So, how you feel about being in the same class?" Banagher asked as he and Audrey walked into the hotel.

"To be honest, I'm feeling a little nervous." Audrey admitted. "More then a little nervous, actually. I know the driver said that your teacher has been told that I'm a new transfer student but do you think this will work? I don't even have a uniform."

"We've been through harder stuff." Banagher said. Pushing Marida's incredibly obese body certainly was hard.

"That's true." Audrey said. "But what about your classmates? I don't think I'll fit in."

"Don't worry." Banagher said. "We're friends and the first thing you did when we met was tackle me."

"Yes but I apologized for that." Audrey stated.

"No you didn't."

"I didn't?! Please forgive me, Banagher! I-I owe you an apology."

Banagher let out a small laugh, which confused the blonde.

"Of course you did! I'm just messing with you. Sorry." Banagher had a small grin on his face, though his apology was genuine.

Audrey sighed before laughing herself. "Alright, you got me." Even she couldn't help but enjoy Banagher's little joke.

The two close friends continued to chat as they headed to the top of the hotel. Which they had been told was were most of his class.

Upon arriving, Banagher noticed that the only one missing was his teacher, Mr. Bancroft. He wasn't surprised. After all, the class was already under the hotel staff's supervision and he did need to take breaks from looking after his students.

"Do you see Micott and Takuya?" Audrey asked.

"Yeah! Their right over there." Banagher said as he directed Audrey's attention to the table where they were sitting. "Ready to meet them?"

"Only if you don't tell them about how much I've been eating and burping." Audrey joked.

"Your secret's safe with me!"
