There she wasn't Marida, the gluttonous fatass, she was Marida, the soldier of Zeon.

Marida rubbed her bloated belly as she belted out powerful belches. She looked over her body, it was embarrassing how fat she had gotten. She remembered the first time her belly had broken one of her belts. At this point, she had lost track of many belts her fat gut had broken. As soon as this mission was over she was going to start working out. Marida unleashed a massive burp. It was weird burping inside of her helmet. The obese redhead thought about how her attempt to retrieve Mineva had gone. She hated how her weight had affected her performance but she wondered if she truly would've won had she still been slim. The boy who was with Mineva had proven to be a surprisingly capable opponent. He was able to fend off two grown men and Marida herself.

The redhead released another loud burp, easing the pressure in her big tummy. As she continued to burp, Marida wondered what the relationship between Mineva and the boy was. They seemed to be friends and trusted each other immensely. Somehow, despite being her opponent today, Marida trusted the boy to protect Mineva. She hoped that they were both okay, while they should both be at the mansion, where both Zinnerman and Cardeas would see to their safety, what if they weren't? If they were somewhere else, then Marida would immediately head out to look for them.

Marida felt herself begin to drift off into sleep. She wasn't surprised, eating so much food would make anyone sleepy. She continued to tend to her aching belly as it became harder and harder to keep her eyes open. Marida closed her eyes, she could use a nap after today. Marida unleashed a massive belch. There was only one thing on her mind as she fell asleep.

"Please, keep Mineva safe."
115121211123321121131211.title: Marida Relaxes

choices: Audrey asks the others to leave ahead of her, she needs to find the key
1151212111233211211312111.content:
At the present time, Marida had just woken up. She stretched and gave a big yawn. The fat pilot looked down at her large stomach and ran a hand over it. Her gigantic meal had been digested, adding even more pounds to her already massive body. She would have to weigh herself after the mission. At least her stomach didn't hurt anymore.

Now Marida just had wait for her orders. While she was a very patient woman, she would often enjoy a snack while she waited. It was actually part of the reason she had gotten so fat. She was going to be sitting around for a while anyways, so why not eat a burger or two? Marida actually felt a little peckish. While she wasn't so hungry that she wanted to devour a massive feast like earlier, she could use a little snack.

She noticed that a small box was floating around her cockpit. Odd, she hadn't asked for anything. Upon closer exception, she noticed that there appeared to be a letter attached to the front of it and a large bottle of water on the side of it with, a few cans of soda next to it. She plucked it out of the air and read the letter's contents.

"Don't push yourself too hard.
Zinnerman

And please stop calling me master."

This was far from the first time Zinnerman had told Marida to not call him master. A smile graced Marida's face, she was truly lucky to know Zinnerman. She opened the box to discover that it contained some hamburgers, just what she needed. The redhead happily began chowing down.

A bit into her meal, however, Marida felt an odd sensation. She stopped eating, something felt wrong to her, like something bad was about to happen. She wasn't sure what was the cause of it but it made her feel uneasy. She shifted uncomfortably in her seat. She remained alert and returned to her meal.

Meanwhile, Audrey and Banagher were happily chatting with Takuya and Micott. Audrey was reading a mobile suit magazine that Takuya usually read. It felt kinda weird to her to realize that despite her attempts to prevent war, she knew very little about the machines used in war. Before today, the only things the blonde princess knew about mobile suits is that they were incredibly large, humanoid machines used to wage war and that there's a special type of mobile suit called a Gundam that was a symbol of hope for the Federation. She didn't even know what a "Jegan" was before today.

"See anything you like?" Takuya asked.

"Um, I think I like the ReZEL."

"It's got a pretty nice design, which isn't too surprising, given that it's based off the Zeta Gundam." Takuya stated. "What's your favorite mobile suit?"

"Well, I actually only recently got interested in this stuff." Audrey said.

"Well, if you ever need someone to give you an introduction, you've got me." Takuya boasted with a confident grin. "I bet I could tell you all about nearly every mobile suit there is."

"T-Thank you for the offer." Audrey was actually caught a little off guard by Takuya's enthusiasm.

"I don't think she's as much of a geek as you are, Takuya." Micott teased.

"We'll see."

"Speaking of mobile suits, I actually saw a new one this morning." Banagher stated.

Naturally, this caught Takuya's interest, as well as Micott's and Audrey's to a lesser extant. "No way! Where did you see it?" Takuya enthusiastically asked.

"Back at the museum, right after we saw the Zaku." The brunette clarified.

"What did it look like?" Micott asked.

"I didn't get a good look at it but it was white and it had a horn." Somehow when Banagher saw it, the painting at the mansion flashed through his mind. As did images of his mother playing the piano and a man whose face he couldn't see."It's like it was a Unicorn."

"Wait, was that the "unicorn" you spaced out over?" Micott said in an annoyed tone. The face she was making wasn't too different from the one she made when Banagher stopped listening to her in the middle of a conversation this morning. The only way this could've seemed even more stupid to her would be if Banagher tried to convince he saw an actual Unicorn.

"Oh, uh, sorry about that." Banagher said with a nervous smile on his face.

"Do you think it's a Gundam?" Audrey asked. Ironically, despite being the princess of Zeon, Audrey was fascinated by Gundams.

"Not sure. It didn't have the V Fin but who knows."

"What's a V Fin?" Audrey asked.

"Man, Audrey, you've got a lot to learn." Takuya said in a friendly tone.

"I know."

Marida felt a chill overcome her massive body. She felt the cry of her fellow soldier, Savior. It’s the cry someone makes before their life is extinguished. She shifted uncomfortably in her chair, griping the controls harder. Marida grunted as she felt the hanger shake, she heard a distant explosion. She trembled as that horrifying chill passes through her body. "Don’t get swallowed by this," Marida told herself. "I can't let myself get distracted."

"Marida, what the hell was that?" Gilboa said from the Garencieres.

"Gilboa, have you heard from the Captain?"

"We lost the connection. The Minovsky particles are getting denser!"

"Should we engage inside the colony?"

"The enemy has surrounded the colony. Our only option is to cut straight through, find the Captain, and get the hell out of here."

"Roger that." Marida didn't want to fight in a civilian area, but she had to save Zinnerman.

But before she headed out, Marida figured she should probably finish eating first. She wolfed down the rest of her burger and then chugged the rest of her soda.

"Marida Cruz, Kshatriya, heading out! UUURRRAAAP!"

Suddenly, Marida felt a sharp killing intent. "The enemy's here." The Kshatriya then launches it's Funnels, the 2m-long attack drones then exited the port and aimed in multiple directions at an unaware Jegan that was guarding the entrance as he and his companions prepared to enter. The funnels then each simultaneity fired a shot into the Jegan's cockpit, killing the pilot and destroying the mobile suit.

As soon as the Funnels returned to her, Marida launched the Kshatriya and then used the Funnels to blow a hole in the gateway leading into the colony. While she was very capable soldier, the redhead couldn't fight that many at once with them all surrounding her and she was well aware of it.

At the hotel, Audrey, Banagher, Micott, and Takuya were still causally chatting, completely unaware of the fighting going on.

"That reminds me, we're going to a party on Saturday, you wanna join us, Audrey?" Takuya asked.

"Oh, um..." Audrey had never been asked to go to a party, or anything social before she met Banagher. "I appreciate the offer but I've never been to one before, I'm not sure if I would fit in."

"Don't worry about it, Audrey." Banagher said. Inwardly, he thought about how ironic it was for him to say that, given how miserable his time at a school party was the last time Micott and Takuya dragged him to one.

"Yeah, just stick with us and you'll be fine." Micott said.

"Well, if you're going there anyways, I suppose I should tag along." Audrey stated. "Thanks, everyone."

"No problem. So other then mobile suits, what are you into?" Takuya asked.

Audrey placed a finger to her head and closed her eyes, seemingly lost in thought. Banagher was curious himself to see what she’d say, since he’d only known her for a short time, himself. A few moments later, the blonde opened her eyes and gave a warm smile.

"Well, I suppose the entertainment around here has fascinated me."

"I'll say!" Banagher happily said. He couldn't wait to show Audrey some video games. "Are you feeling up to a look at some of the stuff at my place later?"

Audrey looked at him, surprised at first, before she let out a small chuckle.

"I think that sounds like fun, thank you Banagher."

Two of Banagher's classmates that were walking not far from them noticed something.

"Hey, Tom, what do you think that is?" One of Banagher's classmates asked.

"Back there, what's that?" Micott said. She spotted what appeared to be a light in the distance.

The others turned their attention to what Micott was referring to, as did the rest of the class. Audrey recognized the sight, it was the thrusters of a distant mobile suit, Marida's.

"Oh no."
1151212111233211211312111.title: The beginning of a War

choices: Banagher reaches the mansion on his own
Audrey, Takuya, and Micott all go with Banagher
11512121112332112113121111.content:
Marida had the Kshatriya uses the thrusters on it's binders to dodge the beams coming at her, causing her gut to jiggle and bounce with every movement. three of the Kshatriya's Funnels then fired at a Jegan from multiple directions, one shot pierced it's right leg, another struck an area next to the cockpit, and one priced the cockpit, killing the pilot. Unfortunately, without the pilot to keep the mobile suit flying, it fell down towards the town and soon hit the side of a highway, it exploded as soon as it made contact. The debris rained down on the unsuspecting civilians, injuring and killing some.

Marida angrily gripped the Kshatriya's controls harder, her anger at what had happened clear on her pudgy face. She knew that civilian casualties were inevitable in war but she hated it so much when it happened.

The fighting raged on. A ReZEL Commander Type was forced by Marida to crash on to the roof of Banagher's school. The pilot was protected by the safety airbags and saved from a concussion, and in his groggy vision, glared at the enemy suit.

"Damned Zeon monster!" The pilot resumed firing at Marida, determined to still aid his allies.

Marida grunted, her stomach hurt. Piloting a mobile suit wasn't good for a full stomach. While she wasn't stuffed, there was still a lot of food in her sloshing belly. Still, she remained focus on combat. As she dodged the shots the downed ReZEL fired at her, Marida felt a chill from not just the the enemy pilot's intent to kill but also his hatred, causing goosebumps to appear over her massive body. Marida kept her eyes on her opponents as she released the Kshatriya's Funnels, she noticed that one of them was missing, there should be three of them, she only saw two.

Her senses and radar alerted her that the third enemy was behind her and was nearly in range to strike her with his beam saber. The other ReZEL still in the air fired his Beam Gun at the Kshatriya which dodged the shots. A ReZEL then swung it's beam saber over it, the Kshatriya countered the attack with it's own beam saber.

"Get off my –UUURRRP- back!" Marida burped out.

The obese pilot then had the Kshatriya slash off the ReZEL's right arm. The ReZEL fired it's Vulcan Guns at the Kshatriya, which then broke the blue mobile suit's visor with one of the Sub-Arms hidden in the binders. The Sub-Arm then tore the beam saber from the severed arm and gave it to the Kshatriya's left hand.

"So –UURRAAP- heavy!"

The Kshatriya was now wielding two beam sabers. A ReZEL then fired at the Kshatriya with it's Beam Rifle, the green mobile suit dodging each shot and closing in, it's chubby pilot intending on destroying the ReZEL with it's Beam Sabers. The Federation pilot then switched his rifle to emit a beam saber, which he used to clash with the Kshatriya's. Marida made the Kshatriya impale the ReZEL from above, killing the pilot. She left the weapon in the mobile suit.

Now she had to deal with the mobile suit on the building.

"I'll shut you down! UURRP!" Marida sent three Funnels at the downed ReZEL that was still firing at her

They swept down to the Federation mobile suit and open fire. One shot hits the cockpit in the center abdomen, one shot hits the mechanical arm with the beam rifle, the ReZEL is down. However, the last hit pierces through the thruster pack from the side, hitting the small reactor core hidden inside. A nuclear explosion occurs, lighting the night sky of Industrial 7 like a miniature sun. Marida leaves the area, ashamed that she was so careless.

Banagher and his class saw the fighting and the damage it caused. The fear was obvious in their voices.

"There are holes in the colony."

"Guys, isn't that around where the school is?"

"This is war." Takuya ominously stated. His friends turned their heads towards him. "This is the beginning of a war."

"A war..." Banagher stated.

"Banagher, I need to go back to the mansion." Audrey suddenly stated.

"What?!"

"Cardeas said that he has the key to Laplace's Box. I need to know what has happened to it."

"You can't go!"

"I know it's dangerous, Banagher but whatever Laplace's Box is I have to make sure it never falls into the wrong hands."

Banagher shook his head in frustration. "Let's make sure everyone gets somewhere safe first, okay?!"

Audrey nodded.

The class made their way to the doors that led from the Snail to the colony. However, the doors were shut and there was no response to their pleas to open the doors. Banagher walked over to the access point on their side that was away from the rest to the class and attempted to open the doors with it, Audrey, Takuya, who was holding Haro, and Micott, with him. Banagher pressed the button for access, but the passage point seemed to be locked, and there didn't seem to be any reaction from the number lock. The brunette hit the machine in frustration. A look of worry was on Takuya's face, as well as Micott's.

"Hey, open the doors!" Takuya shouted, anger clear on his face.

Banagher somehow sensed that a nearby mobile suit was about a fire, a chill came over him. He looked behind him and saw a stray shot heading towards the doors. The shot hit where the rest of Banagher's class was. The impact shook the area and sent a powerful gust of wind towards them. Banagher grabbed Micott and held her close to him, shielding her from the harsh wind. When the gust was gone Banagher looked at where his class was, he didn't see them.

The Kshatriya dashed towards a Jegan and slashed it half with it's Beam Saber. The large mobile suit then moved towards the top of where the doors once stood and began to cut a hole through the wall.

"Marida!" Audrey shouted.

"H-Hey, Banagher," Takuya began as he stood from the spot he took cover in.

Banagher looked at Audrey and then Takuya, he was so glad to see that they were alright. However, he and Audrey then saw the doors begin to grow bright red as heat over took it.

"Hey, Micott, you're not hurt, are you? What about the othe--"

Takuya was cut off as Banagher and Audrey forced him and Micott down. A red beam destroyed the door. It was a shot from the Mega Beam Launcher of a ReZEL Commander Type that was in it's Waverider mode. It quickly passed through the hole took out it's Beam Saber. It then fired two grenades form it's Grenade Launcher. The Kshatriya dodged the shots but was forced to retreat as the ReZEL got closer to it.

Audrey, Banagher, and Takuya watched, they were rendered speechless by how close they were to the fighting.

However, Micott was horrified by something else.

"Esther, Marco, Dennis, Tom..."

Micott was slowly moving forward.

"Micott!" Banagher grabbed Micott to keep her form going anywhere on her own as it was still too dangerous.

"Where are they?!"

Micott began sobbing. Audrey was filled with guilt. She knew that the wars Zeon started killed many innocent people, but this was the first time she had ever seen it and the effect it had on their friends and families.

"I'm sorry, I have to go." Banagher said.

"Huh?!" Audrey couldn't believe what Banagher had just said.

"Takuya, Audrey, take care of Micott."

"Where are you going?" Takuya asked.

"I need to go back to the mansion. There's something very important there."

"Don't, Banagher!" Audrey interjected. "I'm the one who will be going."

"Audrey, please."

"I won't let you risk your life for me. Far too many already have." Audrey said, sorrow evident in her voice.

"Audrey, everything will be okay." The brunette said, a comforting smile gracing his face. Banagher's words somehow made Audrey feel confident that everything would be okay. She loved his smile so much. For most of her life, Audrey was rarely around people that would treat her like a person instead of a symbol. Banagher's smile was so open about their friendship, whenever she looked at his face, even now, she could tell that he was her friend.

"Nothing's going to happen to me, I'll be back, I promise. Now please, look after Micott for me."

Audrey nodded. "I will." She didn't want Banagher to leave but she trusted him to return safely. She knew he would.

"Thank you." Banagher turned his attention to Takuya. "Takuya, did you recognize that mobile suit that just tore through here?"

"It looked like a Zeta-type transformable suit. I think it's from the Federation."

"Then its mothership should be at the Snail. You have to get there. It can protect you."

Banagher very gently moved Micott into Takuya, who grabbed hold of her. Banagher then left.

"Don't go!" Micott shouted. The brunette stood up. Takuya attempted to keep her from leaving. "You can't leave me here. Please don't leave me! Banagher!"

"Am I being too cold?" Banagher thought to himself. "Still, it's better that I go then Audrey. I don't know why but for some reason I want to go back there. I feel like... there's something there I missed. Something very important."
11512121112332112113121111.title: The Key

115121211123321121131211111.content:
The Kshatriya shielded itself from the ReZEL's Vulcan Guns with it's binders. The ReZEL then closed in and struck it with it's Beam Saber, which clashed with the Kshatriya's own. Marida then had the Kshatriya grab the Federation mobile suit's face and then crashed it into the artificial sun. The Funnels destroyed it before it get up. With no enemies left in the immediate vicinity, Marida left the area.

Banagher reached a lift that leads to the Snail and the battery for it was still running. As he was about to touch the control panel, the lift that was moving up let out a slight electronic sound and stopped in front of him.

"Who's in it?"

As soon as it opened, a tall man with sideburns aimed his gun at Banagher, the teen instinctively closed his eyes braced himself for the shot that never came.

"Don't shoot the kid."

The brunette opened his eyes and lowered his defenses, he saw a that there was another man, a bearded one wearing a thick trench coat. He could tell just from looking at them that they didn't belong to the Federation or the Vist Foundation, they were very clearly wearing regular clothes. Unbeknownst to Banagher, this was Suberoa Zinnerman and his subordinate, Flaste. As they passed by him, Zinnerman then fired his pistol into the control panel, turning it nonoperational. He let go of the pistol, it was evidently out of ammo.

"Have you been able to get in touch with Marida?" Zinnerman man asked Flaste as they left Banagher's vision.

Marida. He knew that girl, she was Audrey's friend, the one who attempted to bring her back, and the pilot of the green mobile suit that was destroying the Federation mobile suits. He would have to think about what this meant later, he needed to focus on finding another lift to use.

As Marida made her way through the Industrial Block, she soon spotted Audrey, who was carrying Haro along with two civilians she didn't recognize, Takuya and Micott.

"Princess."

Audrey somehow felt Marida saw her. She instinctively looked at the Kshatriya, she would recognize that mobile suit anywhere.

"Marida."

The monoeye on the Kshatriya's head looked at Audrey as well as Micott and Takuya.

"Oh God, why's it looking at us?" Takuya uttered.

Before Marida could make an attempt to retrieve Audrey, a Loto, stepped out of it's hiding spot and fire it's Missile Launcher at Marida's mobile suit. This unit was piloted by Daguza Mackle, the commander of the Earth Federation Forces' ECOAS special forces team. The Kshatriya shielded itself with it's binders and manged to dodge a few shots. The dust from the explosions blinded Marida's vision, it wasn't a good idea to move as full speed while she couldn't see but she had no choice, the Federation unit would surely fire at her gain if she stayed still. Marida had the Kshatriya move upwards at north eastern angle, her vision locked on the Loto. This resulted in her crashing into the upper part of a wall, Daguza immediately fired again, had the Kshatriya not shielded itself in time, those shots would've caused massive damage.

Audrey had her gaze fixated on the fight.

"What are you doing?!" Micott shouted, snapping Audrey out of her trance.

"Come on, we've gotta get outta here!" Takuya added.

"R-Right!"

Daguza exited the Loto and prepared to fire an anti-mobile suit bazooka at the Kshatriya. He already had the unit in his sights when it removed itself from the wall but he needed to ait for it to get closer before he could fire.

"Not yet."

Within in seconds, the Kshatriya launched it's Funnels and was now in range.

"Got you."

Daguza fired and the Kshatriya shielded itself, Marida expected it to be a regular missile but it wasn't. It detonated before it could make contact and disabled the Kshatriya's cameras. What was once was a clear image of Marida's surroundings was replaced by a blinding light. The tubby pilot grunted as she closed her eyes as the light was hurting them. Daguza immediately jumped off the Loto, and Marida's Funnels soon wildly fired, a beam pierced through the front of the Loto, evaporating the control zone and cutting through to the back. The Loto exploded and blew apart the armor on top.

"Unreal..." Takuya uttered in horror.

The three teens then noticed that the flaming debris of the Loto are heading towards them. They braced for the impact, Takuya held onto Micott tightly, whilst Audrey held Haro even closer, her eyes closed. Fortunately, a ReZEL knocked the debris away from them with it's shield.

"We're saved." Takuya uttered as he and Micott looked up at the machine.

When Audrey heard those words, she opened her eyes and looked at their savior.

"This is the second time I almost died today." Audrey thought to herself.

"It's a Federation mobile suit. It's an RGZ-95. A ReZEL, Micott!" Takuya continued. "Hey, we're students at the Industrial College. They blew holes in the colony, so we escaped. Can you help us?"

The ReZEL's piloted exited the mobile suit's cockpit and turned off his helmet's visor. His name was Riddhe Marcenas. Audrey noticed that he seemed to have a pendent wrapped his wrist but he was too far away for her to see what it looked like.

As Banagher continued his search for a lift that lead to the snail, he came across a room unlike any he had seen.

"What's this?"

In the middle of the room was a white mobile suit being held in place by a box-shaped container cage.

"This is..."

There was no doubt about it. Pure white armor, translucent visor at roughly where the eyes are, and protruding long horn on the forehead. This was-

"The Unicorn."

The mobile suit he saw this morning at the museum. The cockpit at the abdomen was opened, as well as the cockpit's door. He floated up to the cockpit and stood at the edge of it, there was man in the cockpit whose back was facing him. Cardeas Vist. He noticed that Banagher was behind him.

"Gael? You made it." Cardeas said as he turned around to discover that Gael wasn't there, Banagher was. "It's you. Why are you here?" His voice is different from the voice Banagher heard in the villa, and it seem that he’s a changed man.

"For the key. Audrey said that it can't be allowed to fall into the wrong hands." Banagher explained.

"You're in it."

It took Banagher a second to processes what he was told. "This is the key?"

"Yes. It will lead it's chosen rider to Laplace's Box. This is the Unicorn Gundam."

"You were planning on escaping in it, weren't you?!" Banagher accused, his voice filled with rage and frustration at the man.

"Even if I did, I wouldn't survive." The head of the Vist Foundation stated.

Banagher slammed his fist against the side of the cockpit in frustration. "What the hell's wrong with you?!" He shouted, even he was surprised that he was letting out all his anger and frustrations. "You act like you're so superior, but you can't do anything! Audrey came to you trying to stop this war from breaking out, and you had the power to do that, didn't you?"

An explosion occurred near the room and flames began to enter it but the two ignored it. Right now, they had to talk and nothing was going to prevent that.

"Those people... they had plans for tomorrow... for next week... they had a future! They weren't supposed to die like this! I lost my mother, but it was different. This isn't the way people are supposed to die. It's wrong..."

"People should be treated with dignity."

Cardeas words resonated with Banagher. He looked as the man before slowly stood up, clutching a wound on his chest. "We're supposed to respect one another's lives. But once we grow out of childhood, though we know better, we still cause meaningless bloodshed. We've done it to the Earth as well. We devoured the resources then sought out new frontiers to exploit in space. Humanity grew out of control and must endeavor to regain its dignity. We must revive the hope that was born one hundred years ago."

"Through the potential that lies within, we will demonstrate the true power and compassion of humanity." Banagher didn't know why but somehow everything that was being said felt familiar to him. Even the words he just said felt like he had said them long ago.

"So, you still remember." Cardeas stated.

"To transcend what is immediate and realize our god-like potential, the greatness within us that is, possible." Cardeas stuck his and out as he spoke and Banagher slowly grabbed it. You've come this far, but are you confident that your conviction will not waver? The weight of the burden she has to bear is immense. You'll need the resolve to carry the weight of the world on your shoulders if you go with her. Do you have it?"

Banagher pondered his answer for a moment. "I don't have confidence or resolve. All I know is that I need her to need me. I have to be with her. I have to help her."

Cardeas' clips curled up, and a smiling face was right in front of Banagher. It wasn't a wry smile nor a mocking smile, but a satisfied smile that was mixed with pride and some sadness.

"Take this."
115121211123321121131211111.title: RX-0 Unicorn Gundam

1151212111233211211312111111.content:
Cardeas placed Banagher's hand on the monitor on the chair that had the controls to the Unicorn. The monitor's light flashes, and the words access authorized is shown on the screen

Banagher then sat in the chair and put his hands on the control sticks on both left and right side. A flashing light appeared and scanned Banagher and the data it collected on the monitor appeared. A silhouette of Banagher's body was there, the words "Biometric Scan" were to the right of it and "Now Registering" were to the left of it. The latter words soon changed to "Complete".

"I've programmed it to respond to you and you alone." Cardeas explained. "If you can prove yourself to be a suitable pilot, and I know you will, the Unicorn will grant you powers unrivaled And then show you the path to Laplace's Box."

"But what is Laplace's Box?"

"It's a dark curse that has sentenced the Vist family to serve as its guardian for a hundred years. But if used properly, it can bring light to this Universal Century."

"What is it?"

"Anna... your mother didn't want to see you fall victim to this curse, so she took you from me." Before now, Cardeas' words would've been nonsense to Banagher but somehow, everything felt like it make sense to him. it did make sense to him. "She must hate me... as I'm sure you do as well. But now you must go. Fear not, If you trust in the possibility that lies within and try with all your might, the path will show itself to you."

Cardeas warmly placed a bloody hand on Banagher's cheek. Something he hadn't done in so long. Banagher placed his over Cardeas', it felt so familiar.

"It's selfish. You can't say all that to me now."

"Please forgive me." Cardeas said as he began to float away. His hand left Banagher's cheek, leaving a bloody hand print. "I wanted more...so much..." Banagher grabbed Cardeas' hand hoping to stay with him but he soon lost hold of him as Cardeas left the cockpit. A smile then appeared on Cardeas' face as he looked at Banagher. "Banagher... My wish has finally come true, Anna..."

"Father!"

The cockpit closed as the flames consumed Cardeas. Banagher fell back in the chair and placed a hand over his right eye. "Father? Did I... Was he... My..." An old memory resurfaced in Banagher's mind, an old memory of him leaving the mansion with is mother when he was little. The view of the surroundings the cockpit gave him vanished. Tears left Banagher's eyes as the truth set in.

Soon, an image he knew every well appeared on the cockpit's screens, The Lady And The Unicorn.

"'To my only desire.' The beast of possibility... The symbol of hope."

His father showed that picture and was the one who taught him the meaning behind it.

"Father... Mother... Please forgive me, but I... I must go!"

Banagher grabbed the controls, he was ready. The Unicorn's eyes light up, giving a human feel to it. The restraints in the container left the mobile suit and the Unicorn began to step forward amidst the flames.

"Audrey."

Even far away in palm of a ReZEL, Audrey could still feel Banagher.

"Banagher!"

Marida could feel Audrey as she made her way to the colony's exit.

"Princess!"

The pilot noticed that something that emerging from the flames nearby. It was a mobile suit, the Unicorn.

"Where did the machine come from?" Marida thought. There was something about it that set her on edge.

"Funnels!"

Marida released her Funnels and fired them at it, the Unicorn dodged the beams and charged at her. The Kshatriya took out it's Beam Saber but the Unicorn pushed against mobile suit and crushed the hand that held the Beam Saber, crushing the Beam Saber as well. With the strength of the Unicorn, Banagher knew that he could defeat the enemy in front of him.

"Get... Get the hell outta here!"

He increased the Unicorn's thrusters to their maximum strength. The force was enough to active the Kshatriya's airbag, there was barely enough room in Marida's chair for both the airbags and her massive belly. It didn't take long for them to near the wall at the end of the tunnel. The Funnels fired a hold through it which the Unicorn forced the Kshatriya through.

The airbags in the Kshatriya's cockpit deflated back into their inactive form, allowing Marida to fight back.

Marida emitted a huge burp, the pressure from the airbags hitting her forced out the gas in her big belly. With the air pressure on the machine gone, Marida controlled the thrusters like she’s launching and leaves the white mobile suit. Both mobile suits turned around so that they face each other.

"He's open!" Marida released all twenty four of the Kshatriya's funnels.

Banagher pained at the sight, he didn't what to do. Suddenly, the display console immediately flashed the words NT-D, and the fixate equipped on the chair rest moved on its own as it clamps onto Banagher’s head on both left and right side. Everything then began.

The Funnels simultaneously fired at the white mobile suit but the Unicorn was protected by it's I-Field.

The parts forming the shoulders of the Unicorn broke open from the gaps in the armor, and the sliding armor revealed a frame that’s giving off red light. The same phenomenon happens with the legs, knees and thigh. The front armor of the waist and the torso open up as well, causing the Unicorn to look bigger. The red luminescent glow is becoming stronger, causing the bright patterns decorating the white mobile suit to become clearer.

The wrists slid, and two beam saber handles appeared at the back of it, hanging on the shoulders like a decoration. The one change that’s most obvious however is the head. The part like a mask opened, and the visor on the complex eye slid off, causing the Unicorn’s face to look completely different. The one horn that’s represent the unit splits in half and shows a V-shape, showing the main camera. The two cameras that are positioned like human eyes glowed, and the unit had a golden V-shaped horn on its forehead.

The Unicorn readied it's beam saber, Banagher was ready to defeat his opponent.

On board the Nahel Argama with Micott and Takuya, Audrey looked at the sight as she held Haro in her hands. She had seen this sight before, the mobile suit she saw was

"Gundam."
1151212111233211211312111111.title: Day of the Unicorn

choices: Banagher is taken to the Nahel Argama
11512121112332112113121111111.content:
The Unicorn Gundam dashed towards the Kshatriya, destroying two Funnels along the way with a single slash of it's Beam Saber as if they were no threat at all. With the gap between the two suits quickly closing, Marida activated the Kshatriya's thrusters to get away, as the mobile suit wasn't designed for close combat and she wouldn't be able to use her Funnels on such a fast opponent before they managed to to strike her. But in spite of the the Kshatriya's increased speed, the Unicorn reached in a small matter of seconds. It slashed it's Beam Saber at the green mobile suit but the Kshatriya shield itself with it's Binders, resulting in three fourths of it's front left Binder being sliced off.

Marida grunted form the impact, her gut jiggling. She put more distance between herself and her enemy using her mobile suit's thrusters but the white mobile suit quickly followed after her and would soon reach it. She fired her Funnels at it an attempt to slow it down and damage it but like before, the Unicorn kept at the same speed and manged to dodge all of the Funnels shots. It destroyed two more Funnels as it got ever closing, not slowing down in the slightest.

Marida turned the Kshatriya towards the Unicorn, realizing that she would to prepare to meet it in melee combat.

"That thing is built with Psycho-Frame throughout the whole body?" Marida noted as she watched the Unicorn dodge more shots from her Funnels and destroy one.

The Unicorn Gundam destroyed another Funnel as it dashed towards the Kshatriya.

"Gundam..." Marida said aloud to herself, rage building within her. "Gun –UURRP- dam... UUURRAP! Gundam is... –UUUURRRP- the enemy!"

The Kshatriya ignited it's Beam Saber and charged towards the Unicorn Gundam. Their sabers clashed with each other and the suits rotated in sync with each other as they did so. They soon moved away and then charged at each other again. They pulled away from each other yet again but charged much sooner this time. Banagher striked before the Kshatriya was able to and cut off even more of it's front left Binder, and destroying the thrusters the Binder had and forcing the Kshatriya to retreat a good distance from him, using it's remaining thrusters. The uneven amount of force caused it to flip 360 degrees vertically, resulting in Marida's entire body jiggling around all over the place.

Letting out a ferocious belch, Marida charged at her enemy before she felt Zinnerman calling for her. She immediately calmed down, stopped her charge and looked towards where her captain was. She saw a Geera Zulu and focused on the image in her cockpit. She saw that he was in the the palm of the mobile suit's hand, along with Flaste, and was making a movement with hand that singled for her to return to the Garencieres.

The obese pilot realized almost too late that she had let her guard down and the Unicorn was about to land a strike on the Kshatriya's chest. She activated it's I-Field just in time to prevent any damage and began her retreat. She fired all twelve of her mobile suit's Mega Particle Cannons at the Unicorn. Banagher maneuvered the Unicorn Gundam in between every shot. With her mission of securing the Garencieres' escape complete, Marida quickly left the battlefield.

With Neo-Zeon's retreat, Industrial 7, Banagher's and his friends' home, was safe. The adrenaline left Banagher and he felt his exhaustion catch up with him. he struggled to keep his eyes open, he still had to make his friends were safe, but his entire body felt so heavy. Not even when he fought Marida in-person had he felt this exhausted. In spite of his best efforts, Banagher Links, now the chosen pilot of the RX-0 Unicorn Gundam, fell into a deep sleep.
11512121112332112113121111111.title: The Power Called Gundam

choices: They discover that Banagher is the Gundam's pilot
Audrey stuffs herself to the brim
Audrey and Micott stuff themselves to the brim
115121211123321121131211111111.content:
The Unicorn Gundam was retrieved by a ReZEL sent by the Nahel Argama, the ship Banagher's friends were now on. Since Banagher was now asleep, he was naturally unable to respond the ReZEL's pilot's messages. Correctly deducing that the pilot was unconscious, the Argama's mechanical crew began to hack into the mobile suit itself to open the cockpit. However, the Unicorn had a very strong defense system against hacking, making progress very slow.

Elsewhere on the ship, Audrey, along with Micott, Takuya, and Haro, were currently in one of the lounge rooms. They had just been escorted there by Mihiro Oiwakken, a communications officer.

"Please wait here for now." Mihiro said, standing just outside of the door frame. " Let me know if you need anything."

"Have you received any word about who was piloting that Gundam?" Audrey asked as she walked up to the officer. The blonde couldn't explain why but she couldn't shake the feeling that Banagher was the pilot.

"No, from what I've been told, the hatch hasn't even been opened yet."

Audrey was disappointed to hear that. Of course she didn't want Banagher to risk his life but at least being the pilot of the horned Gundam would mean that he was accounted for. She would never forgive herself if he got hurt doing something for her. She hoped, more then she ever had for anything before, that he was alright.

"Hey there, are you doing all right?"

A friendly voice inserted itself into the conversation. Audrey and Mihiro looked towards the source of it, a young, blonde Federation officer walking to them.

"Oh, I'm the ReZEL pilot that pulled you guys out. My name's Riddhe Marcenas." He said as he finished walking to them.

"And my name is Audrey Burne."

"You want to go take a look?" Riddhe offered.

"Huh?"

"At the Gundam." He clarified. "You are curious, aren't you?"

"Ensign Riddhe..." Mihiro uttered. While it wasn't exactly against regulations to show civilians mobile suits in the hanger, it still wasn't something the captain would likely approve of. Not to mention that they should be resting after the hell they had to endure today.

"It'll be fine, Ensign Mihiro." Riddhe assured her. "I know a secret spot where we can steal a peek."

"That's not what I meant."

"I wanna go!" Takuya suddenly said with a big grin as he ran right next to Audrey, much to her shock. "This Nahel Argama was the mothership of the Gundam Team in the first Neo Zeon War, and now it's carrying this new Gundam! It's just too cool. It's like destiny, or... or something!"

It was very clear from the look of surprise and confusion on her face that Audrey was caught completely off-guard by Takuya's enthusiasm. After having spent almost her entire life aorund cynical and stoic soldiers, it would take a while for her to get used to someone being so upbeat. It took her a few moments to regain the stoic look she usually had on her face.

"Uh... yeah." Riddhe said. He wasn't expecting to see such enthusiasm from someone had just barely survived a terrorist attack. It was a good trait to have in times like this, he supposed.

"Hey, you coming, Micott?" Takuya said as he and Audrey looked at their brown-haired friend.

"Whatever..." Micott said in a depressed tone, lounging on the couch as she held Haro.

The smile on Takuya's face instantly vanished and was replaced with a look of worry. He walked over to comfort his friend.

"And I'm coming too." Mihiro told Riddhe. "If that Gundam hadn't shown up when it did, you and I wouldn't be having this discussion now. I for one want to meet the pilot who saved our lives."

Mihiro's words only made Audrey even more worried about Banagher, the worry was visible on her face. Feeling a sudden craving for a snack, Audrey walked over to the nearby vending machine and ordered a bag of tortilla chips. She opened up the bag and sighed as she looked at it. She couldn't believe that she was actually eating comfort food. The blonde began eating her snack.
115121211123321121131211111111.title: The Calm After the Storm

choices: Banagher and Audrey stuff themselves silly
Let's see what Micott and Takuya are doing
1151212111233211211312111111111.content:
"So, that's Gundam?" Micott asked, still holding Haro as she and the others looked at the white mobile suit called the Unicorn Gundam.

The place Riddhe had taken them turned out to be an observation room in the hanger. And as any observation room should do, it provided them with a perfect view of the Gundam.

"That's what they're saying." Takuya responded. "It looks so different."

"I feel like I've seen you somewhere before." Riddhe said to Audrey.

Audrey turned her face away from the others as they turned their eyes towards her. She hadn't been seen since U.C. 0088 so she hoped that no one could recognize e her as Mineva Lao Zabi but it seemed that hope was in vain. She braced herself as much as she could for the words "You're Mineva Lao Zabi!" but she never expected what Riddhe would actually say.

"Hey! You look like Natsume Swanson, you know, the famous actress." He said in a friendly manner.

Audrey blinked twice in surprise, a surprised look on her face, feeling a huge weight leave her shoulders. Though she wished it would leave her gut too. "I-I don't know much about the entertainment industry." In the span of a few seconds her expression had changed from showing her grim acceptance and guilt into showing sheer confusion.

"Oh, right..."

Mihiro closed her eyes and frowned, clearly suffering from a bad case of second hand embarrassment. Micott had her eyes halfway closed, she couldn't believe just how bad he was at this. Audrey just returned to her bag of chips.

"Ah, Ensign!" Takuya suddenly said, immediately grabbing everyone's attention. "The cockpit is opening."

The group looked at the Gundam's cockpit to see it open, just as Takuya had said. As it finished opening, they saw Banagher sitting in the pilot's seat, unconsciousness and with a bloody hand print on his left cheek. It was a sight none of them would ever forget.

Micott covered her mouth with her hands, a terrified look in her eyes. The Burnett was completely scared speechless.

"Banagher!" Takuya uttered in shock. "Why is he...?"

"How could he be the pilot?" Riddhe asked aloud.

Audrey had a completely stoic expression but this was merely a facade. Had it reflected how she really felt she would've looked as horrified as Micott and incredibly guilty.

"Banagher! What happened to you?! This is all my fault." Thoughts such as this flooded her mind. "Please be alright."

Banagher was immediately rushed to the med-bay. Thankfully, he wasn't wounded, he merely passed out from the sheer amount of G-forces that were exerted on to him. Of cruse, he would still need plenty of rest but that was all he would need before he was as good as new.

As Banagher slept in the med-bay's, he dreamed of the life he had with his parents, before his mother took him away to live a normal life, away from the dark curse of the Vist family. His friends waited in the med-bay for him to wake up and fortunately, ti would only a little over half an hour before he did.

"Banagher. Banagher." Haro said as Banagher's eyebrows and eyelids began to move, showing that he was regaining consciousness. And sure enough, his eyes did open, much to his friends' relief.

"Ah, Doctor!' Takuya said, sporting a relieved smile.

The Argama's doctor, Hasan, got out of his chair to look over his patient.

"Banagher..." Micott said in a concerned-sounding voice.

"Hey, are-are you okay?" Takuya said, sounding equally concerned.

Banagher's eyelids were halfway down, he still felt so tired and his body still felt so heavy, the brown-haired young man was barely able to stay conscious. He looked aorund the unfamiliar room to see who else was there with him. He saw Micott, who was holding Haro, Takuya, and Audrey, all looking back at him. As soon as he saw his blonde friend, his eyes opened more, as if her very presence was enough to vanquish his weariness.

"Audrey." He uttered.

Micott looked at Audrey, surprise that her name was the first thing he said as he woke up.

"Banagher, can you hear me?" Hasan before he grabbed both of Banagher's wrists. "If you can hear me, squeeze my hand."

Banagher did so.

Mihiro grabbed the communications phone and dialed for the bridge. "Mihiro to the bridge. The boy is just regaining consciousness."

"How do you feel?" Hasan asked Banagher.

"A little dizzy and really tired."

"Are there any parts of your body you can't feel? Any aching or pain?"

"No, nothing like that."

"Good, your condition is as good as I was expecting it to be." The doctor said. "All you need is some rest and you'll feel fine soon."

"Where am I?"

"You're on board the Nahel Argama, a Londo Bell ship. You'll be filled in on the details tomorrow, once you feel better."

Hours later, Banagher was finally released from the med-bay. Along with his friends, Banagher was given his own room, since it would take a few days until the Nahel Argama could reach somewhere to drop them off. After putting his regular clothes back on, he decided to go check out his room. He wasn't expecting anything amazing since this was a warship but he was a tad curious and it couldn't hurt to get a head-start on getting used to it.

When he opened his room's door he saw Audrey sitting on his couch with Haro and the table across from the bed was nearly overflowing with food. Needless to say, this was far from what Banagher expected to find.

"Um, Audrey." Banagher uttered, walking into the room and closing the door behind him, confusion evident in his voice. "What's with all the food?"

"It's for you." The blonde answered. "After everything you've done for me, I wanted to do something for you, even if it's just something small like this."

"I don't think there's anything small about the amount of food you got." Banagher said as she sat down next to Audrey. "Thanks, I really appreciate this."

"You're welcome but before we begin eating, I want to apologize."

"For what?" Banagher had a confused look on his face, he honestly had no idea what his blonde friend wanted to apologize for.

"For having you go back to the mansion." Audrey's guilt was clear as day on her chubby face. "If you didn't go you wouldn't have gotten hurt. I'm really sorr-"

"Don't worry about it Audrey, it's not your fault." Banagher cut her off, a comforting smile on his face. "Now, how much food are you going to eat?" The brunette had a big, goofy grin on his face.

Audrey let out a laugh, her friend was just being too cute. He certainly knew how to cheer people up. "Well, given that my belly has gotten a bit bigger from my hot dog binge," Audrey gave her pudgy belly a light slap for emphasis, causing it to jiggle. "I'm sure I'll be able to eat even more then I did last time!"
1151212111233211211312111111111.title: A Big Reward

11512121112332112113121111111111.content:
"Whoo, I couldn't eat –UUUURRRP- another bite." Audrey said, rubbing her bloated middle with a content smile on her face.

"Me –UUURRRP- neither." Banagher said as he rubbed his stuffed belly, sporting a similar smile.

Audrey and Banagher were leaning back into the couch and rubbing their stuffed middles after having consumed the entirety of the feast Audrey had prepared for the both of them. Both their pants were unbuttoned and unzipped to make room for their stomachs. Banagher's belt had been undone and Audrey's coat was unbuttoned, Mihiro was kind enough to sow the buttons back on and Audrey was not going to break them again after that.

"I know I said I was going to eat a lot but I didn't think we would –UURRRP- actually eat everything." Audrey stated, giving her tummy a few pats.

"I didn't either." Banagher said. "So out of everything we ate, what was your favorite?"

"Hmm... I'd have to say the hot dogs."

"I had a feeling you'd say that." Banagher chuckled.

"What gave it away?"

The two then let out a small laugh.

Suddenly, both teens felt gurgles in their bellies, accompanied with sharp pains in their chests.

"Oof, I don't think my stomach is agreeing with me." Banagher groaned, giving his belly a rub.

"Mine isn't either." Audrey moaned, rubbing her belly. As much as her stomach hurt she was more concerned about Banagher.

Audrey couldn't bear seeing Banagher in pain like this after all her kind friend did to help her.The chubby blonde wished there was a way she could help ease her bloated friend's stomachache when she remembered the soothing belly rubs Banagher gave her when she had a stomachache.

"U-Um, B-Banagher..." Audrey started, blushing. "D-Do you want me to r-rub your b-belly?"

Both teens' faces were practically blushing scarlet when Audrey finished her sentence.

"Uh, s-sure! That'd be great!" Banagher said.

Audrey then moved a little closer to Banagher, who shifted slightly in his spot so that his gut was facing his friend. Audrey then slowly and nervously placed her hands on Banagher's belly. A few seconds of awkward silence filled the room, both teens blushing heavily. While Banagher had already rubbed Audrey's belly, her rubbing his was a completely new experience.

"So, uh, y-you can s-start whenever you're ready." Banagher stated.

"R-right! Sorry." Audrey stammered. "This is my first time doing something like this. I hope I'm not bothering you."

"Don't worry, you're not. I'd never consider you annoying, you're my friend." Banagher said with a sweet smile.

Audrey's face went even redder. "I-I-T-Thank you, that really means a lot to me, Banagher." The sheltered girl stuttered out, giving a shy, dorky and friendly smile.

"You're welcome!"

"Now here's your reward for being such a great friend, a nice belly rub! As soon as I can work up the courage that is, heh heh!" Audrey giggled.

"Take as much time as you'd like."

Audre nodded and turned her attention back to her friend's tummy. After a few more seconds of silence from the both of them and the blonde preparing herself, Audrey gulped and began gently rubbing Banagher's belly. Banagher let out a moan of pleasure as Audrey's hands made soothing and rhythmic motions on his belly, all his discomforts fading away as a soothing warmth filled him.

"That feels amazing, Audrey." Banagher said with a smile.

"I'm glad it does, B-Banagher." Audrey, a kind smile on her face.

A little bit later, Audrey's massage accidentally forced a huge burp out of Banagher.

"UUURRRP! Sorry about that!" Banagher said, his blush returning.

Audrey giggled. "Don't worry, just do whatever you need to feel better. That's what you told me to do, right? So you should do the same." Audrey giggled a bit more, Banagher was just so cute.

After taking a second to process that a girl and prim and proper as Audrey, who unbeknownst to him was even a princess, has absolutely no problem with him letting out a huge burp right in front of her, Banagher started giggling with her.

"Good point, UUUURRRP!"

Audrey continued rubbing Banagher's belly, a belch occasionally flying out of his mouth. It was a new yet enjoyable experience for the both of them. Audrey's massage felt absolutely amazing to Banagher as he let his bloated gut surge out and felt Audrey move her hands in soothing circles on his stuffed belly, easing the pains and aches inside it. The burps and moans of pleasure he would let out were clear signs of how much he was enjoying this.

Audrey was enjoying it just as much. After seeing her brown haired friend go through so much, some of which she blamed herself for, she was so happy that she could finally help him feel better. And not to mention, after living such a sheltered life, she loved that she could finally hang out with a friend.

A few minutes into Audrey's massage, Audrey's bloated belly let out a low grumble and she groaned. It was clear from that and the look on her face that she was indeed feeling unconformable. Being the caring guy that he was, Banagher immediately picked up on this.

"Does your stomach hurt?" He asked in a concerned voice.

"Oooh -UUURRAP!- Yeah, kinda."

"Well then, how about I give it a good ol' belly rub?" Banagher said with a goofy smile.

"If anyone else if your situation said that I would say they should lie down and rest. But you've always got energy to help others, don't you?" Audrey said with a playful smirk.

"Yup!" Banagher enthusiastically said, a big dorky smile on his face.

Banagher placed his hands on Audrey's stuffed belly and began rubbing it, causing her to let out a moan of pleasure as the pain in her tummy faded away and she was filled with the same soothing warmth that Banagher felt.

"How does that feel?" Banagher asked.

"URRRAAAP!"

"Good to hear!"

Audrey and Banagher giggled. There was something funny about a girl as polite as Audrey giving a big burp as her answer.

And so, Audrey and Banagher rubbed each other's bellies at the same time. Both would often let out a mighty belch due to the massage. Audrey and Banagher loved rubbing the other's belly and the rubs they received as well. Neither would dare admit it but there was something they really liked about the bloated bellies they were sporting. Perhaps it was because they were a result of them hanging out and having fun.
11512121112332112113121111111111.title: Banagher and Audrey stuff themselves silly

Let's check on Micott and Takuya
Let's see what Marida is up to
115121211123321121131211111111111.content:
Audrey giggled before she pressed down slightly on Banagher's tummy, forcing a sizable belch out of her friend's lips.

"UUURRAAP!"

They both started giggling.

"Well excuse you, Banagher!" Audrey said in a playful tone.

"Hey, you're the who pressed down on my gut!" Banagher joked. "Two can play at that game!"

Just as Audrey did with him, Banagher then pressed down slightly on Audrey's stomach, eliciting an equally large belch from her.

"UUURRRAP!"

Both teens laughed again.

"Guess my manners need some work too, huh?" Audrey jokingly said, covering her mouth in a mock gesture of politeness.

"Nah, I think they're just fine!"

What the two overfed teens truly loved the most about this experience was how much closer it was allowing them to become. As they rubbed each other's belly, they happily talked o abut a variety of subjects, such as movies, videos games, and TV. Right now, they were currently watching a marathon an anime that covered the White Base's journey during the One Year War, a personal favorite of Banagher's. Though they were only a few minutes into the first episode.

"So this covers the White Base's -UUURP- entire service?" Audrey asked her friend, still rubbing his belly as he rubbed hers.

"Y -UURP- Yeah. This is one of my favorite shows, I've been a huge fan of it ever since –UURRP- I was a little kid." Banagher answered. He always loved geeking out with his blonde friend. "I've even got a lot of the models. You wanna –UURRAP- see them when this is all over?"

"Sure, that'd be great."

A little bit later, Audrey had an important question on her mind.

"Um... is Dozle –UURRAAP- Zabi in this?" Audrey felt really weird referring to her father by his full name.

"Huh? Oh yeah, he shows up in the next episode." Banagher answered. "He's actually really popular."

"He-He is?!" Audrey said, a little louder then she intended. She really didn't expect that her Father would be so popular.

"Yeah, I like him because he looks like a stereotypical villain when he's really a nice guy and a great dad. I'm sure you'll like a lot too. " Banagher had no clue how awkward this conversation was for Audrey.

"I'm sure I will." Audrey said, giving a small smile.

A little over fifteen minutes later, the episode ended.

"So what do you think?" Banagher asked.

"It was really good." Audrey answered. "Who are your favorite characters?"

"Hmm, I like them all so it's kinda hard to pick but my top three are Amuro, Sayla, and Frau. Do you have any favorites yet?"

Banagher's mention of Sayla stood to to Audrey, as she knew that was the fake name that the daughter of Zeon Zum Deikun took, with her real name being Artesia Som Deikun. From she was taught by the members of Neo-Zeon that looked after her, Sayla was now living a normal life with few (even inside of Neo-Zeon) knowing of her heritage. Audrey hoped that she would one day be able to live like that.

"I like Amuro and Frau.Though from what you said about him I have a good feeling that I'll like Dozle too." Audrey still felt weird referring to her father by his first name. "And if you like Sayla then I'll probably like her."

They then moved on to the next episode. A little bit into their viewing, Banagher and Audrey both felt their stomachs gurgle, they were about to let out a burp and it was going to be a big one. They both looked at each other and smiled.

"UUUUURRRRP!"

Banagher and Audrey both belted out a massive belch at the same time. They immediately started laughing, their faces blushing bright red. Of course, they were still embarrassed but they were having way too much fun to care.

"Ah ha ha, I'm getting pretty good at this, huh?" Audrey asked, covering her mouth in a mock gesture of politeness.

"I'll say!" Banagher concurred, chuckling. "Although you have a long way to go if you wanna match up to me!"

"Ha, no way! I'm definitely way past you in skill!" Audrey said with a playful wink.

"Heh, not likely, but okay!"
115121211123321121131211111111111.title: Burping and Geeking Out

1151212111233211211312111111111111.content:
Two episodes later, Banagher let out a loud yawn. This caught Audrey's attention. The well-fed blonde easily saw the drowsiness in her friend's eyes.

"Do you want to go to sleep?" Audrey asked.

"Yeah. I really need a nice, long nap." Banagher stated.

"I'm pretty tired too." The blonde gave a yawn of her own. "I'm surprised we managed to stay up so long, especially with all this food in our stomachs. Thanks for showing me Mobile Suit Gundam, Banagher."

"You're welcome. It was lots of fun watching it with you." The brunette said. "So I'll see you tomorrow."

"Um, a-actually, Banagher, is it alright if I could sleep here for the night?" Audrey asked, she and Banagher started blushing slightly. "It would probably be hard for me to walk back to my room while I'm this bloated. So I think I should stay here. A-Assuming that's alright with you."

"Sure, that'd be nice." Banagher said in usual friendly tone. "After all, it was pretty nice the first time we did this, heh heh."

"Thanks. Of course, before either of us go to sleep, we need to brush our teeth." The princess stated.

"I'm shocked you can even think about stuff like that after everything that happened." While Banagher knew that Audrey was obviously a very formal and polite person, he didn't know she was such a stickler for stuff like this.

"Taking care of our bodies is always important, Banagher." Audrey replied.

"Good point but I don't know if toothpaste is going to get the smell of pizza out of our mouths, given how much we ate." The brunette joked.

"Nonsense. Brushing our teeth will take care of that."

The two bloated teens then brushed their teeth together in Banagher's bathroom. Once they were done with that, it was time to get dressed for bed.

"I really wish –URAP- we had some pajamas to switch into." Banagher said as he and Audrey waddled out of his bathroom. "I could go for something really comfy after all that."

"We actually –UURP- do. They should be in your–UURAP- dresser." Audrey explained.

"Huh? Pajamas are standard –UURRAP- issue?"

"No, Miss Mihiro bought them a while ago for the crew." Audrey explained.

"That was nice of her." Banagher noted. "It must've cost her a lot of money. Let's just hope we can actually fit in any of them." Banagher chuckled as he gave his belly a little shake.

Audrey giggled at the sight. "Let's see."

They then waddled over to the dresser and opened the drawers one by one to find a collection of comfy looking pajamas. Most of them had styles that would work for a boy or a girl but a few of them were very clearly designed for girls. They picked their clothes and got changed. Audrey got changed in the bathroom while Banagher got changed in the bedroom itself.

Banagher wore a simple white t-shirt and blue pajama pants and Audrey wore a pink button up pajamas shirt that went along well her pink pajamas pants. Of course, given who incredibly bloated their stomachs were, they couldn't pull their shirts down all the way. Banagher's shirt rode up past his bellybutton and only manged to cover the top half of his gut. Audrey only buttoned the part of her shirt that covered her breasts, she knew that if she buttoned the parts meant to cover her middle, her belly would just pop the buttons off. The chubby princess' belly was left completely exposed.

Audrey looked down at her tummy and rested a hand on it as she stood outside the bathroom. She knew she had pigged out but seeing her gut completely bare really hammered the point home.

"UUURRAP! We're going to have work off a lot of weight tomorrow, –UURAAP- aren't we?" Audrey said with a sheepish grin on her face.

"Probably but don't worry, it's not that much –URP- weight." Banagher said, sitting on the edge of his bed with Haro by his side. "Besides, you still look great."

"Thanks." Audrey said as she waddled over to the bed and sat next to Banagher. "You still look great too. I-I didn't mean to imply that you're fat! You're not, you've just got a very big b-belly because you a-ate a lot. You're-"

"Relax, Audrey." Banagher said, giving Audrey a friendly pat on the back, eliciting another burp from her lips. "I know what you meant."

Audrey blushed, something that had long ceased to be an uncommon sight nowadays. "Th-thank you, Banagher," she said. "Your kind words...I don't know what I'd do without them."

Banagher quirked an eyebrow at this. "Hm? What do you mean?"

"Well, it's just...ah, how do I put it...? I suppose your words always have a type of warmness to them, one that's never counterfeit. And when I feel it, I know you never lie when you say things like that."

Banagher chuckled, rubbing the back of his head with a goofy grin on his face. "Wow, you can seriously feel that? Now I feel stupid! I mean, I know you're talented, but to even feel auras- is it, like, literal heat? Am I supposed to feel it, too?"

"But you do, Banagher. I can tell," Audrey said, nestling her large body into Banagher's own softness. "Everyone does when they're with a person they care about. I just tried to put my version into words."

"I never really thought about it like that. You make me feel the same way." Banagher said, starting to blush himself.

The two just sat there for a few seconds blushing at each other, not really knowing what to say. Suddenly, a giant belch escaped Banagher's lips, shocking both teens. They stared at each other for a few seconds before they burst out laughing.

"Good one, Banagher!" Audrey complimented, still laughing a bit.

"Thanks!" Banagher said with a goofy smile.

After exchanging good nights between each other and Haro, Banagher and Audrey then laid down in bed, Banagher was on his side while Audrey was laying on her back, the princess' gut sticking straight up into the air. She and Banagher closed their eyes and began drifting off to sleep. Shortly after, Audrey, not actually asleep yet, felt a hand make contact with her belly and make circular motions on the great expanse, a familiar warmth filling her. She opened her eyes to see that it was Banagher giving her a belly rub. She looked at his face.

"I figured you'd like a belly rub." Banagher said, sporting a dorky smile.

Audrey adopted a playful smirk, Banagher was just so cute. "Thanks, Banagher." She raised a hand into the air and wriggled her fingers playfully. "And I think you'd like one too!" She then placed her hand on Banagher's gut and started giving it a soothing rub. The bloated brunette let out a sigh of pleasure.

"I don't think I could ever turn down a belly rub from you."

Audrey and Banagher rubbed each other's big bellies, once again filling each other with a soothing warmth. They both occasionally belched, easing the pressure in their turbulent tummies. Some of the burps they let out were so loud, it actually surprised them. Since they were both still awake, they talked about whatever they could think of.

"Hey, Audrey, you've heard about the Axis –UUURRRP- Shock, right?" Banagher asked before he let out another belch.

"Yeah, UURRRRP! What about it?" The blonde remembered clear as day the dread and horror she felt as she heard about Axis getting closer and closer to Earth and how Londo Bell's attempts at stopping it were failing. Seeing the members of Neo-Zeon that she was with being so happy about the news unnerved her greatly. To say that Audrey was relieved when Axis was pushed back by Londo Bell is an understatement.

"I know this sounds stupid, but when Amuro, Londo Bell, –UURRAAP- and even some members of Neo-Zeon pushed back Axis, they created this aurora –UURRP- that was like the light from the human heart. Everyone there felt a warmth that made it seem like everything was going to be okay. That's... –UUUURRRP- kinda how I feel right now. I know it's a really stupid comparison but I still wanted to –UUURAAP- say it."

Audrey was far away from the battlefield but still saw the aurora of the Axis Shock as the asteroid moved away from Earth. Just looking at it filled her with a soothing warmth and hope for the future.

"That's not stupid at all. UUURRAP!" Audrey said with a warm smile. "A little weird, yes, but its not a bad comparison. I actually... feel like that too. These moments I've spent with you have been some of the happiest of my life."

"They're some of my happiest too." Banagher said, smiling.

The two bloated friends just smiled at each other for a few seconds, not really knowing what to say. Rather then say anything more, Audrey and Banagher unleashed a massive belch in unison.

"They're also some of our fullest too." Audrey with a chuckle.

"You've got that right." Banagher chuckled.

11512121112332112113121111111111111.content:
Hours later, Audrey woke up from her food coma. She yawned and stretched, still feeling a bit tired. She took a glance at the digital clock that was on top of the TV, already knowing before she read it that she had slept way longer then she usually did. The clock read that it was about 2 PM. Audrey almost let out a sigh, at least it wasn't as bad as it could possibly be. The blonde looked over at Banagher, her brown-haired friend was still sleeping soundly. Audrey couldn't help but let out a small smile, he just looked so cute.

The princess of Zeon got out of bed and walked over to the closet, her tummy jiggling a bit with every step, something Audrey still wasn't quite used to. She pulled her clothes out of the dresser and began walking over to the bathroom to get changed. Banagher was still sleeping but she didn't want to risk him waking up to see her without any shirt or bra on as she was changing clothes, her breasts completely exposed to him. Just the thought of it made a slight blush come to Audrey's chubby cheeks.

As she walked to the bathroom, Audrey saw the mess she and Banagher had made last night with their binge. There was empty snack bags, soda cans, bottles of water, chocolate bar wrappers, hot dog wrappings, licked clean plates, ice cream cans, and even a few boxes of pizza among others. And of course, they would have to clean all this up. Audrey didn't regret eating all that with Banagher, not one bit at all, but she was not a fan of all the cleaning they were going to have to do, hopefully before anyone else saw it.

Audrey entered the bathroom, shutting the door before she started to get changed. She didn't have any problem putting her clothes on, she hadn't gained that much weight, but how her clothes felt a little bit tighter compared to how they felt yesterday morning was still a reminder that she had put on weight. After getting dressed, she left the bathroom and put her pajamas away in the dresser. At that moment she heard a yawn come from Banagher. She looked over at him and saw him slowly getting up and stretching his arms as he yawned.

"Good morning, Banagher." Audrey said as she walked over to the bad and sat next to him.

"Morning, Audrey." Banagher replied. "So how long did we sleep in?"

"It's two o'clock. We really slept in."

"Yeah. At least our stomachs got plenty of time to digest." Banagher said. "Ready for breakfast?"

"Yeah, I'll wait outside while you get dressed."

As Audrey stood outside the door of their room and waited, she started to wonder if anyone might've walked past their room door last night and happened to hear the loud belches they let out or some of the the rather unusual conversations they had. She knew that even if someone had heard them, they wouldn't even know who they were from, unless they were Micott, Takuya, Riddhe, or Mihiro, but anyone hearing it would still be incredibly embarrassing, especially if it was someone who knew them.

When he buttoned and zipped his pants and put his belt on, Banagher noticed that they felt a more snug then before. He wasn't surprised at all, he knew he was going to pack on some pounds from all the gorging he did last night with Audrey.

When he was done getting dressed, Banagher walked out of his room to see Audrey waiting for him.

"What are you going to have for breakfast?" The blonde asked before she immediately found herself examining her friend's weight gain with great interest.

Banagher's body was much softer then before, the most notable area being his belly, which now was a little ball of jiggly fat, it was even a little bigger then Audrey's. His face, chest, ass, and legs were noticeably more chubby as well.

"Probably just some cereal." Banagher saw that his friend was caught in a trance of looking of at his softer body, not even registering his answer. "Guess you noticed I put on a few pounds." The brunette had a slight tinge of red in his cheeks.

This snapped Audrey out of her trance. "Oh, uh, it's not that, y-you haven't gained a pound. You didn't eat that much" She stammered. "I was just, uh..."

"Don't worry, Audrey, I'm not getting fooled." Sighed Banagher, placing a hand on his belly. "I mean, we really stuffed ourselves last night, there's no way we weren't going to gain weight."

"R-Right" Audrey gave her belly a poke.

"But it's not that big a deal." Banagher continued. "It's not like we always eat that much, we'd be huge if we did." The chubby brunette said, giving both of them images of them obese. "So we don't even have to work it off, it'll go away on it's own."

"Y-Yeah, that's right." Audrey started perking up. "It's not even that much weight, and I'm sure everyone has one of those days where they lose control of their appetite."

"Exactly! Now let's go get some breakfast."

"What did you say you were going to have for breakfast again?"

"Some cereal. You?"

"Toast would be nice."

The two then started walking to the cafeteria. They both couldn't help but notice that their bellies were jiggling. They kept thinking about how they would look if they were fat.

"But even if last night made us obese, I wouldn't have regretted it." Audrey said with a small smile.

"Me neither." Banagher replied, sporting a smile. "If it means getting to have that much fun with you, then bring on the pies!" Banagher then lifted his shirt to reveal his belly and gave it a good shake for emphasis.

Audrey giggled at the sight and did the same herself.
