"Trajectory is -UUURRAP-! Trajectory is set!" Mihiro announced, the Nahel Argama preparing to launch it's entire mobile suit team. "Catapult hatches one through four, open! Mobile suit corps, get into launch position!"

With the hanger opening to launch his ReZEL, Riddhe had a prepared yet slightly nervous expression. He thought back to how he had asked Mihiro to see a movie together, she said she wanted him to pick out the movie but told him the type of movie she really hated. Riddhe felt like an idiot when he realized he had already forgotten what type of film that was.

"What's this? Is the tubby rich kid getting cold feet?" Homare teased in a friendly manner, it was his usual way of helping others calm their nerves before combat.

"I don't know what you're talking about, but I'm pretty sure I heard your voice crack, Lieutenant Homare." Riddhe cracked back. He knew it wasn't true but it just wouldn't right to not fire back.

"Ah, just wait till we get back. Then we'll see who pissed their suit."

"Norm Basilicock, Romeo 001, launch!"

"Galoma Gorga, Juliet 002, launch!"

"Riddhe Marcenas, Romeo 008 taking off!"

The team took off, Riddhe was the second to last to take off, Homare quickly falling suit.

"Homare, Romeo 004 heading out!"

Homare's ReZEL was only out of the hanger for a second before the Sinanju effortlessly hit it with a shot that went right through the top of it's chest. The impact from the shot sent Homare's ReZEL off the catapult deck before it exploded. The shot had hit the reactor, causing an explosion large enough to destroy most of the catapult deck.

Riddhe looked back in horror, sweat on his brow.

"Severe damage port side catapult deck" One of the bridge crew reported, the bridge shaking from the explosion.

"Lieutenant Homare!" Mihiro shouted

"Hurry up with the damage report!" Otto ordered.

"Get out of here and head to the Moon!" Alberto ordered as he walked in, wearing his own normal suit.

"Mr. Alberto, it's dangerous for you to be here." Liam told the blonde.

"That's the Sinanju! It's the Red Comet! You can't defeat it."

Otto grumbled. He really wanted to say something that would shut this fatso up, but there really was no way he could honestly claim he was certain they would win this fight.

"Two years ago, our experimental mobile suit MSN-06S was stolen by Neo Zeon while it was being transferred from the lunar city Granada to a testing ground at Von Braun." Alberto stated.

The Sinanju headed into the debris field, followed by the three remaining pilots of the Nahel Argama team. The plan was that Norm and Riddhe would force it towards a pint in the debris field where Galoma was waiting for it. Riddhe tried to land a shot with the mega beam launcher but soon realized that was impossible once he saw how fast it moved. Each shot Romeo 001 and 008 fired missed, but they got the Sinanju to head in the direction they wanted.

"The Federation Forces that were sent to get it back were completely wiped out."

"Got you!" Galoma fired rapidly with both of his Stark Jegan's beam rifles. Once again, each shot missed, despite how fast the firing was, and the Sinanju flew right past the Jegan.

"And they say the one responsible is Full Frontal, the man they call the Second Coming of Char Aznable, the Red Comet."

Full Frontal hadn't fallen for the plan, he just didn't bother to go a different direction because the one they planned on him taking was the most convenient and he knew he didn't have to worry about getting shot down. The Sinanju quickly reached the Nahel Argama. It dodged every shot from the turrets and fired back, destroying another turret.

"I've heard of this story before." Liam said. "The "Ghost of Char", who destroyed two Clop-class ships with a single mobile suit."

The ship shook again from another hit.

"But Char went missing during the Second Neo Zeon War, never to be heard from again!" The captain pointed out.

"Be that as it may, your men don't stand a chance out there." Alberto handed the radarman an Anaheim Electronic information card, which he put into the ship's database."Their mobile suits are useless. The Unicorn was made based on data collected from the Sinanju. We've got to get out of here now!"

"If we run now, we'll be attacked from behind." Otto claimed. "Transfer the data to each section of the ship! Our enemy is not a ghost. Send in the mobile suit corps too!"

"Idiot! You have no clue!"

"That's the last time you'll speak to me like that!"

Before the argument could continue, the bridge door opened. Everyone's eyes were drawn to the sight standing in the doorway. Audrey Burne, an obese teenager, with two imposing ECOAS soldiers flanking her, Daguza and Conroy.

The Sinanju dodged fire from the Argama's turrets. The ReZELs and Stark Jegan had caught up to it. The data on the Sinanju had just finished transferring to their machines.

"There it is!" Riddhe had the ReZEL fire it's mega beam launcher at at the seemingly easy target the Sinanju was. It evaded the shot, which instead hit an asteroid. The Sinanju used the destruction of it to move out of the sight of it's pursuers.

"Stay back, ensign Riddhe." Galoma ordered. "Stay in formation."

Riddhe burped in frustration and had his machine scan every area it could for it's target.

"Galoma, below you!" Norm warned.

Galoma spotted the Sinanju and aimed the Jegan's rifles but a shot pierced the cockpit just a mere second before he could pull the trigger. He died thinking he was about to hit the Sinanju.

"That can't be the real Char." Norm had to divert his eyes away from the light of the Stark Jegan's explosion.

Not far from the field, Full Frontal's royal guards were watching the battle unfold in their captain's favor.

"Lieutenant Angelo, we have multiple hostiles. Shouldn't we cover the Captain?"

"Not at all. We need only stand by and watch, Ensign Sergei. We'd only get in the Captain's way."

Romeo 001 and 008 fired their mega beam launchers at the red machine. The red machine successfully evaded the shots and fired back at Riddhe's machine, destroying half it's left leg. The blonde's belly jiggled from the impact.

"At this rate, -UUURRRP- everyone will-"

"Attention all attacking mobile suits." Daguza spoke over the communications channel. " You are ordered to cease fire immediately. We are holding Mineva Zabi captive aboard this ship." An image of Audrey appeared on the screen, Riddhe's eyes widening. "I repeat: We are holding the Zabi heir, Mineva Lao Zabi, captive aboard this ship. If you do not halt your attacks immediately, we cannot guarantee her safety."

"Hold on." Takuya said, standing next to Micott, who gasped. Both were in their normal suits. They had heard the message over the communications panel in the mess hall. "She's the princess of Zeon?" Micott's face turned to one of anger over Audrey's seeming betrayal of their friendship.

"We are prepared to begin negotiations. I'm sure you'll make the right decision."

Banagher stared down at his bubbling gut dejectedly. Not over Audrey's heritage and identity, he couldn't care less about that, but because of the awful situation. He let out a burp and then started wobbling as fast as he could to the bridge, his big gut, flabby tits, and large ass bobbing and bouncing all the while. It didn't take long for his face to became red and sweaty with exhaustion. But it didn't matter how exhausted he was, or how close to throwing up he was, he wasn't going to stop for a single second.

"Save *Huff* Audrey, *Huff* *Huff* then explode."
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.title: Critical Danger Situation

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"I have received the image." Full Frontal spoke over communications to the Nahel Argama bridge. "I am Captain Full Frontal of Neo Zeon. Tell me. What are your demands?"

"That's Char's voice..." A communications officer said.

"This is Commander Daguza Mackle of the Earth Federation Space Force Special Operations Group, ECOAS. We are requesting that you cease your attacks and withdraw immediately. If you do, we can guarantee the safety of Mineva Zabi."

"Can't we just have her back?"

Audrey was annoyed. "I don't know if you really are Char, but you're just as impatient and uncooperative as him." She thought to herself.

"Let's take one thing at a time. If you allow us to pass, then we can discuss that, once our ship has arrived in a safe location."

"So you're holding her as your hostage. However, we have no evidence that this person is the real Princess Mineva."

"That seems rather cautious for the man that people are calling the Second Coming of the Red Comet."

"To you, we're nothing but terrorists, and since we are not part of your military, we cannot expect to be protected by international law, so you can understand our caution."

"We have the highest regard for human rights."

"Oh, that's quite a statement coming from people who send special forces into civilian colonies, and are now using hostages as shields."

"Don't play innocent, both were in response to terrorist acts Neo-Zeon had committed."

"Can I chime in and say I agree with commander Daguza for once?" Audrey said. She had a feeling Banagher would be proud of her if he was here to see that.

Audrey's voice was picked up Daguza's mic. It gave Full Frontal pause as he realized this was indeed Mineva. "... If that's an imposter then I must say she does an excellent job at mimicking Mineva Zabi's voice and... attitude."

"We can go without the snarky comments, Full Frontal. I know that you realize it's me."

"In any case, it's our turn to make some demands." Full Frontal stated. " I request you hand over the materials you collected from Industrial 7 and all data pertaining to Laplace's Box."

Audrey swallowed down a burp, she was being extra careful not to belch now that she knew it would be picked up by Daguza's mic.

"And in exchange?" The ECOAS commander asked.

"I'll guarantee your safe passage. Unless, of course, you object to the terms."

"I have no objection. However, we are unable to comply. Because we never obtained Laplace's Box."

"But you did retrieve a Gundam type mobile suit, did you not?"

"That's the property of the Federation, and has nothing to do with Laplace's Box."

"Our side will determine this. If you won't accept our demands, we'll be forced to destroy your vessel."

"You would do that with the prisoner on board?"

"Everything pertaining to Laplace's Box takes priority. Of course I do want to retrieve both." The Second Coming of Char explained. "I'll give you three minutes. I trust you'll come to a sensible decision."

Daguza removed the communications headset he was borrowing. "He's bluffing. He wouldn't forsake the guiding star of Zeon."

"I wouldn't be so sure..." Audrey stated, all eyes now on her. She burped into her fist before continuing. "Pardon me. If Full Frontal is in fact Char Aznable, he would be the son of Zeon Deikun, which means he holds the Zabi family responsible for his father's death. Why should he care about me?"

"Interesting you should say that. You've removed any doubt in my mind that you are the princess." Daguza aimed his handgun at the side of Audrey's head, the barrel so close it was touching her blonde hair. Not a single change in expression, she looked at the gun, then at the headset and saw it was still turned on. She theorized it was most likely a ploy by Daguza to ensure Full Frontal knew he was serious about possibly killing the princess. "And I bet that a good number of those Sleeves soldiers out there still believe in the Zabi family."

"If you believe that, then by all means, continue this useless negotiation." Audrey said. "However, the soldiers of Zeon don't play as nicely as you do. If you were a Zeon, all you'd be thinking about is how to destroy anything related to Laplace's Box."

"She's right!" Alberto interjected. "W-We should destroy the Unicorn's electronic system while we have the chance! That thing is the key not the actual box, so if we destroy it, and the safety of the Box will still be-"

Conroy muffled and pulled back the fat man. Daguza glanced at the monitor. Nothing from Full Frontal yet. "If we're lucky, he didn't hear that." He thought.

"Let's put the resolve of a Federation soldier to the test, Commander Daguza Mackle." Audrey turned to face the commander, the gun now pressed against her temple. "If you have the strength, then destroy the key and take my life. Losing both the key and myself will undoubtedly deal a severe blow to Neo Zeon. Otherwise, continue to wait for them to storm in and take it from you. There's no time for indecision."

Otto and Mihiro were about to get up to stop Daguza, when a loud belch filled the air, startling everyone. Surprisingly, the source of it wasn't Audrey, though she did feel a big one bubbling up in her gut. Everyone turned their eyes to the source of it was that was standing in the doorway: Banagher Links, leaning on the doorway for much needed support as he tried to catch his breath, drenched in sweat and face red from exhaustion. He was huffing and puffing. "Audrey!" He said but his cheeks turned green and he covered his mouth to keep himself from vomiting. The nausea soon passed. Daguza stopped pointing the gun at Audrey.

The brunette wobbled over to his best friend, on his round face was a look of worry and anger born from that worry. "Stop talking like that. You’re just forcing others and yourself down the path of despair like this. Just leave this place."

For the first time since Daguza and Conroy came for her, Audrey's stoic facade broke. She showed visible shock. "Banagher... UUUURRRRP!" Their bare tummies were now touching.

"You shouldn’t be involved in these things. Stay with us." Banagher grabbed Audrey’s hand and intended to leave the scene. Audrey managed to steady her body that was about to be dragged away as she used all her out-of-shape strength to shake off the young man’s soft, inviting hand. Banagher blinked in confusion and worry. "Audrey!"

Audrey repaired her cold exterior. "I am Mineva Zabi, not Audrey."

"What are you saying? You’re Audrey. Whether you’re lying or not, you’re Audrey Burne to me."

To her, this was the first time she got rebutted like this. Audrey gasped as she lowered her head slightly. Daguza told off the teenager who intended to grab her hand again. "Enough. Children shouldn't concern themselves with adult matters."

Banagher turned to face Daguza, the worry in his face was gone, only anger was left. "If I'm such a child, then what about her?!"

"This girl is the princess of Neo-Zeon."

"So what? That mean she's not human?! No way! If I’m a kid, so is Audrey. Is using children as hostages the maturity I'm supposed to be looking up to?! Does being a grown-up just give you free reign to do whatever you please to people you think are below you?!"

The anger released from Banagher's heart and soul shut Daguza up just as effectively as if Banagher had physically attacked him so severely he was knocked unconscious. Otto and Audrey stared at Banagher in amazement at the obese teenager. Otto finally sat back in his chair, knowing the situation was now in good hands.

"I'm going to have to apologize to him for underestimating him so much." Audrey thought.

"Time's up." Full Frontal snapped everyone out of their thoughts. "What is your decision?"
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.title: Breaking Through the Facade with his Gut

choices: Audrey goes with Banagher, this is her responsibility
Daguza and Conroy provide support in their Loto
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Ten full seconds of silence followed. No one had any answer, no one but Banagher. he looked aorund at the others in frustration, even Audrey and Daguza, who not even a full minute were completely convinced they knew exactly what to do.

"If you're going to act so sure -UUURRP- of yourself, at least try to do something." Banagher sassed.

"He's... certainly got our father's way of lecturing others." Alberto thought to himself. He was pretty sure Banagher hadn't even noticed him and he still felt guilty.

Banagher yanked Mihiro's helmet off and then her headset. "Hey!" she protested.

"You're not getting Audrey." Banagher said into the headset.

"Audrey?" Full Frontal repeated in confusion. "Is that code for something relating to Laplace's Box?"

"It's Mineva's real name."

"Commander, who is this?"

"A mutual headache between us." Daguza answered.

"All she wants is for everyone to stop fighting, and here you are, considering killing her!" Banagher barked, his belly jiggled. "Don't you care about her?! UUUURRRP!"

"Mineva Zabi's heritage does make her a valuable asset for Neo-Zeon, that is indeed true." Banagher was nearly jiggling with rage when he heard that. "However, she has demonstrated and confessed that she holds no interest in Zeon holding supremacy over the Earth Federation. And Zeon has no need or want of those who refuse to embody it's ideals."

The line was then cut.

"Here it comes!" Otto shouted as the bridge returned their focus to their posts, Mihiro snatched her headset back from Banagher. "Ready air defenses! Mobile suit corps, be prepared to intercept them!"

"It's just a box..." Banagher grumbled. "Why can't you just hand the damn thing over to them?! We don't even know what the Box is. Why do so many people have to die for it?"

"So that no one else has to die for it." Daguza countered, Banagher glared at him. "While we don't know the secrets hidden in Laplace's Box, some say it could overthrow the Federation. What if we were to turn over the Box only to cause even more people to lose their lives? Could you take responsibility for that? How would you explain to all those families that their love one had to die because you didn't know?"

Banagher looked down at his stomach, which was still struggling to digest his meal.

"There's still a chance Full Frontal is bluffing, no matter what she's done I can't imagine a member of Neo-Zeon being so willing to throw away the last surviving Zabi." Daguza passed Conroy the headset.

"Cease fire immediately. Otherwise we will be forced to execute Mineva Zabi." Conroy demanded.

The ship shook again from losing another turret, the vibrations making Audrey and Banagher's chubby bodies jiggle like mad.

"This is your last warning: cease fire on us immediately."

Banagher ran his hand against a chubby cheek, the same one his father placed his hand on before his death. "If we just take down that red mobile suit, then you won't need Audrey as a hostage anymore, right? I'll do it!" He wobbled off in a huff.Daguza, Audrey, and Alberto looked at him, the Zabi had a look of pure guilt on her face.

"Banagher, wait!" Banagher heard those words, but they came from a different obese blonde then the one he hoped for.

"Alberto?"

"No need to run off all half-cocked, there's something you'll need to use the Unicorn to it's full potential."

"What do you mean?"

"I'll explain in the hanger."

+++

"Put this on."

Alberto tossed Banagher a pilot suit.

"This -URP- doesn't look like a Federation pilot's suit."

"It's not, it's a Vist Foundation one specifically for the Unicorn's rider. It's specially designed to help the pilot withstand the ungodly amount of g forces the Unicorn gives when moving at full speed."

"So I won't pass -URAP- out again like last time."

"Exactly."

Banagher's cheeks were a bit red. "Though it looks too small for me." He gave his tummy a few pats to drive the point home.

"As a man of size myself, I am all too aware of that feeling. So there's no need to feel embarrassed."

+++

Riddhe's ReZEL fired wildly at the Sinanju. "Stand down! Stand -UUURRRP- down!"

"Riddhe!" Norm said.

"This is all your fault! How could you?! Did you really think taking a hostage would work against a bunch of terrorists?!"

The Sinanju stopped and aimed directly at the cockpit of Riddhe's ReZEL. Riddhe tried to evade but because he lost half of his machine's left leg, all he could achieve was his machine spinning nearly in place, his gut shaking from it. Before the red mobile suit could fire a fatal shot, a beam came at it, forcing it to take tit's sights off Riddhe to focus on evading. Another beam came and the machine dodged that too.

The shots came from Norm's beam rifle. He switched it into beam saber and then charged at Full Frontal, who had the Sinanju pull out and activate one of it's beam sabers, the blades of their machines locked.

"Ensign Riddhe, control yourself." Norm advised his student.

The Sinanju's beam saber was stronger then that of a mere mass production model's. It overpowered Norm's beam rifle and split it in half before slashing at the ReZEL itself.

"Guahhh!"

"Commander!"

Norm's ReZEL exploded from the slash, the Sinanju flying away from it's kill.

"No... Commander Norm..." Riddhe's sorrow was immediately accompanied by rage. "Bastard!"

The Sinanju headed towards it's last target. Riddhe made his ReZEL ignite it's beam saber. Before he could charge, he felt this sensation. And so did the Sinanju pilot, who left Riddhe alone and moved to a different point.

"What was..." Riddhe zoomed in on the Nahel Argama to see one of it's hangers' opening to reveal the Unicorn ready to head out. The white mobile suit was wielding a beam rifle and a shield on its arms "The Gundam?"

"The Gundam is on catapult one!" Mihiro alerted.

"What the hell?! Don't let it launch!" The captain ordered.

"Gundam pilot, identify yourself! You are not cleared for launch. Return to the hanger bay immediately!"

"UUUURRRAAP! Sorry about that, I just had a soda." Banagher blushed. It wasn't like he could not have one after that grueling run he had.

"Ugh, mind your manners." Mihiro sighed. "You're such a boy sometimes." She raised her helmet's visor to belch into her fist.

Audrey heard the sound of heavy footsteps and turned aorund to see Alberto waddling into the room. She wasn't the only one who spotted him.

"You did this!" Daguza pressed Alberto to the wall with his elbow.

"This is a compromise that could work for everyone." He claimed. "The Unicorn's performance is unmatched. Even a pilot with no training can fend off the Red Comet."

Daguza tightened his hold of Alberto. "You're practically giving the Box to them."

"But it's only the key, and that boy is only one who can use it, you know that. And you know he'll never accept Neo-Zeon's way of doing things. There's no risk!"

Daguza released his grip but kept glaring at Alberto.

Alberto walked over to one of the communications posts. "You can hear me, right, Banagher?"

"Yeah, everything looks good." He answered. "Except me in this suit." He thought to himself. It was a huge pain to get it zipped up over his fat belly.

Audrey got closer to one of the monitors showing the situation in the hanger. Once again, Banagher had shattered her facade of coldness. "Banagher, don't do this!"

"I'll go over everything one more time. That pilot suit you're wearing has a medical sub-system designed to reduce strain on the body from G resistance. Don't worry about turning it on, Once the NT-D is activated, it'll kick in automatically."

"NT- -UUUURAP- -D?"

"That's the mode in which the Unicorn's performance limiters are disengaged. You handled it the last time. You'll be fine."

"Launch preparations complete!" Banagher confirmed. He inhaled deeply and then exhaled. He thought of all the times he had seen Amuro launch from the White Base in episodes of Mobile Suit Gundam. Now it was his turn. "Detaching from ship!"
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.title: The Rage of a Perfect Boyfriend

choices: And so begins Banagher's time as a citizen of Neo-Zeon
Audrey gets in contact with Full Frontal
Audrey mounts the rescue of Banagher
Marida has been given the mission to fatten Banagher up even further
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
The locks on the heels were released, and the Unicorn Gundam took off at a speed that allowed it to dodge a shot from the Sinanju, much to the surprise of Full Frontal. The Unicorn ascended far above the ship that only recently housed it. The machine's targeting system pointed him to where the Sinanju was hiding: Right behind an asteroid.

"There he is!"

The Unicorn fired a shot at the asteroid, it pierced right through the middle. The only reason it didn't destroy the Sinanju and end Full Frontal's life was because he was closer to the side of the rock. The debris sent him off balance.

"Amazing..." Banagher uttered.

The Unicorn kept firing on the Sinanju, each one nearly close enough to damage it.

"I'm actually struggling to dodge?!" Full Frontal thought.

One of the shots that missed destroyed one of Full Frontal's Royal Guards by merely grazing it.

"It barely grazed him, but..." Angelo uttered. Of course a beam didn't have to acutely hit it's target to damage it, but for a stray shot to completely rip apart the Geara Zulu like it was wet paper? The sight of that filled Angelo with something he had never felt before: Fear for his captain's life. "Captain!" His purple Geara Zulu fired on the Unicorn twice, both shots missing. "I can't believe I fired on the captain's perfect battlefield. I desecrated it!" He began trembling with anger at both Banagher and himself, mostly himself. "You made me shoot! I'll make you pay!"

Banagher realized he had spent too much ammo too quickly. He was breathing heavily. "Stay calm, stay clam, Banagher. You've been trained for this." Images of his old life in the Vist Foundation mansion, the life he had forgotten, flooded his mind. The piano. The experiments. The Lady and the Unicorn. His breathing calmed.

The Unicorn reloaded the beam magnum and fired a few more shots. However, both he and the targeting system soon lost sight of the red mobile suit. He came under the furious fire of the Royal Guard team. He increased his speed to dodge the shots, his entire chubby body shaking from the force. His targeting system spotted the Sinanju and Banagher resumed firing on it.

The Sinanju evaded every shot "It doesn't matter how powerful you are if you can't hit me." It's pilot said. Igniting its beam saber, the red mobile suit charged at the white one. Banagher panicked at how fast the suit was approaching, but the Unicorn ascended at the last moment even without any input.

"You moved for me?"

His relief was cut short when he saw a beam from Angelo's Geara Zulu about to hit him. He raised his shield, but to his surprise, that triggered it's I-Field. Something Banagher didn't even know it had.

"Hmm? it has an I-Field?" Full Frontal uttered.

The Unicorn reloaded the magnum and started firing at the Sinanju from a stationary point, hoping that would improve accuracy. he kept firing, each shot coming a little close to hitting their mark then the last. Until he saw an explosion.

"Did I do it?"

An alarm came from his radar and he spotted the Sinanju right next to him. It had released it's two propellant tanks so their explosion would serve as a decoy to trick Banagher into thinking he had won.

The Sinanju gave a fearsome kick that sent the Unicorn into a nearby asteroid. The impact from the kick had forced a huge burp out of Banagher. Banagher was barely conscious as the Sinanju prepared to stab the Unicorn with it's beam saber.

Until Banagher thought of "Audrey..." The Unicorn's NT-D system activated and the Unicorn went into Destroy Mode, bearing the face of Gundam. It flew away from the asteroid, which was all it's red opponent hit. It then chased after the Unicorn, to those watching this field from afar, it looked like two incredibly fast streaks of light, one red and the other blue, were striking each other.

"I've got it." Banagher had confidence. He had resolve. "So this is Gundam. Here we go, Unicorn."

The two mobile suits slashed at each, the Sinanju's beam saber was locked with the Unicorn's beam tonfa.

"Ah, I had forgotten the incredible frustration Gundam so often fills me with." Full Frontal stated. "So you're the successor of Amuro Ray."

"I'm just Banagher Links!"

The machines pulled away from each other.

"We can flank him! Climb!"

Banagher did as Riddhe instructed. The ReZEL fired the mega beam launcher from below it's target, who dodged as expected. However, this put the mobile suit right in the Unicorn's line of fire. The horned mobile suit fired a shot at the Sinanju, which managed to destroy the thruster on it's right leg. Anyone less skilled then Full Frontal would've been killed by that shot.

The Sinanju began pulling back. The Unicorn chased after it.

"Stop! Don't get in too close!" Riddhe warned.

The Unicorn continued pursuing it's target. But then Banagher felt this sudden sense of dread wash over him. Distorted giggling, almost mechanical, echoed in his mind. He obeyed his instincts and moved back but a pale blue mobile suit jumped out from behind an asteroid in front of him. It charged at him maniacally, two beam sabers ignited. It's eyes were red, seemingly with rage, and various parts of it were glowing a heated orange, similarly to the Unicorn. This machine was known as the Todesritter.

One of the Todesritter's beam saber locked with the Unicorn's beam tonfa, but that ended as quickly as it began. The Unicorn pulled back when Banagher saw the pale blue mobile suit about to strike him with the other saber.

"Behind you!"

Before Banagher could do anything, he was grabbed by the Kshatriya.

"The Quad-Wing?!"

The Unicorn fired it's vulcan guns but the much larger green mobile suit delivered a swift punch to the Unicorn's chest. The impact from it put Banagher on the verge of passing out and forced a giant belch from his stomach, his entire body jiggling from the the the fearsome punch.

"UUUUUURRRP! I'm sorry, Audrey..." He was heard via the communications channels by all the combatants on the field and those onboard the Nahel Argama.

He passed out.

Marida recognized him "Why is that boy inside the Gundam?"

+++

Banagher's eyes opened and greeted him with the last thing he would've expected.

A simple ordinary house. He looked around and realized he was on a couch in what seemed to be the living room and that someone had removed his boots. He looked at the door and saw his boots placed near it like he had put them there after coming home from school. He spotted a nearby kitchen that was close to the door, a dining table on the other side of the room. He could tell this meant he wasn't in a big house. Probably just one floor, not counting the attic. He placed a hand on his stomach, it was still rock hard, so only a few hours at most had passed.

"Did I lose?" He thought to himself. "What am I saying? Of course I did, I remember it. But being in an ordinary house makes even less sense then. There's not even any restraints or guards, so what is this? Was I rescued? Did Audrey did somehow find a place to hide me as part of that insane plan?"

"Anyone home?" He asked. No response. He looked around the room, he didn't get up of course, not with a stomach this full on top of the headache that punch gave him. He didn't see any photos lying around that could've shown the face of whoever lived here. Or faces of the people who lived here, possibly.

He gave up and just laid down there, resting. Drumming his fingers on his belly, it was clear he would just have to wait for the owner to return. Besides thinking was painful with this headache.

After half an hour of just laying down, watching TV, thank God the remote was within reach, he heard the doorknob turn. And who entered was the last person he would've expected: Marida Cruz. She was out of breath, in the same state Banagher was when he ran to the bridge, complete with being stuffed to the brim. Only she was wearing her exercise clothes. Banagher just looked at her in confusion... and something else.

In order to help you understand us and come around to our way of thinking, you'll be living here. I'll be serving as your guardian."

They've gotta be, so I should just stay here and wait for them."

Marida soon left her room and returned to the living room. She was now wearing her causal clothes, only without the boots. Because of how distended her middle was from stuffing herself, she had to leave her sash undone, her pants unbuttoned and unzipped, and her shirt was left zipped up to only her large boobs.

"I hope you -UURRRAP-! Pardon me. I hope you don't mind me leaving my stomach exposed. I'm rather full, as you've no doubt noticed, so I can't zip my shirt all the way." Marida matter of factly said, resting a hand on the top of her well-fed middle.

Banagher sat up. "Of course I don't mind, it's not like mine is covered any better."

Marida sat down next to Banagher, the couch groaning from her added weight as she did, and they watched TV together. At first neither of them said anything, which felt unbearably awkward for Banagher. Since he was going to be stuck living with Marida for a while, the brunette figured he should try to have a positive relationship with her.

"I ate two whole extra large pizzas to get this stuffed." He said.

'Oh, I see." Banagher thought they were going to go back to awkward silence, but then he realized something. "Wait, you had five tubs of ice cream in your cockpit?"

"I am trying to lose weight, but I couldn't risk my hunger breaking my concentration. And your fight -UUUURP-! Excuse me. And your fight was rather long."

"Not long enough for my gut to get any softer." A loud gurgle escaped from Banagher's belly. "Oof, it's still busy digesting all that -UUURAAAP- pizza." He said as he rubbed his swollen middle.

"It looks like we're both struggling with our gluttony. UUUURRAP! Ugh, excuse me." Marida was rubbing her own fat belly."I'm going to be doing some exercise tomorrow. You're welcome to join me."

"Sure, thanks. Though I'm probably going to be pretty bad at it."

"It's not like I'm any better." Marida looked down at her gut in disapproval.

"Hey, you're pretty fast for, uh..." Banagher thought on how to phrase this in an unoffensive way.

Marida burped and apologized for it before interjecting. "Don't censor yourself, it's not like I'm unaware of my obesity."

"Right. You're pretty fast for someone as fat as you are. No -URAP- way me and Audrey would've been able to get away from you if we were as fat as we are now."

"I think you're overestimating me, but thank you." Marida replied. She thought back to when they first met at Industrial 7. "I have to say, I'm surprised by how fat and out-of-shape you've gotten in such short time."

Banagher immediately thought back to all the times he and Audrey had been pigging out together these past few days. "You wouldn't say that if you saw how much I've been eating lately." The fat young man slapped his belly, making it jiggle.

The two watched some TV together, tending to their distended middles the whole time. They were both burping a quite a bit, Marida apologized after each one while Banagher didn't bother. There was still some awkward silence here and there, but they were more talkative with each other. Though there were some moments where Marida missed obvious cues for her to engage in a specific topic.

Banagher's big belly grumbled loudly and he felt a sharp pain in his chest. "Uh oh. UUUURRRRP! UUURRAAAAP! Oof." Two great uncontrollable belches came flying out of Banagher's mouth. He looked over at Marida to see exactly what he knew he would: Her chubby face glaring at him. Even with all that fat, her glare was still very intimidating.

"Do you belch like that around the princess?"

"W-Well, I, uh-"

"I'll take that as a yes." The disapproval was evident in her voice.

"I know this is hard to believe , but Audrey's been burping as much as me."

Marida raised an eyebrow in confusion.

"Mineva's been burping as much as me."

"Don't tell lies about the princess." Marida's words made Banagher feel like he was on the verge on a brutal ass kicking. Or having her sit on him with her massive ass.

"I-I-I'm not lying, you saw her burp when we first met. Remember when I was rubbing her belly on the elevator?"

"I only saw her belch once." Marida said. "Though I don't understand why she was so pleased to hear you compliment her for it."

"She's really changed since you last saw her."

"Regardless, I'd like if you could have some manners around princess Minev -UURRAAAAP-!" A massive burp suddenly came roaring from Marida's mouth's. Her chubby cheeks blushing, Marida wore an expression of shock and embarrassment. Even Banagher was surprised. After a second of stunned silence, Marida tried to apologize. "Excuse -UUUURRRRP-! UURRRRRAP!" Two more giant belches forced their way out of her lips, her blushing and embarrassment intensified. She sighed. "Excuse me."

"Nice burping!" Banagher complimented with a grin.

"This is nothing to be proud of... but thank you."

+++

"I thought I was going to throw up the whole -UURRRP- time, I'm still surprised I didn't."

"I wasn't feeling any better. I'm glad I didn't have to fight as long as you did."

Banagher and Marida were in their bedroom, they changed into their sleepwear after brushing their teeth, though Banagher said his mouth still tasted like pizza. Banagher was wearing blue button up pajamas, while Marida was wearing a red nightgown. Because of how bloated they were, Banagher had to leave his pajama shirt completely unbuttoned up to his moobs, even after showing his gut to so many he still wasn't ready to show those puppies off (except maybe to Audrey if she wanted to see them), and Marida's nightgown was clearly riding up. Though not so much she was left indecent.

Marida placed another pillow on the left side of her bed after she moved her pillow from the middle to the right. "Is that enough space?" She asked as she sat down on the bed.

"I think so but, uh, can I sleep on the couch?"

"Um... it's that, you know, I-I-I'm not used to sleeping with g-girls. Audrey is the only one I've done it-"

In the blink of an eye, Marida dashed from her side of the bed and tackled Banagher down to the ground. Marida had him pined to the ground with her strong gut, it was pressing painfully into Banagher's full tum, her boobs pressing into his tits. The collision made them jiggle and then burp at the same time, and since their faces were so close, it was in each other's faces. Banagher was visibly grossed out but Marida's soul piercing glare didn't change.

"Why do fat girls keep doing this to me?" Banagher groaned. At this point, he was expecting to have Mihiro and Micott pin him with their bellies at some point.

"Are you saying you had sex with Mineva?"

"What?!" Banagher was sweating with fear, he looked the most terrified he ever had.

"Do you pressure her into sex?"

Marida got off Banagher. "I see." Marida stoically said. "I'm sorry for jumping to conclusions. Things like that make me rather... quick to anger. I hope you can forgive me, I've been a poor guardian."

"It-It's fine. I worded that poorly."

"That's no excuse for my actions. I'll take you out for ice cream tomorrow, you can have as much as you want, it's on me."

"I'm not a little kid, Marida. And I thought we were exercising tomorrow."

"Is that a no?"

"I think I'll go for chocolate, it's my favorite flavor. How about you?"

"Chocolate is my favorite too."

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
For the first time Banagher woke up before Audrey did.

"It's time to wake up." Marida said as she gently shook Banagher awake.

"Huh? What?" Banagher said, still 75% asleep.

"It's time to get up." Marida affirmed. "It's 12 PM."

Banagher, now only 50% asleep, noticed that Marida was already in her Neo-Zeon uniform. "I'm not an early bird like you, can I sleep in a little more?"

"I already let you sleep two hours longer."

Realizing this was one terrorist he can't negotiate with, Banagher reluctantly got out of bed, brushed his teeth, and got dressed. When that was done, he walked into the living room, seeing a plate with a big, tasty stack of waffles waiting for him on the kitchen table. Marida was eating her own stack of waffles, even though she had finished breakfast hours ago. Right next to her plate was a large notepad and a pen.

"What's the paper for?" Banagher asked as he sat down at the dinner table and started chowing down.

"I need to file a report on how you became the pilot of the Unicorn and everything you know about it and Laplace's Box." Marida explained before she took another bite out of one of her waffles. "Once the captain has read it, you'll be speaking with him."

Banagher swallowed. "I-I am? About what?"

"Aside from any questions he might have about your story, he'll want to see what your perspective on everything is. And help you understand ours."

"I can't ever approve of the way Neo-Zeon does things. Besides, it's not like I look presentable like this." He then patted his exposed belly, which jiggled from it.

Marida looked down at her dome of a middle "I'm not anymore presentable." Marida then looked back at Banagher. "But that doesn't change what I have to do. Everyone is pushed into situations they don't think they're prepared for, but that doesn't mean they can't handle it."

A few seconds of silence followed as Banagher complemented the soldier's words. "So, where should i start?"

+++

Two hours later, Audrey woke up in her room. Normally she would've woken up in the brig, but after Full Frontal proved to everyone that despite her heritage Audrey was no member of Neo-Zeon, there really wasn't any reason to treat er like one. It helped that Mihiro, Takuya, and Riddhe all vouched for her. But that didn't help her feel any better, it didn't help her feel like all of this wasn't her fault. she felt that all the pain death that had happened these past few days were all her fault, and that the best friend she ever had was now captured by terrorists because of her. Her body felt like it was filled with bile, she felt this lump in her throat like she was about to cry, but not tears ever came out. She felt that she deserved to feel like that.

After five minutes of just aimlessly laying in bed, she heard her tummy growl. She got of bed and put some pink slippers on. Still in her pajamas, she left her room and walked to the mess hall, endless thoughts of self-hatred filling her mind. It was like someone was following her everywhere and constantly telling her that she was a horrible person no one loves. If that was what was literally happening, she wouldn't protest.

She got all the snacks she could carry and started walking back to her room. She spotted Micott and Takuya eating together at a table. Micott was fat while Takuya was still just pudgy. They were eating a lot of food, Audrey could immediately tell they were eating just to get their minds off things. She felt that was her fault, that if she hadn't suggested that eating contest, she would be the only fat one here. They didn't seem to notice the blonde, and the blonde left in hopes she wouldn't make things any worse for them.

When she got back to her room, Audrey tossed her slippers off, laid down on her couch, and started stuffing herself with all the snacks she had brought with her. As soon as she finished a bag, she would just toss it aside. She didn't care that her room would get messy, she she felt she didn't deserve a clean room. Her belly grew more and more bloated with every bag, but it didn't feel good like the other times she pigged out. She could only think to herself that was a disgusting pig, and a slob.

Audrey belched loudly once she finished all the food, her gut very bloated, she thought herself disgusting for it.. She just laid there for a while, she wanted to just go back to sleep, but she found herself somehow unable to sleep. It felt like she was in limbo.

The door opened, Audrey looked at it, Riddhe standing in the door frame. Audrey returned to just aimlessly looking at the ground but Riddhe didn't stop looking at her. A few seconds of painful silence followed.

"I came here to yell at you but... I can't." Riddhe said. Audrey didn't reply. "I don't know what it's like to bear such a cursed family name, but I do know what it's like to feel weighed down by your family. The Marcenas family is incredibly influential in the Federation's political system, my father, Ronan Marcenas, is the chairman of the Settlement Issues Council, something I'm sure you know. I hated being treated differently by others, even when it was treating me better then everyone else. I wanted to be my own person, that's why I joined Londo Bell."

His words reached her heart, but the Zabi still didn't reply.

Riddhe continued. "Our families don't decide who we are, you're proof of that. Your family cursed all of us with Zeon, you're trying to break that curse. No one person can change the world on their own, so don't hate yourself because the killing continued. Give yourself some time to heal. Banagher called out your name, he called you Audrey. Even after learning the truth, he still views you as Audrey Burne, his best friend. You are better then you think you are. You two need each other. You'll meet again, and you'll be both be happy when that happens."

With that, Riddhe left. Audrey rolled onto her back, now looking up at the ceiling. There was silence, except for the words in her mind. She thought back to Banagher and all the expediences they shared. The word sof self-hatred slowly left her mind, now all she could hear was Banagher's voice.

"We're going to be fine."
"Yeah, so I'm Banagher Links."
"Audrey?"
"This is Haro. It's a replica of the robot mascot built by an ace pilot back during the war. It was the coolest thing ever when we were kids."
"Yeah, that sounds a lot like me."
"Do you want me to rub your stomach?"
"It's okay. Just do whatever you need to feel better."

She could see his face. She could hear his voice.

"Feeling better?"
"You're welcome. Just let me know if you need me to rub her your belly again. Or, uh, if you need my help with anything. Aside from getting to the mansion that is."
"Good one."
"Give me your hand."
"Good job."

The joy on his face, the joy in his voice. Could the one responsible for that really be worthless?

"We make a good team."
"I'd like that."
"It's nice to talk about stuff like this. You're the only one I've ever opened up to about this."
"You have me. I'm you're friend."

If she can bring so much light to someone as wonderful as him, to give him a place he belonged, then how can she be worthless?

"The Lady and the Unicorn."
"'To my only desire.' The beast of possibility... The symbol of hope."

The answer was simple.

"Audrey, I can still help. You came here to prevent a war, didn’t you? And doesn’t he have the power to do something about that? Hearing you talk about the war is so different from hearing my professors talk about it. More grave. You've made me see how bad it would be. So please, let me… I just... My heart was pounding when I saw you fall from the sky this morning. Everything that felt off in my life just slid into place. For the first time in my life I knew what I was suppose to do. I don’t care who you are! Just say that you need me and I'll... Just tell me…"

She did have worth. She said the words they both wanted her to say that day

"I need you."

Audrey stood up. She removed her pajamas as fast as possible. She put on her pink bra and panties. She put her blouse on, her big belly made it impossible for the blouse to cover her incredibly deep navel. She put on her pants, which was a tight squeeze and the hardest part of her wardrobe to get on. She was visibly frustrated as she struggled to get it cover her large ass, but after some grunting and frustration, she eventually did. She didn't bother trying to button and zip them, she knew that was impossible with a gut like this. She put on her grey socks and brown loafers. Lastly, she put her coat on, leavening it unbuttoned for the same reason her pants were.

After brushing her hair, Audrey walked out of her room. Her belly, boobs, and butt jiggled with every step but she didn't care. She didn't hate her weight anymore.

After getting directions from a Federation officer, the iron-willed resolve in her eyes left him unable to to refuse her request, she entered the briefing room. Alberto was explaining the operation to rescue Banagher, though all the arguing was making that rather hard.

"You're telling me the Nahel Argama is supposed to fight and break into that fortress alone?! Impossible!" One of the engineers yelled at Alberto.

"Excuse me." Audrey said to get their attention.

"This operation is under ECOAS jurisdiction." Alberto countered. "And reinforcements have already arrived."

"I have something to say." Audrey tried again.

"Might I add it is unprecedented for two elite ECOAS teams to join forces like this." Alberto continued.

A little annoyed, Audrey tried again. "You need to hear what I'm-"

"What is the possibility of our success?" A Federation officer asked.

Audrey was now more then a little annoyed. "Can you please just-"

"We're supposed to recapture the RX-0, sizing control of one local area s not going to cut it." The officer continued.

Mad now, Audrey tried once again. "Just listen to me for two-"

"Have you even considered all the resources we'll have to dedicate towards prevent enemy pursuit?!" Another crew member said.

As they kept bickering, Audrey sighed in frustration. Seeing there was only one way to fix this, she breathed in deeply, and-

"UUUUUURRRRRRAAAP!"

The gigantic belch shut everyone up instantly, all eyes were now on the source of the gaseous eruption.

"Thank you." Audrey snarked. She walked towards the briefing monitor and faced the crowds. Normal a fat girl with a huge gut bulging out of her clothes would've been an amusing sight. But there was something that about Audrey's iron will that made her gut flat out intimidating. "Now that I have your attention, I'll be going to Palau ahead of the Nahel Argama."

"Hey, you can't just come barging in here and acting like you're in charge!" A mechanic yelled at the princess. "In case you've forgotten, this isn't a damn Zeon ship!"

"I'm not trying to alter your plans, I'm working on my own. I just believe that I can aid you by doing so. Mr. Alberto, you need someone to to get into Palau to inform Banagher of the rescue, correct?"

"Erm, that's right."

"I'm the best person for that job. Very few are aware that I've completely abandoned Neo-Zeon, they believe I'm simply voicing my complaints while ultimately doing nothing. Full Frontal has no reason to expose me, he's aware that claiming I'm against Neo-Zeon with no proof would merely divide his forces. I can freely walk around Palau without arousing suspicion. Besides," Here, Audrey grabbed the sides of her fat belly, the fat oozing between her fingers, and lifted it up to display the mighty orb. "all this blubber might act as a convincing disguise." She then let go of her gut, it dropped down and started jiggling. "I've lived in Palau for years, I know the layout. I'm perfect for this."

"And how do we know you won't just use this as an opportunity to escape and warn them of our attack?" An ECOAS soldier asked. Unlike the others, there was no hostility in his voice. He was merely asking a question.

"Do I know of exactly how you'll attack Palau? The warning wouldn't do any good if they don't know how you'll attack. They won't move Banagher or the Unicorn either, they want to keep him where there's no chance of him escaping. Moving him would just be an unnecessary risk of him escaping or being rescued."

"I'm with her." One of the crew members said.

"Thank you." Audrey said

"You gotta be kidding me!" Another crew member said

"Regardless of whether or not I receive your support on this, I will find someway to reach Palau." Audrey declared.

"I'm the one who will be taking you there." A man with a beard and black hair said as he entered the briefing room, he was wearing a Londo Bell uniform. Audrey couldn't say why, but for some reason she had this feeling that she knew this person. "It's been a long time, princess Mineva."

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
The large doors of Full Frontal's office opened, Banagher walked into the room, Zinnerman and Marida flanking his sides to ensure he would not attempt to escape. There was a clear understanding between all three of them that Banagher knew attempting to escape without outside assistance would only end in failure. Still, precious "cargo" like Banagher had to always be protected. Banagher and Marida's big bellies bobbed and bounced with every step, but the brunette notice that Zinnerman's did not. He assumed that must be because he had a good amount of visible muscle to go with the fat, unlike Banagher and Marida whose weight was pure lard.

Banagher looked around at the fine decor of the room. It felt condescending, like it wasn't designed to show of the beauty of the room, but rather the supposed beauty of the people who owned it. To show that everything about them was superior.

Banagher looked the desk at the end of the room, Full Frontal was sitting at it, with his most trusted knight, Angelo standing off to the side of it. "Is he human?" was Banagher's first thought. It wasn't just the mask that gave off this uncanny feeling, nothing about the Second Coming of Char felt human to him. He seemed artificial. Robotic.

Dead.

"They tell me there was a room just like this in the last stronghold of the former Principality of Zeon, A Baoa Qu." Full Frontal spoke. His words caught Banagher off guard. "The governor-general of Palau is adamant sympathizer of the former Principality. As such, I have to accept gifts like this graciously, even if the decor isn't my style. I suppose accepting gifts I don't enjoy is a trait of a good leader."

"Is that supposed to be a joke?" Banagher thought. Logically a joke should've put him at ease, which he knew was Full Frontal's intent, but the way it was said in a such a matter of fact tone only further contributed to the uncanny effect Full Frontal was giving. It was like even he didn't find it funny, or even care if it was. He said it like it was something he was ordered to say.

"Good work, Captain Zinnerman and lieutenant Marida. You may leave, I'll take it from here."

"Captain." Marida started.

"I know. Princess Mineva being held hostage by the Federation was unexpected. We will have many opportunities to rescue through both force and diplomacy. Just be patient."

"Sir."

The ones the masked man addressed saluted before they left the room. Banagher took one last look at Marida's exposed bellybutton, and then looked at his own.They were in the same boat but there was something about the way she carried herself that made the fact that was practically bursting out of her uniform seem like a non-issue, even though Banagher knew she hated being like this. In contrast, Banagher felt he just looked like a fat slob, despite not showing off any more fat then Marida was.

Banagher stared at Full Frontal. "Char Aznable." he uttered. He thought about how Char this person was claiming to be used to wear a mask during the One Year War era, though it was a different type.

"Come now, have a seat." Full Frontal invited.

Banagher glanced at the nearby leather couches that faced each other, he walked over to them. Even though he really just wanted to sit down, the idea of sitting down in his enemy's couch felt wrong. Well, Marida was officially his enemy, but she didn't feel like it. The Red Comet did.

"How are you feeling?' The blond asked. "I've heard it was no small feat to get you out of that Gundam safely."

"So, um."

"Yes?"

"Was that you-Were you the guy I fought with in that red mobile suit?"

Angelo's eyes narrowed, furious at Banagher causally referring to Full Frontal as some mere guy.

"Do you have a problem sitting for tea with a mortal enemy, Banagher Links?" That was what Full Frontal said, but it felt far more like he was saying "You will sit down".

Knowing there were better hills to die on, Banagher sat down, he was caught off guard as he felt it flattened it a bit beneath his bubble butt.

"That fatass is tainting the captain's couch! What does the princess see in this blob?!" Angelo could barely keep himself from yelling those words.

The brunette reluctantly took a sip from the cup of tea. "I really hope this doesn't made me burp." He thought to himself.

"You have good reflexes, even if you're a bit reckless." The masked one said he removed his gloves and walked over. "However, that's a temperament not befitting of a pilot." He stood in front of Banagher and extended a hand. Banagher hastily stopped drinking tea and stood up. Banagher was about to accept the handshake when he he found himself unable to, it felt he was being asked to give a handshake to an empty suit of armor.

"This might sound rude but may I ask why do you wear that mask? Are you hiding a scar or something? I'd like to see your face. That is if you have nothing to hide."

"You dare-!" Angelo started.

"It is fine, lieutenant Angelo" Full Frontal said. "Banagher is right, it's a matter of etiquette." With that, he removed the mask.

Banagher's eyes widened, the face of the man known as Full Frontal was undoubtedly Char Aznable's. His blue eyes had the same world-weariness to them.

"I choose to wear this mask because it's my style, but it also serves as a propaganda tool." Full Frontal explained. "Most of the time I forget I even have it on until someone like you makes a point of mentioning it. My apologies." His words carried a feeling of barely restrained condescension.

He extended his hand again and Banagher reluctantly shook it. It felt cold and lifeless.

"I've heard about how you meet princess Mineva but as for how you came into possession of that mobile suit from the Vist Foundation, the Unicorn Gundam, there is much I have yet to understand." The man calling himself Char Aznable said as he walked to the front of his deck and turned to face Banagher. "The truth is the decision to turn over that machine to us had already been arranged. So what would make Cardeas Vist suddenly choose you to be the bearer of Laplace's Box?"

"Marida already put down everything I know in the report, right?" Banagher answered.

"She did." Full Frontal placed the mask down on his desk. "However even with the knowledge of you being Cardeas Vist's son, that the Vist Foundation would throw away the prosperity they had partly gained due to an arrangement with the Federation government, place their hopes in Neo-Zeon by arranging for them to receive Laplace's Box, and then cancel the arrangement in favor of someone so apolitical until now, it doesn't make any sense. It feel like there's some details I'm missing."

"Maybe seeing all the death Neo-Zeon brought made him realize you're not interested in change, just destruction. Did that ever cross your mind? Or are you so close minded you can't even fathom the idea of someone growing to to despise you?"

Before the leader of Neo-Zeon could offer a rebuttal, Banagher found himself grabbed from his hood by Angelo, pure hatred evident in the white haired soldier's eyes.

"That's enough, lieutenant." Full Frontal said for the seventh time that day.

"You'd better learn respect, fatso." Angelo ordered Banagher before releasing his grip and returning to the side of his leader's desk.

"While your theory would explain your father's actions, I am hesitant to believe he would change his mind like that. Simply put, people rarely ever change without it being forced on them."

"Stop trying to push your grown up pessimism on me."

"May I add that we're treating you respectfully because of your relationship with princess Mineva. Please keep that in mind."

"I thought you hated her. You said Neo-Zeon doesn't need people like her."

"It'd be more accurate to say I hate her misguided beliefs. True, Neo-Zeon holds no need for people with her mindset, but I'm hoping she will see reason in time."

"She already does see reason. Audrey wants all this to stop. She was very clear that Neo-Zeon must not get the Box. She said it would mean war if you did. And after what happened to Industrial 7, anyone would feel the same. She's the princess of Zeon, if Audrey is against it, why are you trying to get the box? Why won't you listen to her?"

"Tell me, what do you believe Laplace's Box is? What is it that so many people believe has the power to bring the Federation to an end after every attempt before to do so has failed?"

Banagher paused. "Well I don't know but I think it's knowledge."

"As do I, though if I may ask, what has brought you to that conclusion?"

"Just like Laplace's Box is supposed to, knowledge has managed the world in an instant plenty of times before."

"Such as?"

Banagher took a moment to think of examples. He knew better then to bring it up, but seeing how fat Audrey got shortly after she discovered fast food was an example. "Well, like Zeon's first colony drop, or hitting the Earth with an asteroid to start global cooling. Or centuries ago when they made nuclear weapons or discovered Minovsky particles or developed mobile suits. Even though it looks stable, the world changes little by little right underneath our feet. If an idea comes around at the right time, it could have the power to change everything."

"Absolutely right. And you seem to know your history well." Full Frontal walked slightly past Banagher, not looking at him as he spoke. "Are you aware that space immigration was a policy of mass exile? Even though the autonomy of the Side settlers recognized, the central government retained the right to appoint it's leaders, and since the spacenoids weren't allowed to vote, they may as well have had no suffrage whatsoever." Full Frontal turned to face Banagher. "Not all of Neo-Zeon adheres to a single doctrine but we do have in-common is the belief that this unjust system must evolve in order to break from the oppressive rule of the Federation and realize the Independence of spacenoids, we fight-"

"But no one should resort to terrorism!" Banagher yelled, cutting off the leader of Neo-Zeon. The blond's face didn't show it but he was truly shocked at the obese young man's defiance. "No matter how righteous you think you are, you can't just go around killing people! It's not right!"

"You big hypocrite!" Roared Angelo. Before Banagher could tell what was going on, Angelo grabbed him by the hood again and was pushed against the wall, his entire body jiggling.

Images of all the death he had seen flashed through Banagher's mind. "I'm not wrong." He thought to himself. "Humans should live like humans and die like humans. I can't allow anyone to other people's lives short, people they don't know, just because they think they were in the way."

"If it's never right to take another life, then you're as guilty as the rest of us for using the Gundam! You shot down one of our best men, what do you have to say for that?!" Angelo yelled.

"I what?"

"What's he talking about?" Banagher pondered in his mind. "I only aimed at Full Frontal."

"It might've been a stray shot back then but you did shoot him down!"

The brunette's eyes widened as those words made reality sink in.

"I don't think Banagher even knows what you're talking about" Full Frontal said. "He was probably acting purely on instinct. Ensign Sergei was just unlucky."

"No, did I kill someone?" Banagher muttered to himself, looking down dejectedly at his gut. "It's this stupid thing's fault." He thought. "If I wasn't so damn fat, I would've done much better. I would've beaten Full Frontal, I wouldn't have been captured, I would be with Audrey right now, and Sergei would still be alive. It's all my fault for being such a pig. I dragged Audrey into this too, I ruined her body."

"Call for Marida." Full Frontal's words brought Banagher's focus back to the here and now. "There is still so much you have yet to learn about who we really are." Banagher slowly stood up. "I want you to understand us, and it is my hope that given enough time we will one day work together."

Hearing the sound of the large doors opening, Banagher turned to see Marida's massive body waddle in. She was visibly shocked once she noticed that the captain wasn't wearing his mask. She quickly recovered and then looked at Banagher. "Let's go."

Without protest, Banagher went with her, but turned around right outside the door. "One more thing. Who are you?! Are you Char Aznable or aren't you?!" Marida turned to face Full Frontal.

Full Frontal placed his mask back no. "As I am now, I consider myself nothing more then a vessel. A vessel for the hopes of those abandoned in space and for the ideals of Zeon that will light all our paths to freedom. So if that's what the people desire, then Char Aznable is who I will be. And that is the reason why I wear this mask."

+++

"You alright?" Marida asked Banagher once they were outside of the mansion. "You seem shaken."

Banagher didn't answer.

"What happened in there?" Marida's tone now contained worry. "Did he hurt you?"

A few seconds of painful silence filled the air before Banagher answered. "Marida... can we do that exercise now?"

Standing with the man at the hanger, Audrey looked at the golden mobile suit that was now sitting in the hanger of the Nahel Argama.

"Does it look familiar to you?" he asked the obese blonde.

"Yes, it appears to be a variant of the Zeta Gundam." Audrey remembered witnessing the sight of the Zeta Gundam when it arrived at the Gwadan during the Gryps War, when the AEUG had attempted negotiations with Axis. She had been taught her entire life to fear and despise Gundam, yet she felt neither fear nor anger when she laid eyes upon the Zeta Gundam. Just interest.

"It's the Zeta Gundam 3B Type, but I call it Buster. It's a copy of the original customized for my fighting style." The bearded man explained. "Now tell me, do I look familiar to you?"

Audrey faced the man and looked deeply into his face. He definitely felt familiar but no matter how hard she tried, she just couldn't remember who he was. "You feel familiar but I can't remember who you are. I'm sorry."

"Don't be, I'm happy enough that any part of you remembers me." He then looked deeply into Audrey's face, which surprised her. Like before with Daguza, she could feel herself being scanned. Unlike with Daguza, it didn't feel like a predator seeing if it was time to strike it's prey, rather, it felt like a father who had been reunited with his daughter after many long years. But this man wasn't Dozle Zabi, so who was he? "You've grown into a fine young women. Dozle and Zenna would be proud. You have your mother's face, and I can see your father's indomitable will in your eyes."

"... Did you know my parents?"

"My name is Shin Matsunaga, the White Wolf. I was childhood friends with your father and we fought together in the One Year War. And for a time, I looked after you when your mother died. Do you remember me now?"

Those words made everything come together in Audrey's mind, she remembered him clearly now. She was very young when he left her life, but she still clearly remembered the wonderful time that she spent with him. "I-I do. But Haman told me you died. Killed by a Federation patrol."

Shin contained the anger he felt when he heard that. "I'm not surprised. It's far from the worst thing she ever did, but I was hoping she could at least be honest with you about that. Obviously I'm not dead. I left Zeon behind. When I saw that she was going to make you the monarch of Zeon at such a young age, and use you as a puppet queen, I left."

"Oh, I see..." Audrey said dejectedly. She knew that Haman manipulated her for her own gain, but she still knew that Haman loved her as a daughter. Of course Haman putting her in that position was an awful thing to do, but the Zabi still had many fond memories of her. She wanted Shin to understand that Haman did truly care for her, but she knew that was impossible. He had too much justified anger at her, both for how she abused Audrey, and for the many sins against others she committed. Audrey could never hold Shin's hatred of Haman against him.

"I'm sorry I couldn't tell you in person I was leaving. Haman said I was to never approach you or even your room ever again after I voiced my complaints. Well, that might be putting what I said too lightly. I did consider rescuing you, but I soon realized that was something I couldn't do alone. I did leave you a letter, but Haman evidently burned it. I'm sorry for failing you."

"You didn't. As you said, there was nothing you could've done."

"Your forgiveness is a blessing."

A slight smirk tugged at the princess' lips. "You sound like Banagher."

"Thank you for the comparison. From what I've heard you picked a fine knight."

Audrey blushed. "I guess that's one way to put it. Anyways, that explains why you're still alive but why are you a member of Londo Bell?"

"As you know, the Titans began oppressing the spacenoids shortly after my supposed death. I refused to stand idly by as Neo-Zeon did, I joined the AEUG. And when that became Londo Bell, well, you could say becoming brothers in arms with Federation officers dedicated to ending all forms of oppression, made me see the Federation in a more favorable light. It still needs change, but I now understand we don't have to burn it to the ground to do that."

"There's one thing I still don't understand."

"What's that?"

Audrey's smirk returned. "If you're the White Wolf, then why is your Gundam gold?"

"Oh, that." The White Wolf said, Audrey could tell from the tone of his voice he hated the gold color scheme. "It's a special anti-beam coating. Unfortunately, there's no white or grey version of it."

"Has your nickname changed to the Gold Wolf yet?"

"Thankfully no. More importantly, I think we're forgetting to do something."

"What's that?"

"This!'

Shin gave Audrey a big bear hug, despite not being the White Bear. Her stuffed belly pressing against Shin's middle forced a loud burp out of Audrey. Despite the nausea, she hugged Shin back.

"Thank you, Shin. It's been far too long."

"Indeed it has."

"I-I know this is rude but we can we cut the hug short? I'm feeling kinda full."

"We'll jog to the park and then do a few laps around it." Marida said to her brown-haired friend. "After a break and some water, we'll jog to the ice cream parlor for a small snack, then jog back home."

"Sounds good." Banagher said.

"If you don't mind me asking, what made you want to do this? I know we haven't known each other for long, but you don't seem the athletic type. And that's not a jab at your weight."

"I just..." Banagher considered telling her the truth, but he didn't want to risk hearing her tell him that his self-loathing was justified. That was the last thing he needed to hear right now. "realized I've let myself go, so I want to lose all this fat."

"I can tell you're lying but I won't press the issue. A good jog might clear your head. Now follow me."

Marida broke into a light jog, Banagher followed suit. Their entire bodies were jiggling around all over the place, which somehow made Marida's figure even more alluring to Banagher. At first things went well, they were moving at a decent pace and burning calories, but after thirty seconds of nothing but jogging without a break, both chubsters started panting. Ten more seconds later, they started sweating. Five seconds later, their round faces started getting a bit red, and their speed started to suffer. Eight seconds later, their faces were completely red and drenched with sweat. The poor pilots were panting heavily.

"Maybe we should *huff* take a *huff* a break." Marida suggested.

"We *huff* *huff* need to."

Marida and Banagher collapsed onto the sidewalk, compete wrecks. Panting and wheezing, their legs and lungs felt coated in pain and exhaustion. They felt like they had been traversing a desert. Reaching the park felt like a Herculean task.

"My body *huff* is on *huff* fire." Banagher groaned

"*Huff* Sweat is just fat *huff* *huff* crying... That's what *huff* *huff* I tell myself at least." Marida wiped the sweat off her brow with her soft arm. "I think *huff* we pushed ourselves *huff* too hard."

"We need *huff* water."

Marida looked down the side walk to see a bus station. It had a wooden bench that could fit both them, and it even had a vending machine. Marida internally thanked God she brought her wallet with her today. "There's a vending machine *huff* *huff* at that bus station."

After some panting and gasping, the overweight duo slowly got up and lumbered over to the nearby station, groaning and panting the whole time. Grunting, his large behind on the very inviting wooden bench, Marida made the sacrifice of being the one to get the drinks. She got four bottles of water, two for each of them. She grunted as she sat down next Banagher and handed him his drinks. They quickly screwed off the top of their first drink and started chugging it. It felt heavenly to get the refreshing substance in their mouths, like a farm that had been blessed with rain after a famine. They drank nearly all the water in their bottles before they were satisfied enough to remove the bottles from their lips, burping loudly as soon as they did. Marida didn't excuse herself, she was still too exhausted.

"*Pant* *pant* That's better." Banagher said. He then groaned. "This is going to be tougher then I thought."

"We've just gotta keep at it." Marida said. "And stay *huff* hydrated." Marida drank the rest the water in her bottle. "We're already almost at the park."

After a five minute break, Banagher and Marida resumed jogging to the park. It was far from a pleasant experience, but taking sips from their water bottles helped keep the exhaustion down, though not completely. They soon reached their destination.

"And here we are." Marida said as they reached their destination.

'Thank God."

After a few more seconds of jogging, they sat down when they found a wooden bench near a vending machine.

Banagher threw his head back over the bench. "Jogging hurts."

"It sure does."

They relaxed for a while, just enjoying the beautiful scenery the park offered. It went well with the sunset.

Banagher got back into a regular position. "Marida?"

"Yes?"

"What did it feel like when you... killed for the first time."

"..."

"Sorry, I shouldn't have asked that."

"It's not that I mind answering it. I'm just trying to remember the answer. It's been a long time since then."

That confused Banagher. "How old are you?"

"Eighteen."

Banagher couldn't think of way to answer that. A part of him was glad that he couldn't. It made him feel normal.

"Well, I can't remember feeling anything when it happened." Marida finally answered. "Maybe the world was just so simple for me back then I couldn't even register that someone had died because of my actions. Maybe even back then I understood that once you step into a mobile suit, you're a combat unit. Or maybe I had already comes to terms with taking a life before I first did. Unlike you, I had already known beforehand that I would be spilling blood."

"I... I don't want to get used to this."

"Don't look at it like there's some right answer you must reach. Everyone is different, and that means everyone's reaction to death is different. You only have to do what you feel is right."

"... I can't agree with that. I know what you're saying makes sense, but if there's one thing I know, it's that death should always be a sad thing."

All they heard was the sound of the wind blowing, and the leafs being carried by it.

"Banagher."

"Yeah?" Banagher looked at his friend, only to find her cupping his round cheeks in her hands as she looked into his tired eyes.

"That's enough drama for today. Let's get you back to your normal, goofy self. Some ice cream should do the trick. Do you want any sprinkles on yours?"

"Y-Yeah."

Banagher, Takuya, and you were all I had left. Then you turn out to be why so many of my friends are dead, and then Banagher gets kidnapped by your people!"

"And how are you going to -UUURP- do that?"

Micott stopped looking at the wall and walked forward, her butt was jiggling the most, but her belly, legs, and boobs weren't missing out on the jiggle action either. She stopped a few feet in front of Audrey and looked into her green eyes. "If this works and Banagher returns to us safe and sound, I'll forgive you."

"You will?"

"Completely forgive you. We'll go back to being -URRAAAP- friends, you'll be as close to me as Banagher and Takuya."

"I-Thank you, Micott. I truly appreciate this." Audrey had a small smile on her round face.

Micott sighed, frustrated at how hard to hate Audrey was. "Well, that's what friends do: They forgive each other."

Audrey blinked twice in confusion. "Oh, we're already friends again?"

"No we're not, you dweeb! I meant that when you-Oh, whatever. I've got work to do with the others. See ya at breakfast tomorrow." Micott walked off.

"I'll see you then."

Once she was sure Micott was out of earshot, Audrey put a fist to her mouth and let out an unladylike belch.
