"You've got this, Banagher!" Marida cheered on her fat friend as he grunted, his face red with exhaustion as he attempted to do a sit up in the living room. She was holding his feet in place.

"Gh!" Banagher's belly was squinting against his legs, the orb being his biggest obstacle to doing sit ups, along with his lack of stamina. Still, despite the sweet and exhaustion, the brunette kept on trying, both for Marida and Audrey.

"You can do this!"

"O-O-One!" Banagher triumphantly shouted with all his remaining might as he completed his first push up after fifteen seconds of effort, and then immediately flopped down on his back, his belly jiggling like a blob of jelly when he hit the ground, sticking straight up into the air. "-Pant- -pant- I -pant- I'm not sure if I can keep doing this."

"It took you less time then I did." Marida had done five push ups before it was Banagher's turn, each one took around thirty seconds.

Banagher did four more sit ups, each one leaving him more exhausted and sweaty. His round face red and drenched with sweat, the pilot was desperately hoping Marida was right that exercise gets a little easier every time.

"You did good."

"T-Thanks. Are we -pant- going to do more when you get back?"

"No, I'll need to rest when my mission is done. This will be a daily thing."

Banagher was very relived to hear that. Already dressed in her uniform, Marida got up and wobbled to the door. "I'll be back around 7 PM, you're allowed to leave the house if you want."

"I don't get how you can treat this like it's some job."

"It is a job, just not a pleasant one."

"... I'll see you when you get back."

"See you then."

Marida left, leaving Banagher, who was still laying flat on his back, behind to ponder what to do.

"So now what do I do? I doubt Marida has any video games lying around. Don't think she has a computer either. I could just watch TV." He turned his eyes from the ceiling towards his stomach, which loomed over him. "God, I'm fat. The last thing I should do is sit on my fat ass all day, I'll end up pigging out again and Marida will yell at me for eating all her food." Banagher placed his left hand over his left eye. "I gotta get all these thoughts out of my head, I'm losing it. This is so exhausting, maybe I should take a nap, you know, get some rest. No, I'll yell at myself when I wake up. Maybe a walk is what I need. Yeah, that's it. I can burn some calories, see what the neighborhood is like, and it'll clear my head."

As Banagher stood up with some grunting and difficulty, Audrey woke up in her room on the Nahel Argama. She looked the clock on the nightstand, it read that it was 12:49 PM. She supposed she couldn't blame herself for sleeping in a little when she had so much trouble getting to sleep last night. Without any people or sound, there was nothing distracting her from listening to her inner voices as they channeled her self-loathing. She was eventually able to get to sleep by filling her head with memories of Banagher and her other friends, but it was still hard. Even now it was a struggle to truly believe that it was okay to sleep in.

She got out of her bed and got dressed, a little glad that she could still keep her pants closed, unlike Banagher, but she was well-aware that would change if she kept up her reckless eating. After all, the buttons on her coat were just barely hanging on, and her blouse always rode up just barely above her belly button. Even the pants she was glad she could keep close weren't doing too well, the button on it was visibly tight, and her zipper looked like it really wanted her to undo it. Again, not as bad as Banagher, but a future with Audrey walking around with her pants open and coat undone was still likely.

After doing her hair, Audrey noticed that was the second day in a row she had a really bad case of bed hair, the blonde left her room and walked to the cafeteria. Watching her tummy as it bounced with every step, she thought back to how Banagher once assured her they'd both lose the weight quickly without even having to exercise.

After reaching the cafeteria and waiting in line until it was her turn, Audrey ordered ten pancakes and some water. Taking her breakfast with her, she sat by herself at a table in the corner of the cafeteria. She would have like to eat breakfast with Shin, Riddhe, or Mihiro but none of them seemed to be in the cafeteria, having most likely had their breakfast earlier then Audrey did. Micott and Takuya would be nice too, and knowing their tendency to sleep in probably hadn't had their breakfast yet, but she figured they didn't want to see her.

She started eating her breakfast in silence. After finishing three pancakes, she heard a familiar voice calling her out to her.

"So do you want us to call you Mineva?" Takuya asked.

That question gave her the answer to it. It made her realize that ever since Banagher reaffirmed that she was still Audrey to him, she hadn't thought of herself as Mineva even once. Even in the depths of her self-loathing when she was convinced she didn't deserve Banagher's friendship, she still thought of herself as Audrey. "Banagher made me realize that... my true name is Audrey Burne."

At one point, Takuya made a comment about even though he knew a lot about the Nahel Argama, he had no idea it was so easy to get fat on it, a comment he punctuated by jiggling his belly. This made Audrey take full notice of how fat he had gotten, she was so distracted by everyone she hadn't notice how her freckled pal had also crossed the border between pudgy to fat after Banagher had been captured. Most likely the result of comfort food.

He found that his tummy was surprisingly fun to jiggle and mess around with when he was bored, he didn't even get embarrassed playing with it in front of the others. He had a pair of soft moobs that rested on his tummy like it was a shelf for models. Crumbs from his meals would sometimes land on them. The aspiring pilot had a big butt that would fill up any chair he sat in and spill off the sides of, which was annoying when he was working on building models. His butt would leave an imprint when he sat on a couch, something he was doing more often these days, and he was already kinda lazy even when he was skinny. Takuya's face now had a double chin and round, chubby cheeks that went along very well with his freckles. His face's new softness made his moments of enthusiasm over mobile suits even cuter.

"URRRP! You wanna watch TV with us?" Takuya offered Audrey after they all finished eating.

"Yes please!" She enthusiastically answered.

"Wonder what she's doing right now." He turned his head away from the ice cream parlor as he kept walking, and spotted an electronics store. "If we had phones, would she let me text her during her missions? Hey, if I'm going to be stuck here for a while, then I should get Audrey a phone. She's going to need one when she comes with us to school after this is all over. And we'll be able to keep in touch if we get separated again. I left my phone on the Argama, right?"

Walking over to the store, he was tempted to run but he didn't want to do anymore jiggling then he was already, Banagher was about to walk in when he remembered his current... status. I'm just an egotistical brat. Nothing more." She sighed. "I'm having those thoughts again. I need to focus on the good times, that aren't here anymore because of me. No! I can't keep thinking this, I need to focus on the good times, the moments I spent with Banagher, how happy I made him, how happy we made each other." The pain the princess felt could clearly be seen on her face, one only needing to look for a single second to see it. Her breathing intensified.

"Don't worry about it Audrey, it's not your fault."

"I'd never consider you annoying, you're my friend."

"That feels amazing, Audrey."

"Well then, how about I give it a good ol' belly rub?

"Good to hear!"

Audrey's breathing calmed. Her eye lids rose and her vision focused, allowing her to make out the form of Haro as he stared at her. Despite the ball's inability to change expression, he was still able to look worried, to plead with his blank eyes for Audrey to be okay, to convey sorrow for Audrey with his blank eyes.

"It'll be okay, Audrey. It''l be okay, Audrey."

Audrey gave a tired smile. "Thank you, I needed someone to say that."

"Banagher doesn't blame you."

"He's such a nice person."

"He is! He is! You'll be eating with him again and getting big, stuffed bellies before you know it!"

"Who knew stuffed bellies would be something I'd find myself looking forward to?" Audrey said with renewed vigor as she got out of bed and started getting dressed to face the day.

Once dressed, Audrey let out a loud and unladylike burp as she walked out of her room, holding Haro. She apologized for the gaseous eruption and walked to the cafeteria. Upon entering, she looked to see that Micott and Takuya were at their usual table, already having started eating breakfast. "To think you two got up before I did." She said as she walked over and sat down with them.

Micott burped. "We're not that much better, we only got up ten minuets ago." Micott explained as chewed a spoonful of cereal.

Takuya noticed something odd abut Audrey. "Where's your breakfast? Don't tell me you're starving yourself to lose weight."

"It's nothing like that, I need to talk to Shin about when we'll be going to Palau together. I'll have my breakfast after, I just wanted to to say good morning to you two. Well, good afternoon, actually."

"Just don't skip any meals, we''ll force feed you if you do." Takuya half jokingly said with a grin.

"And take pictures for Banagher." Micott added.

"I'll keep that in mind." Audrey said. She'd rather not be force fed, but if she had to be, she'd definitely want Banagher to see it.

"You know, we might have to cut back on all the eating." Takuya then took a bite out of a waffle.

"Why do you say that?" Audrey felt a little ashamed that actually got her a tad worried.

"Some guy raided the fridge last night when everyone was asleep. No one knows who did it, just that he sure knows how to pack it away."

"I can't believe someone isn't satisfied with the amount of food they're given. As someone's who been quite..." Audrey looked down at her fat gut. "well-fed during her service here," said as she gave the orb a few pats for emphasis. "it's beyond greedy that someone is eating mountains of food during the day, and is not only unsatisfied with that, but steals even more from everyone else."

"The thief must weigh, like, five thousand pounds with an appetite like that." Micott stated, trying to imagine what the raid on the fridge looked like. "Good thing we just got resupplied today, or he'll eat our ship dry in a few days."

"They better not ration us when Banagher gets back. We need to welcome him back by making him the most stuffed he's ever been." Takuya said.

"I'll be sure to give him the best belly rubs he's ever had." Audrey said as all four of them imagined how incredibly swollen and bloated Banagher will look, with Audrey and Micott giving him soothing belly rubs as he burped up a storm.

"Leave some of that gut for me." Micott said.

"Don't forget to eat a ton yourselves." Takuya said. "It is a party after all."

After talking some more about how they should handle Banagher's welcome home party, the detail they were the most torn about was whether it should be held in the recreational room or Banagher's room, Audrey left for the hanger, still carrying Haro with her. Shortly after entering, she stopped as she noticed two new mobile suits sporting dark color schemes. Audrey walked toward the railing to get as good a look as she could, her belly squishing against the railing. "Two new Zeta Gundams? No, they look different. One is even slimmer then the original, and the other is bulkier."

"Oh, hey, Audrey!" A friendly voice coming from Riddhe said. Audrey stopped leaning at the railing and turned to look at Riddhe, seeing that he was was fatter then when she last saw him.

Riddhe's belly was where most of his weight had gone. It was a big orb that was so round massive Riddhe had to leave his pants, belt, and uniform top open for it, as he couldn't keep them closed. It was both a blessing and cruse that his gut was so fat that hung down far enough to obscure his crotch, as it meant no one could see his underwear. His belly was very jiggly, especially when he was piloting his mobile suit.

His chest and butt were much bigger then they had any fight to be. His chest was two sacks of plush flab that rested on his belly, and his butt was two large orbs that made his seat in the cockpit a bit snug. His legs had also gotten chubbier, now rubbing together slightly.

His face had gotten pudgy, with cherubic cheeks and a double chin, though his face's chub wasn't as pronounced as Banagher's.

"I see you noticed the Delta Plus." Riddhe was surprised when his words were met by a judgmental glare from his tubby, blonde friend. "Uh... Did I do something wrong?"

"I'm disappointed in you, I thought you were better this." Audrey coldly said as she approached Riddhe.

"I'm sorry?"

"I can't believe you're the thief who stole all that food from the fridge." The Zabi said as she stopped right in front of Riddhe, staring him down.

"What?!" Riddhe never thought a cute chubby girl could look so scary. "What makes you think I'm the thief?"

"If you're not, then where exactly did all this come from?" With those icy words, Audrey grabbed the sides of Riddhe's exposed belly as tightly as she could, getting the fat in between her soft fingers, and shook it with all her might.

"H-Hey!" Riddhe's cheeks turned scarlet. It did feel kinda nice to have someone like Audrey play with his belly, but not only was this in public, the pilot was downright afraid of her. "I know this looks bad, but I'm not the thief. I've just been stress eating a lot, that's all. UUUURAAAP!"

"I'll take that belch as a confession."

"I just had a snack!"

"This some sorta weird lovers' quarrel?" Those words instantly made Audrey and Riddhe freeze in place, though not the latter's belly, as it was still jiggling a bit. The words came from an older man as he walked up to them.

"No..." They muttered as they hastily moved away from each other, blushes on their full faces. "... And who exactly are you?" Audrey asked partly as a way to divert attention away from the embarrassing sight.

"The name's Travis Kirkland." Travis was an obese man in his fifties. Despite this, his face had a rather youthful look to it, were it not for the grey hair, one would most likely mistake him for someone twenty years lounger at least. He had a large beer belly that hung down greatly, a large butt that would make his pilot chair in the cockpit rather snug, chunky and out of shape arms and legs, huge man boobs, and a full face with round cheeks and a huge double chin. Audrey made an educated guess that he was around Marida's weight. Judging from the green pilot suit he was wearing, as well as the leather jacket he wore on top of it, fit him perfectly, he had been fat for a long time now. "I'm a freelancer."

"I wasn't aware we were bringing in freelancers." Riddhe noted.

"Well, I'm a special case. Londo Bell didn't come to me, I came to them." He explained. "Though I'm not here for your knight in shinning armor, princess." Unlike everyone else in Audrey's life, Travis didn't say princess in a formal manner, he said it as though it were a nickname. The princess appreciated that, thinking on how Haman would've yelled at Travis for it had she heard that. If there was an afterlife, Audrey wouldn't be surprised if Haman's spirit would demand Travis apologize once he finally enters it. "I'm here for these two." Travis pulled two photos out of his jacket's pockets and handed them over to a confused Audrey, Riddhe was looking at them as well.. The first photo showed a young man with brown hair who was wearing a One Year War era Zeon pilot suit, he appeared to be standing in a hanger, a blue High Mobility Ground Type Zaku II as in the background, painted mostly blue and bore the emblem of a white wolf on the middle of it's chest. Presumably the mobile suit belonged to the man in the photo.

The second photo showed the blue mobile suit that had engaged Banagher when he was kidnapped. "The photo's outdated by over a decade, but that man is Vincent Gleissner, my son. I'm looking for him, and I think he's with that mobile suit in the other photo. They're both with Neo-Zeon, do they look familiar to you?"

"No, I did very little leading before I left Zeon and I can't be expected to remember every single pilot and mobile suit."

"Audrey." Riddhe lightly scolded.

"What?"

"I had a feeling that was going to be the answer." Travis took the photos back and put them back in his jacket's pockets. "That mobile suit's name is the Pale Rider, and I think finding it will lead me to Vincent."

"Is he the pilot?" Riddhe asked.

"No, but my latest lead tells me that a blue Geara Doga can always be seen with the Pale Rider, I think that's him. If you see either of them, leave them and let me know ." Travis then looked away from them and pointed at the grey and black mobile suit next to the Delta Plus, directing Audrey and Riddhe's eyes towards it. "That's my machine, the ZII. It's probably the only mobile suit on this ship that can handle the Pale-"

"How did you know this ship fought the Pale Rider?" Audrey shot an accusatory glare towards Travis, Riddhe was surprised when she pointed out that hole in Travis' story.

"hmm?" Even though this was a serious accusation Audrey was making, Travis didn't seem phased at all. "I'm not a spy from Neo-Zeon, if that's what you're getting at. A friend of mine just did a little digging."

"That sounds like hacking."

"It can't be that easy to hack into Federation records." Riddhe stated.

"Heh, she's been hacking them for years." With those words, Travis causally strolled off as if the tense tone the conversation took never happened, his gut and butt bobbing and bouncing. Audrey and Riddhe silently watched, not sure what to say or do as Travis left the hanger.

"... Am I still your prime suspect?" Riddhe asked.

"Yes."

+++

'C'mon! Fit, damn it!" Standing in the living room of his and Marida's house, Banagher grunted as he struggled to get his belt to reach across his stomach. Marida watched him with her chunky arms corseted under her impressive bosom. Banagher's efforts were met with failure no matter how hard he sucked in his stomach, he had to give up, releasing a breath of air as his gut came flopping out so fast it knocked his belt away.

"It was a good effort. " Marida comforted.

"Doesn't change that I'm a blob who isn't getting the job." Banagher sighed, shamefully looking down at his stomach and rested a hand on it.

"You're going to get job."

"Why do you think so?"

"Would you turn me down?"

"Of course not."

"Then you have your answer." With that, Marida walked out out of the house, Banagher following suit. It was a short walk to the restaurant, Banagher took a moment to examine it's outside appearance as he and Marida walked in. It wan as oddly high-class looking place, completely out of place in Palau. Even the name itself, Bistro Gleissner, was adorned on the top of the doors in gold letters. Banagher figured the owner of this place must've been saving up for years to afford it.

Upon entering, they saw that there were currently two other people in the restaurant, a brunette and a blonde, sitting side by side at a table filled with empty dishes. Both were as overweight as Marida. Banagher and Marida could've swore that they saw the brunette remove his hand from the soft surface of the blonde's belly as soon as they metered.

"Oh, Marida."

"Are we interrupting something you and Chloe are doing?"

"We just got eating." The brunette said as he got up and wobbled over to Marida, his tummy jiggling. "So how is being a big sister going so far?"

"Big sister?" Marida and Banagher simultaneously repeated.

"Well, that is what you are."

"I'm his guardian."

"You're his guardian that's a few years older then him, isn't that what a big sister is?"

"I guess that makes sense to me." Banagher said. "Even if it does feel weird to call you that."

"Your name's Banagher, right? I'm Vincent."

"Yeah, Marida told you about me?" Banagher took a brief moment to take in Vincent's obese form. "Never trust a skinny chef, huh?" He thought.

Vincent had a very big belly that was straining the button on his top and pants almost to the point of straining, and hung down far enough to obscure his crotch. His chest was a pair of flabby moobs that rested on his tummy and jiggled with it, Chloe found his man boobs to be an amusing sight and liked playing with them and cupping them in her hands. His ass was huge and would the chars of his bistro weren't able to contain it. His legs were chunky enough that they rubbed together when he sat down, and his arms were a bit thick, but not with muscles, with fat. As such, the brunette was too out-of-shape to use hand to hand combat, instead he would have to use his weight as a weapon. His face was round, with full cheeks and a double chin. Chloe loved to pinch his chubby cheeks.

Chloe loved playing with not only Vincent's massive stomach, but her own as well. Her belly was divided into two rolls and was very soft. The sphere was was flanked with deep side rolls and plentiful love handles. Her boobs were plump, nearly the size of honeydews. They jutted out from her chest nearly as much as her gut did from her middle. Her ass was made up of two huge orbs that had caused some of the blonde's old pants to rip, once in front of Vincent when she reached down to garb his spatula for him. Her legs legs so meaty and wide they were constantly rubbing together with absolutely no separation. Her chunky legs wobbled with every step. Her arms had absolutely no tone to them at all, being so flabby they were worthy of being called bingo wings. Chloe had an adorably round face with pretty much no angles to it, complete with a big double chin.

Compared to Marida, Chloe had the bigger chest and ass, but Marida's belly was bigger.

"She has, and that you're here for a job." Vincent said. "She didn't mention what specific job you want though."

"We never talked about that." Marida clarified.

"So what are your skills?"

Banagher took a moment to think. The only possible jobs he could think of for a bistro were that of a cook, cleaner, or waiter. Banagher knew cooking was out of the question, having never cooked a meal in his entire life. The closest to cooking he had ever done was microwaving a few meals. Cleaning wasn't an option either, Banagher thought back on how his room back at the school dorm was a bit of a mess. that left only one option.

"Uh, I don't really have any that would be useful at a bistro, but I can be a waiter." Banagher said in a voice that made it clear he was a bit embarrassed to begin his job interview by syaing he has no skills that would be of use at a bistro.

"I could use a waiter here. Though you won't get a uniform, I can't afford to get them. Sorry."

Banagher looked down at his stomach and dejectedly rubbed it. "Guess I'll have to put up with it."

"You'll get used to it." Marida said.

"Now about the payment and working hours. I can pay you ten dollars an hour, I know it's not a lot but it's the best I can afford." Vincent said.

"If you work seven hours a day, you'll make the money you need in three days." Banagher's big sister pointed out.

"That sounds good, I'll take it." Banagher said.

"Glad to hear that." Before Vincent could clarify when Banagher would start working, Banagher and Marida's stomachs growled loudly, causing their respective owners to chuckle nervously. "That's right, you said you wanted to have dinner while you were here. I'll start cooking right now, what would you like?"

+++

All four of them stuffed themselves full of Vincent's cooking, even Chloe despite having just finished a meal before Banagher and Marida arrived. Three of the bellies were exposed, Banagher's like always, Chloe's, and Marida's. Marida and Chloe had to undo their pants, in the redhead's case she also had to undo her sash and unzip her top, in order to give their tummies the space they desperately needed. As tight as his shirt was, Vincent didn't undo his buttons, which were tight even before he overate, as he wanted to leave a good impression on his new employee. The four leaned back in their chairs, hands on their bloated stomachs, sighs and belches of satisfaction regularly escaping their lips.

"UUUURRRP! Whew, man, I ate like you, Marida!" Banagher cheerfully said, a satisfied look on his face as he rubbed his belly, an arm thrown over the back of his chair.

Marida chuckled, a slight blush to her cheeks, both embarrassed and flattered to hear that. "You certainly did."

"C-Chloe!" Banagher and Marida looked towards Vincent to see what Chloe was doing, which was undoing all the buttons on his shirt, leaving his gut and moobs completely exposed to the world. She also undid his pants button and zipper.

He started rubbing Chloe's belly, the two of them simultaneously let out a loud belch of pleasure. Seeing two overweight lovebirds with stuffed bellies belch loudly as they gave each loving belly rubs reminded Banagher of the moments he spent doing the same with Audrey. The moments he had been deprived of, and would continue to be deprived of for a while. Looking away from Vincent and Chloe for a moment, Marida noticed Banagher was frowning as he stared at them.

"What's wrong?" She asked him.

"It's nothing." He knew very well it was nothing, but talking about it felt like it would just make the pain even worse. Plus talking about it in front two people he barley knew would be embarrassing.

Marida didn't know what Banagher was sad about, but she knew it had something to do with the mutual belly rubs between Vincent and Chloe. In hopes of getting his mind off them, the redhead reached over and started rubbing Banagher's swollen belly.

"Thanks." Banagher forced a smile and rubbed Marida's belly. Aside from the belches and moans, he was awkwardly silent. To rectify this, Marida asked Banagher a question that had been on her mind for a while but she kept forgetting to ask him. As soon as she got done burping into her fist, that is.

"UUUURRP! Excuse me. Why do you bother putting your belt on each day if it can't fit?" It was such a small detail, but the way Banagher would go out of his way every day to wear something completely useless was bugging the crap out of her. Not only was it completely illogical, but it made Banagher look even fatter, which she knew was the last thing his fragile self-esteem needed.

"Huh? Oh! This thing." Banagher reached down and grabbed one half of his belt that was uselessly hanging down. "I -UUUUUURP- keep it on in case I can ever get it to fit."

"But you can't."

"Well, maybe I'll get lucky."

"That's not how belts work. UUURAAAP! Excuse me."

"UUUUUURAP! There's a chance I'll figure out some -URRRP- way to make it fit. There's no harm in not giving up, right?"

It took a few moments for Marida to understand exactly what Banagher's logic was, but when she did she gave a small smile, and playfully shook her head. She pat her little brother on the head and said, "You're a goofball." Marida patted his belly a few times, and Banagher belched in response with a grin on his round face.

"That was an excellent belch." Marida said as she gave his packed full belly a few more pats in a congratulatory manner, eliciting another burp out of Banagher's mouth.

After a while of the four lazing around as they belched, chatted, gave soothing belly rubs, and were really glad that no customers came in, Banagher discussed with Vincent what his working hours would be. With Marida's advice, they decided on seven hours a day, from 12 PM to 7PM, starting tomorrow.

"I'll be waking -URAP- you up at 10 AM. Excuse me." Marida said, still rubbing Banagher's tummy as he rubbed hers.

"Can't you -URP- wake me -URRRRP- up at 11 instead?"

"No, you need time to fully wake up, shower, get dressed, eat breakfast, and walk. You should be waking up at 10 AM anyways."

"10 AM is way -UUUUURP- too early." Chloe interjected. "I'm glad I don't have to -UUUURP- wake up at the time."

"Aren't you an employee too?" Banagher asked.

"No, you're Vin -UUURAAP- cent's first employee."

Banagher looked around the bistro. "I thought it was weird we were the only ones in here."

"No one is really interested in working for ten dollars an hour. Even Neo-Ze- URRRRRAP- on pays better." Vincent said. "Can you move you to the side?" He asked Chloe, who moved her hand to the side of his tummy. "UUUUURRRP! Ahh, thanks." The overweight brunette then resumed talking to the other overweight brunette. "It's probably a good thing, I can't afford to hire many more then you. I can handle cooking and cleaning anyw-"

Chloe slapped Vincent's tummy, making him wince as his flab jiggle violently, the impact forcing a loud burp out of him. "No you can't! I keep telling -URRRRRRP- you you're working too hard!" Chloe scolded.

"Does this usually happen?" Banagher whispered to Marida as Chloe continued scolding her lover, who futilely tired to convince her he wasn't pushing himself.

"It's complicated." She whispered back.

"That doesn't answer my question."

"You wouldn't understand if I told you."

Banagher gave her a quizzical look, it wasn't like Marida to keep secrets. He wasn't one to pry, he would respect their wishes if they wanted this to remain private, Banagher wouldn't have even asked them specifically about whatever their situation was. But what made him worried was that that wasn't Marida's reason for not telling him, it was because she felt he wasn't ready to hear it.

Marida cleared her throat loudly to get the couple's attention. "Thanks again for the meal, but I think it's about time we leave. Here's the payment." Marida pulled out her wallet and placed the payment on the table.

"Thank you, if you want I could apply an employee discount for Banagher's half."

Marida started to slowly heave herself out of her chair. "That's not -huff- necessary." She managed to stand up after some difficulty and took a moment to catch her breath. She noticed it wans't quite as hard to stand up this time as it usually was, she hoped it was a sign her exercise with Banagher was paying off.

Banagher tried to get up as well but found that his stomach made him too heavy and had to plop back down. He panted as he belly moved in and out with every breath. He burped and tried again, meeting failure once again.

"Need some help?" Marida already knew the answer.

Banagher's cheeks were red, and not because of exhaustion. 'Yeah, thanks." He reached his hand out and Marida grabbed it. It took quite a bit of grunting but Marida was able to get Banagher on his feet.

"Man, that food was gooood. UUUURRRRP!" The brunette said with a grin, patting his belly in satisfaction right before he bumped bellies with a confused Marida, waves of blubber jiggling from the collision as the two of them burped in unison from it, only Marida bothered to apologize.

"What was that?" The redhead asked.

Banagher's grin got big. "It's a belly bump. A little thing me and Audrey do after we stuff ourselves silly." He gave his stomach a hearty slap for emphasis.

"That looks like fun." Chloe remarked with interest and then immediately bumped her stuffed belly into Vincent's. Just like their two overfed friends, it made them unleash a massive belch in perfect sync as their tummies jiggle and wobbled like mad.

The cool night breeze hit the bellies of Banagher and Marida, the two shivering as they wobbled home. "Oof, that's one thing that sucks -UUUUURP- about being fat: having your -URRRRAAP- stomach hang out on a cool night."

Marida burped and apologized for it. "Agreed." The two were rubbing their swollen stomachs to both ease the aches inside, and also to warm up a little. "How are you settling in so far?"

"I'm..." Banagher paused to belch. "I'm liking it here. But..."

Marida already had a good feeling of what he was about to say.

"You know, I-I miss everyone and I'm worried about them."

Marida avoided eye contact out of shame. "I see." She wished she had more to say but she couldn't find the words. Banagher couldn't find his either, leaving the wind as the only thing they heard.

The brunette cleared his throat. "I'm not mad at you."

Marida could now bring herself to look him in the eyes, but finding more then two words to express her gratitude was more difficult. "Thank you."

"You're welcome. So, um..." Banagher struggled to find a subject to lighten the mood. "Is walking with my stomach exposed on a chilly night another thing about being fat I'll have to get used to?"

As the overfed pair wobbled home, and gave each other belly rubs when they arrived, Audrey had just gotten dressed in her pajamas. During her talk with Shin, he informed her that they would infiltrating Palau tomorrow via a shuttle a spy ECOAS had in Neo-Zeon would supply them with and pilot for them. The plan they had agreed on was that after arriving, Audrey would go to Marida's house (the spy having informed them that was where Banagher was at), which she was familiar with enough that she wouldn't need directions to, and assuming Banagher wasn't there alone, she would leave a letter addressed to Banagher, the envelope saying it was from one Audrey Burne. If Banagher had not told Marida about the blonde's new name, then she would see nothing wrong with the letter and pass it to Banagher without a second thought. If she was aware of the princess' new name, then that's also okay, as Marida respected and cared for Audrey too much to intrude upon her privacy.

The letter would inform Banagher of a place to meet the princess at tomorrow. Once he arrived at said meeting place, Audrey would pass along a map showing him what route to take in the planned rescue operation that would occur in two days from then. Then came the last and hardest part of the plan: Audrey would leave Banagher and then return to the Nahel Argama to await his safe return in two days.

As she would need all the energy she could get, the strawberry blonde was going to bed early. She was considering leaving her pajama top unbuttoned as the button were very tight on her humongous belly, but she decided she should herself for going a whole day without choosing to stuff herself full of food. And seeing those buttons not be defeated by her stomach as her day came to a close felt VERY rewarding. With a pleased look on her chubby face, she proudly pat her round belly, not even minding how it jiggled so much from every pat, and laid down in bed. She exchanged good nights with Haro and went to sleep. Well, it took a while because her body was used to staying up much longer then 11 PM, but she did eventually fall asleep, thoughts of what her reunion with Banagher would be like filling her mind.

"It's time to wake up."

Banagher yawned and stretched as he got into a sitting up position. He then lazily gave his belly a scratch as he noticed Marida was holding a tray with a plate of pancakes on it next to some orange juice. "Breakfast in bed?"

"Enjoy." Marida placed the tray on her little brother's belly.

"Thanks!" Banagher happily gobbled up his breakfast as it laid atop his tummy, Marida was very pleased to see him enjoying this. Once he finished his plate, the brunette leaned back in the bed with a content look on his round face and let out a satisfied burp as he happily rubbed his belly in circles. He then got of bed and went to the bathroom to take a shower and brush his teeth, showering while having a big belly was still a feeling he wasn't quite used to yet.

When the Gundam pilot walked into the living room, he saw that what he just ate was only part 1 of his breakfast, part 2 was waiting for him on the coffee table. There was two plates, one had two stacks of pancakes waiting for him with plenty of syrup, and the other had eight strips of bacon. It was topped off with another carton of orange juice. Banagher almost felt his stomach growl in hunger at the sight of it. "Is that for me?" Normally he would've assumed it was Marida's but she was currently eating her own breakfast at the kitchen table, and apparently writing a report of some kind.

"It is. Dig in."

"I know I already said this, but thanks!" He sat down in the couch and Just as he did with part 1, Banagher eagerly ate up part 2 of his breakfast. Once finished, he leaned back with pleased look on his face as licked some foodstuffs off his lips, pat his now-swollen belly, and let out a content burp. "That hit the spot."

"Glad to hear it." Marida took a bite out of a pancake.

Soon Banagher left for work, Marida guiding him to the bistro as he hadn't had the directions memorized yet. At the same time, Audrey woke up. As much as she wanted to stay in bed a little longer, she forced hersel fout of bed as soon as she was awake, today was far too important to even slightly risk sleeping in. She yawned as she stretched.

Haro woke up at the same time. "Good morning, Audrey!" The mechanical ball cheerfully said.

"Good morning, Haro." Audrey said and then burped into her fist. "Excuse me."

"Can I come with you to see Banagher?"

"I'm sorry but you can't. It's too dangerous."

"Oh..." Haro made Audrey realize exactly what the term "puppy dog eyes" refers to.

She tried to resist Haro's charm, but her willpower only lasted for three seconds. "Okay, you can!"

"Yay! Yay!" The green ball excitedly bounced up and down.

After showering and getting dressed, Audrey left her room and walked to the cafeteria. She sat down at the usual table and ate her breakfast with Micott and Takuya.

"So today's the big day." Takuya said.

"Not quite. I'm only informing Banagher of the plan to rescue him." The princess clarified.

"it's still a pretty important day. Look at you, you're so excited you're shaking." Micott grinned.

"I am?" Audrey looked down to see that yes, she was shaking a little, the little jiggles it caused only served to place emphasis on that. "I'm not shaking that much..." The blonde blushed.

"That's just because you're not there yet." Takuya teased. "Speaking of, you sure you can't bring Banagher home first and come back for the Unicorn later?"

"I wish I could, but it would be next to impossible to drag the Unicorn around in the middle of a battlefield. I'm sorry, I understand if you think that seems cruel of me."

"We don't." Takuya said.

"I just want all this to end." Micott said.

The trio soon finished their breakfast.

"URRAP! Are you leaving for Pallet or whatever now?" Micott asked.

"The name is Palau, and not yet. I want to explain exactly what the plan is to Riddhe and Micott. Can you tell them to meet me in my room? I have to check in with Shin first."

"Sure, how long are you going to be doing that?" Takuya asked as he rubbed his pleasantly full belly.

"Ten minutes at most, thank you for doing this. Actually, if you don't mind, can you wait with them in my room? I want to say goodbye before I leave."

"No problem, I want to say goodbye too."

"Thank you both."

Audrey got up and left, bringing Haro with her. As soon as they were sure she was too far away to hear them, Takuya and Micott got up and left the cafeteria.

"Can't believe we have to move all that food in just ten minutes." The brunette complained.

"Riddhe and Mihiro will be helping us, we can make it in time if we hurry."

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"Apologies for not getting you a normal suit in a bigger size, I forgot to mention your weight to our informant." Shin handed Audrey a Neo-Zeon normal suit for the trip as they stood together in the hanger.

"It's alright." Audrey held up her normal suit in front of her and looked over it, it looked like it would've fit her fine at her previous weight but it was way too small for over 200 pounds of Audrey Burne. "It'll be a tight fit but I'll make due."

"He also supplied with Neo-Zeon uniforms should we need them." Shin pulled Audrey's out of the large box that contained equipment for the mission. "Though it runs into the same problem as your normal suit."

"I won't be wearing that. I'd rather not explode out of my clothes in public."

"Don't take this the wrong way, but isn't that your current state?"

"Yes but at least the explosion won't be in public... This time, at least." The princess' expression contained some memory-induced embarrassment. "We probably won't be needing those anyways, there's nothing outwardly suspicious about what we'll be doing. Even if someone does suspect us, I'll just tell them my name. I may have put on over fifty pounds but my face is still recognizable. Full Frontal has most likely not told anyone about my leaving Neo-Zeon to ensure I don't get any supporters. So I still have all my authority."

"Good point." Shin put the uniform back in the box and pulled out a case no bigger then the ones used to carry glasses. He then opened that case to reveal two devices small enough one could fit both of them in their grasp. "This is a two-way radio earpiece, it'll be our most useful tool. Update me on your progress periodically, I won't be that far from you."

Her face didn't show it, but a part of Audrey was excited to see that she would be wearing those. She remembered that Marida would wear them when she took on mission that involved going into civilian areas. In fact, she was probably wearing one when she chased after her in Industrial 7. To wear those, to Audrey it was like sorta kinda almost being as cool and tough as Marida.

Shin closed the case and put it back in the box, which he then closed. "That's everything."

"I see. Sorry if this seems rude, but I need to go back to my room now, my friends are waiting there for me to say goodbye."

"About that, do you mind if I come with you?"

"Of course not."

When Audrey entered her room with Shin in tow, she saw Riddhe, Micott, Mihiro, and Takuya all waiting for her in it. That was expected but what she didn't expect was that her coffee table would absolutely overflowing with food like pizza, cake, cookies, hamburgers, and hot dogs, to name a few. There was also some smaller piles near the coffee table itself.

"Surprise!" Haro exclaimed as he flapped his ears in excitement.

"What is this?" The blonde was too confused to even try to guess what was going on.

"It's a little surprise party for you." Takuya had a smile on his soft face.

"For what?"

"We noticed you've been feeling pretty down lately." Riddhe answered, a smile adorning his own face. Audrey thought on how that was a massive understatement, something all of them likely knew, but she didn't interrupt him. "So we decided to throw you a party to show you that we care about you."

Once the full meaning of those words sunk in, a huge smile formed on the Zabi's face. "Really?" was all she could say, her voice nearly squeaking.

"We love you, Audrey! Love! Love!" Haro said as he flapped his ears.

"Yup! And all that food on the table is yours." Micott pointed towards it.

"A-All of it?" Audrey's stomach immediately growled in hunger, asking for it's owner to please eat it all. The princess was almost watering at the mouth. "But what are you all going to eat?"

"Don't worry about it, you just eat all you want." Shin said.

"Eat up! Eat up! Get a big, big stuffed belly!" Haro chanted.

"Don't worry I will." Audrey gave Haro a loving pat. "So this is why you wanted to come with me, Shin."

"You should've seen how excited he was when we told him about the party." Mihiro said.

"Thank you all so much. I... I really don't know what to say." Audrey's eyes had a light to them no one had seen in them since Banagher was kidnapped. "But are you sure you won't mind not eating?"

"No one said we're not eating anything, everything not on the table is for us." Takuya said as he rubbed his stomach.

"It's not a party unless everyone is pigging out." Micott said with a grin.

"I still don't get how you all didn't get fat sooner." Mihiro said, shrugging her shoulders.

"Don't tell me you're not going to pig out." Riddhe asked.

"Of course I am!" Mihiro gave her pudgy tummy a proud slap, making the soft expanse jiggle. "Just because I'm the only one here actually trying to lose weight doesn't mean I know when when to have a good time."

Mihiro's tummy was a soft ball of flab that would form a nice muffin top. It would fill up her lap whenever she sat down, and gave her something to mess with when her role as the communications officer got boring. If there was one thing Mihiro liked about her weight gain, it was how it made her boobs bigger. They were much more jiggly now, and strained her bra to it's limits. Her ass was massive, second only to Micott's in size, and completely filled up any normal-sized char sh e sat down in it, including the communications officer's chair, which was a problem. Her huge butt was complimented by chubby legs that had zero separation between them. Her face was more cherubic with it's softer cheeks and small double chin.

Audrey and Riddhe weren't the only ones there suffering from wardrobe difficulties because of gaining weight. Takuya and Micott's respective shirts had risen up their stomachs so much their deep navels were exposed. Unlike Banagher and Riddhe, they could keep their pants closed but buttoning them had become an annoying chore at this point due to how hard it was to do so. Takuya also had to deal with the other annoyance of clipping his belt too, though that was still more then Banagher could say. Micott's ass was so huge her short shorts had ridden up a bit and left some of her ass cheeks exposed. Mihiro's uniform was visibly tight on her, especially her pants and belt, her pants in particular looking like they would rip if she bent down to grab something.

The group begun happily pigging out, except for Haro, who of course couldn't eat, and Shin, who ate a regular amount of snacks as he the only one among them who wasn't fat. Audrey was smiling the whole time as she quickly shoveled more and more food into her greedy mouth, Haro sitting right by her side the whole time. Food wasn't the only thing filling up her stomach, she was also chugging obscene amounts of soda, the carbonation increasing the quantity and quality of her belches. Soon her tremendous belly popped off the buttons on her coat and pants, allowing her gut to bulge out even further and force her zipper all the way down, showing the world her pink underwear. What was Audrey's reaction? She just slapped her big belly with pride and burped with equal amounts of pride, seeing that as an accomplishment, though she did ask Mihiro if she could please sew them back on after the party, which she agreed to do.

Two hours later, the party was finally finished and all he food was eaten. All party members except for Shin sporting greatly bloated stomachs they rubbed as they moaned and belched in satisfaction. Audrey's was the biggest there, which was impressive considering Riddhe's was normally bigger then hers when they weren't bloated.

A big, goofy smile on her face, Audrey happily rubbed her big belly in circles and unleashed a magnificent belch. "UUUUURRRAP! That was so -UUUUUUURP- good. Thank you all -URAAAAAP- again for doing -UURRRRRRP- this."

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Licking her lips, Audrey rubbed her big belly in circles around the middle of it and unleashed a loud, unladylike belch as she wobbled out of her room, still sporting a big, dorky smile. Her tummy jiggled with every step, as did her boobs and behind.

"Audrey, we forgot to sew your buttons back on!" Mihiro called out.

After rectifying that mistake, it was time for Audrey and Shin to leave. They boarded the shuttle, the pilot asked them what took them so long and Shin simply told him there was a meeting they had to attend, knowing that Audrey wouldn't want anyone other then a good friend to know about her pigging out.

Audrey couldn't help but sigh in comfort as she sat down in her seat, walking while being this fat and bloated was very tiring, holding Haro. Shin sat down next to her, both as a bodyguard and a family member. As the shuttle started taking off almost immediately, all the preparations having be done while Audrey and Shin were partying, Audrey had to keep looking through the window at the slowly shrinking sight of the Nahel Argama. "It's only been little more then a week, yet it feels like the Nahel Argama has been my home for years."

The Zabi soon grew drowsy from the feeling of having a bloated belly. No matter how sleepy she felt, she tried desperately to force herself to stay awake, not willing to supposedly "embarrass" herself by taking a nap in front of Shin. She even tried to make her yawns quiet. Of course, there was nothing she could do about the tired look in her green eyes.

"You can take a nap if you want." Shin suggested.

Audrey burped, she was too tired to even remember that she was trying to keep the belching to a minimum so the pilot wouldn't hear. "Huh? I'm-I'm not tired." She said as she struggled to keep her head held up.

"Don't worry, I'm not judging."

"... Thank you, Shin." Audrey rested her head and very soon fell asleep. She might've not been so easily convinced had she known that not would she be snoring, but also talking in her sleep. Though even if she did, she still would've required very little convincing. "Oh Banagher... give me that... big... jiggly... belly..."

+++

Audrey's eyes slowly opened. She looked around, first at her stomach which had digested the vast majority of her feast, which she was very glad for as she did not want to walk around for hours while being that stuffed, and then at the seat to her left that Shin was sitting, only he had evidently left it while she was asleep. Letting out a yawn, she assumed Shin was discussing thing with the pilot or using the bathroom. The Zabi looked around, thinking on how shuttles always looked so depressing when you were the only one there, but her eyes nearly bulged out when she looked at the window and saw that the shuttle was at a port in Palau. Audrey jumped out of her seat as fast her chunky body would allow and bolted out, her body jiggling violently.

Upon exiting the ship, the blonde saw that Shin wat right outside it, seemingly waiting for her.

"Is something wrong? You look worried." He asked.

Audrey was clearly out of breath, her belly moving in and out with every pant.. "I -Pant- I just realized I slept in. -Pant-."

"Why is that such an emergency?"

"I didn't -pant- I didn't want to be late. Did I delay the operation?"

"Well, yes, but we still have hours to do this. No need to be so worried."

Audrey sighed in relief. "How long was I asleep?"

"A few hours. I wasn't waiting long for you if that's what you're asking."

"I'm glad I didn't. Now let's commence the operation."

"Before we do that, you might want to button your clothes, I think they'll fit now."

Audrey blushed, she thought she had forgotten something. "Oh, r-right!" She hastily zipped her pants back up and buttoned them before she buttoned her coat. This didn't change that she was still too large for her coat to hide that her blouse had rode up on her belly to right above her very deep navel, but in Audrey's words "It's better then nothing".

as Audrey and Shin "commenced the operation" as the princess put it, Banagher was busy doing something much less exciting: Sitting in a chair and fighting the urge to fall asleep. The poor guy was bored out of his mind, not one single customer had come. He let out a yawn, wondering if it would be preferable for random people to be staring at his free gut again. At least then SOMETHING was happening.

"Are most days this slow?" Banagher asked.

"Well, they're not usually this slow, but yeah." Vincent said. Normally he would be in the kitchen now, but since things were so slow today, he figured there was no harm done waiting it out at a table.

Banagher looked at the clock again, this time it read that it was 5:04. That meant that he had spent five straight hours of doing nothing. Thankfully it was time for that to end, as the bistro's bell rang, signaling to Vincent and Banagher that a customer had entered. They looked towards the door to see a young women entering, around Banagher's age. Banagher found her cute, which normally would be a good thing, but when he was obese and unable to hide his massive stomach, this was a worst-case scenario.

"Um... Welcome! W-What would you like?" Banagher stuttered, hoping the girl would just say she was asking for directions and then leave.

"Well, I'll need to take a look at your menu first." She chuckled as she sat down at a table, Banagher eternally grateful she didn't sit down at his.

"Oh, uh, r-right."

"I'll wait for the order in the kitchen." Vincent got up and waddled back to it.

Banagher began strategizing what the least embarrassing way to take the girl's order would be. "Okay, how should I do this? When she gives the order, I'll just stay here and write it down, I won't get u[. But hwat about when I need to give the order to Vincent? Should I just shout? No, I'm not going to half-ass my job. I'll just have to grin and bear it."

"I'm ready to make my order." The girl said.

"So what will it be?" Banagher got his pen and notepad ready.

"Aren't you going to come over here?"

"No-No need! I'll just write it here."

"Well, okay. I'll have caveira."

Banagher wrote that down. "Coming right up." He nervously got up and did a fast walk to the kitchen, blushing for he knew that the girl saw his ass jiggle. "Here's the order." He said as he handed Vincent the order.

"Thanks." He said and soon started cooking the order. What didn't happen soon though was Banagher leaving. "You don't have to stay here, I won't be done with this for a few minutes."

"I know. I just... don't want her to see my belly."

"She's going to see it when you deliver it."

"I know. But it's better if she only sees it once."

"You haven't been fat for long, have you?"

Banagher sighed and placed a hand on his soft tummy. "No, I'm still getting used to it."

As Banagher hid in the kitchen, Audrey was approaching Marida's house, holding Haro with her the whole time. "It's only been a week since I left Palau, yet it feels like years." Looking around, she saw that everything looked the same, she felt it was foolish of her, but Palau still felt somewhat unfamiliar. "Palau feels like it's changed, but it hasn't. So why can't I shake this feeling? Like I don't belong here anymore. I do belong here, as much as I hate it, I'm still a Zabi. The only thing about me that's changed is that I've got this huge gut now." Audrey lifted up her rotund middle and then let it drop, watching how much it jiggled. "... I miss Banagher."

Walking through Palau was pretty much the same experience for Audrey as it was Banagher, though it was even more embarrassing for Audrey as the people who saw her knew who she was. Every time a blush manifested on her face, all Audrey could do was hope that the stranger who saw her didn't recognize her.

She soon came across what she recognized as Marida's house. As soon as she did she placed herself against the wall of an alleyway, which did nothing to hide her huge middle but Audrey thought she was being both stealthy and cool as hell. She called Shin. "I've located the mission objective."

"It's a mailbox, Audrey, you don't need to take it so seriously." Shin was at a nearby street behind Audrey, alternating between keeping his eyes peeled for any sign of Marida, and keeping an eye on Audrey.

The Zabi blushed. "I-I-I'm just using the proper terminology, for your intel! At any rate, I'm making the delivery." Audrey moved out from her hiding spot after checking to make sure no one was nearby. Crouching, Audrey looked both ways before slowly crossing the street. Upon crossing it, she then started crawling along the ground, which her tummy made awkwardly done as it squished against the ground and wobbled. Upon reaching the mailbox, Audrey removed the envelope from her pocket, placed it in the mailbox, and then raised the flag to be polite. With her objective complete, Audrey then left the street the same way she came to it, unaware that all her stealth was pointless as Marida was out buying groceries.

"Shin, I've completed the objective."

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"Here's your meal." Banagher quickly placed the plate of caveira on the girl's table and then awkwardly walked back to his table as fast as he could.

"Thanks." The girl said, watching the brunette's butt bob as he walked. "Hey, are you new here? I didn't see you the last time I was here."

"Oh God, she's talking to me." Banagher thought. "Yeah, this is my first day here." He answered. "Actually, I just moved here a few days ago."

"Why? This place isn't exactly high class."

"It's, well, it's complicated."

"I see. So did you get a job here because you like the food?"

Banagher blushed. "I-I didn't get fat off the food here."

"Huh? I wasn't saying you did."

'Oh, uh, sorry."

The girl giggled and told Banagher it was okay.

The young women finished her meal in half an hour, it was clear from the speed she ate that she really enjoyed it. "Waiter, I'm finished. I'm ready to pay now." She said as she got her wallet out.

"I'll be right there. Just, uh..." Banagher looked down at his stomach as he tried to find the courage to show it to her. He couldn't tell why, but getting to know the customer a little made him even more shy about his weight. "Just give me a sec."

Picking up on the brunette's embarrassment, the customer offered the obvious solution. "How about I come give it to you instead?"

"That'd be great, thanks." Banagher then got as close to his table as he possibly could so he could hide his gut under it.

The girl walked over and placed the payment on the table. "And here's your tip." She said as she placed ten extra dollars down.

"Thanks, this will really help me out." He said, hoping his man boobs weren't noticeable.

"You're welcome. I'll see you around." The customer walked to the front door, but right before she left, she stopped and looked back at Banagher. "By the way, your tummy is really cute."

"What?!" The pilot's blush returned in full force.

With that, the customer left the bistro, leaving Banagher alone with those words. "She's just messing with me, right?"

That was the bistro's only customer for the day, which meant that Banagher only had to sit there and wait for a little over an hour for Vincent to come out of the kitchen, close up shot, and pay Banagher. At Marida's request, he was paying him cash at the end of every work day.

"here you, seventy dollars." He said as he handed Banagher the money.

"Thanks... Ah, great. I just realized I don't have my wallet."

"Did you leave it at home?"

"If you count the Nahel Argama as my home, which I kinda do these days."

"Marida could hold onto the money for you."

"I should still see about getting a wallet soon." He placed the money in his pocket for now. "Hey, that girl is a regular here, right?"

'Yeah, she comes here every now and then. She's my biggest customer, which isn't saying a lot."

"Does she ever talk about your weight?"

The chef gave a quizzical look. "No, why?"

"Never mind."

The bell rang, signaling again that someone had entered the bistro. "How was work, Banagher?" The person who entered was Marida, jiggling with every step like always.

'It was fine." He answered.

"Hi, Marida. I'm closed now but if you don't mind paying, I could cook dinner."

"Thank you, but we're actually going to be eating at Gilboa's home."

"Who's that?" Banagher asked.

"Another member of the Garencieres' crew. He wants to meet you so he invited us both to dinner."

Leaving the bistro with him, Marida guided Banagher to Gilboa's house. It was a bit of a long walk, and the chill of the night was starting to set in, neither were a good thing for two out-of-shape pilots that had their belly fat exposed to the elements.

"A letter came for you while you were at work." Marida confirmed.

Banagher shivered a little. "How? I've only been for a few days."

"I was confused too. It says it's from someone called Audrey Burne."

Banagher's light brown eyes widened, the shock of hearing that news stole all his focus and directed it towards it and nothing else. It was impossible for him to think of anything else, he had even forgotten he was cold. "Audrey's here's on Palau?" His mind could only create questions like that and muse on the possible answers. "Was she captured? Did she come to rescue me? Is it a trap? If Zeon got her, then I need to sneak out and rescue her somehow. But how would I even get away without Marida noticing? Maybe I could run away while on the way to work. No, that won't work. Marida will show up to pick me up and Vincent will tell her he hasn't seen me. maybe I could really stuff Marida to the brim, like so full she falls into a food coma. That might work, but does she even have that much food? And how would I get her to eat it all?"

"You said that's the name the princess goes by now." Marida unknowingly brought Banagher back to reality.

"Yeah. What did it say?"

"I didn't read it."

"Aren't you supposed to make sure I don't escape?"

"Yes, but I still respect both your rights to privacy."

Banagher showed a heartwarming grin that Marida unfortunately didn't see. "Thanks. You're a great big sis."

Banagher couldn't see it but Marida was blushing. "Please don't call me that in front of Gilboa and his family."

"Sure thing, sis." Banagher felt a little proud about that one. "You know, you should've waited until we got home to tell me about the letter, because now I can kinda want to rush though dinner so I can read it."

Marida spent three seconds trying to think of a counterargument. "That's actually a good point."

+++

"So you're Banagher." With a smile, Gilboa greeted the brunette once he and Marida had entered his house.

Just from the way Gilboa said that one sentence, the overweight brunette immediately knew he was a completely different person from Full Frontal. Kind and jovial, Gilboa had in less then ten seconds done a better job calming Banagher's fears about Neo-Zeon then Full Frontal had in over ten minutes. "Yeah, I'm probably fatter then you expected." He joked.

"Nah, don't get mad at her, but Marida told me all about it."

"I told him I finally found an exercising partner." The obese redhead explained.

"I told you to call him your exercise buddy, the poor kid's gonna have trouble thinking of you as his big sis when you're so damn formal about everything."

"If Gilboa's doing it, then does that mean I can call you my big sis while we're here?" Banagher knew what the answer was, but he was having too much fun messing with Marida.

"No."

"Forget what I said, it looks like you're already his big sister. Anyways, dinner's all ready. Take off your shoes and sit down at the table."

Marida and Banagher did so, finding that the other members of the household were already seated at the table. "Oh, you must be Banagher." A women said, Banagher saw that was clearly Gilboa's wife, and judging from the oven mitts she just took off, the cook as well. "I must say, I'm glad to be serving another person with such a healthy appetite." That made Banagher wonder if Gilboa's wife might've been part of the reason Marida had gained so much weight. Then again, most of the binges he saw Marida do were done without her. So who knows?

"I'm trying to lose weight, but I can't hold back when I'm invited to dinner." Banagher said, rubbing his stomach in anticipation. He was unaware that Marida had told Gilboa's wife to make sure she really stuffs him.

"Good attitude." Gilboa said.

Gilboa had three children, all of whom were also sitting at the table. If Banagher to guess the age of the oldest, Tikva, he was no older then 11.

Gilboa's wife placed the dinner on the table, it consisted of sautéed rabbit, soup, bread, and potato salad that was piled up like a hill, Banagher and Marida's servings were much larger then the others. This meal was already amazing for Banagher and he hadn't even eaten anything yet. The food wasn't what made this so important to him, it was that it was a family eating dinner. He had eaten dinner with his mother many times, but that was only with his mother. It was never the image he had seen in media and books. But now, he was eating with that image.

After the family said their thanks to God, Banagher awkwardly joining in on it despite having never done it before, it was time to eat. Banagher pigged out with gusto, it was easily one of his biggest binges ever, able to give Marida a run for her money. It was quite the sight to see him happily shoveling down plate after plate of food, asking for another serving as soon as he finished each one, to see him get another serving so many times as his belly grew bigger and bigger as he kept eating and eating. When he was finally done eating, he was sporting a giant, stuffed belly as he leaned back in his chair and rubbed it, a huge, please smile on his chubby face. Marida was in a similar state.

"UUUUUURRRP! Man, that was -UUUURRRP- good!" Banagher gave his big belly a proud slap for emphasis, the impact making the mass of soft fat jiggle.
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.title: Dinner for Seven

choices: Switch to the Nahel Argama's crew
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Marida tenderly massaged her swollen belly, noting how Banagher's belly was the biggest she had ever seen it, the orb of adipose was almost as large as hers when it wasn't full of food. She burped into her fist and apologized for it before making a comment. "Not TOO good, I hope. Keep eating at that rate, and we'll have to up our game tomorrow."

Banagher's tummy gurgled loudly. "UUURP! UUUUURRAP! URRAAP! Don't act like I'm the only one here with a stuffed belly, Marida." He teased with a grin as he lightly elbowed Marida in her stomach, making the soldier burp.

"I know, I'm joking."

Banagher belted out another loud belch. "Ahh, aren't meals like this the best? This was gre -UUUURRAP- at!"

"It was...very nice, yes."

"I'm happy to see someone enjoy my cooking like Marida does." Gilboa's wife said as she eyed Banagher's impressive stomach.

"He's someone who enjoys good food, alright." Marida commented.

"My gut is proof of that!" Banagher gave it a big slap for emphasis, the giant belly jiggling in a gelatinous fashion. "UUUUURRP! Whew! To think just a week ago I was skinny."

"You were? Huh, you didn't mention that part, Marida." Gilboa said.

"I didn't know if he was okay with others knowing that." Marida clarified.

"I don't mind." Banagher said.

"Hey, are you from the Federation?" The voice of Tikva cut into the conversation, surprising all it's members. He had been mostly quiet this dinner.

"Huh? URRP! Yeah. I was forced to come here. To Palau -UUUURP- I mean, I'm happy to be a guest in your home." Now that Tikva was his main focus, Banagher taking a good look at his face made him realize that the eldest child had been staring at him a lot throughout dinner, he was just too focused on food to notice. There was something chilling about it, it was like being stalked by a lion cub. The cub may be harmless, but the killing intent it displayed wasn't any different that that of a full grown one.

"Oh, you're a prisoner?"

'Tikva, I told you to treat him normally." Tikva's father scolded.

"I'm just asking a question."

"I'm -URAAAAP- something like a prisoner." Were he in the mood to be fully honest about his situation, Banagher would say he felt as chained as any other prisoner would feel. He was usually able to suppress that feeling when he was being treated well, but not always. The sense of freedom he was given was false, an illusion created by Full Frontal to indoctrinate him into Neo-Zeon, something he knew. And he imagined Marida knew that too.

"Well, you're lucky to be our prisoner."

"I know I'm -URRRRRP- lucky that Zeon felt uncharacteristically kind enough to not execute me."

Tikva was momentarily stunned by that, unable to think of a comeback The purpose behind Banagher's verbal strike was twofold, both to serve as a deterrence against a potential argument, and to make it clear to Marida that his stance hadn't changed at all. Unfortunately, deterrence is only so effective against someone who feels they have something to stand for.

"Oh yeah?! Well, I hope you're enjoying all that food mom made for you, because if you were a Federation prisoner, they wouldn't give you anything. You'd be tortured!"

"Tikva, enough!" His mother scolded.

"The Feder -UUURRRP- ation doesn't -URAAAP- do things like that." Banagher knew he shouldn't be mad at a child for saying stupid things, but logic is often unable to stand against emotions. He was tempted to bring up the torture Zeon had done during the One Year War, but he really wasn't in the mood to make this argument anymore heated then it already was. All he wanted to do was just relax, rub his belly, belch some gas out, have actually pleasant conversations, and maybe take a nap.

"Yeah, they do! My dad says so. He was a prisoner on Earth, and the captain rescued him from the camp!"

As much as he tried to force the memory away, Banagher still saw the image of his classmates, his friends, being killed in the crossfire of the Industrial 7 battle, the battle that Zeon caused. "I..." He tried not to, but he glanced at his big sister, something she noticed. "I know people whose friends and family were killed by Zeon."

Except for Marida, who burped loudly, the others at the dinner table showed shocked expressions. The fact that their cause had gotten people killed was a bitter truth they tried to suppress, something that couldn't be done when that truth was raised in front of their faces. Of course, that was only how Tikva and his parents felt. his younger siblings sill couldn't even comprehend the idea of Zeon doing something bad.

"Yeah, well the same goes for us! This is war. Zeon is fighting for the Spacenoids, you're a Spacenoid, so why are you siding with the Federation?"

"Control yourself, Tikva, or you'll make your dad angry." Gilboa might not have been yelling, but it was clear he was already angry.

"No war -UUUURP- is ever -URRRRAAP- right." Banagher couldn't feel any of the food's taste anymore, or enjoy the feeling of a full stomach. All he could feel was sadness. "Even if what you're saying is right, that doesn't mean that Ze -URAAAAP- on dropping a colony and killing millions of people is something that should just be written off." Gilboa grimaced at the mention. "The people Zeon killed, they didn't have a chance to think if the cause they were dying for was right or -URRRP- not. The soldiers who killed them woke up that day knowing what would happen, but their victims didn't. It just wasn't fair, not fair at all. I..." It was impossible for Banagher to talk about killing without reminding himself of the one he had done. "URRRRRP! There was nothing else I could've done. I didn't mean to kill him, but... if Sergei didn't die, then I would've."

Tikva tried to force himself to not cry, to stay angry at Banagher, but his facade was paper-thin. As evident as the anger Banagher felt towards himself.

"I'm a killer. Even so, I'm not a murderer."

There was a pause, no one was able to find the words to say. Instead of words, what broke the silence was the sound of piles of dishes clattering, the result of Marida slamming her meaty hands on the table as she stood up. "Come with me. UUUUURAAAP!"

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
+++

Banagher found himself being led somewhere he didn't recognize. At first he thought Marida was angrily taking him home but the scenery soon turned unfamiliar as he wobbled behind her, their full tummies bobbing and bouncing with every step. That didn't really help with the digestion. Initially the walk was silent with neither chubby pilot saying a thing. The only sounds they heard were the occasional gust of wind, their stomachs bubbling and gurgling, and the belches they released.

"You must hate me." Banagher solemnly said.

"What?!" For the first time in his life, Banagher heard Marida express shock. She immediately stopped moving and turned to face Banagher. "What gave you that idea?"

"For what I said. Aren't you taking me somewhere to punish-" Marida placed a hand on Banagher's soft shoulder, preventing him from finishing that sentence.

"I'm not upset."

"... Then you must be disappointed in me."

"No. What you said there wasn't -URAP- wrong. No war is ever truly -UUUURRP- justified."

"But if you're not mad at me, then where are you taking me? This isn't the way home."

"There's something you need to see." Marida turned around and resumed leading Banagher to their destination.

The town soon disappeared behind them, and a rocky quarry Banagher had never seen appeared in front of them. Marida led him down a tunnel, the lights in it were still functional, but the fact that Marida had to turn them on was proof that they were the only ones there tonight. In fact, Banagher got the impression that they were this place's only recent visitors. He couldn't put it into words, but abandoned places always gave off a certain feel to them.

At the end of the tunnel was the last thing Banagher expected to see: a church, one built into the tunnel itself. "This was built back when Palau was still in the asteroid belt." Marida led to Banagher to the front of a the altar of a cross. It wasn't constructed professionally, being merely a cross placed on a pile of rocks, but the hope it held for the ones who placed it still shone brightly even now. "When you look back at the earliest space pioneers, they -UUURRP-! Excuse me. They were mostly beggars and political prisoners. They sought to settle in space because there was nowhere else for them to live. They saw when the Universal Century began, the prime minister stated that we were bringing an end to the era of God. For the people who lived in the asteroid belt, the sun was as indistinguishable from any distant star."

Hearing talk of starts and hope made Banagher think of Audrey's own words on the subject. "There are two hundred billion stars in the galaxy, and this is only a small part of that seen from here."

"They needed a light to guide them." Marida's eyes were fixated on the cross.

"A -UUUUURP- light?"

"Nothing can live without light. URRRAAP! Excuse me. But the people abandoned in space eventually found a new light to replace God. And the new light that they found was Zeon. It gave them hope where there was despair, so they could overcome the impossible and keep living in this cruel world. It held out the shinning -UUUUURRP-! Excuse me. The shinning promise that we could all become better. You might find it foolish to put your faith in something so intangible, there are those who would say that ideas like this are not essential to life. I think those people must be either very lucky or very deluded." The pilot for Zeon waddled over to a nearby bench and sat down on it, sighing in relief as the bench groaned in pain. "Apologies for all the belching. I'm aware it made my point hard to take seriously." She rubbed her packed-full stomach as it gurgled up a storm.

"It didn't, words like those can't be weakened by anything." The brunette answered as he sat down next to her, he too sighed in relief as the bench once again groaned. He placed a hand on Marida's middle and started rubbing, Marida herself returned the favor, both of them belching as their soft hands soothing circles on the other's massive belly. "Humanity -URRRRRRP- alone possesses a G -UUUURRRP- od."

"Hm?"

"Someone once said that to me. Without burping, of course. He told me about the power to transcend the now, the inner god called possi -UUUUUUURP- bility."

"UUURRAAAP! Pardon me. He must've been a romantic." Banagher was taken aback by Marida’s smiling face, and felt rather happy too. An embarrassed and proud complicated feeling rose up his chest. "A person cannot believe that without having strong faith in humanity and the world. Sounds like a nice person."

Banagher looked at the cross.

"Ensign Sergei," Marida's words made him look back at her. "Don't worry about the lives you take in battle. When you go into battle, you become one with your machine, a combat unit called a pilot. There's no room for re -URP- grets. That said, you are already entangled in the situation and it's best you remember that. As for taking action to help protect princess Mineva, or Audrey, as you call her, I thank you."

Banagher showed her a warm smile, his chubby cheeks making it warm Marida's heart even more. "You're welcome. I don't agree with everything you said, but thank you for saying all that. I really needed it."

"I'm glad I could help you."

The two rubbed each other's stomach in silence as they smiled at each other, though that silence was broken by a creaking sound, and before either of the tubby pilots could figure out what the source was, the poor, ages old bench broke under their heavy weights, sending them to the ground, their entire bodies jiggling violently, which stirred up the gas in their middles. They both belched out loudly at the same time, the expulsion of gas echoed loudly through the church and the rest of the tunnel. Were someone at the entrance of the tunnel as this happened, they would've heard it.

"We really gotta lay off the pizza." Banagher said, he and Marida were both blushing.

"Agreed."

Neither knew what to say from there, but after a few seconds they snickered, which soon turned into bellyful laughter, their fat tummies and chubby cheeks jiggling. it was the first time Banagher had ever seen his big sister laugh any harder then a chuckle, and he was so glad to see it. And Marida was so glad to be laughing this hard.
