1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
The sight of Audrey and Shin walking into the lobby of a hotel could be found humorous by some. The stark contrast of how right next to a fit soldier with toned muscles, a soldier who was capable of winning many battles, both with and without a mobile suit, was an obese teenager who was so incredibly out-of-shape that her gut was constantly left exposed to the elements, with the buttons on her coat and pants rendered tight by her plentiful blubber. Where as Shin walked with a perfect form, Audrey had a bit of a waddle to hers due to how chunky her legs were, her legs and tummy jiggling and jostling with every footfall. She even seemed a bit tired from walking all the way here.

The two walked up to the counter and, after taking a moment to catch her breath, Audrey ordered a room. "How much does a room for one night cost?"

"That'll be one hundred-Oh my God!" The clerk exclaimed as soon as he was able to look past Audrey's new chubby features. "Are-Are you Mineva Lao Zabi?!"

Audrey was pretty clearly caught off guard by the clerk's enthusiasm. "Um, yes."

"Looks like you startled the poor thing." Shin chuckled.

"Shin..." Audrey whined like someone telling their parents they were embarrassing her in front of all her friends.

"I'm so sorry, princess. Please forgive me" The clerk bowed his head in shame, one of Audrey's most hated sights.

"It's alright." She said.

The clerk raised his head. "Thank you. I'll have to talk with my boss about it, but I'm sure he'll agree to give you one of our best rooms for free."

"I'd rather pay for an average room."

"Are you sure?"

"Yes, I'm sure." It was hard for Audrey to not let some minor annoyance slip into her tone. She knew that he had only the best intentions and that she shouldn't get mad at him but being given special treatment because of her heritage always hurt.

"She'd like you to treat her like any other guest." Shin told the clerk.

"I'm not sure if I can do that but I'll try. You said one room for one night, right? That'll be one hundred dollars."

Happy to finish this conversation, Audrey pulled out her wallet and dug through it. "Do you do change for five hundred dollar bills?" She obliviously asked.

"Er, no."

She resumed digging through her wallet, mostly finding only five hundred dollar bills, looking at her wallet reminded her that she still hasn't gotten around to getting a fake ID as Audrey Burne. She did at one point find a fifty dollar bill, but only one. "There has to be a one hundred dollar bill somewhere in here." After a few more seconds of searching, she found one.

+++

Audrey grunted as she finally managed to fit her pajama pants past her impressive booty. "Phew." She sighed, thinking on how it was a good thing they brought her pajamas from the Argama with them. The last thing she needed was to be put in the situation of having to make do with pajamas her ass had ripped, for all she knew the pajamas the hotel had were even more of a tight squeeze. She took a moment to look at herself in the mirror, she felt she looked ridiculous, a big gut hanging out that stretched the buttons to their limit, a huge butt that was clearly too big for her pants, large boobs that ensured the top button wasn't the only button free of trouble that day, and chunky thighs that rubbed together. She grabbed the sides of stomach and looked down at it as she shook, watching all the blubber jiggle like mad. "I need Banagher's hands on this gut. He always makes me feel good about having a big tummy." It took a few seconds for said big tummy she REALLY wanted Banagher to play with to stop jiggling and bouncing after she removed her hands from it.

She left her bathroom and ungracefully flopped down on her bed, it was tempting to fall asleep then and there but she needed to keep up a healthy sleep schedule for the meeting with Banagher tomorrow. She looked down at her tummy again, which obscured mot of her vision. "At least I didn't pig out again. I wonder what Banagher and Marida are doing right now."

+++

"Almost got it..." Banagher said he struggled to stand up, but his filled up stomach was simply too heavy, and he had to plop back down. "Oof. This is -UUUURRP- tough."

"It's always hardest to -UUURRRP-! Excuse me. It's always hardest to stand up after breaking a chair." Marida remarked as she rested a hand on her gut.

Banagher blinked. "H -URP- Huh? You broke chairs before?"

Marida flashed back to all the times her formally of average size ass had broken chairs, the one she focused on the most being the first time it happened. It was when she was around Banagher's current weight, she and Audrey had just finished having a nice dinner together, the redhead was incredibly swollen from how much she had eaten, so much so she had to undo her top, sash, and pants to give her tummy enough breathing room. As she was chatting (which was peppered with belches of indigestion from the pilot) with the princess, a creaking sound from Marida's chair sounded, and before either of them could react, it broke, sending the poor women towards the ground with a grunt, her belly, breasts, and butt jiggling from the impact. It was humiliating, and while she already knew her steadily climbing weight was a "big problem" (Marida cringed at how she accidentally made a fat joke), that was the moment that made her realize her weight issues were even worse then she thought, and she thought they were pretty bad when she noticed her stomach kept her from seeing her feet.

She was already blushing pretty hard, but when Audrey asked her if she was okay and the only response Marida could give her was a loud gurgle from her stomach followed up by a humongous belch, the poor redhead's chubby face was practically scarlet. Not her finest moment, and certainty a moment she'd rather her chubby little brother never find out about.

"Um... yes." Marida blushed.

"At least it happened here, instead of at Gilboa's house. Way less embarrassing." Banagher remarked.

"True, but it is a bit blasphemous to break a bench in a house of God."

"That is also true."

Their next plan to stand up was for Banagher to push himself up with Marida's shoulders, then pull Marida up by grabbing her hand. It was harder then it sounded. While Banagher was able to stand up that way, albeit with some grunting and difficulty, partly because their stuffed bellies pushed them away from each other when they faced each other, helping Marida, the over 300 pounds soldier, was the hardest part.

"Ready when you are." Marida extended her pudgy hand, which Banagher grasped after taking a brief moment to catch his breath. Both parties huffed and puffed as the out-of-shape teenager tried to pull up his incredibly obese big sister. Even with Marida doing her best to heave herself up, it was still hard for Banagher. And once he eventually succeeded in doing so, Marida was accidentally sent tumbling into Banagher, their tummies crashing, resulting in plenty of jiggling and one loud belch each. The brunette was almost knocked down by the Neo-Zeon soldier's massive girth.

"Are you alright, Banagher? Do you need a belly rub?" Marida asked.

"Don't worry, I'm fine. Though a belly rub would be pretty nice." He placed his hands on his gut as he said that.

His sister chuckled. "Wait until we get home for that."

The walk home wasn't really a walk, it was far more of a waddle, with the duo swaying about as if they were drunk on top of stuffed silly. Sometimes it almost looked like they were doing an imitation of a peg-legged pirate.

"I'm so -UUUURRRP- jiggly." Banagher remarked as he watched his middle bounce up and down.

"Still not used to it? URRAAAP! Excuse me." Marida also watched all the jiggling Banagher's gut was doing

"Yeah, it feels kinda weird."

"It'll feel natural after some time. Let me -URP- know if you have questions about being overweight."

"Does it get in the way of piloting a mobile suit?"

"No. Aside from your chair being tighter, it's the same as piloting when you're slim."

The two moaned and belched as they wobbled home, giving their stomachs tender belly rubs the whole time, all of which was helping to ease the pressure in their packed full stomachs. When they arrived home they quickly collapsed onto the couch, groaning in relief once they planted their behinds on the soft cushions

"UUUURRRAP! After all that, I need some TV." Banagher said after letting our a tired yawn.

Marida burped into her fist. "Before you that, don't you want to read the princess' letter?" She said as she picked up the envelope up from the nearby stand and passed it o the brunette.

"Of course." He took it and quickly opened it and belched before he started reading the letter.

"Dear Banagher,

I'm so sorry for getting you caught up in all this. There is a rescue coming, meet me at the ice cream parlor tomorrow, I'll give you information on the operation there, and a proper apology.

I'll be waiting for you there at 12 PM, I'll wait for you there the entire day. I brought Haro.

To prove this is from the real me, I'll recall something only we would now. After you woke up on the Nahel Argama, we binged in your room, gave each other belly rubs, and watched six episodes of the original Mobile Suit Gundam series. I am looking forward to when we can enjoy moments like that together again.

From Audrey Burne."

Banagher smiled at the letter. It was only a piece of paper, but it carried with it the spirit of his friend. It was almost like seeing her again, and he would be seeing her again tomorrow.

"You look happy." Marida remarked.

"It's a really nice letter."

The rest of the night was spent chatting and watching shows Marida still wasn't used to yet as they gave each other belly rubs.

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Marida took a moment to watch Banagher and how he snored loudly, his belly sticking straight up into the air as a monument to his appetite, the mountain of fat moving in and out with every snore. Marida had never before thought that laziness could be so endearing until she met him. "Breakfast," She said as she placed a tray containing his breakfast on to his stomach. Banagher's only reply was another snore that made Marida shake her head and pinched his chubby cheeks which finally woke him up.

"Huh...?" Banagher said with a grunt.

"It's time for breakfast," Marida said.

Now fully conscious - though still sleepy - Banagher held the plate up as he sat up, then placed it down on the top of his belly which had quickly become his favorite table. "In bed again? Thanks!" He said as he quickly ate part 1 of his large breakfast, punctuating it with a pleased belch.

After resisting the urge to go back to sleep, Banagher got out of bed, dressed himself in his poorly-fitting clothes, and went to the living room to find a very hearty helping of pancakes waiting for him at the kitchen table.

"Ready for part two?" The obese redhead said to the fat brunette as she had her own hearty helping.

Banagher was sporting a goofy grin, "Man, Marida! You're really gonna fatten me up!" He said, happily drumming his belly as he waddled over, the blubbery orb jiggling to the beat.

"You're fat enough already." Marida teased before taking a big bite out of a pancake. "In all seriousness, we haven't done any exercise in a while. I was thinking we could jog to the bistro and then jog home after work. How does that sound?"

Banagher gulped down a bit of pancake that had a good amount of syrup on it. "That's fine. You're right, we have kinda been slacking off lately." It was then that he remembered he had to meet with Audrey today after work. "Actually, is it alright if I only jog on the way there?"

"Of course, but why?"

"I just don't feel up to it."

"But it's not time for the second jog yet."

"I mean that I'll probably feel too tired after work to jog."

"Already planning another binge?" The pilot teased.

"You know me, I'm always making sure I've got this big thing filled up." For the sake of emphasis, and because he liked playing with his gut, Banagher lifted his stomach up and then dropped it, resulting in waves of chub wobbling. "I think I'll take a little walk around town, I still haven't gotten used to the neighborhood yet."

"Do you want me to come along?"

"No thanks, you've got a gut to lose. I don't want to get in the way of that."

Once they were both finished with their breakfast, it was time to start their jog. "Ready, Banagher?" Marida asked after doing some brief warm ups. Banagher tried to answer but he was cut off by his own loud belch. He blushed and slapped a hand over his mouth. "I'll take that as a yes." The older sister chuckled. The two out-of-shape pilots started jogging, their soft chests, ample bellies, chunky legs, and rotund butts bobbing and bouncing the whole time.

The weather was sunny that afternoon, much to the dismay of the two as they pitifully attempted to keep a brisk pace. It was more of a cycling rotation between out of breath shuffling and a few more minutes of jogging. The warm sun didn't make the feat any better, either. Banagher didn't want to say anything, but he was starting to regret jogging. Little did he know that Marida was kicking herself mentally more than her belly flab did to her upper thighs physically.

"*huff* Keep it up, Banagher! We can do it!" Marida cheered in between pants. Banagher groaned, but continued onward to keep Marida placated. It was becoming more and more obvious to him that people were staring, and that made him somewhat fidgety. Marida had taken notice too, but tried her best to ignore it.

It turned out that having every passer by stare at them was just the motivation that they needed to keep moving. The mock siblings tried their hardest to ignore the fact that their fat was shaking about as they barreled along the sidewalk, and the fact that they were dangerously close to a wardrobe malfunction from the fat jiggling, but somehow they made it work just long enough to reach their destination.

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Marida leaned against the wall of the bistro and let out a long, dramatically loud sigh, and said, "Oooh! Banagher, we did great there. -Huff-! But let's not over exert ourselves, we need to rest after such strenuous activity!"

Banagher gave a weary smile, and said, "Yeah, and luckily we're right at a place where at least you can take a breather."

Marida smiled as Banagher stuck his tongue out teasingly. It apparently was not much of a big secret that the two didn't care much for jogging. Marida sighed; her observant little brother had predicted exactly what she wanted to do.

The two stumbled through the door of the Bistro, still exhausted and panting. To someone who had none of the context, like Vincent, it was quite a surprising and concerning sight. "Are you two okay?" He said as he wobbled over at a brisk pace. "What the hell happened?"

"N-Nothing, we're fine." Marida explained as she pulled up a chair to sit down in, which groaned under her massive weight.

Banagher did the same. "We -huff- We just did some jogging."

Vincent felt a little stupid for assuming something serious had happened when the explanation was such a normal thing, though few would blame him for assuming the two were trying to escape more then just their own obesity." Oh. Well, I guess exhaustion is a sign of progress."

"And pain." Banagher groaned, his belly being completely left out in the open meant that Marida and Vincent could see all the sweat on it. He was glad his curse of cute girls seeing his stomach wasn't striking right now.

"I'll get you two some water. It's free, of course."

The morning jog had left Banagher in a fairly awkward state for the day. His legs were wobbly, and he had a hard time getting going on the daily tasks and grind. It would have gotten him a stern talking to from Vincent - if more than five customers actually had shown up that day.

By the late afternoon Banagher was thoroughly recovered from what could have been mistaken for being hit by a truck from the way he moved in the early hours. The slow shifts allowed him ample time to rest, almost as ample as his own backside. As his shift ended and he metaphorically turned in his apron for the day, he wished he had an apron to physically turn in that way he would have something to cover his gut, Banagher lamented to himself how sad it was that someone like Vincent had to pay him money to essentially sit for hours on end.

Wobbling out to meet with Audrey, Banagher wished she came to meet with him tomorrow. He knew he should just be happy to see her again, and he was, but it would've been so great if he could surprise her with a present. he only needed to wait another day to have enough money to buy it too.

When he walked into the ice cream parlor, his gut entering before the rest of him, the brunette scanned the entire place for the sight of his favorite chubby, dorky blonde. Sure enough, he saw her in both at the end of the room. As expected, she was enjoying a big bowl of ice cream, as told, Haro was sitting right next to her. What surprised Banagher was that Audrey was wearing a familiar pair of sunglasses that really didn't suit her, and not just because they emphasized how chubby her cheeks were.

Jiggling on over to her, wearing a big grin, the Gundam pilot was so happy to see her again that he was on the verge of giving her a big ol' belly bump. "Hey, Audrey, I'm here!" He said as he sat down at the booth. It was a bit snug for him and even though he knew he had the bigger gut of the two, he couldn't imagine it wasn't at least a little bit of a tight squeeze for the princess too.

"So you are." Audrey uncharacteristically said, not looking up from her ice cream bowl as she kept eating.

"Hi Banagher! hi Banagher! It's been so long!" Haro excitedly said as he bounced up and down.

"It's great to see you again too, Haro. We're going to have to spend a lot of time together today." Banagher showed him a kind smile. "So how have things been for you guys?"

"That depends, who wants to know?" Banagher was glad to hear Audrey's voice again but he wasn't expecting such a cryptic answer from her.

He simile was replaced with a confused look. "Um, it's me, Audrey." He pointed at his pie-like face. "I haven't got that much fatter since we last saw each other, have I?"

"Trust me, in war, you never forget a face." Despite the topic, Audrey was still only looking at ice cream.

"Yeah, a fat face like mine stands out in the military, doesn't it?"

He saw a smile creep up on Audrey's face, it looked like she was trying to hold back a giggle, but she forced both that and the smile back down. "So you're here to talk business, huh?"

"I guess that's what you could call it, but after that I was hoping we could hang out."

Audrey made this bizarre and obviously forced grunt that Banagher thought was supposed to sound inquisitive. "What do you have in mind?"

"I don''t know, I was hopping we could come up with something together."

"Walking into a battlefield without a plan? You must have a death wish."

"You're acting really weird, Audrey."

Audrey yanked her sunglasses off. "Forget this! I can't do it right!" She exclaimed in frustration.

"I don't get it." But Banagher was glad to see Audrey back to normal.

"Since I'm your informant, that means I'm supposed to be cool and mysterious, but it didn't work. What did I do wrong? This is way harder then it looks." She pouted and resumed eating her cream.

Banagher chuckled, his smile returning. "Well, there's not really anything cool and mysterious about a chubby girl eating ice cream, even if her shades are cool."

"Marida is fat and eats ice cream, and she's still cool and mysterious." Audrey grumbled.

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"Anyways," Audrey reached into her pocket and pulled out a folded map. "This is all the info you'll need for the rescue. It'll tell you exactly when the operation will commence, follow all the instructions on it to the letter." She handed Banagher the map, who put it in his own pocket.

"When you put it like that, it sounds so easy."

"I won't lie to you, this operation will take lives. I know it's cruel of me to ask this, but you need to prepared to end lives again."

Banagher tensed up at hearing that, something that Audrey and Haro could clearly see even before he said anything. "... I understand." Those were the solemn words he said.

That sentence was all that was needed to replace his blonde friend's serious expression with a frown. "I'm sorry, Banagher. I shouldn't have brought that up."

"It's-It's alright, let's just focus on enjoying today, okay? We've both been through a lot, we need a break."

"Thank you.."

"For what?"

"Well, I have a lot of things to thank you for, but this time, it's for being the first person to tell me to take a break from being Mineva."

This made Banagher perk up a little. "I'm glad I can help. So what do you do first today?"

"Enjoy some ice cream with you, of course." With a smirk, Audrey got out of the booth, which was a bit of squeeze as Banagher figured it would be, and soon came back with a big bowl of ice cream for her brown-haired friend. "Eat up."

"Thanks." Banagher heartily dug in.

Audrey had to take a moment to stare at Banagher, he was just so adorable, round, and jiggly. Seeing that big goofy smile on his face made her heart warm. Seeing him shovel ice cream into his round face, licking any bits of it that got onto his chubby cheeks, was so adorable. If he wasn't busy eating, she would pinch those puffy cheeks. Her chunky friend was just as adorable and sweet as she remembered him.

"Aren't you gonna sit down?"

"Oh! Uh, yes." She hastily squeezed herself back into her side of the booth with Haro and resumed eating. "Did I at least look cool from a distance?"

"Well..." Banagher said, but his smile told Audrey her answer without him needing to elaborate any further.

"Aww..." Audrey pouted.

"Audrey's not cool! Audrey's not cool!" This friendly teasing from Haro earned him a playful knock on the head from Audrey. Banagher chuckled; he didn't blame Audrey for that.

Happily chowing down together, they spent some time catching up with each other. Banagher wasn't too surprised to find out that Takuya, Riddhe, and Mihiro had gotten as fat as them, he felt a little jealous when his friend told him that Takuya could still keep his pants and belt closed.

When Audrey finished most of her first bowl, she suddenly dropped her spoon, a display of poor table manners complete unlike her, and she grunted in pain. "Ah!"

this sight made Banagher drop his own spoon in shock, even Haro looked concerned despite being incapable of changing his face. "What's wrong, Audrey?" Banagher asked in a worried tone.

"My mouth... it's so cold!"

Audrey was being completely serious, but that just made Banagher's smile return. "Looks like you've got your first brain freeze." He said with a chuckle.

"What's that?!" She was confused. It felt like she was suffering from a serious medical condition, but Banagher calmed down once she described it to him.

"It means you ate your ice cream too fast. Your mouth is just a little too cold, that's all. Don't worry, it'll go away in a sec."

And just like that, it did. "Oh... this is embarrassing." That embarrassment almost completely vanished when Banagher let out a friendly chuckle at how endearingly unused his blonde friend was to normal stuff. Audrey chuckled too, it was so good for things to be back to normal, even if it was only for a few hours.

Once they finished eating three bowls, the two leaned back in their seats with pleased looks on their faces as they each let out a massive belch, their hands on their stomachs. "Pardon us." Audrey said with a giggle. "Do you want to keep eating ice cream or should we try some other place?"

"Let's try somewhere else, I've had my fill of ice cream for today." Banagher pat his tummy. "You're more familiar with Palau, so where should we go?"

"Actually, I'd rather you pick. Even though I've lived here for a long time, I never ate outside of my home. I don't know anything about normal food stores."

"Well, I saw a burger place that looks pretty good, you want to give it a try?"

"That sounds wonderful. I've never eaten at a fast food place before. I heard the food there is disgusting and leads to an early death," She said, tone deaf to how morbid her description was. "But whenever I see people eating it, they look pretty happy."

With Banagher holding Haro, he and Audrey waddled out of the parlor, only for the blonde to bring things to an unexpected halt. "Can you please wait a second?"

"Sure." He casually said.

Audrey seemed a little nervous. "Um, can I touch your big belly?" There was a slight blush to her chubby cheeks, a blush Banagher's own cheeks then matched.

"S-Sure, but why? Usually we do this after we're done eating."

"I know, but it's just been so long since I've felt you and your stomach." She anxiously placed her hands on her chubby friend's stomach, the longed after sensation giving her goosebumps. His stomach was so soft, like a giant pillow, and just as inviting to rest her head on. She began moving her hands around the puffy orb, making Banagher sigh in pleasure. Coyly smiling in a cute but pervy way, Audrey's soft hands felt up every bit of her friend's gut. "Ah! It's a lot softer than I expected!" Audrey said, her eyes bright with a childlike wonder. She grabbed handfuls of his creamy belly fat, poked the soft expanse and marvel at how deep her finger sank in and how the fat would jiggle back into place without a mark, pat the giant orb in a friendly manner, grab the sides of it and jiggle it, slapped it lightly, and poke him in his incredibly deep bellybutton. It all felt as amazing to Banagher as it did Audrey, he had missed this feeling. The brunette was really happy to see Audrey enjoying herself so much.

"Okay, I'm done. Thanks for letting me do that." Audrey said as she released the jiggly orb.

"You're welcome." The brunette then started walking. "Now lets get some-"

"Actually,"

The brunette stopped walking.

"Can you rub my belly?" She asked. "I know you want to~" Audrey said playfully as she gave him a joking wink, followed by a laugh at her own joke.

"Y-yeah, you're right about that," Banagher said, his face flushed. He hesitantly placed his hand on her protruding stomach; his own filled with butterflies from the surrealness of getting to touch someone he hadn't seen in so long. He started moving his hands over her stomach and fondling it, he thought on how her stomach felt different then Marida's, and it wasn't because Marida's was bigger. Sure, they were both big, fat bellies belonging to two kind girls who love to eat, but they didn't give off the same feeling. Marida's was... tougher, as odd as it felt for Banagher to use that adjective to describe a fat gut. It was still very soft and squishy, but still strong, even if Marida herself couldn't see that. Audrey's tummy was different, it was pure marshmallow fluff. But neither belly was better then the other's, they were equally good in different ways.

Banagher engaged in much of the same belly play Audrey did with his stomach. Just like he did, the blonde would occasionally sigh in pleasure. Kneading this princess' chub was like kneading cookie dough to her knight. Seeing Audrey jiggle reminded Banagher of good memories, really good memories. At one point, the princess' belly gurgled, and a huge belch came flying out of her mouth. They both giggled and the blonde excused herself. Banagher stuck his finger into Audrey's deep navel and shook it around in there, they both watched as the Zabi's stomach jiggled and wobbled from it.

The two punctuated this session of belly rubs by bumping their massive tummies together, sporting big, goofy grins on their cherubic faces. Their stomachs took a few seconds to stop jiggling, that amused both of them.

"Ready to get some burgers in your belly?" Banagher asked as he pat his friend's stomach.

"I am."

With Haro in hand, the fat princess and her chunky knight jiggled on over to every food place they could find, stuffing themselves full of all the delicious food they found. Being as rich as she was, Audrey's wallet meant they could eat all they wanted. Hamburgers, hot dogs, pizza, corn dogs, pretzels, kebabs, ice cream, cookies, and cakes among others filled their stomachs up. They'd enter every place with big bellies and come out with even bigger bellies. They were happily chatting about stuff like their friends, food, TV, and video games as they glutted themselves.

After wobbling out of yet another fast food place, their bellies bigger then they were when they wobbled in, the blonde noticed that Banagher still had his opened belt on, and now that she thought about it, it had been like that the even before they started pigging out. "Why do you keep your belt on if it doesn't fit?" She asked after burping.

"Huh?" He was a little surprised to see another friend ask that same exact question. "It's in case I ever figure out a way to make it fit."

"Besides losing weight?" Audrey said in a bemused tone.

"Yeah. I mean, I AM trying to lose weight, it's just gonna take a while."

"Let me help you with your belt." With a helpful smile, Audrey pushed Banagher's gut in, eliciting an "Oof!" from the poor guy, and started the great struggle to zip and button his pants.

"Audrey, I -URP- don't think this going to work." Banagher said in obvious discomfort.

"It's *grh* not that t-tight." Audrey lied through her teeth. She knew Banagher was fat, but trying to actually close his pants made her realize she had almost forgotten how fat his belly truly was, realize that she had let her own weight gain overshadow Banagher's. "There we go." She said as she finally got his pants zipped and buttoned, though they both knew it was serving as a dam against the ocean of Banagher's blubber. "Now for the belt." She said with a hint of dread she tried to hide. The belt was just as hard to close, Audrey compared it to trying to force two magnets together.

"Really, Aud -URRRP- rey, you don't have to do this."

"I *grh* insist, it's my fault you're fat in the first -UUURRRP- place."

"It's really not."

She finally managed to clip it together. "Done, whew!" She removed her hand and let her friend's well-fed stomach bulge back into place. "That's much better isn't-" Audrey's hard work was immediately undone as her big friend's middle snapped his belt and popped off the button on his pants, the button and belt buckle was sent flying right into Audrey's stomach, making the soft expanse jiggle violently. Waves of creamy flab came flopping out, forcing his zipper all the way back down, which would've left his white underwear exposed if his stomach wasn't so heavy it hanged down enough to cover his crotch.

This wardrobe malfunction made both their faces take on the coloration of a tomato, but for different reasons. They were silent at first, not even Haro was able to do anything but stare at his friend's tummy.

"Well..." Audrey started.

"That happened." Banagher finished, resting his hands on the top of his belly. Their difficulty to find what words to say was empathized by the chirping of a nearby bird.

Banagher burped into his fist. "Um, you wanna get some more pizza?

"Yes, that, uh, sounds nice."

"I forget, did we have pepperoni pizza yet?"

The chubby princess gained a look of curiosity on her face about this mythical pizza. "No, what is that?"

The amount of food they were packing away left many people, including the employees and other customers at where they ate, amazed. Audrey and Banagher were eating machines, eating and eating with no sign of stopping. As their bellies grew bigger with every stop, so did the amount of stares they got when they wobbled into a new stop, belching crazily while sporting gigantic bellies. It made them feel a bit embarrassed but they were having far too much fun to care that much about it. One cashier asked them why they came here, since they were obviously both very full. With a grin, Banagher gave his stomach a few proud pats, belched loudly, and told him that they were having a night on the town.

As the night went and they got fuller, their belches got louder and more frequent. A fat guy like Banagher burping wasn't an unusual sight, but what certainly was was the princess of Zeon not only belching, not only with seemingly no embarrassment, but with skill matching her friend. The two even had a few small belching contests here and there, Haro kept track of who many each one, which was three each. Audrey at one point accidentally burped right into Banagher's face. Not too long ago Audrey would've been horrified beyond words, now she just laughed it off with Banagher, even though it was embarrassing enough to make them both blush. Whenever one well-fed teen complimented the other's belching talent, it made the other's heart fill with joy. Sometimes Banagher let out a laugh so bellyful or a burp so loud it made his cherubic cheeks fold and bounce, which, the princess thought was the cutest thing, she couldn't resist pinching those chubby cheeks.

Jiggling around the block, Audrey and Banagher were holding bags of chips, pretzels, and popcorn, along with an extra large cup of soda, as snacks.

"UUUURRRRP! Excuse me!" Audrey joked with a smile before she happily ate another handful of popcorn. "All this amazing food -UUURAAAP- was so close to me all this time."

Banagher finished sipping on his soda. "UUURRAAAAP! It must feel liberating -UUUURRRRP- to get to taste it all of the -UURRRRRP- first time."

"It does, it's fantastic." Audrey shoveled a few more handfuls of pretzels into her greedy mouth. "How do normal -UUUUUURP- people like you not get fat sooner? URRRRRRRP!" She ate another handful of chips and downed it with soda.

"I'm not sure I'm -URAAAAAP- the kind of person you should be asking -URRRP- that." With a blush and a goofy smile that screamed "Please still think I'm cool, Audrey!" the obese young man gave his gigantic belly a jiggle to drive his point home.

"Good point." Audrey teased with a wink.

"Banagher's a fatty! Banagher's a fatty!" Haro teased, causing Banagher to playfully give a very light kick. He could barely even see Haro past his gut.

"I'll have to ask Mihir-" A loud popping sound interrupted their chat and brought all three pairs of eyes looking at the source, which was the middle button on Audrey's coat being popped off. Audrey gasped in shocked, which her tummy bulge ever so slightly, but it was enough to pop off the lower button too, with the button on her tight pants immediately following. Her massive tummy was now free to bulge forward, and bulge forward it did, the zipper powerless to stop her pale belly fat from forcing it all the way down, exposing her pink underwear.

Blushes adorning two faces, three if Haro was capable of blushing, the fat friends were so embarrassed they couldn't bring themselves to eat. "Oh God..." Audrey said, she couldn't actually see past her stomach, but she logically knew that the zipper going down meant her underwear could be seen by anyone. Her, Banagher, and Haro looked around, luckily there wasn't anyone there right now but there was no way no one would see her before the night was over.

Banagher sighed, resigning himself to what was about to happen. Desperate times called for desperate measures. Praying no cute girls would walk around the corner, the Gundam pilot lifted his heavy stomach up with all his strength, which normally wasn't much since he was so out of shape but Audrey gave him all the strength in the world, exposing to the world his white underwear. Audrey would've blushed even harder at the sight if she could, her blush was no longer solely out of embarrassment. "So, um, -UURRRRRP-, here you -URP- go. It's my underwear." Banagher was hoping he could say something less lame but that was all he got.

Once what Banagher was doing sank in, Andrey showed him a relived smile and laughed. "Banagher, you're an amazing friend. UUUURRRRAP!"

Eventually, Audrey and Banagher were finally finished eating that night. Wobbling out of a hot dog buffet, the fat lady and unicorn unleashed a massive belch in unison with pleased looks on their faces, hands on their full bellies, feeling how full, hard yet soft, and massive they were.

"I'm stuffed!" Banagher said as he pat his bloated gut, even with the sphere of adipose being as packed full as it was it still jiggled from the pats.

"Me too." Audrey said as she rubbed her full belly, thinking on how it was like a giant, pale Haro. "That was amazing, Banagher! UUURRRRP!"

Their bellies were massive, nearly the size of beanbag chairs. They were even nearly as large as Marida's stomach when she wasn't bloated, which was really saying something. Even they were surprised by how big their stomachs had become, Haro was downright amazed by them. He'd be looking at them even if they weren't blocking his view of his friends' faces.

"UUUUURRP! You've got that right!" He started rubbing his own fat belly. "I've gotta say, you can really pack it away! UUURRRRP! Maybe you -UUURRRP- and I should e -URRP- nter an eating contest at some point!" Banagher said, giving a big smile that his puffy cheeks made even more adorable and heartwarming.

Audrey answered by grinning and giving him a (very light) punch on the shoulder. "Yeah, -URRRAAAP- and ruin even more -UUUUURRP- of my clothes? What a fantastic offer, I’ll have to get back to you -URAP- on that."

This was punctuated with even more laughter from the bloated teens.

"No one can eat more then you two!" Haro said as he bounced up and down, looking forward to later bounce on their stomachs.

"Thank you Haro but we'll need to start keeping our appetites in check or else they'll be rolling us around." Audrey jiggled her belly for emphasis, which she found fun and Banagher found cute.

"So now that we've eaten Palau dry, what do you want to do?" The brunette said as his stomach gurgled audibly enough for both of them to hear.

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"I was thinking we could lay down in the park for a while. If that's okay with you, of course."

"Sure, that sounds nice."

They waddled over to the park, Banagher holding Haro. The teens were so bloated that they were waddling like they were peg-legged pirates. They couldn't explain why, but there was something they found interesting about the way the other's stomach bobbed and bounced during the walk. When Audrey wasn't watching Banagher's stomach bounce, she was looking at her own jiggly stomach, something thebrunette noticed.

Banagher burped before he said something. "Still not used to being so jiggly?"

"H -URP- Huh? Oh, yes. It still feels strange." To Audrey, her full stomach jiggling felt like her stomach was a full bag of marshmallows that was being carried down the stairs.

"I'm not exactly used to either yet." Banagher gave his gut a pat. To him, his stomach jiggling felt like it was a basketball being dribbled. "Marida said we'll get used to it."

"I hope that won't take long. All the food we ate isn't helping this feel less strange."

Banagher concurred with her by letting out a deep burp.

Once they waddled their bloated forms over a bench in the park, the pair groaned in relief as they planted their huge asses down on it, the pilot relived there wasn't any groaning from the bench like when he and Marida sat down at the church. He tried to take it as a sign he wasn't that fat yet but it was hard. The two almost immediately reached started rubbing each other's stomachs as they resumed chatting.

Soon into the belly rubbing, Audrey felt a gurgle from her stomach along with a sharp pain in her chest. She had been belching a lot tonight, and quite loudly too, but she hadn't felt so much gas at once. She looked over at Banagher who looked back at her, she could tell he was experiencing the same thing. A week ago, they would've been mortified at the massive burp they were about to unleash, after all, one was a princess who was raised to be as polite and elegant as possible and belching loudly was neither of those things, and the other was a goofy guy trying to find a place he belonged to who just burped loudly in front of a kind, cute girl who understood him and gave him that place he was seeking. But now, after all the time they spent with each other, they grinned at each and at the same time happily belted out a belch so massive it made their big, fat bellies jiggle.

"UUUUURRRRRP!"

They immediately started laughing, their faces blushing bright red. Of course, they were still embarrassed but they were having way too much fun to care.

"Ah ha ha, I'm getting pretty good at this, huh?" Audrey asked, covering her mouth in a mock gesture of politeness.

"I'll say!" Banagher concurred, chuckling. "Although you have a long way to go if you wanna match up to me!"

"Ha, no way! I'm definitely way past you in skill!" Audrey said with a playful wink.

"Heh, not likely, but okay!"

Truly, their friendship was blossoming in a way neither would've thought possible a few days ago. Just a few days ago both the blonde and brunette had never even dreamed of ever being in this situation, yet they had found themselves belching and eating galore, and having a blast doing it. Both teens wanted this moment to last forever, just to lounge around, have fun, and not have a care in the world.

"Hey, is that princess Mineva?" A young man asked his friend he was strolling through the park with as they saw Banagher and Audrey burping and giving each other belly rubs, and looking very happy while doing so.

"Gotta be. Wow, she really got fat."

"Her boyfriend's pretty fat too, wonder if he was always fat or of they got fat together. Wonder who he is."

"Whoever he is, he's damn lucky."

The slim duo was unaware that the obese duo, plus Haro, could hear them perfectly fine. "Boyfriend?" The blonde half of the chubby duo repeated in confusion, her chubby cheeks were sporting a blush. "You're not my boyfriend, are you?"

"Um..." Banagher's face matched Audrey's blush. "I-I dunno. I mean, I never called you my girlfriend, but those guys -URAAAP- thought we were acting like a couple." He said as he nervously drummed his fingers on his friend's tummy, which she thought felt oddly nice.

"And we've been -URRRRRP- doing this a lot..." A very brief silence followed, Banagher really wished he could let out a huge burp to change the subject, but his stomach picked the worst time to not give him a lot of gas.

"Um, so what do you think?"

"I don't know, I've never had a boyfriend before."

"Love! Love!" Haro chimed in as he bounced on Banagher's belly and then Audrey's, the first bounce on each belly made them burp.

+++

Taking a break from giving belly rubs, Banagher, Audrey, and Haro looked up at the stars, the gurgling and bubbling of their stomachs was the only audio. No matter where you were, the stars always seemed the same, always giving the same feeling of serenity.

"Banagher." Audrey said, stifling a burp.

"Yeah?"

"You said that you like to look at the stars as you think about your place in the world. After everything you've been through, have your thoughts on that changed?"

He crossed his arms over his flabby chest and gut, closing his eyes. A few seconds of contemplation later, he sighed and then opened his eyes. "Everything just feels so confusing. When I lived in Industrial 7, I was scared of how restricted life seemed. It was like what we going to do was decided for us before we were even born. That we were destined to just follow a path someone else laid out for us. Like a factory." Those words surprised Audrey, not just because of how cynical they sounded, but because of how similar they sounded to how she feels about her life. "But now everything is too free, it's all so chaotic and irrational. I can't tell who my allies and enemies are. All I know is that I can trust you, Haro, Takuya, and Micott, but that's it. Out of all the people I'll have to decide which should live and which should die, that's a small number. I'm not suited to pick up a weapon, but I have to anyways." Haro snuggled up closer to the young man.

"I see." Audrey looked down, she had to force herself to look at him in the eyes. "But knowing that we're on your side helps, doesn't it?"

"It does but... I just don't know what to do."

"Think of it like this," She could now more comfortably look him in the eyes. "Admitting that you don't know is wiser then most people think. It's a wisdom a lot of people in the Federation and Zeon don't possess."

"Maybe." Banagher looked back at the stars. It was like staring into a crowd of people, each face you see represents a life as unique and detailed as your own, but from a distance, they all seem blank. "So how do you feel about your place in the world?"

"... All I know is that I'm the only one who can end this war."

"I hate it when you get like that."

"I'm the only surviving member of the Zabi family, the only one both willing and able to bring peace between the Federation and Zeon. This is my responsibility and only mine." Audrey said and then let a small burp pass her lips.

"Please stop it. I already told you this mindset you have is selfish, it's arrogant too. You can't do everything by yourself, let people help you."

"I want as little people involved as possible."

"I know but you won't get anywhere on you're own. URRAP! You get like this and rush off into danger without thinking things through. You've nearly died twice from this."

A contemplative expression washed over Audrey's face. "... Three times, actually."

"What?!"

"When the fighting broke out in Industrial 7, the remains of a mobile suit nearly crashed into me and the others, Riddhe saved us. If you count that since my recklessness is the whole reason I was in Industrial 7 in the first place, then I've nearly gotten myself killed three times."

"I'm not going to, just please let us help you."

"It-It's hard." The pilot of the Unicorn Gundam was surprised to see Audrey let vulnerability show in her voice, he could only think of one other time she did. "I don't want you or anyone else to get hurt."

"And we don't want you to get hurt."

She looked lost for a moment but quickly gave her pal a weary smile, almost looking defeated yet relived at the same time. "I really needed someone to say that."

They returned to stargazing for a while, the mood of their conversations returning to normal. The first thing they talked about was movies, Banagher quickly discovering that Audrey's experience in films was rather... limited. Her favorite was some film Banagher has never heard of before, staring an actress she had never heard of called Audrey Hepburn. The princess couldn't resist teasing her friend about how she 100% right that Banagher wouldn't recognize the obvious reference. Banagher pouted and said he's not into that sorta stuff. For her part, Audrey had at best only vaguely heard of some of the films Banagher said he liked, the brunette quickly telling her that he'd have to show them to her, something she was looking forward to.

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"Remember how when we first -URRRRP- met you said you might want to enroll in my school? UURAAAAP! Have you thought anymore about that?" The pudgy pilot asked.

Ever a princess, Audrey belched loudly as she gave her swollen gut a pat, nodding affirmatively. "I have, once this is all over, you'll be returning to school with me."

"That's great but like I said, my classes are in mechanics. Do you know anything about that?" He asked, already knowing that was practically a rhetorical question with someone like his strawberry blonde friend.

"Well, no. But that's what school is for."

Banagher scratched the back of his head. "Well, yeah but the school year has already been going on for months already, it's not going to be beginner stuff."

"It still can't be that hard."

"You're going to need a tutor, luckily you've got me. Let's start with something simple." Banagher held Haro up to Audrey's face, startling her a little. "Let's say we wanted to modify Haro to make his eyes light up, what's the first thing we should do?"

"Um," She wasn't sweating but she sure felt like she was. "Um... buy two light bulbs?" She trailed off as if she was asking a question.

Her friend blinked at her answer and placed Haro back on the bench without saying a word. "This is going to be harder then I thought."

"Oh come on, my answer wasn't that bad."

Banagher at one point casually drummed his belly, the flabby mass jostling from his little "performance". He didn't think much of it but he could tell from Audrey's face that she thought very much of it. "What?"

"Can you do that again?" Child-like wonder was clear as day on Audrey's face.

"This?" Banagher drummed his belly again, each hit making the fat jiggle like waves of water.

"Yes, that." She answered, her eyes locked onto her pal's gut. "What's that called?"

"Um," Banagher was wracking his brain to try to figure out what was so special about drumming his belly. "It's called belly drumming."

"Can you please keep drumming your belly?"

"Sure, no problem." Banagher drummed his belly as Audrey watched, a small smile on her face that washed away any embarrassment Banagher had about doing this goofy activity. "I'm glad you're enjoying this -URP- but I don't really know what you like about this so much."

"I don't know either but please keep doing it."

"Don't worry, I will." A few times the drumming stirred up the gas in his tummy, making it expel itself loudly from Banagher's mouth, which made Audrey giggle.

Once Banagher was done, his blonde friend had an unusual request for him. "Can you please teach me how to do that?" She said with an amount of enthusiasm that befuddled Banagher, something the question itself also did.

"I don't think it's something you need to be taught." Banagher scratched the back of his head. "You just slap your belly and that's it." He was giving Audrey a small smile that said "Your naivety is endearing".

"i see." Audrey looked down at her round stomach in thought, it let out a low grumble as it struggled to digest her feast. She then gave it a single slap, this accomplished making her dome of a middle wobbling but it didn't get the drumming effect she was looking for. "Hmm..."

"You've gotta do it with both hands." He saw Audrey raise her hands to do a simultaneous slap on her stomach and realized he needed to be more specific. "A-And you gotta alternate hands. And it's not really a slap, it's more a mix between a slap and a pat."

"I see, it sounds rather complicated."

"It's really not."

With Banagher's instructions in mind, Audrey successfully drummed her belly. She giggled at the sight of her jiggly tummy in motion. "You're right, it isn't once you get the hang of it." As Audrey continued to slowly drum her belly with a look of child-like wonder on her soft face, Banagher couldn't stop himself from smiling too.

"I don't know what I should be doing with the Unicorn and Laplace's box." He thought, the drumming making Audrey belch more then once. "But I do know this: My mission is to keep Audrey smiling." Looking at those wonderful emerald-green eyes, the first thing he ever noticed about her face, they were like a shinning light to him that illuminated his path. He saw another stranger walk past them, that stranger looked at the princess in confusion. The brunette could tell his goofy friend noticed but she played it no mind, she was having too much fun playing with her stomach. Thinking on the huge contrast between Audrey and Mineva, Banagher chuckled, a type of happy chuckle. What he'd give to see the past and the present meet.

Once Audrey had her fill of fun, she stopped drumming her stomach and returned to massaging her friend's tum, who returned the favor. "Thanks for teaching -UUUUURP- me -UUURAP- that. Do you want to do anything -UUUUURP- else before we call it a night or should we just stay here and chat?"

"I've got an idea, UUUUURRRP! How about we see a movie?"

"That'd be great. What's a good -UUUURAAAP- normal movie for me to start with?"

"Hmm..." That question was one of those questions where the answer should be simple but it still takes you a bit to think of it. "I guess Star -UUUUURRP- Wars would work."

"Do we need to buy a ticket for Haro too?"

+++

"Are you sure popcorn isn't too filling?" Audrey asked her brown-haired best friend, she was looking into the cup of the delectable snack contemplatively. "We did eat a lot before this, our stomachs are still just as swollen as ever."

"It's fine. Besides, the movie-going experience isn't complete without popcorn."

Each carrying a big popcorn cup and a soda, Audrey and Banagher took their seats in the theater. Luckily there was an empty seat on Banagher's side, so he placed Haro in it, who they did not have to buy a ticket for, not that doing so would've put even a single scratch into the Zabi's infinite wealth. She could've bought tickets for every seat in the whole theater, everything the snack bar had to offer, and then the theater itself and it still wouldn't have even begun to slightly dent her finances.

Audrey started snacking on her popcorn, as did Banagher. The young women of the trio wasn't entirely sure if Banagher was correct them being bale to eat all this popcorn without getting a really bad stomachache, in a worst case scenario, throwing up, but thus far it seemed fine.

"I knew the T -UUUURP- V would be huge but seeing it in person is another thing. I bet that's how other people feel about our big bellies, hee hee!"

'Hmm?" Banagher's mouth was full of popcorn. "Oh! That's not a TV."

"It's not?"

"It's a screen, movie theaters use projectors to show the -UUUURP- film."

"I -UUUURP- see..." Audrey's voice made it obvious she felt like an idiot.

"Don't beat yourself up over it, it's what anyone in your position would think. Besides, you're kinda like a medieval princess, it's really charming."

Her face and voice showed that she was cheered up. "And that makes you my knight -UUUUUURP- in shining -UUUUURRRP- armor. Though I don't think your armor will fit anymore." She gave a teasing poke into her knight's flabby side.

"This gut's the only armor I need." Banagher played along with a hearty slap to his dome of a middle.

When she saw the projector light up, Audrey felt a sense of amazement. Like she had said about the size itself, seeing it in person was completely different from hearing about it. Unfortunately, that amazement was about to swept aside for a short but unbearable moment. "Ahh!" Audrey jolted as soon as the iconic opening crawl started, she placed her hands over her ears in a clear panic, Her sudden movement sent her popcorn cup flying but Banagher managed to catch it before much popcorn could fall out.

"What's wrong, Audrey?" A concerned Banagher asked.

"Are you okay?" Haro asked, somehow looking as concerned as Banagher despite his face never changing.

"I-Its-It's so loud."

Banagher sighed in relief that it wasn't anything serious. "Yeah, it is pretty loud to someone who's never been o the theater before, I forgot. Sorry about that."

+++

"It's okay, it's over. You can watch the movie now."

The obese princess slowly brought her hands away from her ears, seeming surprised that the unbearable sound was over. "Okay... Okay. Whew... Whew... That was... UUURP! That was Hell."

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"So, -UUUUUURP- final thoughts?" Banagher asked Audrey as they jiggled out of the movie theater, the brunette of the group holding Haro. They were holding their huge bellies as they rubbed them, Banagher having to do it with his only free hand.

"It was fan -URRRRRRAP- tastic. I can see how it led to one of the biggest film franchises of all time."

"I knew you'd say something like that, you were really into it."

"Is it it really that obvious when I'm enjoying something?" Her voice contained not a hint that she was aware of how rhetorical her question practically was.

"Well..." Banagher had an amused grin as he flashed back to all the big smiles and looks of wonder he had seen his best friend make. Whether it was good food, good TV, good movies, good friends, or good bellies and fat, Audrey was always incapable of hiding her joy. "Yes, you always get this huge smile when you're really enjoying something." The two were now out of the movie theater and just aimlessly walking.

"I do?" A small blush was on Audrey's round face. "I-I had no idea."

"It's really charming."

"Thank you." Audrey cleared her throat as a way to announce that she would like to change topics. "Back to the topic of the movie, it was really interesting how many parts of it's story and world paralleled real life. You said that film was made before the Newtype theory, right?"

"Yeah, it's decades old." Now that Audrey mentioned it, Banagher could see the similarities their world and Star Wars held.

"I had heard a story that three Newtypes, I believe they were called the "Miracle Children", saw a vision of the colony drop on Sydney before it happened and were able to convince their town to evacuate. I wonder if, uh, who made Star Wars again?"

"George Lucas."

"I wonder if George Lucas was a Newtype himself, saw a vision of the future, and based his films off that." She said completely seriously.

"That's, uh, a rare sentence."

They spent some more time chatting about whatever they felt like before the overweight Zabi raised the obvious question.

"In hindsight I should've expected the job to be as boring as it is." Banagher said. "I think it's only -UUUUURP- gotten five customers in two days."

"Hold that thought." Audrey burped before she continued. "Are we just aimlessly walking around?"

"Uh, yeah. We are."

"Um... Maybe now would be a good time to... call it a night."

"What do you mean?"

Audrey stopped in her tracks, Banagher followed suit. "I mean that I think this is where we should part ways for now. Until the rescue, of course." Her stomach gurgled very loudly.

"Oh. Right... Yeah it is getting pretty late."

"It's the perfect -UUUUURP- time to do so."

"We've got some pretty b -UUUUURRAP- ig meals to sleep off after all." Banagher showed her a very clearly forced smile, which Audrey felt was the best forced smile she ever saw, not that that's saying anything.

"We certainly did." Showing an equally forced smile, Audrey patted her tummy as she looked down at it. Letting out another impressive burp, she ran a hand through her strawberry-blonde as she showed Banagher the most comforting smile she could give. "UUUUURRRP! Whew, I don't know about you but I think our rampage through all the town's eateries is one for the record books!"

Banagher slapped his tummy, sending a jiggly wave throughout it. "You've got that right! URRRAAAAP! These are two of the biggest stuffed bellies I've ever seen. Guess we'll need someone to roll us around tomorrow, huh?"

The princess giggled. "Looks like it. Good thing you've got Marida to do it."

The two laughed, though it was awkwardly followed up by a painful silence. Both bloated teens looked at each other, waiting for the other to walk away first. Haro alternated who he was looking at it. All they heard was the intense gurgling and bubbling of their overfed stomachs. They couldn't even put up fake smiles.

"I... Banagher?"

"Yeah."

"I... I can't do it." With that, she charged into Banagher and gave him the biggest hug she could give, their bellies slamming into each other, making a caught off guard Banagher go "Oof!", nearly dropping Haro. "I know it's only two days, but-but after everything I've -UUUUUUURP- gone through since you left and how hard I've been -UUUUUURP- trying to see you again -UUUUUURRP-! I-I just can't, I can't-"

"It's okay, Audrey." Banagher wrapped his arms around her, feeling how soft and huggable she was. "We'll stay together, we'll leave Palau together in the Unicorn, okay? Let it all out."

"... I think I just did."

For a while, they were simply frozen there, neither making a sound. Other then occasional belch of course, all the drama in the world can't stop the workings of a stuffed belly.

"You're like a huge teddy bear, Banagher. I want to sleep on you."

"Thanks. I, uh, want to sleep on you too."

"Promise that you will. And that you'll let me sleep on you too."

"I promise."

+++

Banagher ungracefully waddled into his and Marida's home, he wasn't surprised to see his big sister here but he was surprised to see that Gilboa was here. Banagher just hoped Gilboa would leave before the Neo-Zeon member started yelling at him over last night.

"There he is." Marida said. "I see you're looking... quite well-fed." She stood up, like anyone who saw Banagher in his current state would assume, she knew that Banagher was about to flop down on the couch.

"That's... UUUUUUURP! One way to put it." Just as predicated by both Marida and Gilboa, he flopped onto the bed as ungracefully as when he wobbled into the house. Marida sat down on his thick legs, which wuld've been incredibly painful had Banagher not put on over fifty pounds. She placed a meaty hand on his stomach and began rubbing, Banagher let out a cute moan of pleasure.

"You sure had fun. I usually only see guys that happy after a really good date." Gilboa said.

Banagher panicked a little, did Gilboa see him with Audrey? If he did, then did that mean he knew what hotel Audrey was staying at? "But if he did then he would've followed her to it, right? Then there's no way he would be here." He thought. "At least I hope that's the case." He tried to think of something to say but another belch left his mouth before any words did. He tired to clam himself down by thinking about how this was the first time he ever saw anyone sitting in the chair Gilboa was using. "Is that -URP- the only time you ever see people like this?"

"Well, you did seem pretty happy when you were having dinner at my house last night."

Banagher sighed in relief, Marida and Gilboa assumed that was just from getting comfortable.

"Speaking of, that's actually why I'm here." Looking up at the ceiling, Banagher did his best to brace himself from the scolding he was about to receive. The only solace he could take in this was that it wasn't Marida doing the scolding. "I wanted to apologize for how things went last night."

Banagher blinked twice, he couldn't deice what was more shocking, that or Marida telling him he got a letter from Audrey. "You mean you're not mad at me?" As he looked at Gilboa, he accidentally showed him his trademark puppy dog eyes that would keep all but the most vile of individuals from saying yes.

"Of course not, it was Tikva that started that."

"But don't think you think I should've just -UURAP- stood down so things wouldn't escalate? I almost made him cry."

"No, absolutely not. You have to stand up for yourself, no matter what. And to be honest, I think we all needed to hear that little speech of yours. We... well, no one here really gets any reminders that Zeon isn't the bastion of morality we all wish it was."

Banagher was about to ask him why he hasn't left Zeon if he doens't like the way Zeon does things, but then the image of the cross in the old church flashed before him, like if someone suddenly put a photo in front of his eyes. "You sure Tikva will take it to heart?"

"He won't admit it, but I think he already has." Gilboa then looked at Marida. "You can say something, you know."

"I think it's best if this conversation stays between you two. Besides, I have an impressively overfed belly to rub." That last part made Banagher blush a bit as he sported a goofy grin.

"One of these days you'll have to admit you're his big sister." Gilboa chuckled and then returned his focus to Banagher. "Almost forgot. I heard you're working at Vincent's bistro now, it's about time he got an employee. You want to have a little talk over there? Since we had to cut dinner last night short."

The Gundam pilot swallowed down a belch. "Sure, I have lots of breaks there anyways."

"Great. Marida?"

"Sure, I'm free tomorrow."

"I'll see you two then. Good night!"

With that, Gilboa got up and left. As soon as the door closed behind the pilot of Zeon, Banagher released that belch he held down, unaware Gilboa could still hear it.

"I see you enjoyed yourself." Marida gave his belly a pat before resuming her rubbing activity.

"Sure did! UUUUURRRP! Me and-I mean I pretty much cleared Palau out. How -UUURRP- was your day?"

"It was fine. After jogging I did some working out at the park. I beat my record number of sit ups before I got too exhausted."

"That's -UUUUUURP- great. UURRRRRRP! How many did you do?"

"Seven, I'm making progress. I'm sure you could do that many too."

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"You know, we've been wo -UUURAAP- working out a lot together but I don't think we ever talked about how we got fat in the first place." Banagher pointed out, at the same time he was looking at his huge stomach, which took up the majority of his view, and the pleasing movement's Marida's hand was making on it. "So what's the story behind your gut?"

Looking at her obese little brother, the redhead thought back to when she was his weight. Were this past version of Marida standing side by side with the current Banagher, one would see that Banagher had the bigger belly but Marida was fatter everywhere else except the face. She wondered, if he had come sooner into her life, and he was just as chubby as he was now, would they be skinnier by now or even fatter? On one hand, living with another fatso, especially one as friendly as Banagher, helped motivate them both to exercise more. On the other hand, Banagher is the kind of guy you just want to pig out with and then just relax together as you digested, chatted, burped, and gave each other belly rubs until you both fell into a food coma.

"I don't recall exactly when my weight gain "journey" started, if you want to call it that and I have feeling you do."

Banagher burped before he said something. "You know me so well."

"Anyway, I used to have a diet and exercise regime, and it just started slipping over time. I was working out less, I was eating more and what I ate was much less healthy. By the time I realized what was happening to me I was already pretty overweight and out-of-shape." She decided to leave out the bit about how she came to that conclusion because she broke a chair.

"How big were -URP- you?"

"Around your weight. I tried to cut back on the eating but, as I'm sure you know, as you get bigger your stomach demands more and more food and it gets harder to resist it. And now that dedicated exercise was so hard, there was nothing stopping me from ballooning up. Honestly, I hadn't made any meaningful progress until you moved in. So you have my thanks."

"You're welcome, though I don't feel like I've done much to help."

"Having someone like you to exercise with is more helpful then you think." She made her point with a few friendly pats to his stomach before she resumed rubbing it. "So what's your story?"

"It's kinda a long story. it all started when I met Audrey."

"You didn't mention anything about gaining weight in your report."

"Well, it -UUURRP- it's not important or anything. And I'm a bit too embarrassed to have it on some military record somewhere." He then cleared his throat. "Anyways, after I saved Audrey we were both starving so did a quick pit stop for some hot dogs. Heh, you should've seen her. At first she was complaining about how impolite it was to eat while walking but as soon as she took a bite she had this huge smile on her face."

"I don't think I've ever seen her smile like that." Sure, Marida had seen Audrey smile, but it was never like how Banagher described it.

"Well, she doesn't really like -URP- it here."

"I'm aware of that but she has her obligations." She said before Banagher let out a giant burp, both because it helped his tummy feel better and in order to end that topic before it got heated. He felt that if Audrey wasn't currently free, or as free as anyone can be in their current situation, he probably would've flown off the handle at Marida.

"Anyways, she really likes hot dogs so she orders a ton of them, which left her with pretty stuffed belly but I know she didn't regret it. I gotta say, I was pretty impressed with how she can really pack it away."

"That explains why her stomach was so large when I found you two. I was wondering why she was like that, it's not like her to pig out."

Banagher resisted the temptation to explain precisely she doens't Audrey act like that but he elected to instead answer with humor. "Well, -UUUUURRP- that's probably how -URAP- she felt about you before you got fat, right? UUUUURRRRP!" He flashed her a cheeky grin, the puffiness of his cheeks didn't deter from his charm at all. If anything, they increased it.

Marida chuckled and pinched one of his cherubic cheeks. "True." His cheek jiggled when she let go. "I also noticed you also gave the princess some much needed belly rubs, you did an excellent job of escorting her."

"Thanks, -UUURRRAP- giving her belly rubs is what I do now, apparently."

"You do it very well. So how does the princess' appetite relate to your own?"

"I think that's what got rid of her reserv -UUURRRAAP- ations about binging. She later got me a ton of food for me to apologize about getting me roped into all this. I didn't blame her but I ate it anyways, we shared it of course, and we were pretty stuffed -UUURRP- by the time we finished it all. After that, we grew to like pigging out so we just kept eating and eating together. And well, here we are." He grabbed the sides of his well-fed tummy and gave it a lazy shake, making it jiggle in a very cute manner. He let out another giant burp.

"That's a unique reason to gain weight. I thought your laziness just caught up to you."

Banagher let out a protest burp. "UUUUUURP! Hey, I'm not lazy. I'm just... you know, normal."

"If you say so." Marida showed him a small smile, the small smile of a big sister amused by her goofy little brother. "I take it the princess was rubbing your belly when you were bloated."

"How -UUUURRRAP- did you know?"

"It was pretty obvious from the way you talk about your binges with her."

"Guess it is." A gurgle sounded from Banagher's big, busy belly. "Hope she's okay with me telling you this, but yeah, we -UUURRRP- gave each other belly rubs all the time whenever were stuffed. Which was often, heh heh! Plenty of belly play too."

Marida imagined her two little siblings, fat as can be, bigger then they were currently, and stuffed to the brim on all sorts of yummy food. They laying down in bed together, their giant tummies, which Marida would dare describe as adorable, were hanging out, completely free, just like Audrey and Banagher. Everything that got in the way their glorious bellies had been popped or busted, even Audrey's collar had been popped by her neck fat. They were rubbing and playing with each other's rounded stomachs, filling them with a very pleasurable warmth, sporting goofy but sweet smiles the whole time. They unleashed an amazing belch in unison, one so loud their entire bodies jiggled. As soon as it stopped after ten whole seconds, they burst out laughing, which sent them right back in a state of jiggling.

"Who knew being fat -UUUUURP- would be so much fun?" Audrey was grabbing a handful of Banagher's belly fat, grabbing it as tight as she could to get all the fat she could between her fingers, and gave it a big shake.

"Aw, yeah... UUUUURP! That's the stuff." Banagher said almost in a dazed like state, which he snapped out of thanks to a slap to his belly from Audrey, which made him burp again. "I-I mean. Yeah." He then poked his pal's incredibly deep navel, which made her burp as well.

"You're suck a dork -UURRRRRP-, Banagher." Audrey giggled.

"Guilty as charged, heh!"

In the real world, Banagher continued speaking. "You think my stomach would make a good pillow? Audrey wants to try it out."

As she looked down at Banagher, Marida pinpointed the exact spot on Banagher's tummy the princess of Zeon would rest her head on. "Definitely."

"When this is all over, you should eat with me and Audrey. It'd be great! I have some other friends who could join us too. There's Takuya, who is-"

"Are they from the Federation like you are?"

Banagher was a little surprised, it made him realize how this wasn't the first time he had forgotten that Marida was a member of Neo-Zeon when he was enjoying her company. He raised his head. "Don't think of them like that, I'm from the Federation and we're friends, right?" His heart had gone from calm to pounding, he felt like hearing anything other then his desired answer would completely destroy him.

"You're a special case, but I suppose you're right."

Satisfied, Banagher rested his head and breathed a sigh of relief. "That's good enough." He thought, his heartbeat returning to normal. He looked over at the TV in hopes of finding a new topic on it, but what saw on it was displeasing. "The TV's been off this whole time? UUUUUURRP!"

"You didn't notice?"

"UUURRAAAP! URRRRRRRRP! No. C'mon, you gotta turn it on, something really good might be on."

As he watched more mech action goodness, Banagher yawned, proof that he was ready to go to bed as there was no way the Banagher Marida knew and loved as a little brother would be bored by one of his favorite mech shows.

"Ready for bed?" The big sister of the family said, seeing the sleepy look on her little bro's chunky face.

"Yeah. UUUUURRP! Surprised I haven't fallen into a food coma."

"Can you get up?"

"Probably not but let me try." And try he did, but effort alone wasn't enough to meet success when he was weighed down by his overstuffed stomach. He made very little progress, a slight blush was on his chubby cheeks when he ended his first try. After some quick panting, he tried again and met an equal amount of failure.

Looking at how much Banagher was struggling, Marida thought on how normally she would see such a display as pathetic and pitiful at best, disgraceful at worst. But when it was a sweet and goofy guy like Banagher doing it, it was purely charming. Here was the chosen pilot of the Unicorn Gundam, the one picked decide the fate of the Earth and all it's colonies, the soldier who forced the second coming of Char to actually try, the pilot who fended off Marida herself, the knight sworn to protect the princess. And he couldn't even get on his feet, his toughest enemy was his own belly.

"I'm gonna need some help." He knowingly pointed out the obvious, showing a sheepish grin that complimented his blushing, chubby cheeks perfectly.

Marida got up, which made Banagher wonder if he somehow ate so much he now weighed more then Marida. She extended her hand and Banagher grabbed it. Banagher grunted and puffed as he tried his hardest to stand up, and Marida grunted and puffed as she pulled with all her strength. It took ten seconds of build up and lots of effort but they did manage to get launch him off the couch, he landed a good foot away and jiggled as he tried to keep his balance.

"Well, hope that was -UUURRRAAP- some good exercise for you." He half-jokingly said and sheepishly rubbed the back of his head. He started waddling to their bedroom but he only made a single step before Marida decided to lend him a hand. It was a very small walk but Banagher was REALLY bloated and could some help making sure he didn't fall over. Marida wobbled over to him, her body jostling as much as Banagher's if not even more and threw his arm over her shoulder. Their bellies were touching together, which felt oddly pleasant to both of them. Banagher's belly was so sensitive from how gorged he was that just touching Marida's tummy made him burp right before he thanked her. This wasn't the first Neo-Zeon pilot had to help him down the small walk to the bedroom, she also did so after the dinner at Gilboa's home.

After they both entered the room and brushed their teeth, it was time to slip into their pajamas. The brunette was tempted to just slip off his pants, jacket, and hoodie and simply go to sleep in his underwear and a shirt, less work that way, but he knew that he had to keep his dignity. Plus, Marida was here.

With Marida changing her clothes in the bathroom to give him privacy, Banagher peeled off his out-of-date clothes, his gut safely censoring his crotch. "I really gotta go clothes shopping when this is all over, before all my clothes explode in public." He thought. "Huh, I wonder if Audrey would get me clothes as high-class as hers." He imagined himself wearing wearing a high-class blue sweater with black slacks and expensive white sneakers. He was still fat but at least his clothes fit him, his tummy was comfortably contained within the hem. "It really doesn't suit me but I guess I might as well give it a try if Audrey wants me to." He then poked one of his soft moobs. "Oh yeah, I forgot to ask Audrey about how she puts up with her chest bouncing."

Slipping out of his clothes was easy, even though the tightness did make a slight problem, slipping INTO his pajamas was more difficult then Banagher felt it should be. Putting on the shirt was easy, he knew better then to think the buttons could contain his mighty stomach, so he only buttoned the top one to cover his man boobs. His pants, however, were much more difficult to slip into. In fact, slip wasn't the right word, he was squeezing into them. His large booty and thick legs were a big (no pun intended) part of the problem but it was his belly that was the biggest obstacle. Banagher looked down at his huge gut, which completely blocked him from seeing his feet, and grunted as he fought the sphere and the pajamas, a look of frustration on his face. Now Banagher had no problem letting it all hang out in front of his big sister, so he didn't have to go through the extra trouble of bringing the waistband up around his stomach, he was fine leaving it under his middle, but the problem was that, as previously mentioned, his stomach was so heavy that the laws of gravity had caused it to hang down enough to censor his crotch. He sucked it in as mcuh as he could it wasn't even close to enough. The simple solution was just to lift it up but as Banagher knew well by now, nothing is ever simple with his life these days, not even clothes or adipose.

His stomach was so full and heavy from the food it was packed with that Banagher couldn't lift it all the way with one hand. Two hands, yes, but he needed one of those hands to pull his pants up. "Come... on... damn it!" He grunted, grabbing his tummy as hard as he could as pushed up, feeling the soft fat in between his fingers just as Audrey had done earlier.

"What's wrong?" Marida asked from the bathroom.

Banagher burped and then swallowed down the next one he felt coming up. "Nothing! My stomach's-I mean everything's fine!" A gurgled sounded form his stomach and he burped again, louder then the first time. Marida knew he was lying but she decided to not press the subject, she didn't know exactly what was going on but her little bro was clearly embarrassed and she didn't want to increase that.

Ten seconds later of grunting and frustration, Banagher finally managed to lift his stomach up enough to raise his pants to above his crotch. The second he did so, he breathed a sigh of Leif and let his stomach flop back into it's normal position, the malleable orb and his soft thighs jiggling from the impact.
