1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"Hope Audrey didn't have as much trouble as I did."

Unfortunately, Banagher's hopes were in vain. Just an hour ago, Audrey was fighting a fearsome battle with her pajamas pants. Just as Banagher did, she grunted as she tried to force her pants up, though she less frustrated and more embarrassed then in Banagher's case. Also unlike Banagher's case, her belly wasn't the part of her body giving her the most trouble, it was her bubblebutt. The whole time she was paranoid that she was going to rip her pants. She was having so much trouble getting her pants up over it she had to take a break to catch her breath.

"My butt's -UUURRRAAP- not that big, is it?" She asked to one one in particular as she self-consciously ran a hand over one of her impressive butt cheeks. "It's not, right, Haro?"

"It isn't. It isn't." Haro lamely said. He wanted to say more but he couldn't think of any way to convincingly lie beyond just saying it wasn't.

She eventually managed to get her pants up over her ass and then went right to sleep. In the present time, it was time for Banagher to do the same. With no grace at all, unlike when did the same, he flopped down on his bed, hands on his stuffed gut, feeling it gurgle and bubble as it digested his meal. He belted out a giant belch without shame, he kinda wish Audrey was here to hear that one. "I'm all done, Ma -UUUUURAAP- rida."

Marida left the bathroom and took her spot on the bed next to him, the mattress creaking as she did so, mcuh to her embarrassment. Laying on her side, she placed a hand on his hard yet soft stomach, which Banagher knew the blanket wouldn't be able to cover, and resumed tenderly massaging it. "Ah, yeah... UUUUURRAAP!" Banagher moaned.

"You're like a puppy when I do this." Marida remarked. "A fat, stuffed, belching puppy."

"Audrey -URRAAAAAP- gets like this too when i rub her stomach. Is she more of a fat, stuffed, burping kitten?"

"No, you're both puppies." She said as she playfully shook his gassy tummy, making him belch yet again. "By the way, I noticed you broke your belt, does that mean you really did manage to get it to clip?"

"Well... Aud-It only lasted about a second. UUUUURRP! Maybe two. Guess I was wrong about finding a way to clip it."

"No, even though your stomach broke it, you were able to clip it. Even a second is longer then I thought possible. So your ideology is correct here, mine wasn't. You're still goofball though."

"We're talking about my gut. UUUURRAP! It's got nothing to do with ideology."

"Not true, everything someone does is driven by an ideology, even something as mundane as wearing a belt."

"I don't get it."

"Let me put it like this." Banagher belched as Marida said that. "You're in an eating contest, your stomach is starting to get full and you're slowing down but your competition doens't seem to be. Do you give up or keep trying?"

"I'd keep trying."

"Exactly. That reflects your way of life, that you never give up, even when things seem impossible."

"Huh, that actually makes sense.You should tell Audrey that some day." Before this interesting discussion could continue, a really loud gurgled sounded from the brunette pilot's stomach, Marida could feel it beneath her hand. As both of them predicated, Banagher belched loudly et again, loud enough to impress Marida in fact, which neither of them predicated.

"UUUUUUURRRP!"

"Whew, man my stomach's busy -URP- tonight."

"What did you eat?"

"Uh, one of everything."

"Where?"

"The whole town, I ate one of everything being served in the whole town. Actually, it was way more then one."

It wasn't much longer when Banagher drifted off into a deep slumber. His belly sticking up into the air like a mighty mountain, moving in and out with every loud snore he made, drooling. He dreamed about pigging out with Audrey.

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"Audrey... I couldn't eat another bite..." Banagher talked in his (deep) sleep, still dreaming that he and Audrey were pigging out. At this point in his dream, he asked Audrey if she thought he was still in good enough shape to be a Gundam pilot, to which she jokingly suggested he might be after finishing yet another slice of pizza. He thought she was serious and told her he couldn't eat another bite, a sentence he followed up with a belch.

"I think you've got room for breakfast." Marida teased as she jiggled Banagher's tummy to wake him up, which worked. She was actually expecting it to be a little harder then that. Waking him up that is, not his belly, that she was expecting to be completely soft with zero hardness to it.

Banagher yawned as he came to. The first thing he saw was the plain ceiling of the bedroom. Then he looked down from it and saw his big belly and Marida, chunky as ever and with part 1 of his breakfast. He sat up and Marida placed it on his dome of a middle. "Thanks." He then chomped down on his toast. "Sorry if I'm a little drowsy, I really stayed up late last night."

"It's alright." She saw Banagher just use his hand to wipe some breadcrumbs off his round cheek, not even bothering with the napkin she gave him. "Actually, if you're too tired I could go do your job for your. I'm sure Vincent won't mind."

The pilot coughed. "No thanks. If I'm getting a gift for Audrey then I can't be lazy about about it. I have to give it my all." He then drank some of his orange juice.

"That's a good attitude to have but let me know if you feel too tired to work."

+++

Banagher started part 2 of his breakfast by taking a hearty bite of a waffle. "I haven't seen the captain since I got here, is he really busy or something?"

Sitting across him at the kitchen table, Marida was balancing a big breakfast and writing yesterday's daily report on Banagher. She normally did them at night but she was too busy tending to Banagher's belly to write about him. "No, he lives on our ship. He's paranoid about something happening to it."

That reminded Banagher that the rescue operation was happening tomorrow, meaning that there was a decent chance of something happening to it. "You should, uh, have him come out more often. URRP!"

"I've tried. He's too stubborn."

Banagher drank some water. "Are you writing another report on me?

"Yes but there hasn't been much to write about for a while." The Neo-Zeon pilot had just finished the writing the first paragraph of it. "Don't worry, I don't include your binges."

"It looks like you're writing a lot though." The subject of the reports took a big bite out of a strip of bacon, it tasted really good. The thing about bacon is that it's so delicious but you eat it all so quickly, unless you're eating an omelet but that's a separate dish. But Marida had given him so much of it that he could chow down on them all he wanted without feeling like it was over too quickly. He still wanted to lose weight but no way in Hell was he going to deny that getting to eat all this was awesome.

"I can't just say nothing happened, I have to still write a detailed report. Or else they'll think I'm being lazy."

"Sounds like the writing assignments I got in school. You had to always make them a certain length even when something short works better." Thinking back on those simple days at school, Banagher couldn't believe he actually felt nostalgic for them. Sure, he felt incredibly disconnected from everything and he was rather aimless, which only changed once he met Audrey, but there was a charming simplicity when your worst nightmare was annoying homework. "You should try padding it out with adjectives, it makes it much longer without having to come up with a way to stretch out the sentence."

"That... actually would help." She wished him giving her that helpful was advice was something Full Frontal would want to hear, then she could put it down in the report.

Once they finished their breakfast, it was time for them to jog to Banagher's last day of work. He was excited for a moment to make the money for Audrey's phone but then he instantly remembered that most of his work would just be sitting down and waiting for a customer.

"Ready?" Marida asked.

"Yeah. UUUURRP! I really gotta work off the pounds I packed on from last night." He said as he looked down at his belly and gave it a jiggle inducing slap, it was a little more puffy then usual because of the big breakfast he had.

With a small smirk, she grabbed the sides of her fat little bro's sphere of adipose and gave it a good shake, resulting in plenty of jiggling goodness. "You've got quite a lot of belly to lose. We both do."

"Good thing we've got each other." He sincerely said. His gut took a good couple of seconds to stop it's gelatinous motions after Marida's meaty hands let go. He bumped his belly into Marida's, sending both their stomachs jiggling.

"What was that for?" A confused Marida asked.

Banagher blushed, he thought on how he was blushing nearly as much as Audrey these days. "Sorry, I'm still used to hanging out with Audrey, like I said we mess with our stomachs and bump them a lot. I was thinking we could do a little belly bump for luck on losing weight but I forgot we don't really do that."

To Banagher's surprise, Marida didn't scold him or change the topic, instead her smirk returned. "Well," She lifted up her hefty belly, almost as if to present it to her little brother. "if it'll bring us good luck, then how can I refuse?" She let go and let her belly drop, it wobbled as it hit her legs.

Banagher's smirk returned too. "That's the spirit." And with that, they happily bumped their massive bellies together, once again making both orbs jiggle like jello. it felt weird but nice and fun to Marida, to Banagher it was simply nice and fun. "Now that we've got luck on our side, let's get jogging." Enthusiastic, they began their jog to Bistro Gleissner.

They started panting after thirty two seconds.

+++

3:08 PM. That was when Audrey woke up from her food coma that day. She knew when she went to bed last night that she was going to wake up really late, but she still felt upset at herself. At least she didn't wake up too late to hang out with Banagher.

Her stomach growled, begging for some food. She blushed and placed her hands on the soft orb. "What's wrong with me? I've been waking up hungry ever since I got here."

After brushing her teeth and yet again going through the hassle of changing clothes, Audrey took Haro with her and left her room to eat a big breakfast with Shin. It wasn't as big as Banagher's were these days, but certainly bigger then hers used to be.

"How was your time with Banagher?" Shin asked Audrey as they ate their breakfast together at the hotel's diner.

"It was fantastic, it felt so good to see him again after all this time."

"I had a feeling it was. Only a good time will you get you as full as you were last night."

"You sound like Banagher." Audrey remarked.

"What do you two do last night?"

"Eating! Eating!" Haro exclaimed.

"Haro..." An annoyed Audrey grumbled.

Shin laughed. "I could tell."

It was quite a sight how an incredibly bloated Audrey looked as she waddled in through the hotel doors last night, letting out a gigantic belch as she did so. She followed that up with a meek "E -URP- Excuse me" and then a groan as her stomach gurgled and bubbled, all the bobbing and bouncing it was doing thanks to her waddling was not helping. Haro was bouncing right alongside her, pretty much as spherical as her stomach. Shin, who was waiting in the lobby for her return in order to make sure it was safe, was somehow not surprised by how stuffed the princess was. He wonder how Dozle would react to seeing his daughter so large and round and quickly came to the (correct) conclusion that his only problem with this scenario would be that she had a non-daddy approved boyfriend.

"To answer your question, yes we did in fact do a lot of eating, thank you very much for informing him, Haro." Audrey was a little surprised he didn't jokingly say she was welcome. "We talked a lot. About normal stuff, the rescue operation, of course, each other, what's been happening since we were separated, pretty much whatever we could think of." Audrey then ate another spoonful of cereal. "It was so great. I know I already said that but it bares repeating."

"I'm glad it was as enjoyable as you were hoping it would be. I'm actually glad we're staying here longer, I would've hated to have torn you two apart again."

"I should probably explain why that it is." There was some clear shame in Audrey's voice. "I need to apologize, both for changing the plan all of a sudden and for not explaining it to you sooner."

When Audrey returned to hotel she told Shin that they would be staying here until the operation and that she would explain why tomorrow, as she was way too full to explain now. After letting another huge burp and apologizing for it, she then started wobbling to her room. Shin asked her if she needed to be carried but she said no, she didn't want to give him such a difficult task.

"It's fine." Shin said.

"There's no grand or practical reason for it, I just can't bare to part with him again, even if it's only for two days." She rubbed her chunky arm.

"You keep saying those words like you expect me to yell at you."

"You're not going to chide me?"

"Of course not. Like I said, I didn't want to tare you two apart."

The Zabi sighed in relief, her tummy moving in and out. "Thank you. I was worried I was being selfish again."

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"UUUUUUUURP! Excuse me." Marida belched out before she wiped her mouth with a napkin, a now empty plate on her table.

"That's plate number 15." Banagher said as he took the plate and started bringing it to the kitchen. "You're doing great."

"Thank -UUUUURRP- you." Marida said as she rubbed her now even fuller belly.

"How are you feeling?" Gilboa asked, sitting at the same table but not currently eating anything.

"I'm rather f -UUUUURAAAP- ull but I think I'll be able to finish. URP!"

Half an hour into Banagher's work shift, he asked Vincent if, being a bistro owner and all, he ever saw someone get fat off his food. It was obviously something Banagher asked out of worry he was getting even fatter but Vincent decided to give him a legitimate answer, which was that only one person had gotten fat off his cooking and that was Chloe. Granted, she was already getting chubby from her large appetite but Vincent always cooking for her was not helping her lose the pounds. He offhandedly mentioned that she also held the record for biggest amount of food eaten at the bistro, a grand total of 25 plates. Well, technically it was 20 plates and five bowls of pasta, but just saying plates rolls off the tongue. For Chloe's sake, he left out the part about how eating that much made her so overstuffed she broke the chair

Hearing Banagher call that amazing, Marida asked if she could try beating that challenge. Vincent had no objections to someone spending money at the bistro, so he said yes. Banagher and Gilboa were a little surprised to see Marida have an interest in something like this but they were both excited to see her beat the record, having faith that she would. Plus, Banagher felt like had hadn't been doing enough to earn his paycheck, so he was glad he could now properly earn it by bringing plates back and forth.

Banagher entered the kitchen to return plate number 15 and get plate number 16. "Time for plate number 16." He cheerfully said as he entered and placed the dish in the sink.

"Actually it's bowl number 3." Vincent said as he held up a bowl of pasta for Banagher to receive, it had just cooled off enough to be eaten.

"Man that looks good." Banagher said as he grabbed it, his and Vincent's tummies were touching. Vincent's took up 75% of the gap while Banagher's took up 25%.

"Thank you. How's Marida doing so far?"

"She's really packing it away, she's got this."

"If she does then I owe her a trophy." Vincent said, it was mainly a joke since he didn't think he'd have a torphy to give her for a long time, if ever. But if he did have one, he would definintly give it to her.

"That means you owe Chloe one too." Banagher pointed out.

"True." The pilot chuckled.

"Hey, where is Chloe by the way? I haven't seen her in a while."

"Oh, uh..." He suddenly seemed unsure about something. "She's sick. She's been sick these past few days so she hasn't left the house."

"Oh, hope she feels better soon." Banagher didn't understand where all these sudden tension was coming from. Was it possible to offend someone by asking where a mutual friend of theirs was? He really wanted to ask why Vincent looked like he just asked something incredibly inappropriate, but he didn't want the tension to be as thick as Vincent's body, so he let it go.

"Yeah." Vincent awkwardly said. Equally as awkwardly, he coughed into his fist, it was obviously forced. Banagher was starting to feel like the tension was only going to get even more thick at this point, he was doing his part to lower it but Vincent sure wasn't. "Did Marida tell you about me and Chloe? Our story, that is."

"Yeah but not mcuh." Banagher shrugged. "All she said is that you opened a bistro and that you and Chloe have something complicated."

"I see."

The second Vincent finished saying that, Banagher said "Well, I better go get this to Marida before she gets hungry, right?" and walked right out.

"There you are." Gilboa said as he Banagher waddled over. "What took so long? poor Marida is starving over here." He worded his question as a complaint but his grin and friendly voice made it clear he was joking.

"No idea." Banagher said, absolutely positive that was the best way to describe the conversation he just had with Vincent. He placed the plate in front of Marida. "Sorry about the wait."

"It's fine." Sh said and then started eating.

"Already you've got apologizing for late meals down pat, you're a fine waiter, Banagher!" Gilboa complimented.

"I wouldn't go that far but thanks." The brunette said as he planted his fat ass back in his chair.

As he watched Marida eat the pasta, he couldn't stop thinking about her, Vincent, and Chloe. What was going on? Why was everything so complicated? Why won't they tell him what the problem is? It's obvious hiding it like this is just as uncomfortable to them as it is Banagher, so it must be something they really want to keep secret. And why was Marida allowed to know but he wasn't? Sure, she knew them longer then he did but this came off like something they wouldn't even tell long time friends.

There was one explanation he could think of that would explain everything, something he had experienced himself. It would explain why Vincent was so uncomfortable when he asked him where Chloe was, why he was being left out of the loop, why Marida said the relationship between Vincent and Chloe was complicated, why Vincent said she was sick.

"Did Chloe die?"

"Did you say something, Bana -UUUURRP- gher?" Marida asked before eating more pasta.

"Huh?" He realized he had accidentally mumbled his thoughts, though thankfully not loud enough for them to be sure he was saying something. "No, nothing."

"So I heard you're pretty close friends with the princess." Gilboa asked Banagher. "What do you two do when you hang out? From what I've seen of her she's pretty no-nonsense."

"She used to be but she's really loosened up since we met." Banagher said, fondly looking back. "Heh, and to think the first thing she did was tackle me and demand to know who I was."

"Heh, that sounds like her. But how did that little thing manage to tackle a big guy like you?"

That made Banagher imagine how that tackle attempt would've went if Banagher was as fat back then as he is now. pressing up against him with all her might, Audrey would've managed to barely tip Banagher, so slowly he had time to turn around, which would've caused him to lose his balance, both of them falling down together, Banagher's chunky body jiggling as he hit the ground. Audrey face would've landed right into Banagher's jiggly tum, unintentionally burying her face in his creamy belly flab, both of them thoroughly embarrassed.

"I wasn't fat back when I first met her." He grabbed the sides of his dome of a stomach and jiggled it for emphasis. "We spent a lot of time hanging out and, well, eating. We both got pretty fat."

"Looks to me like you've been showing her plenty of good times."

"That's what she tells me." Banagher noticed Gilboa wasn't taken back to hear that Audrey got fat. Either he couldn't care less about her weight or he viewed the weight gain they both went through as a sign of the two enjoying themselves, a viewpoint Banagher could get behind. "She can really pack it away, she's almost as good as Marida, you should see her."

"Never took her for a big eater." Gilboa noted. "She seemed like someone who didn't eat much."

"I was pretty surprised too. But as soon as she tried a hot dog, she was hooked."

"What else did you two do?"

"Oh, you know, we chatted a lot and watched TV. She wants me to introduce her to video games."

"UUUURRAAAP! Excuse me." Marida didn't seem to realize how good her belch was. "There's an arcade here, you could -URRP- take her to it once she's returned."

"Thanks but I think she'll want to start with a console game."

"I don't know what that is."

After finishing her bowl and burping again, Marida leaned back undid her sash, pants, and top, sighing in relief as her swollen gut bugled out three inches, completely free. She let out a manly belch, apologized for it, and requested that Banagher retrieve her next plate.

Nearly an hour later and a grand total of twenty six plates were situated firmly in Marida's bloated stomach. "D -UUUUURRRRP- Done..." Placing the plate down and leaning as far as she could, Marida was utterly stuffed. She moaned and belched as she tenderly massaged her gut in hopes of soothing the gurgling beast. If before the best way to describe Marida's tummy was saying it was a beanbag chair, now the best way to describe it was to call it an extra large one. She even had to push her chair away form the table so it wouldn't cut into her belly.

"Knew you could do it." Banagher said with a grin. He placed his hands on Marida's tummy and started rubbing it. This was tied with the night at Gilboa's house for the most stuffed he had ever seen her.

"UUUURRRP! Thank -UURRRRRRP- you. URRRAAAP!" Marida said, relaxing her hands now that Banagher was taking care of her belly.

"How do you feel?" Vincent asked. He took a seat at their table once plate number 26 was done.

"URP! Accomplished. Ooohh." She moaned as her tummy gurgled. "And glad no one else is here to see me like this."

Gilboa laughed. "So, Banagher, how do you think the princess would react if she saw Marida like this?"

'She'd definitely be impressed." He said without a shadow of a doubt.

"That reminds me, today you'll have enough to get her that phone, right?" Vincent asked.

"Yeah, I'll go buy it as soon my shift's done." He looked at the clock and saw that he only had thirty minutes left.

"Here you go, with this you've got one hundred and seventy dollars, more then enough to buy princess Mineva the phone." Vincent said as he handed Banagher the cash, who placed it in his pocket with the other $120. "You were an excellent employee, I'd compliment you more but since you're the only employee I've ever had, there's not really much more I can say."

"It's fine, I didn't really do much." He said. "Well, until Marida did that contest anyways."

"If we had more then five customers a day, you would be doing a lot of work."

Banagher was about to say "If you had more customers then me, you wouldn't be calling me a great employee" but he realized it sounded close to an argument, so he dropped the subject. "Anyways, I know it's closing time but you don't mind letting Marida stay here to digest, right?"

"Of course not, though it'll probably take her hours to digest all that." He chuckled.

Marida's stomach gurgled right before she unleashed another loud belch. "I can confirm that." She moved her right hand to the underside of her belly and resumed her rubbing activity there.

"I'll help her get home when she's ready." Gilboa said. "You'll be heading home after you buy the phone, right, Banagher?"

"Actually I think I'll just do some walking around after I get it." Banagher felt a little guilty that he wasn't going to be there to help Marida wobble home. "You know, just wandering around and doing whatever seems fun."

"Still haven't gotten a feel for Palau? I can show you around if you'd like."

"No thanks." Banagher wondered if he could trust Gilboa with the knowledge of Audrey being on Palau. He seemed pretty friendly, like the sort of person who would support Audrey in what she's doing. Then again, that might be what he would think of Marida if he hadn't seen her chase Audrey. "Anyways, I'll see you guys later." He started to walk out, his thighs rubbing together and jiggling.

"Wait a sec." Banagher stopped moving and faced Gilboa. "I forgot to say this earlier. Audrey's caretakers, and probably some other people at Neo-Zeon, won't approve of how you and ht princess have been acting together, they'll say it's disgusting and unbecoming for someone like her, but don't listen to them. You're making her happy and that's all that matters, so next time you see her, do what you two always do together."

Banagher had a small smile. "Thanks, I will." He then left the bistro and headed for the electronics store. "Does he know?" He pondered as his belly, ass, legs, and moobs jiggled and jostled. "I gotta remember to ask Audrey how she puts up with her boobs jiggling."

+++

Banagher was about to enter the electronics store when got cold feet about it, remembering what it was like the last time he was there. He looked down at this stomach and tried once again to pull his hoodie down, to no avail. It didn't surprise him, he certainty hadn't gotten any skinnier since then. If anything he had gotten even fatter.

Still, this was for Audrey, so he had to do it. Steeling himself, he was going to push open the door as he walked in but he had underestimated the size of his belly and found that it opened the door for him. Blushing, he noted that this little feature of his tummy was both very convenient and very embarrassing.

Fortunately, no one was in the store to see that, not even the cashier or any other employee of that matter. He sighed in relief. Since the door was unlocked, the store was definitely open, so whoever was manning the cash register was probably checking up on something in the back of the store or whatever. The way Banagher saw it, the less a cute girl other then Audrey, Micott, Marida, or Mihiro sees his tummy, the better.

He went over to where he remembered the phone was, glad that he could jiggle in here without being embarrassed, even if it was only for a little bit. Just as he grabbed the phone, a vaguely familiar female voice called out "Hi! Can I help you find something?", making a startled Banagher jolt. It was the cashier who had just returned to her post.

"Oh, uh, I actually found it." He said as he slowly turned to face her, even just turning made his gut jiggle and swish. Obviously nervous, he waddled over to the counter, the cashier not sure if he was nervous because his stomach was showing or because he had a crush on her. "It's one hundred and fifty dollars, r-" Blushing, he looked down and saw that his squishy tummy was pushing into the counter. "R-Right?"

"Yup, I actually just bought that model myself." She said to strike up some casual conversation to help Banagher feel better.

"Do you think it would make a good gift for a girl?" He said as he reached for the money.

"Well, I did just say I bought it." As soon as she finished saying that, Banagher placed the money on the counter. "Don't you have a credit card or something?"

"It's a long story." Banagher felt like an idiot for saying something as cliche as that.

"Well, money is money." She said as she counted up the amount, sure enough it was a hundred and fifty dollars, Banagher kept the other thirty dollars he made in his other pocket. "If you don't mind me asking is this for your girlfriend?"

"Well, we-we aren't sure if we're a couple."

"Sounds like a yes to me."

"It does?"

+++

Audrey smiled as she saw Banagher run over to her, his face was red and sweaty from exhaustion. For anyone in shape, it wasn't a long run from the store to the park, but to someone as fat Banagher, it was a marathon. How sweaty the poor guy was wasn't only detail about his body she picked up on, she also noticed all the jiggling his belly was doing. "Hey. Audrey!" The brunette said as he reached the bench, it was the same park bench they sat at last night. Banagher had to take some time to catch his breath as he sat down next to Audrey, technically he was also sitting next to Haro, since Audrey was holding him.

"Good evening, Banagher." Audrey said, curious about what the rush was over.

"*Huff* *huff* Yeah, you *huff* you too." Some more huffing later, he was finally ready to present his friend her gift. He didn't feel that he had a right to say that he worked hard for it, but he did feel he had a right to say he worked a while for it! "I *huff* I got you-" Before he could finish that sentence, Audrey suddenly lifted up his stomach, eliciting a startled gasp from the chubby pilot. "A-Audrey, that's-"

"Why are you still wearing your belt? You do know it's broken, right?" She said and then let go of the chubby stomach, leaving it to slap right back onto Banagher's crotch area with a predictable shake.

"I decided to wear it as a memento." He answered. "Tonight was pretty special for us, so I kept the belt around as a souvenir."

"Honestly, you're rather weird," She bluntly said, wearing an expression that said "I have no idea that what I said could be hurtful". "Though it's a big part of your charm."

"Thanks, you really know how to make a fat guy feel good from being called weird." Banagher said with a small smile, which his puffed up cheeks emphasized, making it even more heartwarming. "Anyways, I got you a gift."

Banagher of course expected Audrey to be happy about this but he didn't expect her to look so truly touched. "You-You did?"

"Rain drops hitting your belly is actually pretty soothing." He said as he tapped his fingers along the blubbery surface of his big gut, which had completely digested all the soda and water.

"Is that so?" She said as she looked down at her tummy. She then looked back at Banagher. "Speaking of your stomach, you must be hungry."

Like it wanted to answer her question, Banagher's stomach let out a loud growl of hunger. "Well, you heard the belly." He chuckled, sheepishly rubbing the back of his head.

+++

Laying down on her bed as she watched TV, with Haro on the bed with her, Audrey was bored. She wasn't sure what it was, but TV wasn't as entertaining as it usually was. Maybe she just didn't like what was on, or maybe it was that she was lost without Banagher to guide her through the strange and almost intimidating world of normal television. Yawning, a certain memory of her and Banagher popped into her mind's eye.

It was when they went on their reunion binge, right after they had purchased a bunch of snacks from a grocery store. They couldn't even wait to find a bench to sit down at before they started stuffing their faces.

"Mmm~ These mini pretzels are divine, Banagher." Audrey said right before she munched on another handful of them.

"Yeah, they're perfect snacks for watching TV." As for Banagher, he was snacking on a bag of popcorn. "Like popcorn." He said through a mouthful of them.

"Manners, Banagher." Audrey lightly teased.

"So all this belching is fine but eating with my mouthful is impolite?" He joked before eating another handful of popcorn.

'I'm aware of the irony." Audrey ate some more pretzels and practiced what she preached, by waiting until she swallowed her food to ask something. "Anyways, is it normal to eat while watching TV? I never thought of doing that."

"Oh yeah, I do it all the time. Or when I'm playing a video game. It makes it better." He then took a big drink from his can of soda.

"I'll have to try that sometime."

"UUUUUUURP!" Was the only comment Banagher felt like making.

"Were you always this good at belching?" Audrey asked as she poked him deeply in his tummy. As she hoped, it made him burp again.

"I dunno. I never really thought about it." He then jiggled Audrey's tummy as she ate more pretzels. "What about you?"

Audrey swallowed her handful of pretzels and belched. "I definitely wasn't this good before. I always made sure to keep my belches to a minimum and not audible. I still do when I'm not alone with you, unless I'm so full I can't stop myself." Then she smirked. "Like right now. UUUURRRAAP!"

"UUUUURRRRP!"

Though Audrey certainly didn't mind thinking back on it, the orchestra of belches they let out after that was irrelevant, her main takeaway from that memory was Banagher's advice on eating snacks while watching TV. Since she was bored and not quite sleepy enough to go to bed now, now was the perfect time to try it out. So she left her room for the hotel lobby, where three vending machines were placed. She made three trips from the lobby back to her room, carrying all the junk food that she could each time. It was exhausting to the poor girl, she had to take a break between the second and third runs, a break she spent snacking on her haul, of course.

Once her third run was done and she had wiped the sweat from her brow, Audrey started gobbling up snacks and soda as she watched TV from the comfort of her bed, her impressive booty sinking into the mattress, which made her feel even more self-conscious then usual. Thankfully she managed to push those thoughts away by reminding herself of the vow she made with Banagher. "Bring on the pies" indeed.

Snacking while watching TV turned out to be as enjoyable as she hoped, there was something so great about kicking back and stuffing your face as your TV entertained you. Far more enjoyable then all those political dinners and banquets she had to attend under Haman's care. If only Banagher was with her then, she firmly believed that he would've convinced her to go to town on the food there with him. Even with them only being eight years old, Audrey had a feeling they still would've been able to out-eat any of the adults there, even Haman herself, if she knew what fun was. Though now that she thought about, the Zabi was pretty sure Haman would've lost on purpose to her.

Even the shows seemed better with snacks, even with her loud belches drowning out the dialogue sometimes. Fittingly enough, one of the animated shows she was watching just happened to show a petite, redheaded girl eating herself silly and getting a huge stuffed belly as a gag. She kinda wanted to watch that scene with Banagher now but she had forgotten the name of the show, and wasn't going to use the remote to look it up on the TV guide when she would be snacking instead. She did partly remember the show's name though, it was something starting with "Gin". Presumably the show's full title was a pun based on the beer of the same name, though she didn't see anyone drinking gin in the episode she watched.

The blonde had heard the saying that time flies when you're having fun. For her that proved untrue, whether it was binging or watching TV, it always seemed to last forever. This time was no different. Once she had finally eaten everything she brought up, Audrey's belly was just as inflated as it was when she was full of soda. Letting out an unladylike burp, she looked at her stomach and gave it a poke, it gurgled in response. Rubbing it, she felt a little drowsy. "Banagher, -UUUUUURRP- your advice is as wise as that of a life guru. UUUURRRP!" She joked with a goofy smile. "I wonder what he's saying to Marida right now. Knowing him, he's saying something weirdly charming charm like"

+++

"URRRRRRRP! Ahh~" Banagher burped as he finished another big forkful of pasta.

"Excuse you." Marida teased.

"Sorry about that." Banangher then finsihed his last slice of pizza for the day.

"I've noticed Ital -UUUUURP-! Excuse me." Marida was still firmly bloated, and Banagher was starting to rejoin her in that category. "I've noticed Italian cuisine is your favorite."

"UUUUURP! Oh yeah, pizza and pasta are great." He heartily slapped his big belly, which had started to bloat up around the time he finished his second slice of pizza. "A lot of people prefer spaghetti, but pasta is way better." He eagerly dug into the last bits of pasta in his bowl, he ate so quickly even Marida was a little shocked by his gluttony.

He placed the now empty bowl down on the coffee table, along with the other dishes, and leaned back in the couch, tapping his full belly. He let out a sigh of pleasure. "That was good. UUUUURP!"

"I'm glad that seems to have satisfied your gluttonous appetite." After a brief struggle, Marida got up and headed towards the kitchen as Banagher rubbed his gut. Soon she returned with a plate in one hand and a big bowl in the other. "Would you like some dessert?" She said as she placed them on the coffee table, the plate contained a hearty helping of cookies and the bowl contained a lot of chocolate ice cream, with a spoon to eat it with.

"Oh yeah!"

+++

"UUUUURRP! Ahh~ That hit the spot." Banagher moaned, a content look on his chubby face, hands on his stuffed belly, it was as massive as it was after the burping contest.

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
The morning, well, it was practically the morning to Banagher, started off as it usually did for the chunky pilot: Him snoring away with his big gut sticking straight up into the air, almost proudly. If there was an argument for being obese, Marida felt this sight was one of the better ones. "Good morning, Banagher." She politely said as she not-so-politely grabbed a big handful of his pale belly fat and shook it. To her amusement, this took a bit to wake him up.

"... I'm awake, I'm awake." He then yawned, his tummy took a second to stop jiggling. He sat up and Marida placed his big breakfast on his big belly.

"Is breakfast the only thing you've used your gut as a table for?" Marida inquired as she looked at this butterball's gut.

"So far, yeah." He then took a big bite out of a waffle. "I should do it more often, eating pizza or ice cream on my gut would be great. Or I could put stuff like a controller or my phone on it."

"I hope you don't think that's proper etiquette for eating with the princess."

"I don't think she'd mind." He took a break from his waffles to gobble up some cereal. "Hey, what time is it? You said you have to go on patrol today."

"It's 3:18."

"Why didn't you wake me up at 12 PM like usual?"

"You earned a few extra hours of sleep."

When he finished pigging out on his breakfast, Banagher let out a pleased sigh as he rubbed his tummy, a content look on his round face. Though when it came to Marida's own round face, she had a look of expectation. "What?" Banagher said.

"I'm just waiting for you to belch, you always do after you finish breakfast."

"Hey, I don't -UUUURRP-!" Predictably enough, he did belch, leading to a goofy, embarrassed grin on his pie-like face, and an amused one on Marida's. "Well, it was a compliment in France. That's what Audrey said, anyways."

With Marida taking the plates, Banagher went to the bathroom to shower. As much as he had come to view this place as a second home, it still felt really weird to take a shower here, mainly because of how he had to be naked. Even though his heavy, hanging, belly pretty much censored his crotch. "That's another nice thing about being fat." He thought as he poked it. "Though it's a pain having to move this big thing when I need to get water there."

Once his shower was done and he brushed his teeth, Banagher squeezed into his outdated clothes. "God I hope I can get some new clothes before I explode right out of these things in front of Audrey. I'm leaving today and I'm sure Mihiro has bigger clothes for me and Audrey on the ship. So I've just gotta go through a few more hours without ripping anything. Hope I don't drop anything, I know I'll just forget about my clothes and lean down to pick it up like a dumbass."

With most of his preparations for the day finished, it was time for the best one: Getting to stuff himself with part 2 of his breakfast. But once he was about to dig in, he realized this was probably the last time he and Marida were going to do this. No more getting woken up by the best big sister he could've asked for. No more asking her for advice. No more getting stuffed with food she prepared for him out of love. No more cheering her on as she wolfed down mountains of food. No more walks in the park with her. No more exercising together. No more.

He felt like someone had taken hold of him and replaced all his joy with sorrow. Having to say goodbye to someone like her, it all felt so familiar.

"What's wrong?" Those words from her made it so hard for Banagher to not just spill it all to her. He was positive that he would've if only he was at stake, but he wasn't, telling her the truth would endanger Audrey. And even if she wasn't, there all the soldiers of Londo Bell and ECOAS that were going to kill and be killed for him tonight.

"Marida."

"Yes?"

"Can-Can I see you off today?"

"I was actually just about to leave, but I'll wait for you to finish eating on one condition."

"What is it?"

She showed a small smile. "Enjoy your breakfast like you always do."

He smiled back at her, it was different type of smile, one of relief. "I will." That was what he said right before he dug in with gluttony rivaling the night at Gilboa's house.

"Was eating at that speed a compliment in France too?" She teased.

"I think it's a pretty universal compliment." He said through a mouthful of bacon, Marida barely understood what he said, and she was pretty sure the only reason she could at all was because of her special abilities.

He finished up his breakfast in record time, not because he wanted to hurry up so Marida would be on time, but because he wanted to make their last meal together as enjoyable as possible, he felt he succeeded in that. Contently resting a hand on his somewhat bloated tummy, Banagher leaned back in his chair and unleashed a booming belch, looking very pleased.

"Thank you." Marida said.

"You're -URRRP- welcome." Banagher casually tapped his fingers like a piano on his gurgling belly.

"I noticed you put your belt back on even though it's broken."

"Oh yeah, I wear it as a memento."

"A memento of what?"

It only took a second for Banagher to realize his careless words had backed him into a corner. Obviously he couldn't tell her the truth, as hat would mean telling her that Audrey was on Palau. "Oh, you know the time where" Then he felt like a cartoon character when a light bulb appears over their head. "Where you said my philosophy of trying even when it seems impossible was right."

"I see. I didn't think there such a logical reason to wear a broken belt before but like usual, you never fail to impress."

+++

As Marida guided Banagher to where he would see her off, the sights of the town seemed to grow more unfamiliar the closer they got their destination. "I don't think I've been here before."

"I'm not surprised, there's nothing of note this way besides the spaceport." Marida said. "No arcades, eateries, video game stores, model shops, or anything else you'd be interested in."

"I think you just listed some hobbies you know people my age like."

"Well, you're into all those things, aren't you?"

"Yup!"

Marida chuckled, she was starting to think a doughy look suited such a goofy little bro. "I actually brought you through here when you were captured. I had to carry you."

"That couldn't have been easy." The brunette ran a hand across his jiggly tummy.

"It wasn't, I had to take a lot of breaks. When I pulled you out of the Unicorn, I was surprised to see the pilot was so fat and out-of-shape."

A small blush appeared on Banagher's face, he looked down at his beanbag chair of a stomach, noting how he couldn't even see his feet. "Yeah, most people probably would've-Oof!" Banagher was cut off as his fat belly collided with another, waves of blubber jiggling.

"Watch where you're going!" An obnoxious voice rhetorically said. The voice sounded familiar to Banagher but he couldn't quite recall where

"Don't try it, Angelo. It was obvious you meant to bump into him." Marida said, Banagher didn't even need to look at her to tell that she had an annoyed expression on.

Both Banagher and Marida nearly did a double take when they saw how different Angelo looked. He looked to be over at least a hundred pounds different. He once flat, though not muscular at all, stomach was now a large orb-shaped tummy that was very soft and jiggly. The buttons on his uniform were visibly tight, and very much so, there was even a gap at the bottom where some of his pale blubber could be seen. His tummy had a hang to it, causing it to slap onto his meaty thighs whenever he walked, which he wasn't doing much of these days. Speaking of his legs, they were impressively thick. They so were thick and meaty that they constantly rubbed together, with zero separation. They jiggled with every step, and not just because his belly would bounce into them. These chubby legs went perfectly with his bubble-butt, which was so big it was rivaling Micott's booty. Each cheek was incredibly soft and plush, the size of bowling balls. Any normal sized chair he planted his booty in, including in the cockpit of his mobile suit, would be filled up up, with fat spilling off the sides. Assuming the chair didn't break. His butt jiggled with every step he made, they would be especially jiggly on the rare occasion that he was running. His chest had turned into a pair of two, small puffballs of fat that rested on his tummy, which they jigged with. His face was round, pie-like in fact, complete with chubby cheeks and a double-chin. These features left him completely incapable of appearing intimidating, only cute, much to his dismay.

"You're feeling quite protective of the enemy today, Marida." Angelo snidely said. He looked down and was dismayed to see that Banagher's belly was significantly bigger then his. "Impossible! I've been eating far more then you!" He shouted.

"Trust me, Angelo, no one is ever going to beat him at having a huge gut." She slapped his belly for emphasis, making it jiggle like mad. "This boy is talented at getting a huge belly."

"Hey, you're that guy who hit me!" Banagher shouted.

"What?!" Marida grabbed Angelo's shoulder, tightly. He grunted in pain, rage written on his face. "What did you do?" Her voice was like a massive icicle. Icy, sharp, and deadly.

"I didn't do anything!" Marida gripped even harder, and Angelo grunted in even more pain. "Okay! I threw him against a wall and hit him."

She responded to that answer by swiftly throwing him against a wall, far harder and stronger then Angelo did to Banagher.

Waddling over, she looked down at him, literally and metaphorically, and gave her superior officer orders. "Don't bother my little brother ever again."
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.title: Don't Talk to Me or My Fat Little Bro Ever Again

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Angelo struggled to get up, his blubber did little, if anything, to shield him from the impact. "You'll regret this!" He snarled right before he got up.

"One more thing." Marida said, freezing Angelo in place. "We'll be taking all the money you have in your pockets, it's compensation for what you did to Banangher."

"I don't have any money!" Angelo snarled.

All it took was Marida cracking her knuckles and walking forward, without saying a word, for Angelo's angry look to replaced by pure fear. "Okay! Okay! Take it all and consider it a bribe for you to leave me alone forever!" He pulled out all the money he had out of his wallet, it was around a hundred dollars.

"That's not how it works." She causally said as she started counting up the money.

"How did you even know I had my wallet with me?"

"It wasn't hard to tell you were going to a buffet to gain more weight."

"Hmph! Glad to see it's obvious I'm working hard." Trying to hide his wounded pride, Angelo stormed off back to his house so get more money to pay for the buffet.

With that problem out of the way, Marida walked over to a shocked Banagher, who had been watching the whole time in stunned silence. "How does a tirp to the ice cream parlor sound?"

"You called me your little brother." Banagher was smiling so hard he had dimples.

"Oh, I did." Marida looked a little embarrassed.

"I'm really happy you're my big sister." He got a little more up in Marida's space as he excitedly said that, their soft tummies were now touching.

"Um..." That look of brotherly admiration he had made Marida's heart warm, how round and soft his face was made the look even more endearing. "Thank you. I'm happy you're my little brother. Now why don't we have some ice cream?"

Unfortunately for a certain obese blonde, Banagher was so caught up in the moment that he didn't realize that there was someone else he was supposed to be spending time with right now.

"Where is he?" A frustrated Audrey said to Haro, mainly to blow off steam. The two were all alone together in at the usual park bench. "He wasn't found out, was he? No, if he was we'd have all of Neo-Zeon on top of us right now. He's probably just sleeping. Has he always been this lazy?"

"Banagher's not that lazy." Haro defended.

"He absolutely is. I know I've been sleeping in lately, and I wish I wasn't, but Banagher wakes up at 4 PM with no shame!" She pouted.

"Your upbringing is showing! Your upbringing is showing!"

Audrey sighed, the frustration her face was displaying replaced with regret. "I know, sorry. I guess I'm suffering from Banagher withdrawal... I can't believe I just said that. You'd be laughing right now if you could, wouldn't you?"

"Yip yup!"

The growling of Audrey's stomach brought up another reason why she was in such a bad mood. "Or maybe it's because I had a small breakfast."

"You should always have a full breakfast, it's good for you."

The Zabi placed her hands on her round stomach, Banagher wasn't kidding when he said their stomachs were soft. "I know but ever since we got here I've always been starving when I wake up, so my breakfasts are even bigger then usual. I was hoping I could cut down on that, I don't need to be eating even more then I already do. I don't know what's wrong with me, does being within a hundred mile radius of Banagher just make me hungry or something?" Her belly growled again, like a child trying to get her mother's attention. "Let's get some food."

+++

"UUUUUUURRP!"

"URRRRRRRRP!"

Those were the incredibly loud belches Banagher and Marida unleashed in unison. The obese pilots were absolutely stuffed! Their big bellies so full of ice cream that they had bloated to twice their size, making Banagher and Mairda look like they had eaten large beanbag chairs. Banagher didn't suffer any wardrobe malfunctions, barring his shirt being forced up even further, as his clothes had come pre-broken, so to speak, but Marida was a different story. The poor woman's magnificent belly had done quite a number on her uniform. Her belt was broken, her pants' button was vanquished, her zipper was forced all the way down (thankfully her belly acted as a censor for her underwear), and the best part of her uniform was forced open, showing the world that her gut had force the shirt part up so much it was practically a tank top.

Bigger stomachs and wardrobe malfunctions weren't the only change in their appearances, their messy and excited eating caused them to get plenty of ice cream on themselves, from their boots, to their legs, to their bellies, to their double-chins, but mostly on their mouths and puffed-up cheeks.

"Man, that was good!" Banagher gave his bloated belly a big slap, sending it jiggling. "UUUUUURP!"

"UURRRAAAP! The ice cream or the two of us earning the title of this parlor's best eaters?" Marida rubbed her swollen tummy with both her hands, she was pretty sure she knew the answer but she loved talking with Banagher.

"Both."

When the bloated pair were finally finished eating and laying back in their seats as they waited for their taut stomachs to digest enough for them regain the energy to stand up, letting out many manly belches of indigestion, the owner of the parlor, who was also the bartender there, unexpectedly came over and told them how amazed he was by how much they could put away. As thanks for them enjoying his parlor so much, and for all the money they had given him, he bestowed upon them the title of his parlor's best eaters. He even planned to put their names faces together on a plaque in the place. When he got ready to take a picture of them together, the tubby redhead realized she and Banagher were covered in ice cream and should probably clean up first, but the owner said it works better this way.

"And of course, -UUUURRRP- getting to spend more time with you." Banagher added.

The two rubbed each other's packed-full tummies as they wobbled to the port, those full bellies jiggling and wobbling, along with their chunky legs and big boobs. The incredibly obese big sister and little brother burped many times, occasionally starling a passerby, and earning them many stares. Banagher and Marida would compliment the other when they unleashed a particular loud burp, which never failed to elicit a sense of pride in the other.

Some groaning, belching, and jiggling later, the two arrived at the port. Banagher felt his heart rate increase and his body tense up, he felt so stupid for getting so caught up in the fun that he had let it slip his mind that he was going to have to say goodbye.

"Before -URRP- I go, there's something I need to say." Marida said, she and Banagher still massaging in each other's tummies.

"URP! About what?" Banagher didn't want to let go, metaphorically or literally.

"Ever since I was assigned as your guardian,"

Banagher opened his mouth.

"Or more accurately, your big sister,"

Banagher closed it.

"I've been thinking about what exactly the captain's goal with it was."

"But he already told us, he said it was to convince me to join you guys."

"He would like that but I believe that he was betting on something else happening. I think he wanted to use you to -URRRP- lure the princess, or as a bargaining chip for her."

"Why would he think Audrey would come here?"

"It's easy to deduce from your testimony that you're very close with her, which would make you the perfect bait for her." Mairda's explanation was making a scary amount of sense to Banagher. "And since you're very valuable to the Federation, they would undoubtedly try to rescue you. Either by trading the princ -UUURRRP- ess for you, a deal the captain would never honor, or by attacking Palau. The princess would definitely use what political power she has to stay on the Mock Trojan Horse as it rescues you."

"What's a Mock Trojan Horse?

"It's codename we've given to the ship you were on."

"Oh. Well, that all -URAP- makes sense but what about someone sneaking me onto a ship or something?"

"That would never work, your name, face and, ahem, body shape is known to every dock officer, it would never work, and ECOAS must know that." The redhead burped again.

"Why are you telling me this? This all came out of nowhere."

"It did? I'll try to work on that. But the reason I told you is that you deserve to know everything about your situation."

Banagher showed a small smile. "Well, thanks. I really appreciate it."

"You're welcome." Marida looked at the port before looking back at Banagher. "I should be going now, my master is mad enough at me for being so late. I'll see you when I get back."

Feeling like this could very well be his last chance to do this, Banagher embraced Marida in a big hug, surprising her, their bellies were like two pillows pushing together. As soon as the short-lived shock was gone, Mairda smiled and hugged him back, she supposed she should've expected that. It only lasted fifteen seconds but to Banagher it felt like eternity.

When the embrace ended, she patted Banagher on his head and warmly said "See you soon." It was hard for Banagher to fight back his tears, he could only do so until she was gone.

+++

"Hey, where's Audrey?" Banagher said to no one in particular as he looked at the completely empty park bench. "That's odd, she's always here before me.

"UUUUUUUURP!"

An incredibly loud and manly burp shocked Banagher. He looked at the source, which turned out to be a an equally bloated Audrey wobbling to him as she held Haro.

"Uuuggh... Too much cheese... UUUUURP!"

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"Audrey? The hell happened to you?"

"I..." Audrey paused to let out another burp, she thought to herself on she seemed to losing the right to be called a proper princess more and more with ever passing day. She wasn't sure if that was a good thing or a bad thing. "I had a light -URRRP- breakfast and, well, I got hungry while waiting for you, so I had to "make up" for the difference." She gently pet her tummy a few times, even that was enough to make it gurgle loudly, Audrey groaned as her belly did so.

The princess mercifully plated her humongous booty on the bench, groaning again, this time in relief. Banagher sat down next to her, also groaning in relief. "So -URAP- why are you as bloated as me this time?"

Banagher contently drummed his finger along his belly as he explained. "I has a good time with Marida at the ice cream parlor. UUURRP! We're now it's best eaters."

"I had a feeling that was the case, since you're -UUURRP- covered with the stuff." Audey snarked as she poked Banagher in his belly and listened to him belch loudly, making for what was quite the adorable scene to the blonde. "Your eating habits could use some work." With a sweet smile, she took out a napkin from her pocket and began cleaning up Banagher.

"So where did you eat?" Banagher said as Audrey started her clean up by wiping the bits of ice cream off her pal's belly.

"Pizza. You remember that one pizzeria we ate at during our reunion? The -URP- one where -UURAAAP- that man got upset at you for beating his eating record without even trying. I ate there."

"I still don't get why he took it so badly. I know this is a poor place but two extra-large pizzas isn't that impressive. UUUURRP! Must be a new place if that's the most anyone's ever eaten there."

"He was lying. I checked and the owner doesn't keep track of stuff like that." She finished cleaning Banagher's bare belly, then she moved onto cleaning his shirt and man boobs. She felt tempted to use as an excuse to sneak a grab but she knew that would be wrong of her, and she was still too embarrassed to ask for permission.

"We should've figured he was a -UUUUURP- a scam artist when he started talking about us having to pay him for "cheating". How do you even cheat at eating?" A small smirk formed on Banagher's face as he remembered how Audrey stood up for him that night. "I gotta say you can really-Ah!" Banagher was silenced when Audrey's napkin reached his flabby man boobs. For a brief moment, both were frozen as they looked at the sight of her soft, napkin-covered hand on his squishy man boob. Blushing, words failed both of them. They both knew beforehand that she would obviously have to touch his moobs in order to clean the bits of ice cream on that part of his shirt, but it was still an awkward moment when it happened. The scene was only five seconds but it felt way longer to them. And Haro.

When she regained the ability to move, Audrey hastily cleaned up his chest and then started cleaning his pants, returning to her normal calm speed of cleaning. "Um, what were you saying?"

"I-I was just gonna say that you really know how to make yourself look imposing. Being chubby sure hasn't affected you there."

"Thank you, though I think that was just my status doing all the work."

"No way, you're tough. Just like -UUUUURP- your dad and Marida."

Audrey felt embarrassed having such a big smile in front of Banagher. She hoped looking down at the pilot's thighs as she cleaned then kept him from noticing it, she was incorrect. "Thank you. Oh, you'll have to clean the rest of your pants, I can't reach past your thighs."

"Gotcha." Audrey handed Banagher the napkin and started wiping. He had tl lift his legs up, bending over was way too painful while he was this stuffed.

Audrey looked up at the sky as Banagher cleaned, she saw nothing but dark clouds. "Looks like -URAP- it's going to rain again."

"Does that mean we're dancing again?"

"I don't want to risk getting distracted. I don't know if you read the details on the map I gave you yet but we're supposed to initiate our part of the plan as soon as it gets dark."

"Can't we just go now?"

"The guards will get suspicious if they see us loitering outside the spaceport. Even my authority -URAP- won't stop them from reporting it to Full Frontal. He might've even chosen to inform them about my disappearance."

Banagher finished cleaning his pants and boots and handed the napkin back to Audrey, who then cleaned his face. he loved feeling up his round as a pie face.

"Thanks." He said, showing his appreciation with a smile. He followed it up with a big belch, still smiling. Audrey found it oddly charming.

"You're welcome." The princess placed the napkin back in he pocket, he would throw it out as soon as she passed a trash can. "How are you feeling? About the operation, I mean."

"Awful. It's the worst kind of dread I've ever felt."

Audrey burped into her fist. She apologized with a polite "Excuse me", both for the expulsion of gas and for accidentally making Banagher's moment a little harder to take seriously. "I see. That's natural, it is the first time you knew beforehand that you were going to fight."

"Audrey, when we get back to the Argama, there's something I need to tell you. It's very important."

"Can't you tell me now? We've still got an hour or two until it gets dark."

"I want to say it when I've got a clear head, I don't need anymore stress and this is something I don't even really understand myself."

"I understand."

"You two should be spending this time having fun." Haro interjected.

Banagher and Audrey both smiled at this. "Yeah, you're -URAP- right." The pilot said. "You wanna do anything or just sit here and chat?" He asked the Zabi.

"Well, I could use a belly rub." Audrey then emphasized her point by burping loudly and patting her jiggly stomach. "And it looks like you could too."

"You know I could never turn down a belly rub from you." The two started rubbing each other's swollen bellies, moaning in pleasure

"There is one other thing I'd -URRRP- like to do."

A small burp left Banagher's mouth. "What is it?"

"I was thinking we -UUURAAP- could go on a nice walk in the rain, rubbing our stomachs the whole time."

"I'm up for that. UUUUURP! But, well, getting up is going to suck when we're this full." He poked his stuffed tummy, it gurgled in response.

"I forgot about that." The princess looked down at her massive belly that completely covered up her lap and then some, getting up certainly was going to suck.

Audrey attempted to stand up but her overstuffed belly was giving her a lot of trouble. She had to give up and plop her big butt back down after five seconds. She took a moment to catch her breath, her face a bit red, if there was one positive thing one could say about her attempt, it's that it didn't fail due to a lack of effort.

Banagher tried right after Audrey. He needed a lot of build-up before launching himself off the bench. With an "Oof" he landed a good foot away, he turned around, his tummy and in a gelatinous fashion, and offered a hand to his blonde friend, revealing that he was looking a little red in the face.

Audrey extended her other and grasped Banagher's soft hand. "Good thing you're the one doing all the fighting." She snarked. With grunting from both parties, she was lifted up, though the momentum was unfortunately uncontrollable, it sent her slamming her right into Banagher, knocking him onto his back, with Audrey right on top of him, belly to belly. Their entire bodies jiggling violently, the duo belched at the same time and groaned.

"UUUURRRAAP!"

"That... sucked." Right after he said that, Banagher felt a rain drop hit his head, the first of many.

"Agreed." Audrey was resting her head on Banagher's shoulder. "Though snuggling together like this feels, well, rather nice." Once she said that, the redness in their cheeks wasn't just from exhaustion.

"You know, it really does." Banagher gave her a smile.

"If I was still skinny, all your fat would've probably shielded me from the impact like a pillow." Smiling, she reached down and grabbed handfuls of the pale, creamy fat of her buddy's big gut, making him moan in pleasure. That wasn't the only fun she had with his stomach. For a few minutes she did stuff like grabbing different handfuls of his tummy, shaking it, jiggling it, patting it, and poking it deeply to make him belch. She would playfully say something along the lines of "Well, excuse you!" to every belch, always getting a laugh out of Banagher.

Once she had her fill, she sloppily rolled off Banagher onto her back. She looked at her stomach, the giant orb was looming over her like an intimidating enemy. "I can't -UUURP- see my feet. How about you?"

"I can't see mine either. UUUURRP!" Banagher casually said, the rain starting to pick up, just in time to get the tops of their bellies wet. "Haro's been staring at us this whole time."
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.title: Cleaning Up and Falling Down

choices: Audrey and Banagher head to the Unicorn
Marida is given orders to apprehend Banagher
A bloated Angelo rushes to his mobile suit
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Two big bellies bobbed and bounced in the rain with every step their respective owners made, those were the big bellies of Audrey and Banagher. The princess tenderly rubbed her knight's tummy as her knight returned the favor, filling each other with this soothing warmth that told them everything was going to be okay. Both stomachs were absolutely soaked with rain, along with the rest of Audrey and Banagher. The blonde and brunette's hair had lost all their poof, and the color had darkened. Besides their conversations, they mostly only heard belching, the gurgling of their stomachs, moaning, their hands feeling the other's belly, the rain hitting their bodies, ground, and the trees, and the occasional comment from Haro.

"Did I ever tell -URAAP- you about the thief on the Argama." Audrey asked.

"I don't think so. UURRRP!" Banagher was holding Haro by his side, with his jacket covering him. It was a tight fit but even though Haro was water proof, the pilot didn't want to risk anything.

"Ever since you were captured, someone comes to the kitchen at night and raids the fridge, I never saw the aftermath but from what I heard the thief eats an obscene amount of food. UUURRP!"

"Aren't you allowed to pretty much eat all you want before bedtime?"

"That's exactly it! It's ridiculous that someone could be given so much food and not only be unsatisfied, but so entitled that she would steal even more."

"Any suspects?"

"My number one suspect is Riddhe. He's gotten awfully chunky ever since these midnight raids started."

Thinking back, Banagher couldn't see anything about Riddhe that would hint at being greedy enough to steal so much food. He wouldn't call him the most disciplined person he ever met, that's a title that went to his father and Daguza, but he seemed disciplined enough that he wouldn't knowingly cause harm to the ship's crew, especially not over mountains of food not being enough for him. "UUUUURP! I can't really see him doing that."

"I wouldn't have suspected him either had it not been for that huge -UUURRAAP- belly he's sporting. It was definitely big enough, soft enough, and jiggly enough for him to be the culprit. I'm very disappointed in him."

"You felt it?"

"Only to emphasize my point. Don't worry, I'll still be giving your belly plenty of attention." She playfully patted Banagher's tummy a few times, making it jiggle like jello, Banagher felt himself go red in the face from that, Audrey's face was pretty red too. Just as suddenly as it came, the confidence vanished from the princess, replaced with her usual awkward personality. "Ahem. That is if you don't mind, of course." She avoided eye contact out of embarrassment.

Banagher let out a giggle, which suddenly turned into a big burp. "Of course I don't. I gave you permission to feel my gut whenever you want, remember?"

It slowly got darker as they continued their walk, filling them with a sense of growing dread. For once they were glad to have stomachaches that required belly rubs, besides of course that it meant getting their tummies rubbed, it helped distract them from their anxiety.

"I feel like I'm forgetting something." Banagher commented, he would've cupped his double chin in thought if he had any free hands.

"Is it something you wanted to tell Marida?" Haro suggested.

"No, I'm -UUUUURP- I'm pretty sure I told her everything I wanted to say."

"I'm starting to feel like I'm forgetting something too." Audrey said.

"I guess it'll come to us later." Banagher then burped. "By the way, you're not getting cold, -UURP- are you?"

Audrey let out a huge burp, it almost seemed like that was somehow her answer. "No, your hand is keeping me nice and warm." She said as her knight's hand made soothing circles over the middle of her stomach. He suddenly gave the orb a hearty slap, making it jiggle like mad, Audrey watched the way her fat danced from the impact. "UUUUUURP! How about you?"

"I'm fine, you're keeping me-Oh! I just remembered what we forgot!"

"What is it?" The causal way Audrey said that made it completely clear she was not expecting the way she was about to react.

"You forgot your seat and your normal suit."

Audrey's eyes practically bulged out of her sockets. "Oh shoot! I left it at the hotel!" Taking Banagher's hand, she bolted off towards the hotel as fast as she could. Which wasn't very fast.

"S-Slow down, Audrey!" A caught off-guard Banagher requested.

"I can't, there's no time! UUUURRRRP!"

The jiggling both bodies were doing put the dancing Audrey's belly did earlier to shame. Everything from their legs, to their guts, to their boobs, was jiggling and jostling like someone was shaking a tray full of jello. It was so much jiggling it was actually hindering the digestion their stomachs were trying to do, stirring up the gas in their tummies, resulting in lots of belching. Of course there was also lots of sweating and panting, thankfully the decently heavy rain was able to cool them down somewhat.

Banagher was amazed by how long Audrey kept this up. Sure they weren't going that fast, but by the standards of the incredibly out-of-shape Audrey, this speed and endurance was incredible. The brunette was rather impressed by his chubby friend, he guessed this was the power of determination and an adrenaline rush.

As soon as they barged through the double doors, the duo collapsed on the ground, like a car suddenly losing gas at high speed. They panted heavily, struggling to catch their breaths, feeling like they were about to lose all their food. Perhaps the only thing keeping their upset sounding stomachs from forcing their meals back up was that the duo really didn't want to embarrass themselves in front of each other.

Like one would expect, someone saw this and thought the situation was far worse then it seemed. This someone was a bellhop. "Princess Mineva!" He exclaimed in worry as he rushed to her side. "Are you okay? What happened?"

Audrey panted before she had enough breath to answer. "I *pant* was in a rush. *pant* *pant* I need you to get something from my *pant* my room." She feebly handed the bellhop her room key. "It's room 7, there's a mobile suit seat -UUUUURP- and a normal suit there." She was too exhausted to care that she just belched in front of a total stranger. "Please get them."

"Right away, your highness. I'll get some water for you and your friend too." Said friend was laying flat on his back, the way his gut stood into the air highlighting how massive it was. He belched loudly, making the bellhop wonder how someone as polite as the princess could be friends with him.

The time they spent waiting for the bellhop to return was a merciful break between the two periods of movement they would have to make, the one they had just performed and the one they would have to perform once they had everything they needed. Once he returned with what he said he would, Audrey and Banagher promptly gulped down three fourths of the bottles of water he had given them. They needed rest of that and another full bottle before they were ready to leave, the bellhop helped them get up.

+++

The start of Operation Billiard would be announced with rumbling to the people in Palau, and with flashes to those outside of it. At 6 PM sharp, a series of bombs planted by ECOAS' mobile suits on the connecting shafts of Palau would detonate, these explosives were specifically placed to insure damage would only be done to the industrial sector and not the civilian sector. Once that had occurred, the Nahel Argama would fire it's Hyper Mega Particle Cannon at the base, pushing the two halves in the type of effect the operation was named after. Not only would the collision crush some of the Neo-Zeon mobile suits and ships, it would also push Neo-Zeon into a panic, forcing a hasty response out of them. Full Frontal would undoubtedly remain as calm as ever, but the initial period of chaos before he could give orders would be massive advantage, one that would allow Banagher and Audrey (and Haro) to escape with the Unicorn.

Speaking of, they were doing their part as best as they could in their bloated states. They were running even slower this time, in Banagher's case this was partly because he had to carry the (admittedly lighter then it looked) chair while Audrey had the easy job of carrying the normal suit and Haro, which was Banagher's idea.

"We're *pant* almost there *pant*, right?" Audrey groaned, for once she couldn't wait to be in a mobile suit.

"Yeah *pant*, I recognize this street."

Both were jiggling as abundantly as they were before, their tummies and faces glistening with a combination of rain and sweat. The Vist find himself staring at the Zabi's jiggling form, there was something so mesmerizing about the way her meaty legs jostled, her belly bobbed up and down, and her big tits bounced. It reminded him of the girls in Super Robot Wars and the way their boobs would bounce during the animations, only Audrey was fat, yet that seemed to just make the sight even cuter and hotter to him.

"I gotta snap out of it. This isn't the time to appreciate how cute Audrey is." He thought. That was when his watch started beeping. He felt his heart race even more. He already knew what this meant but he had to see it anyways. He pulled his sleeve up and saw the numbers on his watch: 6 PM.

"It's started."

Audrey and Banagher reach the Unicorn
