1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
At 6 PM sharp, a series of lights ignited on the surface of the two asteroids that made up Palau.

"I'm reading explosion flashes in Palau's connecting shafts!"

That announcement from the helmsmen of the Nahel Argama was the signal for the Nahel Argama to activate it's engines, entering the airspace of Palau had they had been waiting at the very edge of.

"We're about to enter enemy airspace!"

"Cut the engines! Inertial flight!" Otto ordered. "Transfer all power to the Hyper Mega Particle Cannon!" He looked at the ever larger sight of Palau. "We've only got one shot at this." He thought.

"Disperse Minovsky Particles at combat density!" Liam order with just as power as the actual captain of the ship. "Mobile suit corp launch in sequence!"

Down in the hanger, Takuya and Micott watched at the mobile suits ascended up to the catapult deck. Some of them they had worked on, some of them would soon vanish along with their pilots. It was a bittersweet feeling for them, to see machines they had worked on, piloted by people they had gotten to know, march off to war. It was what they had been preparing for, and they had all been deemed ready for it. But some of them were going to simply be unlucky.

Takuya rested a rand on a solemn-looking Micott's shoulder. "Don't worry. Banagher, Audrey, Haro, Riddhe, they're all gonna be fine."

She really wanted to enthusiastically agree with him, but ell, after everything they had seen and been through, it was hard. "I hope so." Then she remembered the conversation she had with Audrey. "No, you're right. This is all going to work out. I saw the look in Audrey's eyes, she's bringing Banagher and Haro back with her, and Riddhe going to be helping them."

"That's the spirit. But I don't get why looking at her eyes makes you so sure. Is that a girls' thing or something?"

"You're so clueless." Micott bluntly said before she turned around and started walking towards a hallway, treating Takuya to the sight of her humongous bubble butt that bobbed and bounced with every step, a sight complemented by the jostling of her thick legs. "Let's get a snack."

"I still don't get girls." Takuya lamented before he joined her. Their normal suits were already tight on their rotund forms, and Takuya had a feeling they were about to get even tighter.

The first two machines to rise to the catapult deck where a Prototype Stark Jegan and Riddhe's Delta Plus. "I'd like to think all those sparring matches prepared me for this, but I know even wit the Delta Plus this is going to take all I've got." He looked at Palau, he could see a little of his tummy even as he looked forward, he still wasn't quite used to that yet.

As the Nahel Argama flew towards Palau via inertia, a small bit of debris struck close to the bridge. It wasn't big enough to cause any damage but it was enough to give a bit of a shake. Mihiro let out a small shriek, she felt her entire body jiggle form it. She shot her fat stomach a glare and grabbed a handful of it through her tight normal suit, even through the materiel of it she could feel the softness of her tummy. "Damn it." She muttered. "At least seeing Banagher's boulder of a gut will make me feel less fat."

"This is insanity!" Alberto loudly shrieked, a shriek everyone did their best to ignore. Mihiro did the best at ignoring him, as she had a belly to be mad at.

"Hyper Mega Particle Cannon ready to fire!" The helmsmen announced.

"Prepare to attack once we've reached the designated point!" Otto said, he then looked at Mihiro to order her specially. "And remind all friendly suits to stay clear of our line of fire!"

Mihiro let go and looked away from her stomach and at her captain. "Yes sir." She looked down at her console, making her double chin more pronounced. "Bridge to all mobile suits. We are about to fire the hyper mega particle cannon. All friendly mobile suits, evacuate out field of fire. I repeat all -UUUUURRRP-!" Blushing like Audrey at her most embarrassed, Mihiro instinctively slapped her hands over mouth. Hastily turning her communicators back off, her eyes were then drawn to the cause of her gaseous eruption, an almost empty can of soda on her console. She inwardly chastised herself for drinking it right before an operation, she prayed Riddhe and the others would let her live this down.

+++

With all the guards having left the port to participate in the fight, Banagher and Audrey made into the port with no issues besides their exhaustion, and even that wasn't that big of a deal anymore, as they gotten to the zero gravity section. In order to go to one's desired space gate, one would need to use a jetpack-like device to reach it. Multiple racks of this device were available at the end of the hallway Audrey and Banagher were currently in. Banagher had plenty of experience with this device, he had to use them plenty of times at his old job of clearing space debris at Industrial 7. Pulling out one of these devices reminded him of that job, he wondered if all the others were back to work there. He frowned when he realized they might've come to the logical conclusion that he, Micott, and Takuya were dead. If that was the case they were sure to be shocked when they saw them again, not just because they were alive, but also because they had gotten so damn fat.

With one device for himself, Banagher pulled out another for Audrey and handed it to her. "Here you go."

Audrey pointed out something Banagher hadn't considered. "I don't know how to use this."

"Don't worry, it's not that hard, just a little tricky at first. I'll teach you." Banagher then began to put his on, putting the harness on was easy enough, if very uncomfortable for his squished moobs, but the belt part was another story. The poor guy grunted as he tried to clasp it together but his gut simply wouldn't allow that to happen. He sucked in his gut as hard as he could but it still wasn't enough, the blubbery ball was a great wall between the two halves.

Audrey wasn't doing too better. Not only was it EXTREMELY uncomfortable to have that strap press down so much on her big boobs, which she had a bit of struggle even getting it on like that, but she had the same problem with the belt portion. Her tummy wasn't as big as Banagher's it sure as Hell was still big.

"C'mon! Fit, damn it!" Banagher grunted as he tried to force the clasp past his plentiful fat, to no avail.

"We did not come this far just for our stomachs to stop us!" Audrey sucked in her tummy but it didn't go back far enough for the halves of her belt to meet. She soon had to give up and release a breath of air, her tummy coming flopping out and pushing back what little progress she made.

Haro was just floating by the whole time, watching his friends grunt and belch as they fought their soft blubber. Sometimes they would try to push in their stomachs, usually causing a belch int he process, and then quickly clip the belt together, which always failed, as their stomachs came flopping out too fast. Many loud belches escaped their mouths, a result of all the pressure that was being put on their rumbling tummies.

"UUUUUUURP!" Audrey belched loudly.

"Good one!" UUUUURAAP!" Banagher complimented, still looking and sounding frustrated despite the positivity of his words.

"Thanks, you too!" Audrey returned the compliment, sounding and looking just as frustrated as Banagher.

Their tummies were jiggling and jostling the whole time from all the frantic movements, almost as much as if the two were shaking their bellies for fun again. Though fun was the last word they would use to describe this, and you could tell from just their faces. They were red in the face, due to a combination of exhaustion and embarrassment, and wore frustrated expressions that were rendered cute and dorky from how chubby their faces were and the belching fits they were having.

They pushed and pushed against their big bellies, feeling how incredibly soft and malleable they were, the added pressure making them belch up a storm. Eventually Audrey was miraculously able to clip her belt together, it was a very tight squeeze and cut painfully into her tummy. She wasted no time and moved the belt down off her belly, letting it come bulging out and hang freely, grazing the control pad. She sighed in relief. "I got it! UUUURP! How about -URP you?" She said as she grabbed Haro.

"Still haven't -UUURRP- got it!" Since he had the bigger belly of the two, Banagher was having bigger trouble. Banagher and Audrey need to search for a bigger version
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.title: 6 PM

choices: Banagher and Audrey make their escape
Marida finds them as soon as they're in the open
More then one person rendezvous with them
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"10. 9. 8. 7. 6." With the countdown nearing the end, every number the helmsman said increased the tension for the crew of the Nahel Argama. "5. 4. 3. 2. 1."

"Fire!" Otto roared, and the Hyper Mega Particle then roared as it released it's energy towards the center of Palau. A handful of of Neo-Zeon soldiers were instantly vaporized as their mobile suits were caught in the blast, not intentionally, that was simply the power of the blast. They didn't even the luxury of knowing what killed them and why, all they could process before they died was that there was some odd light.

They weren't the only unintended causalities of the unforgiving light. Once the beam had hit it's target, more mobile suits were crushed by the larger pieces of debris, or torn apart by multiple smaller ones. While their deaths weren't painless like the others, they at least had the dignity of knowing what killed them and why.

The impact of the beam caused the two halves of Palau t slam into each other, sending the civilian population and even most of Neo-Zeon into a terrified panic. Yet despite this, there were a few people closer to the effects then anyone else, and yet showed no fear even as their machines shook from the intense vibrations. This was the ECOAS unit, their Lotos standing primed and ready on the surface on the asteroid. "You better be there, son, I'm coming to get you." For people like Daguza, the intense damage and chaos the blast caused was just a signal for him to head to the next point.

+++

Shortly before the beam was fired, Marida was involved in something much more mundane on the outskirts of Palau airspace, sitting in the cockpit of the Kshatriya, her giant butt and meaty legs making the chair a very tight squeeze for her. No, patrol wasn't what she dealing with, she was still on patrol duty but that wasn't her main focus. What was was giving herself a much needed belly rub through the tight materiel of her normal suit and burping up a storm.

"UUUUUURP! Ooh..."

The poor young woman was tempted to take her helmet off and unzip her normal suit, both so she could better rub her tummy and ease the aching going on inside it and so her gut would have all the freedom it needed. As much as she wanted to make her belly as comfortable as possible, she knew it was too dangerous, sure it was unlikely that she would get attacked but it was still a risk he couldn't take.

The redhead sighed and then let out one of her biggest belches that day, it was so loud it actually surprised her. "UUUUUUURP!" Blushing and raising a hand to her mouth in surprise, she was glad she had turned her microphone off, both because command and the other patrol units would not want to hear it, but also because it would be highly embarrassing, Banagher was the only one allowed to hear her belch. "Banagher probably would've complimented me if he heard that one."

She looked down past her massive tits and at her humongous tummy, perhaps her biggest and toughest enemy yet. Her normal suit was so tight one could still make out her cavernous bellybutton. She gave he belly a big slap, even dressed like she was, it still sent her stomach jiggling. "UUURRRAP! Poor Banagher, all alone with a massive stomachache and no one to rub his belly. I'll have to give him the best big sister -UUUURRP- belly rubs I can as soon as I get home." Her stomach gurgle loudly, she clutched the massive orb in pain as she desperately tried to rub the pain away. " Urgh! While he -URAAP- rubs my stomach too. UUUUUURP!"

Soon the aching settled down and Marida felt drowsiness overcome her. She had been feeling drowsy for half an hour by now but she had been fighting it the whole time, as she was determined to not slack off on duty. In fact, she pretty much never slacked off, the only time she ever did was when she was incredibly stuffed and on the verge of a food coma, and even then it was never willingly. And that was the exact situation she was in now. Her eyelids grew heavy despite her efforts to stay awake. As she started to feel slumber overtake her, she figured that since she couldn't stop herself, she might as well enjoy her nap, she knew Banagher would definitely agree with her on that.

She let her eyes close but that was only a very brief rest. Just ten seconds later was when Palau was hit. She could feel all the panic and chaos of her fellow citizens of Palau hit her like the beam that hit Palau itself. her eyes instantly shot open and all her drowsiness vanished. "Master! UUUURRRP! Banagher!" She gripped the controls and turned the Kshatriya to Palau, flying at the top speed the machine could manage. She checked her fuel levels, at around 95%, it was slightly less full then Marida herself. More importantly, that was way more then enough fuel needed for her to reach Palau and fight without having to waste time refueling.

Her stomach gurgled sickly. "Grgh! UUURRAAP!" Marida grunted as she clutched her upset stomach with one hand, still continuing to control her mobile suit. As much as her big gut hurt, she wasn't going to let it get in the way of protecting her "master" and Banagher. Not one bit. She applied all the rubbing she could with one hand and belched many times, even forcing a few out with a slap or a poke, to get as much gas out as she could. To someone like Marida, it didn't feel weird to apply tactics to belly rubbing and belching. Once her stomach settled down, she removed her hand and gripped the part of the controls her hand had let go of.

+++

Rocks and other debris were speeding towards the military port facilities, dooming many of the ships stationed there. In order to at least save the mobile suits, any inside the ships were ordered to immediately leave and move into combat. Most of the mobile suits were able to escape in time but nearly every ship stationed there at the time was crushed, along with the crew inside. Some were destroyed by other ships being knocked into them from the debris.

All of the teams that managed to escape rushed out in a panic, with no plan beyond killing any Federation machine they see, just as ECOAS planned. One team consisted of four Geara Dogas and a Dreissen. The leader, a pilot of a Geara Doga Commander Type, was in front of his team, feeling it was his duty as the leader to take the most dangerous position in a time like this. But even he had no idea how quickly he would be killed. Just seconds after he entered the open, his team not far behind, a shot completely knocked off his machine's right arm.

"What?! What did that?! There's no one here!" He moved his machine towards his right, where the shot had come from. Zooming in on what he correctly suspected was the firing point, he could just barely make out what was two Lotos equipped with Long Cannons. Before he could say anything more, the Lotos began firing again, wiping out the all entire team in short order, leaving only one Geara Doga and the Dreissen. They didn't last much longer, as a team of Jegans and ReZELs led by Shin began firing upon them from the left, destroying the last Geara Doga and grazing the Dreissen's right shoulder. The Dreissen's pilot spotted Shin's gold mobile suit but just two seconds after he did, Shin had closed the gap between them and cut the Dreissen in half with his machine's Beam Saber.

+++

Daguza's Loto stood outside of the tunnel that the Unicorn was to escape through, a hole not too far from a depressurized part of spaceport that no one had ever bothered to fill up with any sort of machinery. It as thanks to the keen eyes of the spy ECOAS had stationed on Palau, for months at this point, that this hole was Incorporated into the escape plan.

"We're two minutes past the scheduled rendezvous and there's still no signs of the target." Conroy informed Daguza, he was in the same Loto as as him.

"Banagher, where the hell are you?"

+++

"You sure you're okay down there?"

"It's hard to read a map while I'm carrying all this stuff but I'll manage." Audrey really was given a difficult task. Reading a map while holding it, Haro, a chair, a normal suit, a helmet, and Banagher's leg was harder then it sounds, and it sounds pretty damn hard to start with. AND that's all while trying to avoid being distracted by the panicked workers in the port. Banagher wished he could give her a hand but even in zero gravity, his stomach was big enough that it would always be touching the control pad, or at least blocking it, unless he had it lifted with one hand. "The map says the entrance is the second left."

"I see the sign for it." The "it" in question was the 14th space gate, according to the map, the Unicorn was shortly past it's entrance.

And shortly past it's entrance it was, they came across it, placed in a mobile suit cage on the ceiling, so soon it actually surprised them. Adjusting his pack so it would leave them floating in front of the center of the Unicorn, both he and Audrey gazed upon it. "What are you doing here?" The brunette asked the machine.

Audrey contemplatively raised an eyebrow. "This doesn't feel right. It's placed so obviously, the cockpit is open, I don't see anywhere a guard could've been placed, and it's shield and gun are still with it."

"Yeah, I get what you mean." He looked under where the Beam Magnum was placed. "I didn't have that gatling gun when I was captured, Zeon had that put there."

"Full Frontal wants you in it."

"Still, we don't have a choice. It's not safe for the Argama and ECOAS if we stay. Not me, not you, not Haro," He looked up at the Unicorn's masked face, the Gundam almost looked like it was placed in an unwilling sleep. "and certainly not him."
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.title: Operation Billiard

choices: A Dreissen attempts to keep the Unicorn from escaping
The Kshatriya attempts to keep the Unicorn from escaping
The Pale Rider attempts to keep the Unicorn from escaping
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
With the objective of preventing Neo-Zeon's advance, the Stark Jegans of the Nahel Argama fired a barrage of missiles into the field. Two of these three were the regular Stark Jegan model, their missiles were large but meant for mobile suit combat, but the third one was different. It was the prototype version, a version superior in a few ways and inferior in a few others. The prototype had less pieces of armor but each piece was stronger then the ones the regular version had. The biggest difference however were the four large anti-ship missiles it carried, each one capable of producing a blast larger then all six of the standard type, a single one able to destroy a whole ship. These differences made it more expensive to produce then the standard version, and it was this reason, along with the fact that it was a two seater, that caused it to be produced in even more limited numbers then the standard version. However, an operation like Operation Billiard was exactly the type of mission that called for the prototype version.

The blasts created orbs of fire that prevented Neo-Zeon form advancing form that side. The goal wasn't exactly to destroy them, that would be a happy coincidence, it was merely to push two bits of Palau together in another billiard effect. Instead of a massive hole, all they could out from this side was now mere cracks. The first two that made it out were a Gaza D and Dra-C, painted in green and pink retrospectively as their new Sleeves colors. They didn't last long, the Dra-C was picked off almost immediately by a Mega Machine Cannon armed Loto, it's many shots tearing the pink machine to shreds. The Gaza D did a little better, it's pilot used the explosion of his friend's mobile suit as camouflage and then fired at the Loto. Despite what one would naturally assume from it's Guntank-like appearance, the Loto was a nimble machine. It's thrusters moved it to it's right, almost looking like it was skating, and fired all four of the missiles in it's right Missile Container. The Gaza D got off another shot as it tried to doge, but such efforts were in vain.

A Geara Zulu that had arrived from the left side of the battlefield opened fire on the Loto, which quickly evaded the shots as the ECOAS pilot moved it to higher ground. That Geara Zulu wasn't the only Neo-Zeon suit to come from that direction, he was part of an entire wave.

Two Jegans were attacked by another Gaza D and a Geara Doga, the Jegans were about to return fire when the Zeta Buster quickly appeared and destroyed both Zeon suits with it's beam Saber just as suddenly as it appeared. "Looks like their command structure's been reestablished, Full Frontal will be here any moment!"

For such a big event, Full Frontal's arrival was so subtle. An ECOAS team inside one of the Lotos taking potshots saw a red afterimage, one of them could only let out a panicked "A red mobile suit?!" before the Sinanju quickly closed the distance between them and stabbed the machine in it's chest. The team inside the LOTO next it saw this and was about to open fire on the red machine, only for a green light to envelop them as Angelo impaled them with the beam spike on his Geara Zulu's Beam Tomahawk. Seeing that Angelo's job was done, Full Frontal had his machine look back at the seemingly defeated Loto, it suddenly extended it's Beam Burner at the blond's mobile suit. He effortless dodged it and grabbed, bending it. "That's odd, I couldn't have possibly missed the cockpit... Oh, I see now. A mobile suit manned by a small ECOAS team, allowing it to serve as a command hub and an infiltration unit. Well done, ECOAS, well done."

As sick as Angelo was feeling, piloting a mobile suit while stuffed to the brim was NOT a comfortable feeling, the sight of his captain's magnificent skills made it so easy to ignore that sickness. He burped and then turned his mic back on, using this brief break from combat as a chance to rub his tummy. "Captain, I can't get a read on the size of the enemy force. Even taking-Excuse me for a moment." He hit mute again to let out a few small belches. Once that was done, he was disappointed his belches weren't bigger but he figured he just needed to do some training once this was over, he turned his mic on again. "Even taking this fraction into consideration, it's far too small to capture Palau."

"You're looking at this from the wrong perspective. Their goal isn't to capture Palau, it's to capture the Unicorn. This force is large enough to create an opening to reclaim the target. It's just as expected."

"Of course!"

"Lieutenant, why do you keep turning your microphone on and off? And for that matter, why are you set to voice only?"

"Um..."

As that unusual conversation went on, two Jegans were destroyed by a pincer attack coming from above and below as Neo-Zeon forces arrived from those directions.

+++

"Juliet 005 laser signal terminated!" Mihiro sadly confirmed.

"Multiple enemy contacts! Friendly suits are being surrounded!" The sensor operator called out.

Despite being a relatively inexperienced captain, Otto seemed unfazed. "Send in our own escort units to back them up! And take us in as well!"

"Anti-air defenses open fire! Release dummy asteroids!" Liam added on.

"Any word from ECOAS?"

"Communication is still dark." This bit of news from Mihiro left Otto visibly frustrated. This operation was to completed in thirty minutes at the latest, ECOAS should've gotten back to them by now. "Can we hang on that long?" He thought, he was fairly certain the delay wasn't due to the ECOAS team being annihilated, Neo-Zeon would have to look pretty hard to find them even in a peaceful situation. Regardless, this was a situation that would require them to time their retreat perfectly, and as much as Otto would hate to abandon ECOAS, Banagher, and the princess, failing to retreat at the proper time could cost the entire crew their lives.

"We walked right into their trap!" Alberto shouted, slamming his fist onto his chair's armrest as he angrily flailed about. "They anticipated everything we were gonna do!"

"Captain! I'm reading a new com signal from Palau!" All eyes and ears were now honed in on Mihiro.

"Is it ECOAS?" Liam asked.

"Negative, it's not ECOAS!" She silently worked on the communications panel until she got the best read possible. "It's the Gundam!"
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.title: Full Frontal's Counterattack

choices: Audrey and Banagher rendezvous with ECOAS
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
The Unicorn Gundam flew through a large hole in Palau, having just entered a part of it that was exposed to the outside, letting him see what was going on, like raising the blinders on a window after waking up. "They're not attacking with much, are they?" This brought some relief to Banagher, the smaller the battle the better for everyone. Though there was another battle he had attend to, the battle going on in Audrey's stomach. "How are you holding up?" He turned his focus to his suffering soulmate, who looked like she was about to vomit all over the place. One hand held Haro and the other clutched her gurgling belly and trendily rubbed it, groans and burps of a troubled tummy leaving her lips.. "UUURRRAP! I'm alright, don't mind me." Her abdomen looked like it was rising and dropping in a painful manner, her eyes were widened.

"Well, okay. UUURRRP! Just let me know if you need a break." He returned his focus as best as he could to piloting and had the Unicorn resume moving. He looked back at the sight of the battlefield the opening in this part of Palau had given him, he was mainly trying to find one specific thing. "It's the Nahel Argama." However, the Unicorn wasn't alone in that tunnel.

"The Federation mobile suit?! You won't escape!"

The Unicorn alerted Banagher to the presence of an enemy machine above them. Looking up, he dodged the shot that would've hit him otherwise, flipping the Unicorn over (much to Audrey and Banagher's discomfort) to see who his opponent was: An AMX-009 Dreissen that was aiming his Giant Bazooka. The machine fired again and again, Banagher electing to go on the defensive, holding the Unicorn's shield up to cover himself from the shots and he moved backwards. Both shots missed but hit the bottom of the tunnel, the blast kicking up rubble that the Unicorn's shield protected itself from, as well as the flare of the blast itself.

The one-eyed machine fired again, this shot landing particularly close to the Unicorn, the blast and debris sending vibrations to it's enemy. Those vibrations traveled from the Unicorn to Audrey and Banagher, their bodies briefly jiggling from them, it made both feel even more queasy, Audrey more-so, who was worried that she was about to vomit. "Stop!" Banagher cried out, he knew there was no way for the pilot hear him but his desperation forced those words out of his mouth. Without even thinking to, his hands began preparing to fire on the enemy and removed the safety on his weapon.

Fighting back her nausea, Audrey leaned over and began working on the Unicorn's communications system, leaving Haro to float aimlessly. "I'll switch us to Palau's frequency. Don't worry, I have it memorized." Thick densities of Minovsky Particles prevent communications via radio, except for those from a command center like a battleship, however close enough proximity would allow communications between mobile suits under even the harshest of conditions. "We're good! UUUURP!"

"Please -UURAAAP- stop! I don't want to fight you!"

This plea fell on deaf ears, the Neo-Zeon pilot continued firing and the Unicorn dodged once more. "Good! Now stand still and let me kill ya!"

The blast again sent vibrations to the overweight duo's jiggly bodies. "All this shaking is making me sick." Her stomach matched her groans. Were her visor not down, the princess would've held a hand over mouth in case she felt it all coming up.

Banagher pressed for the Unicorn to fire but there was only the worrying sound of a click. "Come on!" He kept pressing the button in frustration, each time he still only got the same frustrating click. He looked to the weapon screen on his left, it showed that the Beam Gatling Gun wasn't finished installing yet, only at 63%. Now 75%. Another missed shot, more nauseating vibrations, this time the worst yet. "C'mon, hurry!"

Audrey felt her cheeks bulge up. Eyes widened in worry, she had no choice but to raise her visor and slap a hand over her mouth, looking down her free side, like someone about to vomit over a bridge. Banagher looked at her in sympathy but had no chose to quickly return his attention to the fight.

The Dreissen's main weapon was out of ammo. In a manner that made it look as frustrated as it's pilot, the descendant of the Dom tossed it aside and yanked out it's Heat Saber. However, it's Giant bazooka wasn't ti's only raged weapon, as the pilot sent out it's two Tri-Blades, one having to be sacrificed for the Heat Saber to have a slot. Those blades rushed at the Unicorn, both fended off with it's shield, the second one putting up much more of a fight. Once again, the poor, unfortunately-jiggly duo was sent unpleasant vibrations.

Banagher and Haro could hear Audrey's groans of discomfort, the blonde removed her hand, all three parties in the Unicorn expecting huge amounts of vomit to come flying out of her mouth. Only for a giant belch to fly out instead. "UUUUURRRP!" She slumped back in her chair, her boobs and belly jiggling greatly, Haro and Banagher looked at her as she panted.

"You -URAP- okay?" Banagher asked.

"I-I'm fine." She lowered her visor, she looked exhausted.

Banagher was starting to think it might be better for her sake if she just let it all out. Regardless of Audrey's condition, he returned his focus back to the fight. "You have to let me go! If you don't the Federation will keep attacking! Do you want to turn Palau into a battlefield?!"

"You're why Palau's being attacked in the first place! I'll make you pay!" His machine readied it's 3-barrel Beam Cannon.

Audrey leaned over as much as her bloated middle would allow. "I'm-I am the person you know as Mineva -UURRRAP- Lao -UUUURP- Zabi! UUUURP! I am in this mobile suit and I demand you stand down!"

Those words were the first to give him pause. "The princess?! Just hold on while I deal with this Earthnoid scum!"

"I haven't been captured, I am aiding this pilot's escape! Now stand down or he will crush you!"

"You... You've betrayed us?! Damn you!" Enraged even further, the soldier of Zeon fired on the Unicorn with the three beam cannon equipped on his Dreissen.

With the Unicorn's shield as a protective wall against the shots, Banagher winced screamed at the chaos, here the weapon screen beeped, announcing that the gatling gun was fully installed and ready to fire. Angry and gritting his teeth, Banagher pressed for the Unicorn to fire, and fire it did.

"Why?!"

The shots tore his enemy to shreds, piece by piece, yet the enemy pilot seemed to not care, he kept firing, not even bothering to try evading or guarding. It scared Banagher how similar it looked, the way chunks of it were torn off it in rapid succession, to an actual human being ripped apart by a gatling gun. It was mercy when the machine finally exploded after five seconds of constitutive firing, a fate sealed in less time.

"Why wouldn't you listen?!"
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.title: Escape

choices: The Unicorn and the ECOAS team return to the Argama
Vincent and Travis' reunion is cut short
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"Did we talk into a trap?" Riddhe uttered to himself, observing the many flashes on the battlefield from nearby the Nahel Argama, having just fought off a wave of Neo-Zeon suits. He wasn't expecting someone to chime in.

"Looks like it." The one who chimed in was Travis, his ZII just floating near Riddhe's Delta Plus. They were two of the crew members given the duty of guarding the ship.

"You don't sound concerned."

"I always pull through, it's in my nature. And that luck rubs onto whoever's with me." The next part he said notably more quietly, not like he was trying to hide it, more like he didn't care if anyone heard it. "Not everyone though..."

This talk of luck brought Riddhe's eyes down to the good luck charm wrapped around his pudgy wrist: a bracelet with a miniature biplane attached, he remembered building it with his father, a sign of the times they spent putting model planes together.

"I'm picking up five heat signatures!" Those words from the sensor operator indicated the time for chit-chat was over. "They're coming straight from Palau!"

"Are any of them the Red Comet?" Riddhe asked, this newest wave was too far away for his machine to identify them.

"Negative, they're coming in too slow."

"Then this'll be easy." Riddhe cockily said, an emotion Travis quickly shot down.

"No, it won't. That's less then they sent last time, if more didn't work, why send less?"

"Maybe they thought they weakened us."

"We didn't lose anyone, they wouldn't get cocky from making us waste ammo." That was when he it hit him. He zoomed in as much as he could at the soon upon-them team. It consisted of one green Geara Doga, two Dra Cs, and far more importantly, two blue mobile suits. One a Commander type Geara Doga painted in blue with a wolf on it's chest, and the other the machine known as the Pale Rider. "Vincent!" Travis looked the most serious he had ever since arriving on the Nahel Argama. "Do whatever you want with the others but leave the blue Geara Doga to me!" Unlike Audrey, Travis didn't know the frequency his son was using, and since they were in space, he couldn't simply use his machine's speaker like before. The only option this left him with was to establish a connection by physically touching Vincent's Geara Doga.

The team defending the Nahel Argama consisted of eight units: Four Jegans, three ReZELs, Riddhe's Delta Plus, and Travis' ZII. Were the Pale Rider not involved, getting to Vincent would be relatively easy with this set up. WITH the Pale Rider however, this was the bare minimum he would need.

The two teams about to engage, Riddhe's switched the Delta Plus into it's Waverider mode. He quickly closed the gap between him and the green Geara Doga, the machine seeming to share it's pilot's surprise, and ejected one of it's Beam Sabers, transformed, grabbed it with one hand while the other held the Beam Rifle, and quickly slashed off both is opponent's arms as they gripped it's firing Beam Machine Gun, all without losing any momentum but causing much jiggling to his tummy. "That should give you an excuse, now go home!" His computer alerted him to the two Dra Cs closing in on him. One charged close to him, hoping to fire it's gatling gun at point blank range, but the Delta plus' quick mobility allowed it to dodge both it and the other's one fire and retaliate with a slash to the first one's shoulder, disconnecting the entire arm that held the weapon. Continuing to ddge the second's one's attack, he fired his Beam Rifle in it's Guillotine Burst mode, slashing off the binders of the other and causing an explosion that knocked it away. "Now for the blue one."

Turning his attention to it, he saw it using INCOM units, six of them, in an attempt to destroy the defending force, with Vincent providing supporting fire. The pale machine seemingly burning like last time, it's INCOMs destroyed one of the Jegans in three shots, then moved onto the next one, who lost it's right arm and left leg, only being spared because the Pale Rider had to dodge incoming fire, movements it performed seemingly without effort. A ReZEL pilot had almost completely forgotten about the other blue machine and was unable to defend himself in time when he saw it about to slam it's Beam Sword-Axe into the ReZEL's chest. Seeing this as his chance to make contact, Travis carelessly rushed towards him. An ignorant Vincent saw this and pulled back, switching to his Beam Machine Gun and opening fire, Travis dodged those shots but noticed a beam from the Pale Rider's hyper Knuckle Buster too soon. He dodged it but the shot still hit the thruster on the ZII's right leg, the explosion knocking the machine away. He might've been finished off if the rest of the Defense team didn't force Vincent and the pale Rider to return their attention to them.

"Don't hit the Geara Doga!" Travis shouted, his eyes locked on it's movements.

"I'm not aiming for the cockpit!" Riddhe informed. He fired another shot, a shot the Pale Rider's partner dodged. Riddhe thought he was damn lucky the team's attention was split between him and the Pale Rider, otherwise he would've been killed a dozen times over by now. Even without the others saying so, Riddhe had zero doubt he and Travis were the only ones not aiming to kill Vincent.

"I'm not dying for a damn terrorist!" A Jegan's pilot shouted out. His shield was then torn to shred by the Pale Rider's Tri-Blades. The Pale Rider was about to finish it off with it's Beam Sabers, already perilously close, but was stopped by a ReZEL that blocked the would-be fatal attack by locking blades with it.

+++

"Target sighted!" Conroy informed Daguza, their radar picking up on it as it reached the rendezvous point in the tunnel.

"Good, send a message to the Argama."

"On it." Conroy then set up the connection, battleships being one of the few things a mobile suit could communicate with despite a heavy amount of Minovsky Particles, even far away, "729 here, target 1 retrieved. We'll confirm if target 2 is with it. If it is then we'll depart shortly."

This message made it clearly to the bridge of the Nahel Argama, where Mihiro informed Otto of it's contents. "Captain, we've received a message from ECOAS! They've rendezvoused with the Gundam and will return soon." The officer chose that choice of words as she knew that Banagher wouldn't even consider leaving Palau if Audrey wasn't already with him.

"Finally we can get out of here!" Alberto reclined in his chair, probably the first sign of relief he had shown all day.

"Good, we might need it to fend off the Pale Rider! Tell them to be ready for a fight when they get back!" Otto commanded.

"Should I tell everyone to return?" Mihiro asked.

Before Otto could reply, Liam interjected. "Not yet, that'll just draw enemy forces here. Wait until the Unicorn is closer."

"T-That's exactly what I was gonna say." Otto claimed, which would've elicited a sigh from Mihiro were Alberto not there to make her sigh even harder.

"A-And I was just about to come around to that line of reason!"

Conroy and Daguza's Loto received the message just as the Unicorn reached them. "There you are, is the Zabi with you?" Daguza questioned.

As they talked, a visibly stressed out Banagher was rubbing poor Audrey's tummy. "Her name is -UUUUURRP- Audrey! And yes, she is." Audrey burped and then moaned cutely as the pilot said that.

"Then it's time to leave. We have a route planned that'll keep us away from most of the fighting. I can't guarantee we won't see any combat though."

"Match your speed with ours, Banagher." The Loto began moving as Conroy said that, the Unicorn following it.

"This all better be worth it." Banagher muttered, only Audrey and Haro heard him, the princess would shortly then speak up.

"UUUUUURP! Excuse me." Or rather, belch and then speak up. "Banagher, Daguza was one of the most vocal supporters for the Argama rescuing you, rather then reaching Luna 2 and waiting however long it takes for the Federation to mount a rescue."

"He -URAP- He did?"

"He called it a hostage rescue operation, he said everyone on that ship owed it to you to get you out of here. I'm not sure if the captain would've agreed to the operation were it not for him, Conroy, and Alberto."

Banagher was silent.

"He might say it was just to acquire the Unicorn, and you might think that was why he did it, but I assure you he did it because he truly felt it was his duty as a person to help you."

"... Mr. Daguza, thank you."

Conroy looked over at his commander, he seemed to have the same stern look on his face, but Conroy was sure what was he feeling was anything but sternness. All this time as a soldier of the Federation, one truly trusted to obey any order given, a man who had even given up the life of a family man for the sake of it, and this was the first time he had even been "Thank you" because of something he did, truly told that, by a member of the naive population. "... I'm a cog in the machine called the Federation, I'm not allowed to have a sense of self, an ego."

"Even back then I understood that once you step into a mobile suit, you're a combat unit." He thought of those similar words, and thought on how similar their eyes were. Cold and hollow, like they led to a dark cave that never ended. "No, that's wrong... Everyone has an ego." The Kshatriya intercepts the Unicorn
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.title: Ego

choices: Banagher and Audrey convince Marida to come with them
Banagher and Audrey convince Marida to let them go
Banagher and Audrey are unable to convince Marida
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"Don't die before your old man does." Thinking back on that day, Travis charged his ZII straight at the Geara Doga that housed his son. "Vincent!" His only defense from the firing of it's weapon was his machine's left arm. Even as the shots chewed it up, along with parts of it's head and chest, he kept pushing on, until he truly, finally reached him. One machine grabbed hold of the other as the momentum pushed them on. "Vincent, is that you?!"

"How do you-Father?!" He felt goosebumps on his meaty back, his pudgy hands subconsciously gripping the controls harder.

"It is you!" Relief shined on his dad's full face. "It took me a long time but I finally fulfilled my promise! Now let's get out of her before you break yours!"

There wasn't any reply, he couldn't see his son's face but he looked incredibly guilty. "Vincent?"

"I can't..."

"What are you talking about? We've both been waiting for this, haven't we?!"

"I know!" He shouted, but his next words sounded far more defeated. "But... But there's someone who needs me. She's not well, the Sleeves are the only ones I can trust to get her the medicine she needs. I can't trust the Federation to give it and I won't abandon her."

Travis gritted his teeth. For so long finding his son felt like trying to find one specific grain of sand in a desert. Now it was like there was this clear cage separating him from his son, he could see him right there but there was no guarantee he would be able to open the cage. "Then we'll find it for her! I've still got Diver, Hire, and Bomber! We all know all sorts of people, we'll find it for her, no doubt! Now just come with me!" Before he could hear an answer from his son, his computer warned on the quickly approaching Pale Rider, a yellow Beam Saber in each hand. "Damn! Not now!"

What his computer couldn't tell him was that Riddhe had a lock on the Pale Rider. "Got you!" He clicked and the Delta Plus fired it's Beam Rifle, a shot that would've been fatal were it not for the borderline inhuman reaction speed the Pale Rider's pilot had. The machine dodged, but in their worry, the pilot didn't realize this meant the shot would instead hit Vincent's machine instead. Fortunately the shot only hit it's right thigh, cutting of the entire leg from the rest of the mobile suit.

The seeming burning the pale machine did evaporated in an instant. It dropped it's Beam Sabers and instead used a bare hand to rip the ZII away from the blue machine, then grabbed hold of the Geara Doga and sped off as fast as it's thrusters would allow. "Vincent!" Travis tried to keep up with them but every passing second away from them evaporated more of Travis' belief that he could catch up while his machine was missing a thruster. "Damn it!" He stopped the ZII dead in it's tracks and slammed his fist on the armrest until his the rage was replaced by sorrow. "Damn it all!"

+++

'Enemy sighted right up ahead! It's a Geara Doga, he'll notice us any second, we're gonna have to take him out." Conroy announced, Daguza preparing to fire a Missile Container at the upcoming target.

Banagher's grip on the controls tightened. "We're -URP- so close to the Argama..."

"Conserve your ammo, Banagher. The Loto can handle this." Said the third crew member on the Loto, his role was that of the the vehicle commander: The one who would drive the machine when it was in it's tank mode. ironically, the one boasting of the Loto's skills didn't actually have to do anything right now. Unlike Daguza and Conroy, he didn't have a face or a voice Banagher recognized, so he come to the correct assumption that he was part of the reinforcements that joined the Argama after he was kidnapped.

Right before the Loto could fire, the strangest thing happened. He turned around, looked at the Unicorn briefly, like it was doing a headcount, and then just left.

"Hey, did he -UUUUURP- give up already?" Normally Banagher would've felt relived, but the oddity of how this soldier behaved, especially compared to the far more ferocious pilot of the Dreissen, prevented him feeling like a fight had just been avoided and a life saved. The way he left didn't even seem to give an aura of fear, it was more like he didn't care.

"Terrorists almost never give up so easily, even when it's clear they're about to die." Daguza's statement made Banagher flashback to the encounter in the tunnel, something a concerned Audrey noticed just by looking at him. "Something's wrong, keep your guard up."

This sudden sensation they felt put one thought on the minds of both Audrey and Banagher. "Marida?" Banagher uttered.

"Something's coming from above!" Conroy shouted.

"Funnels! Move! UUUUURRP!" Audrey shouted, very glad that she was able to keep her belch down until after she said that. She was not going to let her eating habits impede her ability to warn others.

The Loto's speed and small size allowed it to completely dodge the shots, but the Unicorn had more trouble, not just because it was bigger but also because it was the only thing the Funnels were interested in. The unicorn came very close to being hit a few times, and would've been were it not for the shield. "Get to the Argama! You can't fight Marida!"

The Loto team was willing to sacrifice themselves if it meant getting Banagher back to the Argama, but as close as they were, the space between them and the Argama was still too great for a distraction to buy enough time for Banagher to reach it. "We'll come back with reinforcements, just you hold on!" Daguza said as the Loto left, the Funnels paying it no mind.

The Kshatriya moved in closer, the three in the Unicorn now able to easily see it. It descended from above and released the remaining half of it's Funnels, but they didn't fire, instead they each got into a position and just waited, staring at their prey. Like a statue or painting that seemed to always have it's eyes on you. The Kshatriya ignited it's Beam Saber and closed in, the Unicorn igniting one from an arm and locking blades. This lock quickly ended and they both moved away from each other, the Funnels now firing at the Unicorn.

"Securing that mobile -UURRP- suit has top priority, even if all that remains is -UUURRAAP- the cockpit." Marida repeated the exact order she was given. "No war is ever truly justified. UURRAAAP! We both agreed on that, right? Neither of us are in the wrong, and neither of us are in the right, that's just how war is."

Banagher aimed the Unicorn's weapon at the Kshatriya as it got closer. "I won't hurt her. I won't hurt her. I won't hurt her." That mantra, or any combination of words for that matter, couldn't stop the pilot from thinking back on what happened to the last person he used this weapon on. The more times he saw those images, the more the chunks of metal being chewed off seemed more human. He couldn't fire, all he could do was fight defensively.

Audrey began switching the frequency back to the Palau one, the crash of the two blades locking made each obese body jiggle like pudding. The two machines lbacked away again, Audrey looked down to see that the force from the crash had caused her to mistype, she quickly fixed the errors and got to the correct setting. "Do it! URRRAP!"

"Marida, stop!" The Unicorn lowered it's arms, telling Marida "I'm a friend". "We can talk this through!"

"... I wish I could forget that was you in there."

The Kshatriya nearly tackled the Unicorn, it's right arm and two of it's sub arms firmly holding the machine in place. The green one deactivated it's saber and pushed it against the chest of the white one. "Surrender immediately, Banagher -UURRRRP- Links. If you don't, I'll toast the cockpit."

"... You're still full from that meal we had together, UUUUURRP! Aren't you?"

"... Yes, I am. UUUURRAAP!" For just a few, unbearable seconds, no one said anything. "That's why we have to work this out, so we can have moments like that again."

Those words should've calmed everyone, everyone knew that, but they didn't. It felt more like she was pleading God to listen, then for Banagher to.

"That's what we want too! Come with us! We can give you a new life! One where you don't have to fight anymore!"

"... I'm sorry but I can't. When we first met, I said the princess has to return to us because of her obligations. And just like her, -UUUURRP- we both have obligations. Right now, you and I are nothing more then combat units called pilots."

"Combat units?! You're -URRAAP- wrong, you're Marida, my big sister!" Shin interrupts them

choices: The Unicorn easily defeats the Kshatriya
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Unknown to both parties, this conversation was being listened in on.

"This is odd. The NT-D should've activated by now." These words were said by Full Frontal on the bridge of the Rewloola. "We've met all the requirements for it's activation without a doubt."

"I think we all made a mis -URP- understanding. Of course, I'm only saying this in hindsight, so it's no fault of yours, captain." Angelo suggested, standing right next to his captain, just the way he liked it.

"What factor do you think we got wrong?"

"I only came across this bit of information this morning, sir. I happened to have passed by the lieutenant and Banagher without incident this morning. From what I overheard of their conversation, they seem to have grown quite close."

"Ah, I get it. You believe he truly doesn't consider her an enemy?"

"Yes, sir."

"Then we need only wait. In spite of their connection, I have no doubt that Marida will still carry out her mission, and once she does, Banagher's-"

"Why are you leaving Marida to fight alone?" Zinnerman growled, his gruff voice and barely hidden rage brought all eyes on the bridge towards him. All except Full Frontal's.

"This is a job only few can perform. The way to activate the NT-D is to get him to fight an enemy Newtype. We've installed a Psyco-Moniter onboard the Unicorn. We'll intercept any Box data that gets revealed by the activation of the NT-D. Since we cannot analyze the :LA+ program itself, our best option is to break the seals one by one. To accomplish that, we had to use the Federation's inside-man to bring Banagher back to the Unicorn Gundam. It is, of course, regrettable that I had to leave you and Marida in the dark, captain." The way he said that last sentence made it very clear he couldn't care less.

"But Marida is a-"

"Yes, captain. I know. A Cyber-Newtype can't be said to be a true Newtype. But then again, what exactly is a true Newtype? No one has the answer to that. What we need at this moment is a catalyst that will trigger the NT-D." An anticipating smirk appeared on his face. "We've yet to see what this Gundam is capable. We're going to have lieutenant Marida draw out the true potential of The Second Coming of Amuro Ray."

Ignorant of the true nature of this duel they had both been forced into, Banagher continued to plead with Marida. "Palau is your team's home, -UUURRP- right? If the Federation gets the Unicorn back, they'll retreat."

"That's the rhetoric of the Federation."

That was when Audrey broke her silence. "Then why am I also saying it?"

Her curt words were truly shocking to everyone on the bridge, not just because of it's meaning, but also because it meant that she was in the Unicorn too. Even Full Frontal and Angelo's smug sense of invincibility seemed cracked.

"That's the princess' voice!"

"She's siding with the federation?"

"Why is she in the Gundam?!"

Those were just what a few members blurted out, everyone on that bridge was pondering something about the princess that day.

"You miscalculated!" But none were as angry as Zinnerman, except for Angelo, but that was merely at the disrespect the former showed.

"Watch your tongue, cur!" He turned around in an instant, glaring daggers at the captain, daggers that failed to hurt him.

"You said the princess would be on the ship! I even asked you if you were positive and you said you were!"

"I'll admit, I made a mistake." Full Frontal seemingly recovered from his shock, he still kept his eyes glued onto the screen. "One that we can easily recover from. All this means is that we can recover the Gundam and the princess at once."

"If you hurt that brat, you'll hurt the princess as well! If Marida has to give him another concussion, you'll be giving Mineva one too! That pilot was out for hours after Marida captured him, she said his head was still pounding when he woke up, are you gong to have her do that to Mineva too?!"

For the first time since he had returned to Neo-Zeon, Full Frontal felt the pressure of multiple eyes being drawn on him. He didn't even have to look to know that everyone on that bridge was looking at him. "... That is up to her and Banagher."

+++

"I knew that you were there, princess." Marida solemnly said.

"So why won't you listen to us?"

"Because I have a role to play!" Marida flinched at her own words, she wasn't expecting to raise her voice like that but she found herself powerless to stop. "So make this easier -UUURAAP- for all of us and surrender!"

"You don't have to -UUURRP- do this! Reject your role, just like I did!"

"Marida, please!" Banagher shouted, sweat starting to run down his face. "The whole reason I even met Audrey is because she tried to -UUUUURAP- stop all the fighting! Please consider not figjithng, jsut for now. Think of all the civilians in Palau, like Mr. Gilboa and his family, they could die!"

"If you surrender, we'll withdraw our forces too. That's your only option."

"You're not listening to us!"

"Because you don't understand what's going on. Banagher, you talk about how you want all the fighting to stop, but your -UUUURRAP- perspective is that of the Federation."

"I'm not -UUUURRRP- I'm not on their side!" He placed a hand over his heart without even noticing it, where the Vist Foundation emblem was, the version of it only given to the rider of the unicorn. "You're not like most people in Zeon, you're not single minded, that's why I don't get it! You told me about the importance of having a light in your life, so why won't you just let us end this fight?! It's getting your friends killed!"

"You're just repeating more enemy rhetoric!"

Those words killed Banagher's ability to speak. His mouth was agape, he tried to force something out of it, something that would change Marida's mind, but he couldn't even stutter something out. His head just slumped down in defeat, he felt like his body was filled with bile. Audrey and Haro looked at him in sympathy, Banagher couldn't notice. He felt like he he in this void, completely alone, no hope of someone saving him. That was when it happened, his mouth suddenly shut tightly, his teeth gritted, his hands gripping the controls harder then he thought possible of himself. "Damn you... stubborn idiot!" His head shot up, his eyes filled with his rage, the words NT-D reflecting on his visor. The Unicorn sensed that rage and acted upon on it. The Unicorn broke out of the Kshatriya's grasp so ferociously it broke it's sub-arms, and delivered a brutal punch to it's face, the impact cracking some of it, the force knocking it away.

Free, the Unicorn ascended and it shifted into it's Gundam form. "There's no point in trying to reason with an enemy."

"Gun -UUUURRP- dam!" Marida called on her Funnels to attack the Kshatriya backed further away. The Unicorn blocked the shots with it's shield and aggressively chased after it's enemy.

+++

"NT-D activation confirmed. The enemy has engaged the Kshatriya." One of the bridge crew informed, the worry he held for the princess laced his words.

"See? What did I tell you? From friend to enemy just like that. Humans truly are foolish creatures." Full Frontal gloated, gloating that even some of the most loyal of the bridge crew found off-putting.

"Your ability to predict human nature is truly second to none, captain." Angelo said through a forced, smug smile. "Why is the captain making me think of... them?" He thought, a thought he would never allow himself to make public.

Zinnerman found himself almost too angry to say something, and at the same time, too angry to not say something. "You're sure happy about it." He snarled.

"I'm merely glad that the operation is back on track." The Red Comet condescendingly said.

Nonetheless, everyone on the bridge continued to watch the visuals being displayed on the monitor. It showed the Unicorn destroy two Funnels with a single slash of it's Beam Saber and charge towards the Kshatriya, like the mere annoyances they were.

"Funnels!" Marida called on her other Funnels to fire again, her enemy kept making rapid movements, dodging every shot, even when Marida added shots from her Mega Particle Cannons to the mix. Only one beam from a Funnel landed a hit, and that was on the Unicorn's gatling gun, causing it to explode. She saw the Unicorn then just float there, motionlessly. She put aside the dread she felt and had her Funnels close in. Before they were ready to fire, the Unicorn suddenly moved, in an instant it was glaring right at her, the Sleeves soldier feeling like those were Banagher's own eyes glaring at her in pure hate. It emitted this "air" of presence, Marida didn't physically feel anything when it hit her, but she could still feel it. It was like hate had taken form and hit her. She tried to force her dread aside and order her Funnels once again. "Funnels!" They did nothing. They just sat there, but not aimlessly. Marida's mouth opened, quivering as she saw her console register them as enemies.

The glowing red Unicorn slowly lifted out an open palm, aimed at the Kshatriya, and quickly clenched it. "Go."
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.title: The First Fight between Brother and Sister

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Mercilessly, unhesitatingly, the Funnels turned on their master and fired, the machine they came from frantically moving about in a desperate attempt to dodge. Machines like the Kshatriya were widely deemed more then capable of engaging in combat with another Funnel equipped machine. However, that was solely because their Funnels would be able to distract the opponent's, in a scenario like this, where the Kshatriya was robbed of it's Funnels, the pilot holds no chance of putting up a fight.

"Don't you recognize me?!" The pilot yelled in desperation at her Funnels, the machines that once instantly responded to her mind.

The Kshatriya had to cover itself with it's binder, the wings creating a Minovsky Particle barrier, it was the only way for Marida to survive even so much as half a minute longer. The appearance and rationale behind it was not dissimilar to a turtle hiding in it's shell. However, shielding herself like this left her completely unable to attack, again, not dissimilar to a turtle. Her Funnels were able to attack when she defended herself like this when she commanded them, and there was no reason for them to not able to now that the Unicorn commanded them.

"Impossible! How are you doing this?"

Audrey balled her fists as she watched, something she was barely able to do. "I know this is hard for you to do, I'm so sorry that I led you to this... Banagher?" She looked at his eyes, they were locked onto the sight of his enemy's destruction. They didn't move, not even slightly, not to look at Audrey, not to avert his eyes from what was happening. Not at all. "Banagher?" She placed a hand on his, she felt no shaking, not even the slightest vibrations from his hand. Aside from the slight movement of calm breathing, his body was completely still. "Banagher?!"

"That's not Banagher! Not Banagher!" Haro said in a panic.

"Then who is it?!"

Her confusion and worry was mirrored by Zinnerman. "What's going on? Is it the boy that's making that happen?"

"Not exactly." Full Frontal started his answer. " As you know, the Psyco-Frame receives and amplifies thoughts and feelings, in this case we're seeing Banagher's angry and sorrow at what he feels is Marida betraying him. Those amplified feelings have overcome him, leaving him as just a processing mechanism for converting Psyco waves into hostility."

"Then what exactly is piloting that Gundam?"

"that would be the NT-D. If it identifies someone as both a Newtype and an enemy, the suit's performance limiters are disengaged. It combines the paranormal interface of the Psyco-Frame and the power to control an enemy's Psycommu weapons."

To bridge the gap between normal and abnormal, to give power to the powerless, to allow the have-nots to stand up to the haves, to give hope to those swallowed by despair, to allow anyone to decide their future, that is the philosophy behind the NT-D: NewType Destroyer.

"But that's impossible! No normal human could handle something like that."

"Indeed, they could not. Which is why the everyman the machine is meant to give power to would need to receive enhancements. Should a machine ever be able to destroy a Newtype, that is the day they will be cosigned to history. The Universal Century is approaching it's hundredth year, the UC Project was aptly named indeed."

The Unicorn viciously slashed off half of the Kshatriya's front left binder. Fighting back the force of the blow, it's enemy ignited it's Beam Saber and they clashed once again. The force of the Unicorn's blade pushed it back, it quickly used this chance to sever the machine's right hand, the one holding the saber. Looking as scared as it's pilot, the Kshatriya hid behind it's binders again, just in time to block a stab. The Unicorn just left the sword there, it was faster to pull out another and then use it to completely slash what was left of the front left binder.

"Or more simply out, you threw Marida out there to be bait." Zinnerman said, burning rage barely hidden just below the surface.

"Puru 12, that is her designation." Full Frontal matter of factly stated. "She is an artificial Newtype who has been engineered through cloning and genetic modification. The twelfth in a series of prototypes."

Zinnerman growled, just barely able to keep himself from striking his commanding officer. He swore that if Marida died from this, he would kill him.

The Unicorn stabbed the Kshatriya straight through it's mono-eye. It left it there, perhaps a monument to the pain he had dealt. Or to disgrace it's enemy even further. The enemy was soundly defeated now, but the Unicorn wasn't finished yet. In it's rage, it began cruelly ripping out parts of it's enemy, an ugly fluid spilling out of it. Audrey tried to tear Banagher's arms away from the controls but they wouldn't budge. "Am I really that weak? No, it's forcing his arms down."

"It's all your fault, you're the ones who branded me an enemy just because I wasn't on your side. All you do is rampage, destroying everything that's not you, you're the reason why everything turned out he way it did! Not just on Industrial 7, but forcing me to pilot this thing and kill! This damn box. The Federation, Neo-Zeon, everyone keeps screaming their ideals without listening to anyone else. Audrey, Micott, Takuya, Haro, they're the only ones who will listen to me! They're the only ones on my side! No one else! Dad's dead, I don't have any hope, why does everyone keep ruining me?! Why can't I just be happy?! Why am I even still here?!" The Unicorn kicked the Kshatriya down and sent the Funnels to crash into different parts of it. The airbags in the cockpit activated but they couldn't keep up with the constant application of more pressure. The airbags popped, and the next explosion sent Marida's head crashing into her console, shattering her visor and knocking her unconscious.

The Unicorn felt no mercy for it's helpless enemy, instead it readied it's Beam Tonfa. "Go on, destroy the enemy!"

Audrey hugged his body, looking like she was about to cry. "Please don't!"

If he could, Banagher would've listened. But the Unicorn didn't, it charged at the Kshatriya, ready to do something Banagher would never be able to forgive himself for.

And then, the miracle occurred.
