1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
There was light. All Banagher and Audrey could see was this aurora, and a little girl. A familiar little girl. They both felt their hearts pound as that little girl reached out to them. As soon as it seemed like they connected, there was light again. A different kind of light. The light of entering something new, your eyes needing to adjust themselves for you to see.

They weren't seeing through their own eyes anymore, but from Marida's. They saw a hand, Marida's hand, reach out, feeling the cold air, and be grasped by another hand, this was the first time she felt human warmth.

"Welcome to this word. Do you feel cold?" Neither Banagher nor Audrey recognized this youthful voice. "You’re the 12th sister. Your sisters are working outside. Come together with me to the outside world."

Once again, there was light. A different kind of light. The light of the destruction of war, the mobile suits exploding and the beams that caused them.

"They killed Puru Three!" They heard a sister cry out in grief

"Master’s dead too. He’s dead!"

"What should I do?" The young Marida called out, even now, she found herself instinctively asking for orders from her master.

"Calm down. There’re still enemies left on the battlefield. We have to purge the Federation. We have to eliminate all of master’s enemies, whether it’s the Gundam or Haman!"

The third voice had always been the leader if the group when the master wasn't there. Her words able to calm her sisters some, their black machines lined up together and attacked, understanding what to do.

"We just need to destroy every enemy with our Funnels. We won't be whole without master but we can do this. It's why we were created." That was the mindset of Marida during that day. "But what is an enemy? Is it something that's hurting master?" Not everybody was pondering something like that but all the sisters had some question on their mind. Their master was gone, the only ones they could look to for answers were each other and themselves.

Without their master to guide them, the only tactic they could think of was to line up together and raid the enemy with their Funnels. Their mobile suits' movements were slow, and they would be massacred if they gathered together.For the first time, the young Marida broke a rule and broke formation. She wasn't far away, just away enough to survive the beam of light that ripped through space in an instant, and the black mobile suits were devoured. Her own mobile suit was ripped apart by the unforgiving light, forcing her to eject her cockpit.

And again, there was light. A different kind of light. A searing, obnoxious light. The neon lights of the city, designed to be impossible to not see. They saw the young Marida be led to this seedy place that held an awful smell.

"What will you do with a child like this?"

"You'd be surprised by what some of my clients want." They saw a middle aged woman look down, both figuratively and literally, on the young Marida. "Starting today, I am your new master."

Once again, there was light. A different kind of light. The anxiety inducing light of the operation room.

"But... she's so young..."

"You'll have the dead weight removed, right?"

And finally, there was warmth.

"Come on, what are ya?! If you're some kinda of Zeon fugitive, I'm callin' the cops!"

From the poorly kept bedroom she had been given, the Marida of then could only hear muffled gunshots. Soon a bearded man entered her room, the man who now fulfilled the role of her master. He looked at sympathetically and approached slowly, and lightly held her hand. "I'm sorry."

The memories ended there, Banagher and Audrey now saw with their own eyes the product of those memories. Even though they were separated space and metal, it felt like they were right there. They could feel her, like they were holding her hand.

The Unicorn's beam ended, instead it held onto the Kshatriya and kept on.

"This is... this is just too sad." That was all Banagher could say.

"Marida... I understand, that's why I can't allow you throw away your life like this." Audrey wouldn't claim she was wise, but even so, she knew without a doubt that was the right thing to say.

"Compassion alone cannot save people. "It can't erase sin or wash away impurities." That was the hard truth Marida knew.

Just as Marida's beliefs came from her memories, so did Banagher's. Just as Zinnerman's words led her, his father's led Banagher. "Even so."

"Even so."

"Even so."
1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.title: Light

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Audrey and Banagher unzipped their normal suits, letting their big, fat guts flop as they sigh in relief.

"Whoo," Audrey said, giving her belly a good rub. "That feels -UUUURRRP- that feels good."

"Yeah, I –UUURRRP- know." Banagher said as he rubbed his own belly.

"So..." Audrey paused to think on how best to say this. She knew this was a very delicate subject, and she wouldn't claim she even knew what to say, but she felt that she had to say something. Or else there would just be this painful silence between them when they desperately needed to hear something. "how -URRRAAAP- are you feeling?"

Banagher lowered his head and closed his eyes, looking frustrated. "I... I just don't know. I feel terrible but at the same time I kinda feel relived. Like I just found this answer I've -UUURRRRP- needed."

"I feel the same."

"Did you-Did you know about all that... that stuff? About Marida, I mean."

"Not as specifically as we do now, but yes, I did know about it."

Banagher placed himself against a wall and slowly sat down. He, Audrey, and Haro were in the hallway right outside of the airlock to the hanger. "When we first met, I remember that you said she feels like a sister to you. Did you ever call her your big sister?"

Audrey sat down besides him, her back to the wall. "No, but after all that, I think I need to."

"You'll make her smile, she needs it."

"We all do."

They just sat there for a bit. There was silence but it wasn't the painful silence that they both feared. It was a relaxing silence, the kind that came about of two people just taking a break together. And no one in their right mind wouldn't say they had earned it and a lot more. It was only a little past 7 PM, but they felt like they hadn't slept in ages. For perhaps the first time in their entire lives, they had so much free time and no idea what to do with it. All they had planed besides going to sleep was visiting Marida in the med bay once they had rested some. They knew she probably wouldn't be awake until tomorrow, but aside from just simply wanting to see her and hear what the doctor says, they felt it was their duty to do so as her little brother and sister. They had even offered to help carry her to the med bay but they were told that carrying someone who is in physical pain is far more complicated then it seems. Carrying Marida the wrong way could make her condition worse, and to people without medical training, it wasn't obvious which ways were the wrong ways.

"Did you hear a voice when I was fighting Marida?" Banagher spoke up after a while. Until he did, the only sounds they heard was their belches, the bubbling of their full tummies, and the commotion still going on in the hanger.

Audrey burped in a loud, unladylike manner. "No, it's not like there was anyone besides the four of us there."

"Guess I just -ORRRRRRP- imagined it then. It's not like I was sane back then."

"That's -BWURRRRAAP- putting it a little too harsh but yes. No one would blame you for hearing things in a situation like that."

Banagher didn't reply, he looked like he was mulling things over. "BWUUUUURP! How are you holding up? Physically, I mean."

"Well, -BOOOORRAP- I'm still a little nauseous but other then that, I'm fine. Why wouldn't I be?"

"The first time the Unicorn's NT-D activated, I was knocked out by the g-forces." Bringing that up made his soulmate perfectly recall the imagine of his unconscious and still skinny body in the cockpit, a bloody mark on his face Audrey still didn't know the cause of. "I'm only able to stay wake because -UUUUURRP- of this special normal suit. So I don't get why you weren't knocked out."

"Well, the answer is obviously that -OOOORRAP- I'm a lot tougher then you!" She joked as she gave him a light punch to the arm, making his bicep jiggle, a big grin on her chunky face.

Showing a smile, Banagher laughed. "Thanks, I needed that." He then belched loudly and deeply, Audrey felt that somehow made what he said even more pleasant.

"You deserved it too, you're always making jokes that help me." Audrey placed her hands on the top of her soft stomach and began rubbing it, Banagher doing the same with his own giant gut. "UUUURRAAP! Anyways, I think I forced myself to stay conscious, I was worried about both of you."

"You really are tough."

Audrey looked down at her stomach and blushed, hoping to hide the massive smile she grew. "Thanks."

"No problem." Banagher then slowly got up, grunting as he did so. "Still, we should probably have Dr. Hasan check up on you just to be safe. And see Marida, of course."

"Right." Audrey followed suit, both her and Banagher's belly jolted as they stood up. "We haven't seen him since our first day here, right?"

"Oh, yeah, you're right. This is gonna be awkward."

"I don't know if it'll be more awkward for us or for him."

"Probably for you two." Haro said as Audrey and Banagher removed their tight normal suits, very glad to be out of them. When they reached the med bay and entered it, Banagher carrying Haro as usual, they saw that only one bed was in use, which was indicated by the curtains around it being closed. Even without seeing Marida's corpulent form, just a sign that she was there made them feel a little anxious. And not to mentioned distracted, since they hadn't noticed the doctor typing a report up on his computer.

"Ah, hello there." Hasan's calm voice still managed to startle the two out-of-shape teens. "Are you here for visiting or medical aid?" He didn't expect them to answer with the former. After all, his only current patient was a POW, assuming terrorists could even legally count as POWs.

"Oh, both actually." Audrey answered as she and Banagher jiggled over to him.

"J-Just a quick check up, that is." Banagher said as he looked around the room for needles.

"Will do. I just need your names, I don't think we've-Wait, aren't you Banagher and Mineva?"

The duo blushed and averted eye contact. "Yes..." They said, really wishing they could tuck in their stomachs.

Hasan audibly struggled to find a way to be polite. "It-" he cleared his throat. "It's only been a week, hasn't it?"

He wasn't trying to but the doctor's words made his two new patients blush even harder as their tummies bubbled. "Yes..." Banagher then belched, while Audrey swallowed hers.

"I-I didn't think it was even possible to gain that much weight in so little time. Have you two weighed yourselves?"

"Actually no." Audrey answered.

"If you'd like, you could use my scale. We could also measure-"

"T-That won't be necessary!" Audrey interjected louder then she meant to.

"We'll do it later." Banagher added, he and Audrey's blushing intensified once again as they imagined the scale pointing out exactly how obese they were, right next to someone they didn't know well. They didn't know what was worse, that or having the doctor measure their massive bellies, he would undoubtedly have to feel the giant orbs as he measured them.

Catching their drift, Hasan changed the subject. "Alright, so is this checkup about the Unicorn?"

"Yeah, you're supposed to wear a special normal suit when -URAP- it goes into NT-D mode, or else the g-forces will knock you out."

"And Mineva wasn't wearing one when you did?"

Banagher looked guilty. "No, she wasn't. So we'd like if you could check her heart, make sure everything is okay."

"As well as Banagher's." Audrey interjected.

"Alright, this won't take long." Hasan put on his stethoscope and placed the resonator on Audrey's chest, hearing the sounds of a normal, healthy heart at work. "Everything sounds good, especially considering what you went through. Still, activating the NT-D was incredibly risky, you know that, so why in god's name did you do it?"

Banagher clenched his fist as he looked down. "I'm pathetic." He thought. "I completely forgot about her and Haro when I did that. Wait, I did that?" Thinking back on the three times he activated the NT-D, Banagher couldn't see how he did it, no matter how hard he wracked his brain. "I just wanted power, and then I got it. Does the Unicorn pick up on that and activate the NT-D? ...This is all just semantics, I'm just trying to dodge responsibility." Here, he spoke up. "I was being selfish -UURRAP- and I wasn't thinking."

"No one can blame you for being upset back then." Audrey said without hesitation, without uncertainty. "And using the NT-D was our only hope of getting here." She looked at Banagher when she said that, but Hasan felt like she was looking at him at the same time. "Now, doctor, if you'd please examine my dear friend." Her stomach gurgled as she forced down yet another burp.

"Of course." Hasan did so, finding evidence of a healthy heart. "Everything's fine on that front, though your stomachs are a different matter."

"We know they're big." An embarrassed Audrey as she shamefully rested a hand on hers.

"Well, yes, that is a problem too, but I'm referring to the organ. They've been making quite a lot of noise, which I can't imagine is pleasant."

Fittingly enough, their tummies did indeed each emit a low grumble, drawing all eyes to them. "We're just -UUUURP- really full." Banagher sheepishly said as he scratched the bake of his head.

"I can give you some digestive pills if you'd like."

"No thank you. We have our own special remedy for this." As she said that Audrey, sneaked in a quick jiggle of Banagher's tummy, a jiggle she made sure to look at.

"You really like that stuff, don't ya?" Banagher commented as he jiggled Audrey back, aware that question could just as easily be directed as him.

choices: Banagher tells them about his father
Marida wakes up and asks for Audrey and Banagher

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"I see. Well, I'd like to discuss dieting with you two but I've taken up enough of your time already, I'm sure you're both exhausted and want to see your friend."

They both looked at the bed that was completely covered by it's curtains. "Y -URP- Yeah..." Banagher said. He and Audrey walked over to it, Hasan returned to his computer, both to continue his work and to give them as much privacy as he could. The Gundam pilot grabbed the curtain but found himself unable to move it. He gripped tightened and grew less steady. Audrey saw the sad look on his face, rather then say something, she grabbed his other hand, the one he held Haro with. Banagher looked back at her sympathetic face, and then he opened the curtain.

Marida looked peaceful as she slept. Despite the painful circumstances that put her in this place, perhaps this sill served as a rest for her. There was plaster on her face, Because her head bobbed back as soon her visor broke, none of the shards of it pierced her face, though it did scrap her skin. Only Hasan knew at the time, but some of her ribs were broken.

Words escaped Audrey and Banagher as they looked at the wounded Marida. Haro was the only one of the three who hadn't met Marida, not counting the confrontation in Industrial 7, but he still knew this was someone who had helped Audrey and Banagher dearly, someone who they cared for, someone who cared for them. Banagher reached out and placed a hand on the top of Marida's belly, still stuffed to the brim with all the ice cream they had so much fun eating together.

"It hasn't been that long..." He said.

"Since when?" Audrey was worried this would cause Banagher to breakdown, but after the life she had lived until she met him, she knew it was better for him to let it all out.

"Since... Since the last time I was with her. We were having so much fun together, it feels like it was so long ago but it's been a few hours. It's just 7. We were just talking, we were eating together, it was so wonderful, and then just a few hours later... I... I... I...!" As he shut his eyes closed, he felt Audrey embrace him. "Thanks..." he opened his eyes again. "I... I need to lay down, it's what Marida would suggest."

"It's what I'm suggesting too." Taking him by hand, Audrey led Banagher out of the med bay. Hasan didn't say anything, as a doctor, he knew they didn't need him interrupting them.

+++

The recreational room was empty. There was no doubt they weren't the only ones who needed to relax, so it was probably just that everyone else was busy with whatever. That was the conclusion they would've come to were they not so exhausted.

"Thinking about doing some stargazing?" Banagher asked as the last Zabi led him into the large room, their tummies bobbing and bouncing.

"Yes, I think it would be a good way to unwind."

"Yeah, looking up at the stars is just what we-" Before he could finish that sentence, the Vist and the Zabi suddenly found themselves tackled to the ground, by one person for each of them. Having caught the two large figures out of their peripheral vision shortly before contact, the only had time to turn to face them before they got tackled, all four bloated forms jiggling and jostling from the impact, their big bellies all touching.

"BOOOOOORRP!" The collision stirred up the gas in all their bellies, making Banagher and the two unknown figures belch loudly in unison. Since she didn't know who they were yet, Audrey desperately tried to hold down all the gas she had been kept bottled up.

"It hurts!" "Gyah!" Cries like that could be heard from the four now thta belching wasn't keeping them from complaining about the impact, Haro not included.

Audrey and Banagher opened their eyes to see that their mysterious assailants were Micott and Takuya. The chunky girl had tackled Banagher while the chubby boy had tackled Audrey.

"Welcome back!" Takuya said with a huge smile and all the enthusiasm Banagher and Audrey had missed and needed from him.

"We really missed you!" Micott said with her own huge smile, a relief in her voice and on her face that everyone was glad to hear and see return.

"You guys!" Banagher happily said as Audrey's soft tummy gurgled and bubbled, the biggest smile the Vist had on his fat face since Marida called him her little brother.

"BWWWOOOAAARRRP!" A massive belch, even bigger then the group one the others had done, came roaring from Audrey's mouth, startling all but her. Maybe it was just because they were caught up in the surprise (embarrassment, in Audrey's case), but they all swore they could've felt their entire bodies jiggle and even the room itself shake from the princess' massive five seconds long belch. What Audrey had meant to say was a simple, happy "It's good to be back.", but that was what came out of her mouth instead.

None of them knew who started laughing first, maybe it was Takuya, maybe it was even Audrey herself, but the room was then filled with the group's laughter. It even somehow seemed like Haro was laughing too with the way he excitedly flapped his ears, saying " Go Audrey! Go Audrey!". Audrey and Banagher were blushing, but for different reasons, as they laughed. All their bellies jiggled as they laughed. Banagher and Takuya's pie-like faces joined in on the jiggling, as did Audrey and Micott's big boobs.

"This is where I should be." Banagher's heart was filled with feelings like that. "I'm not going to ride that mobile suit again; I'm not going to get involved with the Federation, Neo-Zeon, or the Vist Foundation. Our nightmare is finally over..."

+++

Takuya made his shot with his pool cue, not scoring a point from this move but that was okay, he was still in the lead. "So, yeah. OOORRAP! We just go to Luna -BWAP- II, answer whatever questions they give us, and then we go home." Unlike the last time Audrey and Banagher were here, the group was using the 3D pool tables, which was basically pool played in zero gravity.

"It won't be the same without... you know, all the others. UURAAAAP!" Micott said as she looked down, her tummy blocking her view of her feet.

Takuya frowned. "I know..."His smile returned once he thought of what to say. "But hey, we've got Audrey now!" He cheerfully pulled a visibly startled Audrey close to him, to the point their chubby arms were touching, which jostled slightly. "And we'll keep in touch with Riddhe and Mihiro. And we've got actual experience with mobile suits under our belts now!"

"Our much tighter -UUUUUURRP- belts, that is." Micott snarked with a grin.

"I actually broke mine -URRRRRRRRP a few days ago." Banagher chimed in as he held up a side of it, he was still wearing it. Banagher blushed from embarrassment, while Micott and Audrey blushed for a certain different reason. "God, that's hot." Was all Micott could think when her pal said that.

"Pizza?" Takuya asked.

"One of everything." Banagher answered as he absentmindedly rubbed his gut.

"And then some." Audrey gave her belly a big slap, making it jiggle and her burp.

"Anyways," Takuya continued. "working on actual federation mobile suits is going to look really good on our grades. So what I'm saying is that while we've lost a lot, but we've also gained a lot too."

"Gained a lot of weight, that is." Audrey joked as she removed Takuya's hand from her arm.

"Well, yeah."

"In all seriousness, it's admirable -BWAAAAARRP- that you're keeping a positive outlook. It's something we all needed to hear." Audrey eyed Banagher before looking back at Takuya.

"Thanks! Like you said, somebody's gotta do it. URRRAAAP! Speaking of doing, you're up, Audrey."

Audrey lined up her shot, adjusting it as she thought back on everything on physics she had been taught by her very well-paid tutors. After ten seconds of deliberation, she made her shot, and once again, scored zero points. She let out a disappointed sigh. "Why is this so hard?"

"Everybody sucks at something." Micott causally said and then casually burped. "Besides, pool doesn't really suit someone like you."

"That's why I wanted to be good at it.

"Don't sweat it, BOOOORRRAP! You're still new at this." Banagher reminded.

"Thanks, I'll try to keep that in mind. UUUUURRAP! Anyways, it's your turn." Audrey said and then handed Banagher the cue.

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Banagher lined up his shot, but then he remembered there was something he needed to tell Audrey. No, now that he thought about it, it was something he needed to tell all his friends. "A-Actually, there's something I need to tell you guys." He stopped lining his shot and stood up.

That reminded Audrey. "Oh! BUUUURRAAP! Is this that ting you wanted to tell me?"

"Yeah, but I think I should tell you guys too."

"I'm getting the feeling this is important." Takuya said.

"It is. I..." It was hard to say it, perhaps because it was something he thought he would never say. "I know who my father is."

Just as Banagher did a second ago, everyone who heard that had trouble saying anything. Takuya was the first one who could say something. "Well, that's great!" Takuya and Micott smiled then, a frowning Audrey was the only one who knew this wasn't going to be a happy story. "So what's he's like?" The bottom-heavy brunette asked.

"He's our school's chairman, Cardeas Vist. And he's dead."

Micott and Takuya lost their smiles. "Oh..." That was all Micott could say, Takuya couldn't even say anything. Audrey was the only one who could say a whole sentence. "Are you talking about THAT -BUUUURP- Cardeas -BUUUUURRRP- Vist? Then, you're the Vist family's-"

"I don't know!" Banagher kept looking down, though it was more accurate to say he wasn't looking at anything, his body trembling with a mixture of emotions. "My mother separated us when I was young, and I couldn't even remember his face. He didn't even come to my mother's funeral, he wouldn't even meet us, and all out of a sudden..."

For whatever the reason, his thoughts after that couldn't become words. Before anyone could say something, Banagher felt something round rub up against his foot, he looked and saw that it was Haro. Just like that, all his anger and sadness was gone. He dropped his cue and picked up Haro, smiling in a tired manner. "Sorry for snapping, guys."

"Don't be. " Takuya said. "We're here for ya. When you need someone to talk to, and when you need someone to vent to."

"You're helping us get through this, and we're helping you get through this." Micott added on.

"Sorry for what I said, I should've realized now wasn't a good time to ask questions." Audrey said.

"Don't be, I shouldn't have snapped at you."

"It's my fault for being insensitive."

"No, it's my fault for being a jerk."

"No, it's my fault for-"

"Okay, that's enough." Micott injected. "You don't -UUUURRRP- need to get into some dumb cycle of apologies."

"R-Right." Audrey said, Banagher sharing her slight embarrassment.

With a cheeky grin, Takuya lightly elbowed Micott in her big tummy,upsetting it and making it's hefty owner burp. "You're just -BOOOORRRP- jealous."

"The hell are you saying?!" Micott's enraged voice rang. "It's -UUUURRAAP- not like -BORP- that!"

"Jealous of what?" Audrey and Banagher said in unison, blinking innocently. This combined with Micott's adorably childish anger made Takuya laugh.

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"UUUURRRRRRP!" Banagher belched.

"BUUUUUUURRP!" Audrey belched.

"BOOOOOOOORRP!" Micott belched.

"BWWWAAAAP!" Takuya belched. "Yeah, this round goes to -URAP- Micott."

Letting a small burp pass her lips, Audrey picked up the scoreboard they had and added another tally mark to Micott's score. This left the score with Micott at 4, Banagher at 3, Audrey at 2, and Takuya at 3. The four of them, plus Haro, were sitting at the massive lounge chair together, their huge butts touching, something they definitively didn't mind, even if it made them blush initially. There was a bunch of soda cans, some empty, some not yet used as fuel for their powerful belching.

"Just one more and I win!" The big-bottomed brunette bragged, giving her gut a proud slap.

"That reminds me, who won the eating contest?" Banagher asked.

"Huh?" Was Takuya's initial answer.

"Remember when the Argama was attacked? You guys were finishing up the eating contest with Riddhe and Mihiro, right?"

"Oh-Oh, yeah! Now I remember."

"God, that feels like ages ago." Micott commented.

"Back then, Takuya, Riddhe, and Mihiro only had potbellies." Audrey's finger sank into her friend's belly fat as she teasingly poked Takuya's full belly, forcing a belch past his lips.

"Hey, that's cheating!" He jokingly said.

"It's not, we didn't start the next round yet."

"So who won?" Banagher got them back on topic.

"It was a tie." Micott answered. "Again."

"Can't imagine Mihiro was pleased." Banagher said.

"She blamed Riddhe." Takuya chuckled as he tonight back on it.

Banagher wanted to say something about that, but one gurgle from his stomach later and he was letting out a huge burp. "BWAAAAAARRP! Damn, I should've saved that one for the next round!"

"You need to work on swallowing your belches." Audrey said. "Not just for this contest, but also for when you're in public."

"I know, I know. Anyways, I guess we'll have to finish up the contest tomorrow or something."

"I've got an idea! We're going to hold a welcome -BUUUURP- back party tomorrow, how about we settle things there?"

"We're getting a party?" Audrey and Banagher said at the same time.

"Party time! Party Time!" Haro cheered.

"Sure! You two earned it." Takuya said.

"Ready for your first party, Audrey?" Micott asked, she had a feeling Audrey's first time at a party would be pretty much the same as that of a medieval princess transported to the Universal Century.

"Won't it be like that party you and everyone else threw to help me?"

"What party?" A confused Banagher asked.

"That was just to help you perk up, this is going to have way more energy. This time we're celebrating, it's going to be a REAL party!"

Audrey disposition instantly changed,. "Oh, um, exactly how different is it going to be? Is there any way I can prepare myself? Some sort of practice I could-"

"Relax, Audrey." Banagher gave her a friendly pat on the back, making her burp loudly. "She's just trying to scare you."

"You walked right into that one." Takuya said, grinning with Micott, somehow their chubby cheeks and double chins amplified how amused they looked.

Th princess could actually feel the nervousness be drained out of her body. "I guess I did." Audrey awkwardly said as she ruffled a bit of her hair.

"It'll just be a little more active then the party we threw."

"Just promise me you'll be there for me if things get too chaotic, alright?" Audrey said with emerald green eyes no one could resist.

"Of course. UURRRAP!" Banagher said with a heartwarming smile, his chubbiness making it even more effective.

"Consider us your body -BOOORRP- guards." Takuya said.

"I've hosted tons of parties before, I've got you covered." Micott said.

"I'll help too! Like when we first met!"" Haro bounced up and down as he said that.

Audrey sighed in relief. "Thank you all." Talking about the time between Banagher's kidnapping and when she left to help him return reminded Audrey about the thief. "If you don't mind me changing the subject, has anything happened with the thief?"

"Looks like you scared him off." Takuya's answer truly surprised the princess, it felt too good to be true.

"That or he finally exploded." Micott said, subconsciously give her belly some rubs.

"He hasn't done anymore raids since -BBBUURP- the party we held, I think." Takuya smirked as he thought about what happened between Audrey and Riddhe. "Guess he heard about you roughing up Riddhe and got scared."

"That or Riddhe -UUUOOORP- is the thief." Audrey said.

"I still don't think he did it, it's really not like him." Banagher commented.

"Regardless, I'm glad we can finally put this all behind us."

"Whatever means more food for us." Micott said, grabbing a handful of her tummy fat. "God, I'd be a mess if they started rationing us."

"Assuming doctor Hasan doesn't ration us anyways." The way Takuya said that made it obvious he had an annoying conversation with the doctor about his weight.

"He's been nagging you guys about it?" Banagher asked, knowing the answer would be some version of "yes".

"Whenever he gets the chance." Takuya practically groaned as he said that. "We got unlucky and he saw how huge our stomachs were after the party, he dragged us into the med bay and lectured us for ten minutes."

"It -UUUUUURP- felt way longer." Micott added. "He tried to get us to weigh ourselves, but that's way too embarrassing to do in front of him."

Audrey looked down at her massive tummy, as well as her plentiful boobs, the result of collecting all the calories from her many binges. "We probably should weight ourselves though." Her finger sank into the plush fat both times she poked it. She then looked at her friends and how chunky they had all gotten, feeling a mixture of emotions.

"Well, yeah, but not in front of some guy we don't even know. I sure as hell don't want him feeling up my belly and measuring it."

"Of course, that would be..." Audrey was distracted as she imagined Banagher's hands running over her nearly perfectly round belly as he brought the measuring tape together, his own gigantic belly pressing into her back and huge butt. It felt like she was being hugged by the huge orb. Banagher gave her stomach a light slap when he announced the number to her, making it sway in a gelatinous fashion. Both their faces going redder at the number. She then imagined the roles reversed, herself putting a finger in Banagher's cavernous navel as she brought the tape together at the apex of his middle, the big brunette moaning.. "BUUUUURRP! Really embarrassing."

"Hey, where do you think we should hold the party?" Takuya changed the subject. "Here or your room?"

To Banagher, both had their pros and cons. The recreational room had a lot more couches, space, and games, and an amazing view of the stars, but no video games and it would be REALLY awkward if someone just walked in on them, or if there another group spending time there who now had to put up with all this belching. That wouldn't be good for either party. On the other hand, Banagher's room was of course much smaller, had no view of the stars, only one couch, but it also had more privacy and video games. "Don't know, I'll have to think about it."

"Are we gonna have another round or what?" An impatient Micott held up a new can of soda as she said that.

Once they grabbed a can of soda, each bloated teen turned their head towards the ceiling and started chugging, downing the whole thing in one go. Their bellies were already so incredibly full and bloated, it wasn't comfortable to put even more into the overstuffed sacks, but this was just way too fun. Once they each pulled the now empty can from their lips, their waited just a few seconds for evidence of their drink to come gushing out. They could feel their bellies gurgle and bubble as they got to work.

"UUUUUUUUUUURP!" Banagher belched first.

"BOOOOOOOORP!" Takuya burped second.

"UURRRRRRRRRRRRRRP!" Micott burped third. "Looks like I win!"

"BBBBUUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRP!" All five of them were shocked by the power of Audrey's massive belch, and yes, that included Haro and Audrey herself. They knew the Zabi could really belt out monsters, after all, they got an example a few hours ago, but they didn't think they would get a second example in he same day. Audrey looked shocked even as she belched for five seconds straight, a blush on her chubby face. She was trying to belch as loudly as possible, but even she was shocked by that one.

"Damn, Audrey!" A grinning Banagher pulled Audrey closer and gave her a friendly noogie, their soft tummies touching, making Audrey start smiling too. Haro was cheering on Audrey again by saying "Go Audrey! Again! Go Audrey! Again!"

"Now that's a burp!" Micott sounded thoroughly impressed, she and Takuya were grinning.

"Man, for a princess, you're good at this!" Takuya said.

"Thanks guys." The princess felt another burp coming up. "BOOOOORRRP!"

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Leaning on each other for support as they swayed like they were drunk, Audrey and Banagher, with Haro, lumbered into the latter's room. It was filled with boxes. As Takuya explained to him earlier, Mihiro had gone through the trouble of convincing Daguza to order ECOAS to retrieve everything from Banagher, Takuya, and Micott's dorm rooms. officially, they were "evidence" but it was obvious that Daguza was being sympathetic. Since it was clear that they would be living in the Argama for a while, Mihiro and Daguza wanted them to feel like they were living here, not being held prisoner.

But decorating his room could wait until tomorrow. Right now, they had well-deserved food comas to slip into. Once they collapsed onto the couch to take a break, it was very tempting to just fall asleep right there and then, and very difficult not to. They slowly got up to brush their teeth, take a shower, and get changed for bed.

Leaving the bathroom, dressed in her unbuttoned pajamas, except for the button that kept her tits decent, of course, Audrey saw the adorable sight of her pal ungracefully laying on his bed, his huge gut displayed in it's full glory as it bulged straight up into the air, his pajama shirt unable to contain it. Banagher belched in an equally ungracefully manner. "BUURRUURRP! Man, I'm tired." Haro was sitting on the bed with him.

"I don't even know how we -BWAAAAAAP- stayed up so long." Eyes locked onto his gut, Audrey wobbled over to him, her tummy, legs, boobs, and ass jiggling. She flopped down next to him in bed with a little more grace then the bloated pilot. "How are you feeling?"

"Better. BURP! A lot better, how about you?"

"I'm feeling better too." She then sighed in what seemed like relief. They were then silent for a bit until Audrey brought up a new topic. "Ready to fulfill your promise tomorrow?"

"Huh? What promise?" He sounded worried as he said that, worried he had hurt her feelings.

The blonde smirked. "You said you would introduce me to video games, remember? I've been looking forward to that this whole time!"

It took him a second to process what she said, but once he did, he heartily chuckled, his cheeks folding and bouncing. He couldn't help it, Audrey was just being too cute damn cute. "Don't worry, I'll show you every game I've got first thing after breakfast!"

"It's good -UUUUURRRP- to have you back, Banagher." Audrey placed her head on Banagher's gut, smiling peacefully. Even as packed full as the orb was, there was still a layer of soft adipose. It felt just as wonderful and soft as she hoped it was, it was truly the world's best pillow.

"It's good to be back." His big belly gurgled as both lovebirds felt a powerful surge rise up from the gigantic orb, it quickly flew out of Banagher's mouth. "BUUUUUURRRRAAAARRRP!"

"Good one!" An amused expression matched Audrey's words.

"Thanks!" Banagher said, patting his tummy.

Before long, they fell into mutual food comas. They slept soundly that night.

For the most part.

+++

Audrey pressed deeply into Banagher's gut to support herself as she got up, forcing a shocked "UUUUUUUURP! Ooof!" out of her friend. "What the hell, Audrey?" He sat up, understandably annoyed. To his further shock, Audrey said nothing, she didn't look back at him, she didn't even seem to hear him. He saw her lumber out of his room, he watched her bubblebutt and legs jiggle and jostle. Wanting to just go back to sleep and forget this ever happened, the bloated pilot returned his head to his pillow. He wrote it off as Audrey just needing to use the bathroom, whether it be to do her business or just to get a drink from the sink.

A few minutes passed of him trying to fall asleep. "It's like when I had to walk down the hall in the middle of the night just to get some water." He thought back on his days at the school dorm. "If there's one thing better about the Argama then the dorm, it's that I don't have to walk down the hallway just to for a some water. It's way better with a bathroom in my room........... My bathroom's in my room?!"

As fast as a fat guy (who wasn't really athletic before he got fat) with a packed-full gut could, which was surprisingly fast in his case, Banagher bolted out of his room, his entire body wildly jiggling, though he to stop as soon as he got of his room to catch his breath and clutch his belly. To be fair to him, it IS genuinely hard to run with a belly that stuffed. "Damn it! What's she getting up to now?" He looked around for her, the lights in the Argama were significantly dimmed, as they were set to do at this time when there wasn't a combat alert. "God, she could be anywhere on this ship! Well, anywhere except one of the bathrooms." With only two paths he could go, he had a 50% chance of picking the right one. So already he was off to a bad start.

He didn't know how long he searched for, but he knew that the more he did, the more he wanted to grab Audrey go back to bed. He kept wracking his brain to figure out what the hell the princess he knew and loved was up to. She certainty wasn't the mischievous type, barring the two times she slapped Banagher's tummy to wake him up. Was this some sort of espionage? She was the type who would sneak around in the middle of the night if there was something important to find out, but she would've told him beforehand, right?

He checked every room he passed by, except for the bedrooms, but found nothing. He called out a few times, burped a few times, but he didn't get any reply. It felt creepy, like he and Audrey were the only people on the ship. The fact that Audrey had genuinely gone missing made it even worse. He realized he should've brought his phone with him, he could've use some background music.

"BBBUURRAARRP!"

"Audrey?"

He headed towards the source of the loud belch, if that was Audrey, that was a damn good one, which led him to the kitchen. As it was a room, the lights were off he moved to turn them on but stopped himself at the last moment. He had no idea what was going on, and he didn't even know for sure if that burp came from Audrey, so he felt he should approach this cautiously and not let himself be seen until he was sure it was safe.

He saw a light, it was a refrigerator light but a rotund figure was blocking a lot of it. "Is that the thief Audrey's been so pissed off about?" Holding his belches down, he slowly approached the figure, hoping he could see his face, the sounds of the figure's munching and burping getting louder. Getting closer, he could make out the figure a little better, he was fairly certain now that it was a girl and that she had medium sized hair. Getting even closer, he could the color of her pajamas and hair. The pajamas were pink, while her hair was strawberry blonde. "Wait, pink pajamas and strawberry blonde hair? It can't be..."

Getting almost as close as he could, he now knew that it was. It was Audrey; she was the thief.

"Hey, Audrey?" He said, but he really had no idea what he was going to say after that.

And it seems Audrey wasn't doing much better at figuring out what to say, because she didn't say anything, she just kept pigging out.

"I'm not mad or anything, -BUUUURRP- I won't tell anyone if you don't want me to. Just tell me what's going on."

All Banagher heard was munching.

"I know you wouldn't do this unless you felt like you had no choice, so whatever the problem is, I'll help you fix it."

The only reply he got, if it could even be called that, was more of the same.

"Audrey?"

After again getting no answer, he walked over and tapped her on the shoulder. "Audrey?" Once again, all the blonde did was stuff her face. He looked closer and saw that while her eyes were open, they were glazed over, like she wasn't even using them. "You okay?"

"......UUUURRRRP!"

And that was when it all clicked. "She's sleepwalking!" He was a little relieved, it looked like this was going to be much easier to fix then he initially thought.

Looked like, being the key words here.

He grabbed her shoulders and gentle shook her, his belly touching her back and huge ass. "You there?" The blonde seemed unaware that she was being shaken. So the brunette shook her even harder. "You're sleepwalking, you've gotta wake up." Again, he wasn't acknowledged. "C'mon, Audrey, you've gotta snap out of this! Before someone finds you!"

Realizing that attempt also failed, he grabbed hold of her and tried to pry her away from the fridge, which was really tough. He didn't think a sleepwalker would be able to resist physical force. "You're going to get sick if you keep eating!" Eventually he was able to pull her off, but because of inertia, he accidentally sent her flying into the counter. Seeing her collaspe to the ground, he was hit by guilt just as badly as the blonde was hit by the counter. On the upside, the impact actually woke her up. "Ugh..." She woke up like normal, but was clearly confused. She looked around, at the room she was in, at the open fridge, and then at Banagher ('s belly before she looked at his face). "Banagher? What''s going on? Where I am?"

Banagher sheepishly scratched the back of his head, only now did he realize how awkward this was going to be to explain. "Well, you're in the kitchen."

"And why am I in the kitchen?" She felt a gurgle from her stomach. "Ooooh. And why do I feel like I'm about to -UUUUURRRRP- explode?"

"Uh, weeelll, you're the thief. You've been been sleepwalking this whole time. I just stopped you from clearing out the whole thing again."

Audrey blinked twice in confusion, and then her face grew extremely red, as red as the tomato sauce on the frozen pizza slices she had just eaten, as the realization hit her. "Oh... Well, this is embarrassing."

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"Okay, BUUURRRAARP! Now I'm going to explode." Banagher groaned as he gave his belly a few pats.

"Again, you -UUUUUURRP- didn't need to eat as much as I did." Audrey pointed out as she massaged her swollen tummy, her emerald green eyes locked onto Banagher's gut.

Banagher grinned at her as he rubbed his belly. "You know me. BOOOORRRP! I'm never one to leave you alone with a problem." Those charming words made Audrey smile as her pal yawned loudly. "Any -BURP- way, lets go back to bed. can you stand?"

"Can you? You look like your legs are about to buckle."

Banagher blushed, if they weren't ready to go to bed, and they didn't need to leave before someone walked in, he would've plopped down right next to Audrey. "I'm okay, I just need someone to lean on."

"That makes two of us. UUUUURRRP!"

After some difficulty, Audrey was able to stand up with Banagher's help. They leaned on each other for support as they wobbled back to the brunette's room, a pair of big tummies, ample boobs, huge butts, and two pairs of chunky legs jiggled and jostled with every step the lovebirds made. Their stomachs were so large and full that they rubbed together, which felt really nice to both teens. It kinda felt like being hugged.

Seeing no reason not to, Banagher started up some small talk. "Marida says I'm like a puppy when -BOOORP- I get my belly rubbed, do you think that's true?"

Audrey burped before she answered. "Yes, definitely."

"Alright, so what breed am I?"

Looking at Banagher's chubby face, the princess found herself tempted to say a French Bulldog. A typical French Bulldog did have rather adorable chubby cheeks like Banagher did, though that was partly because of how fat he was now. Then again, he did always shave some chubby cheeks. She found her eyes focusing on his hair instead of his face, which is where she found her answer. "A Shih Tzu."

"A Shih Tzu, why?"

Audrey giggled at how he didn't get it. "Because you're both incredibly fluffy.

Grinning sheepishly, Banagher self-consciously ran his hand over the top of his head, feeling that yes, he was incredibly fluffy. "Now that you mention it, I guess I am. Oh, Marida said you're a puppy."

"So what breed do you think I am?"

"I think a Chihuahua."

"Why a Chihuahua?"

"I dunno. It just feels right."

Before long they returned to Banagher's room and went back to sleep, Audrey still using Banagher's belly as the world's best pillow. They slept soundly that night, this time for real.

+++

When Audrey woke up, she knew even before she looked at the digital clock that she (and Banagher, but that's nothing new) had slept in. The clock read 3:17 PM. It sounded about right to her. She actually didn't feel ashamed of herself like she normally would've. She looked at Banagher's round face, you'd never be able to tell from how he slept like a log, adorably snoring with a lazy look, that he had been through an incredibly traumatic experience yesterday. The Zabi felt that was admirable in a way.

After giving a few loving pats to her friend's stomach, Audrey carefully got out of the bed, making sure she didn't accidentally wake up Banagher, though she was pretty sure that was hard to do, and went to his bathroom to take a shower and brush her teeth. It was tempting to take a bath but she didn't want to risk accidentally falling asleep again. Once she was done with that, she grabbed her ill-fitting clothes and put them on in the bathroom. It wasn't easy, in fact she was pretty sure they fit even less then when she left for Palau. As she thought back on all the pigging out she had been doing, she knew it wasn't surprising. Still, she didn't regret it, it the extra pounds were worth hanging out with Banagher, well worth it.

Her pants were the last article of clothing she squeezed into, she saved it for last because it was hardest part, thanks to her huge butt. Going through that again made her feel pity for Micott. The Zabi could barely squeeze into her pants, and Micott's ass even even bigger. Audrey thought it was a miracle Micott hadn't ripped her short shorts yet.

Putting her black socks and brown loafers on, Audrey left the bathroom to see that Banagher was still sound asleep, which was no surprise. Audrey smiled at that, her pal was just the cuddliest thing. She walked over to him. "Banagher, it's time to wake up now." She politely said as she not-so-politely grabbed the sides of his gut, tightening her grip to get all the fat she could, and gave it a good shake.

"I'm up, I'm up." Banagher drowsily said as he watched his belly bounce, which actually felt kinda nice. If he hadn't just woken up, he probably would've moaned instead of yawned.

"Good morning, Banagher." Audrey said as if she wasn't still shaking the sleepyhead's belly.

"Mornin', Audrey."

"Today's the day you finally introduce video games to me."

Of course, bringing that up helped get rid of some of Banagher's drowsiness. Some of it. "Oh yeah. You're pretty excited for that, aren't ya?"

"Of course!"

"I'll show you as soon as we get some breakfast, that's a promise."

"One that I know you'll keep. I'll wait for you outside while you shower and get dressed." Audrey let go of the pilot's big stomach, causing it to jiggle and wobble.

As she waited outside, and making sure no one was coming, Audrey passed the time by playing with her belly, including her cavernous bellybutton. She poked and jiggled her belly, watching with childlike wonder the gelatinous way the orb reacted. She grabbed a handful of her belly fat, her stomach felt like an even more malleable pillow. Now that she thought about it, having a gut was kinda like having a pillow strapped to your middle 24/7.

Later she poked herself in her bellybutton, which she fit her entire finger without difficulty, that fact made her feel even fatter. After a burp, she started moving her finger around, making her gut wobble all over. As weird as it made her feel, she got so caught up in her belly play that she didn't notice Banagher coming out of his room, Haro in hand, until he already saw what she was doing. Her chubby face as red as a tomato, she immediately let go of her belly, which took a second to stop jiggling.

"Ready for breakfast?" A friendly Banagher said.

"Y-Yeah, I could go for some toast right now." Audrey said, eternally grateful Banagher didn't comment on what she was doing with her gut.

As they walked to the cafeteria, they found themselves looking at how much both their bellies jiggled with every step. "We've definitely gotten fatter." Audrey said as she ran hand over her blubbery tummy.

"Can't say I'm surprised. We've really been pigging out." Banagher pat his well-fed belly a few times as he said that.

"No regrets though, right? Bring on the pies and all that?"

Banagher grinned, he lifted his belly up and started shaking it. "No regrets, bring on the pies!"

Audrey giggled and started doing the same. "Banagher, you're worth getting fat."

It was a bizarre compliment but it still managed to warm Banagher's heart. "Thanks. You're, uh, worth getting fat too."

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Upon entering the cafeteria and getting their large breakfasts, they were surprised to see Micott and Takuya at the group's usual table. "There you are!" Takuya called out to the duo.

"What are you guys doing here?" Banagher asked as he and Audrey joined them at the table.

"We had a feeling you two would be sleeping in a lot." He answered.

"Was it really that obvious?" Some slight embarrassment was in Audrey's tone.

"Beyond obvious." Micott teased.

"Banagher's lazy! Audrey's lazy!" Haro chimed in.

"Well, I did happen to have the world's most wonderful pillow last night." Audrey reached over and grabbed a handful of Banagher's belly blubber, making it obvious to Takuya and Micott what she meant. "No excuse for you though, Banagher." She joked.

"Heh, glad to see I lived up to your expectations."

"I'm not surprised you two did that."

"You'll have to let me try out your gut someday." An obviously jealous Micott said, obviously jealous to all but Banagher and Audrey that is. She imagined herself as the one using Banagher's belly as a pillow.

"I didn't think my belly would be such a popular pillow." Banagher joked as he lifted up his gut and then let it drop, making it jiggle and wobble when it landed back onto his chunky thighs.

"You two got anything planned today?" Takuya asked.

Banagher was going to answer that, but an excited Audrey did so first. "As a matter of fact, Banagher is going to introduce me to video games just as soon as we finish our breakfast."

"Have you picked out what your going to start with?"

Again Banagher was about to reply, only for a very eager Audrey to beat him to it. "Danganronpa."

"I'm surprised you didn't get the name wrong." Banagher said, partly for the sake of getting to say something.

"That'll be interesting." Micott commented.

"Can't wait to see how you react to the characters." Takuya said.

"Why's that?" Audrey innocently asked.

"You'll see." Takuya chuckled.

While still completely determined to become a geek, Audrey suddenly felt a little in over her head. Then again, that wasn't anything new.

+++

In the gym on the Nahel Argama, Riddhe and Mihiro's corpulent forms jiggled all over the place as they each ran on a treadmill. Their round faces were red and drenched with sweat. While they had been exercising for half an hour at this point, they had only been using the treadmills for a minute.

"Keep *huff* up for just a little *huff* longer." Mihiro said, without even looking at Riddhe or hearing him say anything, she knew that he was on the verge of giving up. Sure enough, when she looked at him after saying that, she saw that he was already off the treadmill, desperately trying to catch his breath. She sighed and returned her focus to losing weight. For ten more seconds that is, after that she had to join Riddhe.

After they caught their breaths, the two officers of the Federation wobbled over a bench and plopped their fat asses down on it. "At least we burned some calories, right?" Riddhe comforted his friend after they both drank some much needed water. They didn't look like tomatoes anymore but there was still some red left on their faces.

"I guess so." Mihiro replied. Then she looked past her big boobs and at her gut. She placed a hand on it, it was just as soft as ever. "It's just that I went into this thinking we would do a lot better."

"Well, how good could we possibly be?" Riddhe pointed out. "We weren't exactly the athletic type even before we got fat."

"I know." Mihiro looked at Riddhe's stomach and then back at her own, two big tummies that were going to get even bigger at the party tonight. Her belly covered up her thighs and then some, while Riddhe's almost reached his knees. It was a small relief to her that she didn't have as much of a gut as Riddhe did, even if she did still have a gut, and not to mention, a much bigger ass. "Let's just hope the party doesn't set us back that much."

"That reminds me, how do you think Banagher is holding up?"

"He must be exhausted, physically and mentally. At least he'll finally be able to enjoy himself again at the party. The poor guy must be skin and bones."

+++

"So do all video game characters look like this?" That was all Audrey could say as she looked at the very unusual cast of Danganronpa, realizing, after the appearance of the game's protagonist seemingly dispelled her worries, exactly what Takuya and Micott meant.

"Nah, just this series." Banagher said, only to immediately realize that wasn't completely true. "Well, not just this series, but most have characters that look a lot more normal."

"I see." Audrey sounded like she wasn't completely convinced.

Even though it was a visual novel, and they weren't too far into it yet, Audrey had already demonstrated just how bad she was at video games. It took her a little time, and a few reminders, before she memorized where here the X button was, and the ones who reminded her were pretty sure she will have forgotten by tomorrow. When it came to movement, she wasn't any better. When she wanted to move the cursor or walk, she would look at the controller, spot the control sticks, and (assuming she didn't mix them up again) would very carefully move it, like this was her first time driving a car. It was more or less the level of skill Banagher, Takuya, Haro, and Micott expected her to display, but actually seeing it was something else.

What she lacked in skill, Audrey more then made up for with her interest in the story. Whenever something new occurred, Audrey would always chime in with her thoughts, especially if it affected one of her theories. An excellent example of this was the scene where each character gave a short introduction. After each one, Audrey said her initial thoughts on them, as well as whether she believed they would be a killer, a victim, or a survivor.

One of her three most notable reactions during the introductory scene was her reaction to Hifumi. Or more accurately, Hifumi's physique.

"Um, it's impossible for us to get like that, right?" Audrey subconsciously placed a hand on her belly.

Were it anybody else who said that, they would've thought they were joking.

"Of course not." Banagher said with a small grin.

"It's a game, Audrey." Micott teased in a friendly manner.

"I know. I know." An embarrassed Audrey said.

"If there's anybody who should be worried about getting like that, it's Alberto." Takuya joked.

This whole discussion about weight made Audrey wonder if now might be a good time to tell them that she was the one raiding the fridge at night, and Banagher had a feeling she was thinking about that. Ultimately, Audrey decided not to, as she didn't want to kill the mood.

The second was at Sakura's introduction. Or rather, right before it.

"So who's next?" Takuya asked.

"Hmm... I'll go with her." Audrey said as she selected Sakura, the pronoun she used surprising the others.

"Wait, wait,how did you know that was a girl?" Micott interjected almost the second Audrey refereed to Sakura as a girl.

Audrey seemed perplexed by the question. "She's wearing a skirt, isn't she?"

"Well, yeah."

"But that doesn't mean she's not a guy wearing a skirt." Takuya pointed out what he thought was common knowledge.

"Why would a boy wear a skirt?" The way Audrey said that wasn't condescending, she didn't sound like she thought that would too idiotic for anyone to do, more like she thought it was impossible. "It's not male fashion."

"I mean, yeah, but it's also not male fashion to have your stomach exposed, yet look at Banagher over here!" Takuya teased with a grin.

"Hey!" Banagher blushed a little with a sheepish grin as he fruitlessly tired to pull his hoodie down over his gut. "You're showing off your stomach too, fatty!" He shot back.

"Yeah but at least I can keep my pants closed."

"He's got you, there, Banagher." Micott commented.

"Back on topic," Audrey sated as she snuggled a little closer to Banagher, feeling their love handles touch. "Banagher isn't showing his big belly out of fashion," Banagher felt like he should've expected her to refer to his stomach with those words. "he's simply gotten a little too big for his britches."

"You wanted to make that pun for a while, didn't you?" Was Banagher's only comment.

The third notable reaction Audrey had was after Byakuya's very stand offish introduction.

"So, thoughts on him?" Takuya asked, not expecting a single positive word out of Audrey's mouth.

"I'm not sure if he'll be a victim or a survivor, but he's definitely not a killer."

"How did you-I mean, what part of that makes you think he wouldn't kill a a guy to save his own skin?" Micott asked.

"Because it wouldn't be a mystery if the most antagonistic character was a killer. I thought it was pretty obvious."

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Marida's eyes slowly opened, the unfamiliar sight of the med bay ceiling greeting her. Well, it wasn't exactly an familiar sight, she had seen the coldness of a medical room before, when she had still yet to find her light. Of course, unlike back then, she was in good hands this time.

As much as she wanted to jump out of bed and go find Banagher and Audrey, she still felt rather weak and tired, which was no surprise. "Doctor?" She wearily said, just loud enough for him to hear.

Doctor Hasan quickly walked over to his patient and moved the curtains. "Ah, you're awake. How are you feeling?"

Marida felt cautious about being treated by a Federation doctor, but thinking back on Banagher and Audrey's words, she tried to force those worries away. After all, she knew they wouldn't leave her with someone she couldn't trust. "I'm feeling tired and my body is aching."

"All things considered, you're healing at a remarkable rate. Which isn't surprising, given your enhancements."

Marida subconsciously placed a hand on her stomach, she knew what he meant but talking about her body like that seemed laughable. Then again, she'd be even more out-of-shape if she didn't have those enhancements. "I see you know about that."

"Yes, I actually met two of your sisters."

Marida blinked, she couldn't recall the last time she had talked about her sisters, she couldn't even recall the last time someone brought them up since the end of the First Neo-Zeon War. "Which ones?"

"Puru and Puru 2. I didn't know Puru 2 that well, she was only on the Nahel Argama for a day. Puru, however, I knew quite well. She was always so full of energy."

"I've been told she was like that."

"Did you know Puru 2?"

"Not well, she was often given missions separate from the rest of us. Though I did see her sometimes, she was very feisty."

"That's how Judau described her."

That name held an interest to Marida, she had been given standing orders by her first master to exterminate him but she never actually saw him, not even during the last battle of the war, which they both participated in. She had no plans to hurt him, but given the history he had with her sisters, she would still like to meet him. "You know Judau?"

"Yes, I served on this ship during the Gryps Conflict, only member of it's original crew to stick with it. Last time I saw him, Judau left for Jupiter with Roux. I don't know if he ever returned, we haven't kept in touch."

Roux. That was another name Marida had heard. Like Judau, Roux was someone Marida and her sisters were given standing orders on, but despite being on opposing sides with her, they were told to protect her. Even all these years after, her first master was still someone she didn't understand. "I see." She wished Hasan's answer was different.

"Ah, sorry for taking up so much of your time."

"i don't mind."

"Still, I'm sure you want to see Banagher and Mineva. I'll just call-"

"Audrey. Her name is Audrey Burne."

+++

"Bridge to, err..." Otto paused, realizing that saying "Bridge to Banagher's room" would sound rather unprofessional. "Bridge to Banagher, the patient has regained consciousness and is waiting for you and Mineva in the med bay. That is all."

"It's Audrey..." The princess pouted.

"Just when we got to Free Time." Micott complained.

"You two will probably want to visit her alone, right?" Takuya asked.

"Yeah, sorry we have to leave you again." A guilty Banagher said.

"I know it's hard to-" Audrey started.

"Geez, you guys. I get it's been a tough week for you but you're just going down the hall." Takuya said.

"R-Right, thanks." Banagher said as he and Audrey got up, the brunette holding Haro.

"You don't need to thank us, ten minutes isn't some big sacrifice." A bewildered Micott said.

As expected, Banagher and Audrey's bodies, especially their bellies, got jiggly. Audrey looked down at her belly, also as she expected, she still couldn't see her feet. Watching the large expanse of chub bob and bounce reminded her of Marida's gut. Back when she lived at Palau, which wasn't long ago, she often found herself watching the way Marida's tummy would jiggle whenever she walked. or made any sort of movement, for that matter. She was pretty sure one particularly huge belch the Puru made even caused it to jiggle. Watching Marida's belly didn't give her the same sort of feeling that Banagher's belly did, it was more that she looked at it because of how much of a stark contrast it was with her former fit form.

Thinking back on that made the Zabi wonder if now Marida would watch hers jiggle, that thought caused her to realize something. "I just remembered that Marida has no idea how fat I've gotten." As she said that, she poked her soft tummy, which gave her finger some leeway before it met resistance.

"Actually, I mentioned it a few times to her." Banagher said, trying to keep himself from staring at his friend's jiggly belly.

"That's better, but it'll still probably be a huge shock to her."

Once they entered the med bay, they were surprised to see Marida was in the middle of a friendly chat with Hasan.

"My original master never mentioned that Judau was so... odd." Marida said in response to something Banagher and Audrey didn't hear.

"He was certainly a headache for captain Bright. They all were." Here, Hasan noticed who had entered. "There you are."

"Is Marida okay?" Banagher asked, as Marida nearly did a double take when she realized the huge fatass next to Banagher was the princess of Zeon. Audrey noticed that, which made her feel even more self-conscious.

"She's fine. Just some fatigue and minor aching."

"That's... good."

"Thank you for your work, doctor." Audrey said.

"You're welcome, though I'm just doing my job." Hasan replied, pretty much the most stereotypical answer a doctor could give. "Now then, I'm sure you'd like some privacy as you talk." He then got out of his chair. "I'll be right outside if you need anything."

There was a brief silence once he left. Banagher wanted to apologize so badly but he couldn't even began to know how he should say it. Just looking at the wounded Marida was nearly unbearable. "Why am I even here?" He thought. "I'm the one who put her here, I don't deserve to see her."

Marida showed a small smile as she looked at them."Hello, little bro." Those words nearly brought him to tears. "Bro" that word sounded so unnatural coming from her. Was the use of such a casual word an attempt to make him feel more comfortable? Or was it that she felt a big sister should use casual words like that to refer to her little brother? Banagher didn't know, and wasn't going to ask, it would feel ungrateful to him. "Hey, sis." He muttered.

Marida then looked at Audrey and said "And hello, little sis."

"Hello to you too. I'm glad you're okay but is there something I'm missing? I know you and Banagher are close but when did you decide you were siblings?" Audrey asked.

"It was Banagher's idea." Marida thought back on Banagher's charming, cherubic smile. "Actually, it was him a few others, but he was the one really pushing it."

"I should've figured." Audrey said as she looked at him. "It's just like you."

Marida looked back at Banagher. "Don't stare at me like that." On paper, those words sounded harsh, like she was reprimanding him. But the way she said made it feel like she was telling him he doesn't have to feel so awful.

But it didn't make easier for Banagher to not stare at her, to not feel awful. "I'm still a bit fuzzy." That was all he could say to her. "Can you tell me what happened back there?"

"I'm not sure what happened either." Audrey added on.

"You must've been swallowed up by the machine. A Psycommu backflow." Marida started. "You're controlling it but then suddenly it's controlling you."

Banagher wanted to find relief in those words, but he couldn't, they didn't seem true. "... That's not what it felt like. I-I remember wanting... to hurt you."

"I'm sure you did, I hurt you badly. I'm sorry."

"Don't apologize!" Banagher didn't mean to yell, but he couldn't help himself. "I'm the one who hurt you! I'm the one who needs to apologize!"

Giving him a sympathetic look, AUdrey held Banagher's hand, she could tell from how his breathing calmed that it helped.

"Banagher," Marida began, her voice filled with care. "You were angry at me, you wanted to punish me for hurting you, that's everyone's first reaction to being hurt by someone they care about. But you weren't why it went so far. Your own pain and anger, the amplification of emotions from the Psycho-Frame, and the instinct embedded in that Gundam to seek, hunt down, and destroy Newtypes, even artificial ones, it all made for a violent combination. The way your emotions were influenced to the point you did something you would never do, it's not unlike someone being drugged against their will."

"... I can't, I can't stop feeling guilty."

"That just further proves it wasn't your will." Audrey pointed out.

"What was your will was when the machine stopped. Your will, your foundation, forced the system into submission.

"My what?"

"People like me don't have that, that's why we can merge our consciousness with machines."

"Marida-"

"Never mind me, you shouldn't be spending a break talking about stuff like this." Marida showed him a small smile again. "I heard you're having a party tonight, would you mind if I join you?"

To say that surprised Audrey, Banagher, and Haro was an understatement, and not just because the conversation's mood had been flipped 180 degrees in less then five seconds. "Don't you have to stay in?" Banagher asked.

"I already got permission to leave, I just need to take some pain medication and check in every day." Marida explained. "My original master gave my bodies enhancements as he created me." To demonstrate this, Marida got out of bed. Slowly, but with no pain. "See?" She was dressed in the typical medical garb, unlike the ones worn in the old world, these were designed with pants, essentially making it proper clothes. That said, one part of the original design that couldn't be fixed was that it would still show off a huge, fat belly, like Marida's. While her bellybutton wasn't showing anymore, the way it hugged her belly wasn't much better. Her belly wasn't the only thing it hugged, it hugged her very chunky legs as well, and it wasn't a good thing either that her fat calves could now be seen. That said, not nearly as much of her flabby legs were shown compared to her arms. The shirt only covered her shoulders and left her huge, bulging bingo wings out in the open for anyone to see how out-of-shape the redhead had gotten. And it wasn't like she was proud to show off the rest of her arms either.

"Did I do that to you?" Banagher solemnly asked.

"Hm? Oh, you mean these?" Marida placed a hand on the burn mark on her left arm, Banagher was also referring to some scars on her right arm. "These are years old, silly."

"Oh." Banagher said, his face returning to a more normal look, specifically embarrassment.

"Didn't know guilt could cause you to forget basic biology." Audrey teased. It was a little insensitive but Banagher could tell she was saying that to help him relax.

"By the way, I'm surprised by how fat you've gotten, Audrey." If Audrey's joke was a little insensitive, then Marida's completely serious remark was a three time gold medal winner in the Insensitivity Olympics.

"Marida!" Her chubby face having turned as red as a tomato in an instant, Audrey futility tried to cover her huge, hanging free belly with her arms.

"Banagher told me you had gotten fat, but I wasn't expecting you to be as big as him."

"H-He still has the bigger belly! ... No offense, it is a very nice belly."

"None taken." Banagher casually said as he rubbed his big belly, which actually did feel kinda nice, like he always had a pillow with him.

"And I noticed your clothes are just as ill-fitting as his." The oblivious Marida continued. "Is your stomach cold? You're holding-"

"Can we please stop this conversation?!" Audrey begged, covering her gut even tighter.

"If you want but I don't see what the problem is. We're only talking about your weight, and I'm just as fat and out-of-shape as-"

"Marida, please!"

The conversation was (mercifully, for Audrey) interrupted by a hearty chuckle from Banagher. Marida was glad to see him feeling better, and Audrey was glad too but she really wished it could've been done a different way.

With that topic out of the way, Marida slipped on her slippers and threw on a light tan jacket Hasan had given her, both to look less like a patient and to hide her arm fat. "So when does the party start?"

"It, uh, huh. You know, we never really decided on a time. I guess it's whenever Riddhe and Mihiro show up."

"And they are?"

"Two good friends, they're members of the ship's crew."

"That's not a problem, is it?" Audrey asked, no longer covering her gut.

"Of course not."

After leaving the room and telling Hasan they were done there, the trio wobbled back to Banagher's room, along with Haro, though he wasn't walking. As per the usual, the bodies of all three engaged in a lot of jiggling and bouncing, especially the stomachs. Marida looked at her little siblings' tummies, just like Audrey, Banagher did truly have the bigger gut of the two. Which wasn't surprising, like as she told Angelo before, Banagher was talented at getting a huge gut. To think just a week ago, it was flat as a board. Of course, Marida did have the biggest gut out of the three of them, but she was also much fatter then them too.

As they engaged in idle chatter, Marida would notice that every now and then, one of the two love birds would be taking a look at the other's tummy and how it bounced. Normally she would've thought it was simple curiosity, but after listening to Banagher describe his journey with her, and seeing their closeness herself, she knew exactly what it was, and she whole-heartily approved of it.

When they entered Banagher's room, Audrey and Banagher had to go before Marida so all four wouldn't get stuck, the redhead's appearance was a bit of a surprise to Takuya and Micott. Banagher had mentioned to them that Marida was fatter then they were but they didn't think she would be over a hundred pounds heavier.

"Huh, didn't know Marida was going to be joining us." Micott remarked as Banagher, Audrey, and Haro sat back down with them on the couch, whilst Marida had to use the second couch.

"You sure you should be up already?" Takuya asked.

"I already got permission." Marida informed, the couch cushion sinking more from her huge bubble butt then the ones the others were using. Her ass was even bigger then Micott's, but were the brunette to pack on enough pounds to rival Marida, she would reclaim her title of having the fattest ass on the Nahel Argama. She wasn't sure if she was ready to accept that title with pride yet.

"In that case, as long as you can really stuff yourself full of food, you're all set for the party!"

Marida ran a hand over her tummy, this was the first time in months it was fully clothed, not counting her nightgown or pilot suit, but she could still feel it's incredible softness through the fabric. Most people in her situation would never plan to eat so much their belly comes bulging right back out, but for Marida, having fun with Banagher and Audrey was more then reason enough for her. "Don't worry, I've got more then enough skill when it comes to binging. After all, how do you think I got so fat?" Marida boasted, giving her belly a hearty slap for emphasis.

"She can really pack it away, she once ate twenty six plates in one sitting!" Banagher bringing that that feat up to his friends brought joy to Marida.

"Damn! Twenty six?" An impressed Takuya said.

"Yup! And she won Best Eater at two different places!"

"Don't forget that we won that title at the ice cream parlor together." Marida reminded.

Micott really wished she was there to see them win that title, though only for Banagher's part. She wasn't entirely comfortable with Marida's prescience, not only was she the one who kidnapped Banagher, but she was why the fight that killed her class started. Still, Banagher was clearly close to her, so she was going to try to see the good in her.

"Oh! I just remembered!" Before he was about to say it, he realized he should probably ask Marida first. "Is it okay if we tell them about, you know, how you were born?" His choice of words got Micott and Takuya interested, so it was a good thing Marida gave him permission.

"I don't mind."

"Right." Banagher looked back at Takuya and Micott. "Guys, Marida is also Puru 12."

Were they drinking anything, Takuya and Micott would've spit it right out. Takuya's would've hit a very annoyed Audrey right in the face, while Micott's would hit the back of Takuya's head. "What?" Micott flatly asked.

"It's true." Marida said like this wasn't a huge revelation.

"But I thought all the Purus were killed." Micott pointed out, yet she somehow could feel that Marida really was a Puru.

"Most of them were, as far as I know, I'm the only survivor. I actually don't see why this is so interesting."

"It's cuz we've been watching you for years!" Takuya suddenly shouted, this startled Audrey (again) and Marida, but it had no effect on the ones more used to his personality, namely Banagher, Micott, and Haro.

"You have?" A VERY confused Marida said.

"Smooth choice of words, dumbass." Micott snarked.

"Crap, that really came out wrong. I mean we've been watching you on TV, there's an anime based on the First Neo-Zeon War, and all the Purus were in it.

"There was? Was Audrey in it?"

"Yes, and I wish I got to voice myself." Audrey pouted.

"Wait, since you're a Puru," A grin started to appear on Micott's round face. "Does that mean you used to say it?"

Grins suddenly appeared on the faces of the rest of those present except Haro, but if he could, he would.

"It?"

"You know," Micott started. "It!"

Marida now looked very embarrassed, it was one of the rare times Banagher and Audrey had ever seen her blush. "Oh, that... Well, I don't anymore if that's what you're asking."

"Say it!" Takuya asked.

"I don't think that's necessary."

"C'mon, say it!" Micott asked.

"It's nothing special."

"Just once?" Banagher asked.

"I probably couldn't do it even if I tried."

"Please, Marida." Audrey asked with her best puppydog eyes, the increased softness of her face made them even more effective. And they were pretty damn effective anyways!

"Just once, is that clear?" Looking away from the group, here was a pause as she awkwardly rubbed her hands together. "... Puru puru puru..."
