Normally Riddhe would be happy to see his friends, but when he saw them enter the Argama's gym, he was not, as their arrival announced that it was time to work out. Still, the presence of the others would make this more bearable.

"She got you too, huh, Riddhe?" Takuya could tell from Riddhe sitting on a bench and not working out that he wasn't much more enthusiastic about this then he was.

"Yeah." He dejectedly said.

"You had no problem getting some exercise in yesterday." Mihiro sassed, hands on her chunky hips.

"Yeah, I wanted to take a break today, maybe get some practice in with the Delta Plus. And your slave driver attitude is making me worried."

"I'm not acting like a slave driver."

"You must be if you got Alberto to show up." Micott snarked, amused by how after all this weight gain, Alberto was still tied with Marida for the title of Fattest Person on the Nahel Argama. Though neither could yet claim the title of fattest Person EVER on the Nahel Argama.

"I heard that!" The fat man chided. "And I'll have you know I won't be doing any exercise at all, I'm merely here to observe." He choose to use the word "observe" instead of "watch" in an attempt to make himself seem more a esteemed gentleman.

"You know that's just a self-own, right?"

Alberto pouted as he wisely decided to keep his mouth shut.

He wasn't the only unexpected guest there, nor was he the only sitting at the bench adjacent to Riddhe's, as Shin and Daguza were also there.

"Hey, uh, is Mr. Daguza going to be our instructor or something?" Takuya asked. "Cuz if he is, I-"

"No, I'm not." As always, Daguza spoke with a stoic and stern tone, like they were in the middle of a military operation. "Like Alberto, I'm just here to watch." The others had a feeling that was the only time Daguza would ever use the words "Like Alberto" when referring to himself, including Alberto.
"And myself." Shin added. Audrey, who hadn't noticed him until now, was happy to see him. It gave her some hope this wouldn't be that bad.


As everyone jiggled on over to either a machine or a mat to start exercising, Banagher wobbled over to Alberto while Audrey waddled to Shin. The princess aimed to catch up some more with the White Wolf, while the Gundam pilot had a more specific topic in mind for the Anaheim Electronics member.

"Thanks for all the help, Alberto. I really appreciate it." The brunette said, how chubby his face was with it's cherubic cheeks and thick double chin made his smile even more friendly.

Alberto had almost found himself at a lost for words. He tried to view his dealings related to Laplace's Box as just a simple matter of doing his job, especially one very unpleasant act he had performed a little over a week ago. He tried to view Banagher as just simply a piece of the puzzle he had to treat very delicately. But hearing those words from him... felt a lot better then he thought it would've. "Ahem. You're welcome. It's good to see someone here knows how to show a little gratitude." He was only willing to say that last bit because he knew Daguza couldn't care less what he thought.

"Don't worry, I'm not the only one who's grateful." As Banagher said that, Alberto saw the incredibly obese visage of Marida as the fat Puru walked past her chunky, little bro. A small burp passed her lips as she ran a hand threw her long, red hair.

"Um, Alberto?"

"Huh?" The blond pried his eyes away from the Neo-Zeon pilot's beautiful hair and massive, jiggling ass. "I-I'm sorry, I didn't hear you."

"I said I'm not the only one who's grateful. The others just haven't said it because they haven't talked to you before or they're one of those gruff, military guys who aren't big on saying thanks. Right, Daguza?" He cheekily said that last part.

"That's correct." Daguza humorlessly said.

"Hopefully some of your friends will thank me, since I'm here." Alberto stated.

"Don't take this the wrong way but why are you here? Me and the others exercising isn't going to be that interesting." Banagher asked.

"TV is an effective way to pass the time and all but I was up for a change of pace."

+++

As the others partied, gamed, talked, ate, and belched to their heart's content last night, Alberto was alone.

Within the darkened monitor room, the only source of light Alberto had as he sat at the terminal was from it's monitor. The image it showed as it made this light was that of Martha Vist Carbine, Alberto's aunt.

"The Nahel Argama will conduct an inspection of the coordinated airspace, before the Unicorn is shipped off to Luna II." Alberto informed her, a tiredness seen in his eyes. "Information regarding the key to Laplace's Box will be-"

"Is there a problem, Alberto?" She cut him off, her voiced contained a mock aura of concern, it was only able to serve as a faint cover of condescension. "You're not looking well."

Now that she said so, Alberto had been finding each report he made to her more tiring then the last one. He couldn't see exactly why that was, and he didn't want to say something that could make her lose faith in him, so he decided it was best to claim there was no problem. "No, not at all." A drop of sweat on his cheek, he uncomfortably cleared his throat. "I-It's just that after all these battles, the men are exhausted. And, well, I... i was just thinking that couldn't hits matter have been left to another unit?"

Her frown shifted into a small, amused smile, unlike the ones Audrey would show Banagher, this smile didn't show a fondness for traits the wearer found endearing, this smile showed nothing but haughty amusement. "You wouldn't be getting attached to them, would you?"

Alberto found his mouth slightly agape, he didn't want to believe that his emotions were impacting his assignment, but he found those words more worrying then he wished.

"Once you've landed on Earth. you'll be able to relax."

"Landed on Earth?"

"I'm currently arranging a transport for you. It'll take some time to arrive but once it does, you'll use it to take the Cyber Newtype whose being held prisoner to Augusta in North America."

"Augusta?" He was familiar with that name, particularly when used to refer to the Federation's Augusta Newtype Labs. Even back during the One Year War that place had a reputation as a place where lives held no value. A place where people left it completely different then when they entered. Yet despite, higher ups in the Federation held a deep, vested interest in keeping them operational. Even heavy damage dealt to it during the war, followed by a major leak of the work done there, wasn't enough to keep someone from resurrecting it. As of now, it had been shut down for years, one of the many concessions made towards the AEUG and like-minded folk, but it was no surprise that humans would still be able to use hat facility's dark legacy. "Gah!" Alberto's mouth opened further as he realized what he was going to be forced to participate in.

"Right. As you know, the labs have long been shut down but my agents have informed me the facilities needed for readjustments are operational."

"I-I-I-I'm not sure that would be wise." He stammered. "That facility is what gave birth to the Pale Rider, which is part of why we lost the Unicorn in the first place." It was hard for him to keep his anxiety from raising his voice against his will.

"I understand your concerns, but I wouldn't say the Pale Rider is a complete waste. If Puru 12 could be captured, then so can the Pale Rider." She said as if she hadn't noticed her nephew's obvious discomfort. "And while 12 will do more then fine for Unit 2, Chloe would be my ideal pick."

"Unit 2? You mean it's been repaired?"

"Yes. As a matter of fact the chest had to be completely overhauled after what Unit 3 did to it."

"I-I see."

"You know, if father had simply told me the location of the box, I wouldn't have to resort to such underhanded measures." She smugly ran a hand through her long, pale blonde hair. "Speaking of our family, how is that arrogant child, Banagher, doing? Still gravely underestimating the burden his father placed on him?"

"Well, I-I'm no psychologist, and I haven't talked to him since before he was captured, so-so take all this was a grain of salt."

"Go on."

"It seems like he wants to just run away from it."

"Meaning literally run away?"

Even making that small, incredibly minor mistake made Alberto feel like his fat neck got just a little closer to the chopping block. "Ah, no! No, I-I mean figuratively. He's mostly been burying himself in his hobbies, as well as a newfound appreciation for, um, eating."

"Ah, a typical teenager then." There was some amusement in Martha's voice, Alberto wasn't sure if it was at the fact that her ambitions were being derailed by someone like that, or if ti was simple condescension at someone she found beneath her. No, know that he thought about it, he knew the answer. It was both. "What was that you said about a newfound appreciation for food? How do you know it's new?"

"He's put on quite a lot of weight. When he first arrived on the Nahel Argama, he was slim as a board, now he can't even keep his stomach covered."

A wicked smirk formed on Martha's face, the sight of it giving Alberto's goosebumps. "That gives me an idea. Let's fatten him up even further."

"I'm... sorry?"

"For now, we need him alive, and capturing him would be difficult when there's a risk of him running to the Unicorn. But if his weight makes him immobile, then we can just roll him out of the Nahel Argama and into our hands."

"Well, I-I suppose that could work."

"Try and get close to him, see what you can learn about my poor nephew's eating habits."

"Mr. Alberto, thank you so much for helping bring Banagher back." Audrey curtsied to show her gratitude to the man, she had to apply more force then normal, as her belly squished against her. It was a little awkward, especially with how her big gut got in the way, but it was far more endearing. "You have my deepest gratitude, as well as that of the others."

"I'm... I'm glad you're so happy, princess Mineva." Although Alberto smiled at her, she and Banagher could still see some discomfort on his round face. They weren't sure where it was coming from, and they didn't want to pry and make him more uncomfortable, so they didn't ask.

"If it's not too much to ask, could you call me Audrey Burne? It's a long story but that's my name now."

With a charmingly chubby face like that, how could Alberto refuse? "Princess Audrey?"

"Just Audrey in casual conversation."

"Very well then, Audrey. Don't let me keep you and Banagher from working out.

"C'mon, Banagher. We've got some big bellies to lose!"

The lovebirds wobbled over to a small line of treadmills, Banagher holding Haro, their legs chaffing together and jostling.

It was only when he saw the two of them, equally obese and jiggling together, and about to work out, that it all clicked for Alberto. "Of course!" Ringed in his mind. "Audrey is why Banagher has gotten so fat! It makes perfect sense, she's being an overly-generous girlfriend to him and vice versa! Oh lord, what is aunt Martha going to do when I tell her that?"

"How does this machine work?" Audrey asked Banagher, referring to a treadmill. She had only seen them a few times before, when she watched Marida exercise, and also in a few movies, so she had no idea how they worked.

"Basically you pick a speed for the tread to run at and you try to keep up."

"What's a good speed for a beginner?"

"Umm..." Banagher crossed his arms over his flabby chest. "No idea. I never did any exercise outside of gym class. You know me, I'm into video games, models, and TV."

"Start with three miles per hour." Shin advised from the bench.

"Thank you, Shin." Audrey thanked.

A little nervous, the blonde stepped onto the treadmill, her friend getting on the one to her left. Right after Banagher did, she started the machine at 3MPH. The tread suddenly moving shocked her, causing her to lose her balance, almost falling over before she regained her balance. She had no doubt that if she had fallen, it would've been the most humiliating start to working out ever, and it would've happened right there for her soulmate and her adoptive father to see the whole thing. At least her belly would've cushioned the fall.

Their running created plenty of jiggling on their bodies, with their bellies, chests, and butts being constantly in motion as they bobbed and bounced. Their meaty legs chaffed and jostled, which wasn't helping their form. The bouncing their puffy tummies did caused them to constantly slap their thighs, which contributed to making the jiggling of both even more intense. As Banagher had the fatter belly, not only was his more jiggly, it had more to jiggle. It was like he was carrying a huge water balloon on his torso.

Audrey had even more of a bubble butt then her friend, and was worried all this jiggling would cause it to her rip pants, exposing her pink underwear.

It took ten seconds for Banagher to start panting, Audrey only took seven. The princess soon started sweating and getting red in the face, symptoms Banagher showed after her. As they got more exhausted, their forms got more sluggish and clumsy. But while Banagher was merely clumsy, Audrey was running like she had just cleared out an all-you-can-eat buffet and was trying to run a marathon while still stuffed. The fat princess' face took on the coloration of a tomato, her panting getting more frequent and loud, her mouth agape in fatigue.

Soon she had to call it quits. She shut the treadmill off, stepped off it, and then collapsed onto the floor, her huge ass jiggling.

Overall, her run lasted fifty seconds. Better then last time, she lasted almost a full minute this time.

Concerned, Banagher shut his machine off and rushed over to her side. He knelled down next to her, Haro joining them. "You okay?"

The poor young woman panted before she could answer. "-Pant pant pant- Exercising -Pant- is hard..."

"I know how you feel." He placed a hand on the top of her belly sympathetically and gave it a little rub. "I'll get you some water."

"Here you go." Before Banagher could even start getting up, Shin was there offering four bottles of water, two for each of them.

"Thanks!" Audrey hastily said as she snatched one of the water bottles out of the White Wolf's hands and started guzzling it down with incredible speed.

Both of them let out refreshed gasps once they chugged down as much as they could in one go, only one fourth of their first bottle was left.

"Feeling better? Feeling better?" Haro asked.

"-Pant- Yeah." Audrey answered for both of them. Here, she wiped some sweat off her brow. "... Maybe I'm just not made for this sort of stuff. I-It's not like I was ever-"

"Don't be so disheartened." Shin stopped her as he knelled down in front of her. "Many start out as unfit as you, but they end up getting a little better every time."

"But I really can't see myself ever being good at this."

"But did you ever think you would see me again? Even if you knew I was alive, would you have thought that?"

"No, I wouldn't have."

"And even if you can't do it," Banagher started his advice, though he didn't think he was helping nearly as much as Shin. "It doesn't say anything about you as a person."

"I..." She found herself struggling to think of something to say. "I want to keep trying, but let's do something that doesn't require running."

"That didn't take long." Micott remarked as she and Takuya saw that Audrey was already a sweaty mess for the second time today.

"It is kinda funny." Takuya admitted. "But cut her some slack, she's never done this before."

"I know, I know. It's not like we're much better."

The two of them had picked push ups, as that seemed like the easiest form of exercise to them. Partly because their puffy tummies meant they could cheat. Since their abdomens were so large, they were always just an inch off the ground when the two teenagers were in position. So this meant they could just go down slightly, say "Well, I touched the ground, guess that counts as one", and call it exercise.

"That's not how you do a push up!" Of course, that scheme was quickly foiled with a quick scolding from Mihiro.

"Okay! Okay! We'll do it right this time!" Takuya quickly said to placate her, her scolding had startled the two overweight teens.

"Man, you really are a slavedriver!" Micott whined as they started doing actual push ups.

Ironically, their stomachs, what they used to make doing push ups easier, now made push ups harder for them. They would have to press them as hard into the ground as they could, their deep love handles flaring out as the bellies squished, in order for their chests to reach the ground. Unfortunately, the expansion all those calories gave their chests couldn't help, their chests specifically had to touch the ground, not Micott's large tits or Takuya's big man boobs.

As for Mihiro and Riddhe, the brunette was doing pull ups and the blond was lifting with a barbel, and both were struggling in different ways For Riddhe, he used to be able to lift 5 pound weights no problem, his personal best being fifty lifts in one session, but the tone of his arms had melted into soft pudge that would jiggle a little if slapped. They were struggling to lift two pound weights, causing Riddhe to start sweating earlier then he should've. The hardest part was when the bar got close to his chest, as it pressed into his squishy moobs.

Over at the nearby pull up bar, Mihiro was having just as much trouble. It was a true struggle for the brunette to pull her hefty body up. She would grunt with a very strained look on her pudgy face with every pull up, and when she actually reached the top, she'd left herself flop right back down, her gut slapping her upper thighs, and her tits slapping her gut as they, her butt, and her legs jostled violently. She'd have to take an at least ten seconds long break after each one, panting as she caught her breath.

Since she was facing a wall, Mihiro's humongous booty was hanging out there for all to see, her pants doing nothing to make it less noticeable. If anything, the obvious strain her gigantic ass put on it just highlighted her behind's enormity. Riddhe found himself looking at it a lot, even when he didn't mean to, and was glad Mihiro was unaware of that.

"This -pant- is going to be harder -pant- then I thought..." She groaned.

"-Pant- Are we still going to do -pant- this for a whole hour?"

Mihiro did not know the answer to that.

"One two, stretch two!" Over at one of the mats, Marida instructed Audrey and Banagher as all three did their stretches. This had been going on for a while by now, all three were obviously in need of a break, red in the face and sweating. It took all of Marida's strength to not pant when she said that.

They were now trying to reach their toes, which their bellies were determined to make very hard.

"I can't. -Pant pant- I'm too fat." Banagher groaned, this being one of those cases where having most of your weight go straight to your gut was not a good thing.

"Stop whining, Banagher! Any bigger and you won't fit in your Gundam!"

"You don't -ngh- need to be so harsh, Marida." Audrey said as she struggled.

"Sorry, I heard being -pant- harsh can be a good motivator."

Jumping jacks were a much more simple form of exercise then stretching, but they were just as exhausting, and the way it made Banagher, Audrey, and Marida's bodies jiggle all around the place was not helping. Their humongous bellies, huge chests, large bubble butts, and chunky legs were constantly in motion, like jello on a plate during an earthquake.

And they didn't merely jiggle, their bellies bounced up and down with each jumping jack, slapping their upper thighs and doubling the jiggling of both. The flabby sacks of fat that made up their chests did the same to their guts. And while their big butts didn't have anything to hit, they absolutely did tons of bouncing. Each part of their bodies were jiggling in perfect synchronization.

"I'm -pant- gonna -pant- collapse! -Pant pant-" Audrey complained, looking as exhausted as she sounded. She and the others had faces so red with exhaustion, it was comparable to her at her most embarrassed. This image of exhaustion was compete with plenty of sweat on their pie-like faces.

Banagher wanted to say something to help the nanosecond he heard that, but first he had to do some panting in order to have enough breath to actually say something. "-Pant pant- Hold on just a little -pant-, we're almost -pant- done..."

"Keep it up! Keep it up!" Haro cheered.

"That's -pant- right." Marida confirmed, both to keep their spirits up and her own. "Just ten left! -Pant pant-"

It took ten more seconds for them to reach their goal of fifty jumping jacks, a reasonable time to do so, but to them it felt more like ten minutes of nothing but pain and thirst. It was no surprise to anyone that as soon as they reached their target number, all three collapsed onto the mat.

It was far from the sight one would imagine the last surviving Zabi, a Cyber Newtype, and a Gundam pilot to be in. They didn't seem to embody grace, power, and will, instead they all looked like a wreck. Not only were their faces still red and sweaty, but now that Audrey and Banagher's exposed bellies weren't constantly in motion, one could now see they were glistening with sweat.

Normally, Marida's belly was completely covered by her new wardrobe, something she had really missed, but all the shaking and jiggling from the jumping jacks caused her gut to come flopping out of her medical outfit, showing that it was just as sweaty as as the tummies of her little siblings, and not to mention reminding the poor redhead of how fat she truly was. If her face wasn't already red as a tomato from exhaustion, she would've blushed.

Even the way they collapsed didn't have much dignity, with Audrey once again sprawled out on the floor, this time with Banagher lazily leaned against the massive sack of softness that was her gut. The princess and pilot looked like they were both about to pass out. Haro rolled over to in between them, partially out of sympathy.

"Good -pant- job. -Pant pant- We burned a lot -pant- of calories today." Marida said as reassuringly as she could.

Audrey and Banagher groaned their (somewhat disingenuous) agreement in between panting and wheezing.

"Is exercise -pant- supposed -pant- to hurt so much?" The blonde princess asked, not even trying to sit up. She knew she would be exhausted but she didn't think she would be as exhausted as when she was running for her life.

"Gotta be honest," Banagher took a quick break to catch his breath. "This is making me feel even fatter."

"No pain, -pant- no gain." Marida reminded them.

That was when Shin showed up with more water for the three of them, at this point he was practically their water boy. And surprisingly, so did Alberto and Daguza.

"How are you feeling?" Shin kindly asked as Audrey chugged water.

The blonde could only respond three seconds later, once she had gotten enough water. She knew it was impolite but she couldn't help it, the poor thing was just so thirsty. "-Pant pant- I I'm exhausted."

"That's because you did so well." Hearing those words from Shin filled the princess with pride, "Do you want to keep going or call it a day? You've earned it."

It was tempting to say she was done for the day, it truly was, but unless Banagher was also willing to call it quits, she felt like she would be letting him down. "I..." She took another sip. "I want to keep going."

Shin's proud smirk grew bigger. "That's the spirit."

At the same time, Daguza was providing Banagher with constructive criticism. Constructive AND harsh criticism. "Your form is sloppy, you get tired far too quickly, and you seem to have very little knowledge of how exercise works. Still, it's not impossible for you to shape up with time."

"Yeah..." Banagher dejectedly said, he found himself looking at his gut. He poked it, his finger easily sinking into the malleable fat. Such a big, soft orb it was, he never saw any of the other Gundam pilots with a torso like this. "Mr. Daguza?"

"Hmm?"

"Did you ever serve with someone as fat as me?"

"No, I haven't."

Banagher frowned and looked back down at his tummy. "Of course that was the answer." He thought. "How did I think it was possible he would say anything else?"

"However," Banagher looked back up at him. "That's not the quesiton you should be asking. What you should be asking me is if I ever saw someone your weight at training. And I did."

"Did he pass?"

"He did."

Although Daguza said that as stoically as usual, Banagher found his frown leaving his soft face.

The third conversation being held simultaneously was between Marida and Alberto as the latter gave the former lots of water. "Here you go, all the water you could possibly need." The blond said as he handed her two out of six bottles of water.

"Thank you." Marida quickly started chugging like she was part of a contest to see who could finish their water first.

"You're welcome. Just make sure you don't push yourself too far." He said as watched her guzzle as if Alberto wasn't there. He found that there was something kinda amazing about how quickly she was drinking, and how much she drank in one go.

"I won't," She said when she was done drinking. "Especially not when it could lead to them overdoing it too."

"Good, and let me know if there's anything wrong."

"Of course."

"A-And I don't just mean physically, I mean emotionally as well."

"You guys -pant- mind sharing some -pant- of that water?" An exhausted Micott said as she, Takuya, Mihiro, and Riddhe lumbered over. Sweating and red in the (chubby) face, they all looked like they had been hit by a truck, not unlike how Audrey, Banagher, and Marida looked before they drank. That trio still looked like they had been hit by a vehicle, just by merely a small car now.

"We're all out." Riddhe groaned. He then wiped some sweat off his brow.

+++

"Hhn!" Audrey's big, bulbous belly pressed and squished against her meaty legs with all it's blubbery might. The way her stomach squished and folded made it look like she had a double belly. Her face was right back to being red and sweaty. Even so, she wasn't going to give up, not while Banagher and the others were watching her.

"You're doing it, Audrey!" Banagher cheered on Audrey as he anchored her.

"Grh!"

"Go Audrey! Go Audrey!" Haro cheered on, bouncing up and down.

It took five more seconds, for a total of 20, and as soon as she finished, she triumphantly shouted "O-O-One!" and then flopped right back down with a thud in less then a second. Her gut, boobs, legs, and ass jiggled from the impact, which Banagher couldn't help but feel some attraction to. Once again, her stomach loomed over her, she could only see Banagher's fluffy, brown hair over it.

"See, Audrey? I knew you could do." He complimented with a sweet smile. "So this is how Marida felt watching me doing it." He thought. "It does seem a lot more impressive when you're the one watching."

"Good job! Good job!" Haro said.

"Thanks..." Audrey said after catching her breath. Here, she focused on her tummy and gave it a disapproving poke. "Somehow after all this, my stomach is my worst enemy. I guess it's my final boss. That what's you said they're called in video games, right?"

Banagher chuckled. "It's more like a really tough bonus boss." For emphasis, he grabbed the sides of his gut and gave it a good shake, the fatty orb bouncing up and down in a gelatinous fashion. "That goes for both our stomachs."

Unbeknownst to them, Micott was watching all that jiggly goodness unfold, and she couldn't, nor did she want to, take her eyes off it. "Damn, Banagher's so jiggly!" She thought. Unbeknownst to her, someone was watching her.

"I see what you're looking at." That someone was a very amused Takuya.

Micott was so caught up in her best pal's gut that she jolted when she heard her other best pal's voice. "Shut up and do your sit ups!" She snarled, with a cute blush on her chubby cheeks.

Takuya did as she asked, his grin quickly leaving him as soon as he had to put in effort. It took him fifteen seconds to do it, and each pull up left him a little more tired then he was before. With how much harder having a gut was making this for him, he was glad he wasn't Banagher. He was struggling so much he didn't notice the way Micott kept her eyes on his fat stomach as it squished against his chubby legs.

"Banagher's the one who's really got a gut around here." The brunette thought. "But Takuya's also got a belly I wouldn't mind giving a rub." All these thoughts about puffy bellies made her think of her own. She looked down at it, while it wasn't her biggest asset, that would be her ass, she still did have a pretty big belly. With it being a fat enough orb that her short shorts were only able to barely hold it back before it finally popped the buttons off during the party. She gave it a couple slaps, making it jiggle. "Since Banagher and Takuya are into fat chicks, I wonder if I'm fat enough for them yet."

For every member of the group, a single sit up would take around fifteen seconds, except for Audrey, who as demonstrated, took twenty, and Marida, who took even more then that.

Marida loudly grunted as she slowly forced her upper body upwards, her huge,massive, blubbery belly was pressing against her very meaty legs and squishing before she was even halfway there. She fought her gut with all her strength, her fat, double-chinned face scrunched as she kept on. Unsurprisingly, her face was red and sweaty from exhaustion

It took her thirty seconds to complete her first sit up, and when she dd, she ungracefully flopped back onto her back, just like her little siblings, but with a louder thud and even more jiggly action. Her dome of belly rose up and down with each labored breath.

While some would see an absolutely defeated woman, Shin, who was acting as her anchor, saw some positivity in her performance."Impressive! You've still got a perfect form!"

"Thank -pant- you." The redhead said, her gigantic tummy blocking her view of Shin, it made her feel like she was talking to her stomach. "At least I haven't lost all traces of my thin days."

"I can tell you've still been doing exercise. Have you ever done it with Audrey or Banagher?"

"A few times with Banagher, this is my first session with the princess. They've got enthusiasm and spirit, but their form is terrible."

They both looked over to see Audrey struggling greatly with the start of sit up number 2 as Banagher and Haro cheered her on, confirming what the Puru said.

+++

The group did hit their target of one full hour of exercise, and when they wobbled out of the gym, they looked like they had been doing it for ten hours straight.

"What a day." Audrey groaned as she held Haro, Banagher waddling with them.

"Yeah but I think we did a really good job." Banagher said. "I think I actually lost enough weight to close my jacket now." He boasted with a chubby grin.

He grabbed the sides of his jacket and tried to close it but he found his big belly was giving him a lot of trouble like usual. He pressed as hard as he could, even making his gut squish a bit. "C'mon!" He realized this wasn't working, and making him look like a fool in front of his soulmate, so he sucked in his stomach as much as he could. It did make the sides get a little closer but not nearly enough. Even so, he kept at it, grunting all the while, looking and sounding more frustrated by the second.

If anything, all he was succeeding in was putting a lot of emphasis on his gut to Audrey, who was just looking at him the whole time in amusement, along with Haro. In fact, he actually made his belly look even bigger, and it was already the biggest belly on the Argama, aside from Marida's.

After 20 seconds of effort, he realized he was still too big and gave up, releasing his jacket and letting his gut come flopping back out. "I'm gonna need to lose a few more pounds." He said, a cute, dorky smile on his fat face.

Audrey giggled with a sweet and amused smile. It was the type of giggle that said "You're a dork but it's really charming". "You'll get it one day."

The two resumed walking, normally Banagher would've felt particularly self-conscious about all the bouncing his stomach was doing, but what his soulmate said really did help. It didn't satisfy his worries, but they had found themselves appeased. For now, just having possibility was enough.

While most of the group kept walking, Micott, Takuya, Shin, and Marida waited for them to be done with their little scene. Now they walked as one group, and jiggled all the way, except for Shin and Haro, of course. Like always, Micott's gigantic, nearly needing two chairs ass was jostling with every step as her chunky legs chaffed together, but this time that actually gave her an idea.

Discreetly, she ran a hand over her left ass cheek, her ass as a whole being large enough that that the lower cheeks were rendered bare."Definitely big enough for him." She thought. "If Banagher thinks Audrey has a big ass, then wait till he sees this!"

She moved in front of him, making sure to wobble in a way that had her bubble butt swaying from left to right like a pendulum as it seductively jiggled. "So, Banagher," She looked back at him, pleased to see the brunette was looking at her massive ass. She would've liked to see a little jealously in Audrey, but this was fine. More then fine. Besides, she wasn't mad at her anymore. Jealous, of course, but she still regarded the princess as her pal. Her very awkward pal. "We're not gonna do any more unpacking today, right?"

"No way, after all that, what we need is a lazy afternoon." That was what he said, what he thought was "Damn, Micott's ass is big! How has she not ripped those shorts yet?"

Takuya wiped some sweat off his brow. "Man, I feel like I just went through boot camp."

"You'll get used to it." Shin said. "Trust me, that was nothing compared to what you'll all be doing in a few weeks."

"You're just making me dread exercise even more."

Ahead of them, Mihiro and Riddhe were lumbering along in their own group. "You know, we should've worn some work out clothes." The blond pointed out.

"I don't want to show off even more of my flab then I already am." She looked down at her stomach, the bulging orb that was it was. She still hadn't gotten around to getting herself a bigger uniform and especially a bigger belt. And given how tired she was right now, she really didn't feel like doing that now. Or today at all. "And I doubt anyone else does either." Mihiro didn't know it, but Micott would love to show off her corpulent figure to Banagher, and to see him show off his own.

"Guess so. I sure don't."

Despite that, the more the two thought of each other like that, with even more of their chub hanging out, they found it harder to stop thinking about it. Or to stop looking at the other's belly, for that matter.

Riddhe and Mihiro went to the former's room to cool off and watch a movie together, nothing in particular, as they had agreed nearly a week ago. They would've liked to see it in a theater, but it was obvious they weren't getting shore leave anytime soon, so this would have to do. Still, it was great to finally do this after days of postponing it because of the depressing mood on the Argama after several members of it's crew were killed in action and Banagher was captured.

Daguza went to the monitor room, to review information and continue planning the ship's next step with Conroy. Alberto decided to retreat to his room for his own bout of planning, planning what exactly he'll say to his aunt.

The rest of the group went to Banagher's room to collapse on the couch, except for Shin and Marida. "Marida, can I talk to you in private for a moment?" The White Wolf asked her.

"Sure." She replied as stoically as ever. They stayed outside Banagher's room as the others went in.

"The princess told me about you, how you looked after her for all these years. I wanted to thank you. I only wish I could've helped you protect her."

"You don't need to feel guilty. She told me about you, there wasn't anything you could've done."

"I know, it's just... hard sometimes."

"Remember that the princess is just happy you're in her life again, that's what matters. That you're here now."

Shin smiled at her. "You must be a fine older sister to the princess and Banagher."

Marida averted eye contact out of embarrassment, looking down to her side. "Is it really that obvious that's what my relationship with them is?"

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
With Marida and Shin rejoining the group, Audrey, Banagher, Takuya, and Micott spent some much need relaxation time watching TV. The fat blonde and obese redhead found that they still hadn't completely adapted to the type of shows their companions watched, more then once having to ask things that the ones from Industrial 7 assumed were perfectly clear to new watchers. Still, they were doing much better at understanding the shows normal teenagers watch.

After watching two episodes, each one being of a different show, the four youngest members of the Argama's crew had recovered enough for some video games. Though Audrey wanted some more time to recover, plus she felt like she had been hogging the game system lately. Takuya decided to play Fallout: New Vegas, and the sheltered princess once again found herself blown away by gaming.

"What is this?" Curiosity was plan as day in the princess' voice. The "this" in quesiton was the level up screen, more specifically the section where Takuya gave his character a perk.

"Whaddya mean?" Takuya replied.

"I mean what is this screen? It doesn't look like you're increasing stats." She saw many odd sentences, most of which seemed to be titles or descriptors of some sort. "Animal Friend? Sneering Imperialist? Vigilant Recycler? What does any of this have to do with your character's abilities?" It felt weird for the others to hear her spouting video game terminology like that, it was almost hearing her suddenly speak French.

"Oh yeah, you haven't seen this before, only Fallout does stuff like perks." Micott commented.

"Perks?"

"They're like personality traits. They change what your character says and give you gameplay bonuses."

Here, Audrey's face lit up with amazement and wonder. If she was a dog, she'd be shivering with excitement and waging her tail nearly as fast as bird turns his head. "S-So it's creating a entire person separate from you?"

"Kinda." Takuya casually said.

"That's amazing!" The Zabi didn't mean to exclaim that, it just sorta came out that way. Like a big belch after drinking soda, a scenario she was very familiar with.

"You'll have to give it a try soon." Banagher suggested.

"I want to, but I'll need more training before I can handle a first person shooter." Audrey's completely serious use of the word "training" made the other teens chuckle internally,

"It's not that hard, we can change the difficulty, and VATS makes it like a turn based game." Takuya said, only to immediately remember Audrey had no idea what that is.

True to that realization, she asked "What's that?"

"It's basically chess, except we know how to play it." Banagher clarified, he still had no idea how she was able to remember all the rules of chess.

"I'll definitely have to try this later then." They returned their focus to the game, only for Audrey to realize something ten seconds later. "Wait, if "perks" are personality traits, then what does Sneering Imperialist make your character like?"

An hour and a half later, a large grumble from Marida's stomach announced it was time for dinner. Looking down at her gut, past her huge tits, the one formally known as Puru 12 placed her hands on it. "I need to keep this thing under control." She thought. "All that exercise will be for nothing if I pig out again. And that goes for them too."

She took her hands off her stomach and looked at the others. "Is anyone ready for dinner?"

"Now that you mention it, I am pretty hungry." Takuya said as he saved the game and turned off the Xbox. Remotely, of course.

"Guess exercise really does work up an appetite." Micott gave her stomach a few pats, jiggling it, a sight Takuya payed attention to.

"I could definitely go for some pasta." Banagher rubbed his belly for emphasis, he didn't notice it but Micott's eyes were drawn to his hand and gut for the few seconds he did that.

Unlike the others' more enthusiastic reactions, Audrey looked at her tummy and grabbed a handful of it's blubber, squeezing it and feeling how squishy and soft it was, it was like cookie dough. Well, you are what you eat after all. "This isn't good." She thought with a sad look. "It doesn't matter how well I control my appetite, I'm going to sleepwalk and raid the fridge again. Oh, what do I do? Can I even do anything about this?"

Banagher noticed his friend looked down in the dumps, and was about to ask her what was wrong, when Marida said something he had to reply to.

"I can cook you all some pasta." Marida suggested. "Including you, Shin."

"I appreciate it but aren't you tired? You're still recovering."

"You don't have to do everything, Marida." Banagher held some guilt in his voice, guilt that Marida noticed.

"It's fine," She matter of factly said. "My wounds have mostly healed and I didn't use all my energy for my workout."

"Still...." He could see some truth in her words, aside from her walking speed being a little slower then usual, the sister he knew and loved was moving like nothing had happened. And she was a Cyber Newtype. "Just let me know if you could use some help."

"You don't even know how to cook."

Before Banagher could say that he could bring the ingredients (and some snacks) to her, Audrey let go of her belly fat and spoke up. "Everyone, there's something I need to say."

"Audrey, what's wrong?" Banagher asked.

"It's about, you know, that."

"Oh, that. Are you sure you? I thought you didn't want anyone to know."

"I still don't, but if I'm going to lose weight, they need to know."

"Jeez, you two are being dramatic." Micott said, a look of second-hand cringe on her face. "This is probably just some coming out thing." The brunette thought. "She's gonna admit she likes fat guys, like we didn't already know that."

"Dramatic! Dramatic!" Haro playfully chanted in between the lovebirds.

"We got through finding out you're the last Zabi, whatever you've got to say can't be more serious then that." Takuya threw his arms behind his head, that combined the carefree way he said that and how pudgy he was (the gut poking out and chubby, freckled cheeks especially made him look cuddly) helped calm the princess' anxieties.

"That's true." The princess then took a deep breath (making sure she didn't accidentally summon a loud belch) and said what she needed to. "I'm the one whose been stealing food from the kitchen every night."

"Wait, what?" Was Takuya's response.

"It's the truth."

"But you're the one who was going on about how you were gonna catch the thief." Micott pointed out.

"Detective Audrey! Detective Audrey!" Haro flapped his ears excitedly.

"I never called myself that." Audrey pouted, blushing. "But yes, I did say I was going to catch the thief."

"But why did you steal?" Marida sounded like a parent. "It's unlike you."

"I didn't meant to." Despite that protest, she sounded incredibly embarrassed, and even after learning the truth, no one there would blame her. "Banagher said I've been sleepwalking."

"Sleepwalking?" Shin parroted.

"Well, sleepeating, if you want to get specific."

"Ah, now everything makes sense."

"It does?" Micott skeptically said. If anything, things made LESS sense now.

"Back during the One Year War, Vice Admiral Dozle once told me about how taxing the war was being on new recruits, and that he was making an effort to get to know them, he hoped his presence would help raise morale. He said some of them got sick from stress, or even sleepwalked." The White Wolf stood , walked the very short distance to the Zabi heir, and warmly pat her on the head. "You haven't been feeling well, have you?'

"I... no." She sounded defeated.

"Do you at least feel a little better now that you let all that out?" Banagher looked at her worryingly.

"A little."

"Every bit counts." Marida said.

"We're here to help you through this." Banagher placed his hand on Audrey's, it felt nice for both of them.

"I'm no psychologist, but it sounds to me like what you need is some rest." Takuya suggested, he knew that helped him whenever he was feeling down. "I know that's not gonna fix it completely, but it'll help a lot."

"But what do we do in the meantime?" Micott pointed out. "If we don't keep Audrey from pigging out every night, she'll be five hundred pounds before the week is over."

"I'd like to believe I wouldn't be that big." The princess ruffled some of her hair. "But there is something I know I have to do."

+++

Audrey stood outside Riddhe's room, Banagher by her side as he held Haro. Even though this was something she was determined to do, she found it hard to move her feet.

"I have to do this either way, but are you really sure Riddhe will forgive me?"

"Hey, it wasn't like you did anything bad. All you did was accuse him of a minor crime, with decent evidence, and shook his belly." He then showed her a chubby grin. "Which for for a guy like me," here, he gave a big slap to his own jiggly belly for emphasis. "Is a dream come true."

Audrey smiled, Banagher was always good at making her feel better. "I'll give you a few jiggles after I apologize."

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
She knocked on the door. "Excuse me, Riddhe, are you there? There's something I need to talk to you about."

It took a second of dead air to get a reply, which was just a big burp. Then she got a proper reply from Riddhe, whom she assumed the belch came from. "Oh, uh, sure! Just give us a second."

It turned out he didn't need just a second, he needed fifteen. To do what, his three friends waiting outside had no idea. They could only guess from the muffled words they heard.

"Try sucking it in." They heard Mihiro say.

"Ow!" They heard from both of them simultaneously.

"That hurts." They heard from Riddhe.

"We're just gonna have to put up with it."

"I got an idea."

Banagher and Audrey looked at each other in confusion, and in hopes they had some idea of what was going on in there, but their double chinned faces told each other they were just as clueless.

"You can come in now."

Following Riddhe's words, the two walked into Riddhe's room to see him and Mihiro on the couch together. That was normal, what wasn't normal was that they were covered by a blanket. In fact, their faces seemed a little strained too.

"So what did you want to talk about?" The room's owner said.

"What's with the blanket?" Banagher bluntly said.

"We -URP- were just feeling a little chilly." Was Mihiro's explanation.

"I know I'm the only one here wearing a coat, and even then my stomach is exposed, but it doesn't feel cold to me." Audrey said.

"Yeah, well, we -URP- were." At the same time Riddhe lamely said that, Banagher felt Haro turn to the left side of the room and flap his ears to alert Banagher. The brunette looked over in the direction his nearly lifelong companion was, seeing a lot of empty snack bags and boxes shoved into and around a garbage bin. Hastily too, it looked.

"Are you okay? You both look rather uncomfortable." Audrey felt Banagher tap her on the shoulder. Looking at him, she saw him wordlessly point to the garbage bin.

"Oh yeah, we're-Whew!" Something forced Riddhe to sigh, his stomach rising under the blanket suspiciously.

"Riddhe!" Mihiro scolded, only to immediately also unwillingly sigh as her tummy bulged out.

The Zabi and Vist looked at each other and nodded, which made their double chins more pronounced, right before Audrey gabbed the blanket and dramatically pulled it off the Federation officers, revealing a pair of very swollen and distended bellies.

The ones the bellies belonged to blushed as their guests' eyes went from their tummies to their faces. "Okay, -BWARP- you caught us." As much as Riddhe would prefer his and Mihiro's recent binge remained secret, he appreciated that he didn't have to hold in his belches anymore, an appreciation Mihiro shared in regards to her own gas.

"Why were you guys trying to hide it in the first place?" A confused Banagher asked.

"We're not exactly in-shape ourselves." To drive the point home, because she found it oddly fun, and because she wanted Banagher to see, Audrey grabbed her fat belly and shook it, which Banagher and Riddhe enjoyed seeing.

"It wasn't like we planned this." Mihiro's face grew even redder as she began her excuses. "We were just watching a few movies, and we thought a few snacks would go well with it, and we just sorta got carried away. BUUUUUUUUURRP!" She slapped her hands over her mouth as soon as she unleashed that massive belch, her face scarlet. She would've preferred to have what she said be peppered with several smaller belches, instead of letting out that monster. She decided she was gonna have to rethink exactly how she should hold down her burps.

"... Why did you try to hide it?" Banagher repeated.

"Because it's embarrassing that I was encouraging everyone to exercise and lose weight, only to pig out myself." While she said that with shame, Riddhe lazily belched.

"I didn't want to -URAP- set a bad example either." Riddhe added, rubbing his gut as he missed Mihiro's touch.

"We've pigged out far too much ourselves to judge you for that." Audrey said as she thought back on their many binges. "As I said, my stomach IS exposed, and so is Banagher's." Banagher gave his belly light slap when Audrey said that.

"Thank, -URAP, you, Audrey. I was worried you were going to scold me." Mihiro said.

"She's not gonna with a gut like that.' Riddhe teased, eyeing said gut.

The princess self-consciously placed a hand over it, she was blushing a little but she didn't take offense to his joke, she actually found it funny.

"So what did you want to talk to me about?"

"Oh, yes, that..." Audrey nervously rubbed her arm, she needed a few seconds to muster up the strength to look Riddhe in the eyes. "I'm the one whose been stealing food every night."

The brief silence that followed was pure agony for the princess, no one even belched.

Mihiro was the one who broke the silence. "...What?"

"Oh, I get it." Riddhe said, but his tone made it obvious he didn't. "This is that trick where you say you did something that I did, and you watch my reaction for anything suspicious."

"No, Riddhe, I'm serious."

"But that doesn't make any sense, why would you draw attention to it if you did it?"

"Because I didn't mean to!" Her shame made her exclaim, shocking the others. "Sorry." She said after clearing her throat. "I've been sleepwalking. Sleepeating, if you want to call it that."

Mihiro scratched the back of her head, looking like she was feeling the awkwardness of this whole mess. "Well, it's not like we can blame you for sleepwalking, you've -BURRRRP- been through a lot, after all."

What Mihiro said would've helped ease the Zabi's fears if there still wasn't the something she had to seek forgiveness for. "Thank you, Mihiro. I appreciate it."

"But does this mean you're going to steal again tonight?"

"That's where me, Takuya, Micott, and Haro come in." Banagher took a step forward, his gut jiggling as he stood side by side with his soulmate. "We're gonna do what we can to keep her from reaching the fridge."

"Hopefully I won't give you all too much trouble." Audrey imagined her sleepwalking self knocking the others away with her gigantic gut, as if were a wrecking ball. "But before we get too off topic, I have to apologize to you, Riddhe. I shouldn't have accused you based on circumstantial evidence. I'm truly sorry, if there's something I can do to make it up to you, just tell me and it will be done."

"Don't worry about it, I -BWOOOORP- never really cared." Riddhe casually said.

"You didn't?" Her voice made it clear Audrey couldn't even comprehend the idea of Riddhe not being offended.

"It really wasn't a big deal. It was kinda annoying, and you were actually a little scary there, but I stopped caring, oh say, a few minutes later."

"Oh." Looking away, she placed a hand over her chest, making sure her tits didn't get in the way, she still wasn't 100% used to being fat. "This is awkward."

"Yes but things have been awkward on the Argama for over a week at this point." Mihiro drily pointed out. She didn't mean to, but the big burp she belted out after really helped drive her point home.

"So, uh, is there anything we can do to help you with your sleepwalking?" Riddhe asked.

"Thank you for the offer, but I think it would be best if you left it to us." Audrey answered, here a loud rumble of hunger from her stomach forced it's way into the conversation. Blushing, she felt all eyes on her gut, including her own, as it shook and jiggled from the growling. "If it's alright, we'd like to get dinner now." Another roar of hunger sounded, this time from Banagher's belly, the malleable orb shaking and jiggling just as much as Audrey's did. Also just like with Audrey, he blushed as everyone looked at his stomach, even himself. "We're starving." Audrey added.

Mihiro and Riddhe couldn't help but chuckle at the cute, tubby couple. "Don't let us -URP- stop you." The blond man said.

"Thank you."

Audrey and Banagher then left the room, their chubby bodies jiggling in synch. If the other fat couple there didn't immediately return to giving each other belly massages, they would've seen the Vist and Zabi's butts bouncing together.

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
Upon leaving the room, they both came to a stop as the brunette started speaking. "Sooo..." A big, goofy smile grew on Banagher's face. "How about those jiggles now?"

Letting out a small laugh, the blonde smiled back at him. "I did say I'd give you a few, and I'm a woman of my word."

As soon as Banagher placed Haro on the ground, his chunky friend got to work. She grabbed the sides of his gut and shook it up and down. "Aw, yeah..." The brunette moaned in pleasure from the combined sensations of his soulmate's hands on his belly, her shaking it, and the resulting jiggling.

Selfless as always, Banagher reached over and did the same to Audrey's stomach, who let out a very pleased "Ahhhh..." as she felt her belly fat be grabbed by the brunette right before he started shaking. The Zabi felt like her middle was a huge bag of marshmallows, and that Banagher was shaking it all around, and that somehow, that was an absolutely amazing feeling.

This went on for a while, Haro watching two huge bellies bob, bounce, and jiggle as his friends shook them. They were truly lost in the feeling of having a loved one's hands on your belly and playing with it, and they had no problem with that. Their big bellies jiggled like mad as they went up and down, they could literally feel the jiggly goodness, both of their stomach and of their friend's.

Eventually, the growling of their stomachs returned, each fatty could literally feel the rumbling of the other's gut. They let go of each other's tummies and then bumped them together, keeping the jiggling going.

"Sounds like it's time for dinner." Banagher asked as his gut kept bouncing.

Audrey's own gut was just as jiggly as she replied. "Let's not keep our stomachs waiting."

+++

"There's something about my sleepwalking that I'm confused about." The Zabi heir then started eating her bowl of pasta, cooked by Marida. The taste put a little smile on her face. "Wow, this is really good."

"Told you Marida's a good cook!" Banagher gave his jiggly tummy a few pats, the large orb being the accumulation of calories from many meals his big sister has cooked for him, and stuffed him with.

"I'm glad you're enjoying it as much as Banagher does." Marida said, thinking back on the pleased looks Banagher had on his round face after each meal she prepared for him. As much as she wanted to help him lose weight, those chubby, heartwarming smiles were worth all the pounds in the world.

The group of Audrey, Banagher, Micott, Takuya, Shin and Marida was sitting at a table in the cafeteria, each digging into a tasty bowl of pasta Marida had each cooked around the same time. As much as they'd like to, they knew one can't just go from eating a ton to eating a normal amount in just one day, it was something that had to be built up to. So each bowl was, much like the ones eating out of them (except for Shin), extra large. They all felt rather guilty that Marida was making so much for them, not that they could stop her, but that feeling mostly dissipated when they saw her cook all this without breaking a sweat. Apparently cooking meals for herself for years really paid off in the long run.

"Thanks again for cooking this." Audrey said before eating more of her pasta. "Anyways, what I'm confused about is that if every night I wake up and raid the fridge, then why didn't I didn't do that at Palau?"

"You're sure you didn't?" Takuya asked.

"Positive." She firmly said. "I remember waking up every day there a lot more hungry then usual. I had no idea why at the time, I even thought it's possible there might just be something about Banagher that makes you want to pig out."

"Well, that part's true." Micott commented and jiggled her own gut, a little disappointed Banagher didn't pa more attention to that then a quick glance.

"Definitely." Takuya ate more pasta.

After swallowing another forkful of pasta, Marida paused in her eating to look down at her massive stomach. Discreetly opening her medical ware, she placed a hand on her ball of a middle and felt it's incredible softness, comparable to a pillow. Thinking back on her binges with Banagher made her feel even fatter. Still, while she definitely gained even more weight since the day he moved in with her, she still felt like she was a little more in-shape then before, though she was well-aware that could just be a fluke or Banagher energizing her with his presence.

"Do I really have that kind of effect on you guys?" Banagher scratched the back of his head.

"We're getting off topic." The Zabi said. "Do you have any idea why I didn't sleepwalk at Palau?"

"Did you know where the kitchen was?" Banagher said.

The princess brought a palm to her face. "I can't believe I needed you to tell me something so simple."

"What's THAT supposed to mean?" Takuya objected.

"What?" She defensively said. "I just said I should've figured something that simple out of my own."

"You should've worded that differently, I know you didn't mean it like this but it sounded like you were saying you were above Banagher." Shin very lightly scolded.

"Oh." Audrey sank in her seat in guilt. "I'm sorry, Banagher. I didn't realize how I came off."

"Hey, it's fine." Banagher said as he kept eating.

"All is forgiven!" Haro sweetly said from under the bench the teens were sitting on.

+++

"So how exactly are we gonna stop, Audrey?" Takuya said later into dinner, everyone was about one fourth of the way into their bowel, except for Shin, who was halfway done.

'Well," Banagher started, his mouth full of pasta. He wisely swallowed it before continuing. "The first time it was really hard for me to wake her up." He cringed as he flashed back to the image of poor Audrey hitting the counter. "So our best bet to drag her back to my room, shouldn't be too hard with me, Takuya, and Micott working together."

"You forgot about me and Marida." Shin noticed.

"Actually, Shin, I think you and Marida should sit this one out."

"Why?" Marida asked.

"Yeah, what's wrong with more help?" Takuya asked before eating another forkful of his dinner.

"Think about it, they're both trained soldiers, the techniques they were taught to restrain someone are way too rough, they're not meant to be used on your friend." Banagher explained as he tried to keep himself from visualizing such an event. "And they're way bigger then her too."

"That doesn't mean we couldn't restrain her without hurting her." Marida objected, using the same tone she would if she were objecting to the strategy during a combat mission.

"What would you do?"

"First I would pull her arm behind her back and apply pressure to ensure she can't move it. If she tries to escape, I'll tackle her and-"

"Yeah, with your fat ass, that sounds pretty painful." Micott cut her off with her snarking, as she said that, Banagher looked at Marida, his arms crossed over his flabby chest, with an unamused look that said "C'mon, how do you not realize that makes you look worse?"

"Bully! Bully!" Haro said.

"Point taken." Was all Marida could say, as much as she wanted to say more.

"His Excellency would never forgive me if I hurt his daughter." Shin said with shame.

"I'm sure he would... In time, that is." Audrey comforted.

"For your sake, you shouldn't encourage them." A completely converted Takuya told her.

+++

With their dinner firmly situated in their bellies, leaving them pleasantly full, Audrey, Banagher, Haro, Takuya, and Micott retreated to the Gundam pilot's room, with the latter two bringing their pajamas.

They spent the rest of their night playing whatever games they felt like, Audrey performing terribly like usual, until they winded down with some TV. This time it was mostly some cartoons, the blonde was very clearly unused to the idea of watching something that focused solely on being funny, but she still enjoyed herself. Another thing she and Micott enjoyed was that when Banagher laughed heartily at a particularly funny scene, his belly and cheeks jiggled.

After an hour of that, three minutes of which were spent explaining to Audrey the idea of a show not having continuity, it was time for bed. Each one, except for Haro, as much as the others thought he would look cute with clothes, got dressed in their pajamas, taking turns in Banagher's private bathroom to change and brush their teeth, the princess going last

Takuya's were similar to Banagher's, with a simple green shirt and black shorts, his belly poking out of his shirt, which highlighted his man boobs, while Micott wore an orange tank top that couldn't cover her bellybutton, and blue short shorts that accentuated her bubble butt.

1151212111233211211312111111111111111111.content:
"When this is all over, we gotta take a trip to the beach." Takuya threw his arms behind his head, perfectly completing the image of a carefree fat boy.

"It'll probably be summer by the time this is all over, so it'll be the perfect time." Banagher said, thinking back on last year's trip to the beach. It was a yearly tradition for them, a fantastic way to settle into a lazy summer. Lord knows they'll need one after all this.

"Relaxation! Relaxation!" Haro chanted.

"God, we need a vacation." Despite the joyful topic, Micott then suddenly frowned. "But it's not gonna be the same without... you know, everyone else."

And just like that, the others shared her mood, even Haro looked sad. They tried to not think about it, but there was a strong part of all of them that dreaded returning to a normal life in Industrial 7. To see their once daily life without any of their classmates... it wasn't something they were sure they could handle yet.

They struggled to find the words to say, all any of them found was a sad "Yeah..." courtesy of Takuya.

Thankfully, the savior of the conversation, Audrey Burne, exited the bathroom in her ill-fitting and pink pajamas. "What were you talking about? Something about the beach?" She wobbled over to them, her tummy bouncing in front of all them, all four pairs of eyes watching it's gelatinous action.

To the Zabi's surprise, none of the others said anything, they just stared at her massive tummy.

"You sure you're not gonna pop out of that?" Takuya asked, pointing to the heavily strained buttons.

"I'm just trying to look decent!" She said with an angry look, though the blushing of her chubby cheeks dampened the effect she was going for. She then realized she forgot something. "And no, I'm not. I'm not that fat." The buttons were holding on, but just barely. Each one, except for the one keeping her chest decent, was being stretched to their very limits, bubbles of fat had formed in the huge gaps between them. Overall, it looked ridiculous.

"If you say so." A disbelieving Micott said.

"That doesn't look comfortable, Audrey." Haro pointed out. "You should let your belly out."

"Can we please go back to whatever you were talking about?" The strawberry blonde requested.

"We were just talking about about going to the beach when this is all over." Banagher answered.

Despite how causally the pilot said that, the Zabi's round face lit up with childlike curiosity, "I've never been to the beach before, can I come?" A flash of visible embarrassment later, she cleared her throat and abruptly forced that enthusiasm down in favor of a professional attitude. "I mean, may I please come? I would appreciate it.

"Of course you can come! You're one of us now!" Takuya enthusiastically said.

"One of us! One of us!" Haro chanted as he bounced and flapped his ears.

"Like Banagher would pass up a chance to see you in a bikini." Micott teased with an amused look, enjoying how she got both of the lovebirds to blush.

"Speaking of, uh, swimsuits," Banagher couldn't stop himself from imagining Audrey in a white bikini, her fat belly, large tits, and bubble butt all being shown off. "We're gonna need some new ones ourselves. No way we could fit into our usual ones like this." He grabbed a handful of his plentiful belly fat, with there being plenty of blubber to grab.

"The photo we take this year is certainty gonna look different from the others." Takuya, along with the others, found themselves looking at their guts. The orbs of adipose being so large each was nearly touching two others in a circle of flab.

"Would a one piece swimsuit at least do a good job at covering my stomach?" Audrey asked.

"No way." Micott bluntly said.

Another half hour spent watching TV, and the group was ready to go to bed. With two couches and a bed, Banagher's room was perfect for Micott and Takuya to sleep over. Both of them slept on one couch, covering themselves with a blanket from their own rooms, the shapes of their huge bellies sticking up into the air could be easily seen.

Sitting together on the bed itself, Banagher asked Audrey a question. "So, knowing that you're going to wake up later and raid the kitchen, how do you feel?" The pilot wished he could've worded that a little more pleasantly, but there really wasn't a kinder way to say that.

"I feel anxious, and I wish I could do something, but I know I'm in good hands with you, Takuya, Micott, and Haro." The princess answered.

"Thanks for having faith in us, just leave everything to us." Truth be told, Banagher didn't have as much faith in himself as Audrey did, but there was no harm done in her not knowing that. At least, he thought so at the time.

"I have an idea for how you could stop me." Here, the blonde's blushing returned, along with a small, pervy smirk she was obviously trying to force away. "You could s-sleep on top of me, belly to belly, chest to chest. Your weight should keep me pinned down." Most people would've realized they should add a "no offense" at the end there. But not Audrey.

Banagher matched her blushing. "You mean... snuggle?"

"Well, yes, that's one way to put it. It's not like we're strangers to that." Her own blushing and Banagher's intensified even further.

And that blushing got even redder when Haro decided to start hopping up and down, ears flapping as he chanted "Love! Love!"

Micott felt herself grow more jealous with every word of that whole scene, and Takuya felt himself growing more amused at all of them. "Man, it's like they're trying to make Micott jealous." He thought.

With the blonde laying down first, her chunky friend then slowly and nervously laid down on top of her, just as she suggested, they were belly to belly, and chest to chest, both parts of their bodies squishing together. It felt more then a little embarrassing for Banagher to rub his man boobs up against Audrey's tits, but oddly nice at the same time for both of them

"So, uh, is-is this good?" The brunette asked the blonde.

"Y-Yes, this'll do nicely."

After all five members of the group exchanged their goodbyes, they found themselves soon drifting off to sleep. In the case of the Zabi and the Vist, much sooner then they thought they would.

+++

"Huh?"

The pilot of the Unicorn Gundam was awake, and judging from the sleeping form of his soulmate, it wasn't morning yet. No way would she wake up before him, not counting sleepwalking.

The room was still dark, two night lights being the only thing keeping it from being pitch black. He felt really tired, more then he usually was when he woke up in the morning. "Looks like I'm awake." He thought. "Feels like it hasn't been too long since I went to sleep. Maybe an hour or two. So why did I wake up? It feels like I had a bad dream, but I can't remember what it was. Guess that's a good thing."

Waking up at this point wasn't completely a bad thing though, he did learn something new about his soulmate because of it. "Didn't know Audrey snores. It's kinda cute."

Wanting to get back to his own snoring action, he tried to drift back to sleep, and for a few more minutes, the only sounds were Audrey's snoring, and Micott or Takuya occasionally shifting around in their sleep.

But that changed when he heard Audrey let out a moan. "Mmmmm..."

"What? Why's she's moaning?" A surprised Banagher thought. "Am I doing something wrong? Is she uncomfortable? Am I touching something I shouldn't?" Unfortunately, this wave of panic that splashed him made him lose focus on everything that wasn't the Zabi, and he found himself rolling off the princess as she started getting up.

"Ow!" He said when he hit the ground, the impact making his gut and butt jiggle. As luck would have it, he landed on his back, making his tummy an obstacle in the way of getting back up. "Audrey, wait!" He shouted in the vain hope of snapping her out of it, feebly reaching out to her as she left the room at a surprisingly quick speed.

The Links tried to force himself, grunting as his belly squished against his thick legs. It took ten seconds of grunt-filled effort to get up on his two feet. "Look like all that exercise with Marida really paid off."
